Our first stay at this fabulous resort\/casino. Even though there are newer places on the strip (Wynn, Venetian, etc.) the Bellagio still stands as the overall best of breed. It is visually stunning, starting with the Fountains of Bellagio on the street with the water and sound shows multiple times per day. As you enter the lobby\/front desk you are overwhelmed by the current display of the Chinese theme: Year of the Pig, carried out in the conservatory with thousands of flowers & plantings, a huge statuary of a Chinese god, a pagoda, animated pig, etc. Fabulous!
Throughout the facility, the decorator touches are all well done. The casino is extensive, spreading out as you walk toward the designer shops or a performance of "O"- a water production of Cirque Du Soleil.
The rooms are nicely appointed and beds are comfortable. As is the current trend, almost everything used in rooms may be purchased new for your own home. My only complaints were with the Conair hair dryer (cheap-turned off after about 60 seconds) & there was only one trash can in the room (bathroom).
As for gambling, maybe it was  just our bad luck-but the slots seemed to be very tight.
Have to mention the patisserie located in the walkway to the Spa Tower. Features a chocolate fountain with multi layers of spill over liquid chocolate. Also have a crepe chef working right out front.
Total Bellagio experience was deserving of  5 stars.

This rating is for the unexpected fee of $18.00, as a local, I had to pay to retrieve my car from valet. My daughter was in town and we always like to see whats new in the atrium. We also ate in the cafe and we gambled and really like the hotel. There was no one in valet picking up their car and now I understand why. I didn't see any signs or read about this fee in the paper for everyone, locals included. Very disappointing and outrageous amount. Feel sorry for the valet parking attendants. The one who brought my car said their business is down 40%. Like the hotels don't make enough money.

Loved the hotel, casino, buffet and O Show.

Hotel room was clean, new. Bed sheets were odor free. Bathroom, tiles and towels are clean and new. Room service was great, I ordered some room service, and it showed up at my door front in 3 minutes.

Casino: As a Californian, I'm really spoiled by the smoke-free indoors, it took me a while to get used to people smoking indoor. But compared to other casinos, Bellagio has a higher ceiling and better ventilation. Dealers are friendly and willing to teach beginners.

Buffet was the best part, lots of food items to choose from. A little over priced ($50?), but worth it.

Cirque du Soleil- O, is a must! It's magical, adventurous and exciting. Middle aisle seats are reserved for VIPs, but try to get seats that will allow you to view the ceiling.

Bellagio is one of my favorites. This has been my favorite place for craps. The buffet is delicious. They're signature chandelier is how I remind myself I've arrived in Vegas! The gardens are gorgeous, the fountains and the placement on the strip. I haven't stayed here, but I always come to play\/sight see here.

Overall a great hotel with nice rooms and a spectacular fountain.         We had a perfect view of the fountain and part of the Vegas strip.     The hotel can get very crowded and the casino very smokey so those are the downsides.     There are many excellent restaurants to choose from.   The Bellagio can look a little tired and in need of some refreshing but overall its still a beautiful large hotel.

Why can't I give 4.5 stars!? Come on, yelp, let's work on this!!!

We went to vegas for a one night stay.. basically just to do some shopping, enjoy the water show, eat some good food, and get away. I was SO SO SO excited to finally stay at the Bellagio. It's one of the hotels I have on my luxury list of places to stay in Vegas. 

I've always believed the Bellagio was a gorgeous hotel, and actually staying in it just reiterated that fact. Their check-in\/check-out system is the craps though. There is no real line, it's all just like a mob in front of the desk and you kinda just have to choose which one you think will be the fastest. Pretty dumb, but I guess it works for them. Something else I wasn't a fan of was how far the guestroom elevators are from the front desk. You have to walk all through the casino and make a left down past the buffet to reach them. No easy feat, especially when there are tons and tons of people walking around. I think I ran over a few toes with my luggage actually, oops. We got a lakeview room, and so I could not WAIT to see the water show from our room. The view was absolutely fantastic! Our room was around the middle and halfway up the hotel, so it was perfect. We could see everything on the strip, and the water show at night with the lights was mesmerizing. Now, on to the room itself. I loved how big it was, lots of room to jog around and do some yoga if I wanted to. The bathroom was a piece of art, huge bathtub and HUUUGE sink counter! Wonderful, since my man always makes such a mess at the sink haha. The bed was super comfortable, and we contemplated stealing a pillow or two to take home (but we didn't, don't worry.) What I was kind of surprised about was the tv. It was one of those older tvs, not a flat screen. I get that no one really comes to vegas to stay in their room all day and such, but when I come back to rest, I want to be able to watch tv on a nice screen. I thought that was kinda weird, but it's true what everyone else says- you pay not for the room, but for the view. 

I loved my stay at the Bellagio, and now I can say I am no longer a Bellagio virgin!

The husband surprised me with a visit to Vegas just because. I have loved the Bellagio fountains since the first time I saw them probably 8 years ago. This was the perfect surprise and we had a room facing the waters. The man thought of everything! The furnishing were gorgeous, bedding beautiful and the bathroom was spacious. Check-in took awhile but it was late night in Vegas so what did we expect? Didn't exactly like walking through the casino floor with our luggage to get to the elevators but that was the only way to get to our room. We didn't spend too much time in our room (it is Vegas after all) but when we did, I spent the majority of the time watching the fountains. One recommendation would be to have the music piped through onto one of the tv channels so we could hear the music from our room. We could barely hear a tiny bit of the music as we were on a high floor and I assume the windows are somewhat soundproof. If you want a luxury getaway, don't wait. Get yourself to the Bellagio (or drop tons of hints to your husband so he can take you!).

I have always wanted to stay at the Bellagio.  We've been there before to gamble and to see the beauty.  We usually stay at the Palazzo or Venetian because we get good prices there - the Bellagio is always more money.  

We originally had a king fountain room, but had to change our reservation to 2 queen beds because we ended up taking our daughter.  She's 12, but they charged us an additional $50 per night.  We ended up changed to a room in the spa tower - we could still see the fountain but it was not a full fountain view.

I was not impressed with housekeeping.  We arrived to a toilet that had a huge brown smudge on the back of the seat...gross!  One of the pillow cases had make up stains.  

Aside from that, the room was lovely, but not nearly as big as the rooms at the Palazzo or Venetian, where we regularly stay for far less than we paid here. 

I understand that soon they will be charging for parking, I guess this will be on top of the resort fee? 

I don't see any real reason to return.

This place is quite good. I've had breakfast here (delicious breakfast burrito and bloody mary), lunch (I think we tried everything on the menu) and numerous cocktails (I recommend the Funky Monkey or whatever the banana colada-type cocktail is called). The service has always been excellent for me and I love that it is on the pool deck and such a convenient spot when I am doing some serious lounging. I really like it here. I'll be back.

I love love love this hotel! Arrive early and request a room with a view:) I usually slide the person a $20 bill at check in and ask for any upgrades. I usually use Expedia but I did save $32 a night using Vegasbooked.com. I highly recommend this hotel -- outstanding service!!
Bellagio is beautiful and has a little something for everyone, from dining to gambling to art and entertainment.

The Bellagio was one of my favorite locations. The architecture is grand with sweeping hallways, sculpted glass, and fantastic decor. The Christmas decorations were beautiful. The lady at the front desk told me that people have to come to Bellagio five times a year for their decor changes - Christmas, Chinese New Year, Spring, Summer, and Fall. The stores are high end and just fun to window shop in. They have a couple of museums and the garden which is decorated fantastically.

Excellent place! Extremely clean and comfortable. Staff is very nice and they go above and beyond for anything you need. They bend over backwards to make you feel at home. It's worth every penny to stay here! It's hands down my favorite. Fountain show is also worth seeing

Lived up to the hype!  I especially enjoyed complimentary Grey Goose, a view of the water show, the pool, the bidet, the tubs, the steam shower, Channel 22, and the suite as a whole.  Pretty much ideal.  The only minus was the a single jerk dealing blackjack and a lack of younger people...but I'm sure it's that way for a reason.  Solid sports book and buffet, but there are better in Vegas.  The hotel itself was fantastic.

It's a beautiful establishment, the conservatory is worth checking out, and it's a great spot to step away from the gambling, and smoke filled casino floor and get some fresh air and take a few moments to regroup.

The gaming is mid to high priced, lots of bigger minimum bets required so for those that are on a budget you may want to avoid this place.  However if money isn't a concern i'd recommend it.  I strictly play at table games, and I hung out at the $100 minimum table for a while and was on a vicious winning streak.  So as we all know, don't bet more than you can afford to lose, but also don't be afraid to go in on a big limit table.

I was only at this establishment for a hit and run, but all my experiences here have been top notch!

The lady at front desk stole my credit card information and used it later. I was able to recover the money months later after dozens of calls to hotel and bank. After the problem was resolved they said: "we're sorry, it was a mistake". Beware who check you in!

Until the Wynn took the crown of Most Expensively Retarded place on the strip, Bellagio had it down pat for a while.

It's still a pretty cool place.  You can play video poker\/blackjack literally at the bar and drink top shelf free the whole time.  It helps if you tip your bartender at the onset, of course.

Poker here is some of the best in town, mostly because most of the players have deep pockets and little game.  Watch out though, because if you hit no limit or high limit, you may have pros at the tables.  Why are the pros supposed to be there?  I think I just explained why.

The pool is supposed to be nice here if you're looking for bored trophy housewives and trust fundies.

The buffet here is the locals' choice on weekends and everyone and their mom (literally) turns out for it.  Get there early if you don't want to wait in line for an hour.  Naturally if you are staying in the hotel, you get to skip to the front.

Overall the experience and service was good but for what I actually had to pay I guess I was expecting more? 

We stayed at a 2 bedroom penthouse premier fountain view suite. 

Pros
Million dollar view
Nice size room
Did I mention the view? 

Cons
Maybe it's because of the age of the resort but some of the furnishings are starting to fall apart.
ie entertainment cabinet doors, dresser doors and two of the five TVs did not function correctly. (no sound)

The checkin was at the chairmans lounge located to the left as you face the checkin area. The checkin was quick and simple unfortunately our room was not ready even though we arrived after 3pm. They called us about 30 mins later to get our keys. 

I doubt I will be back but we will see.
Great hotel very pricey. .. use uber to get around town ... best deals on inexpensive food is off the strip or in old Vegas  use my code darrisr33ue for a free ride ...

If you want more of an upscale feel of a casino then look no further! Make sure you bring plenty cash because the winnings over here are a lot less likely. I mean it's vegas and once you find your favorite place to gamble stick to it. It's one of those to each is own kind of situations but I rather not gamble here. Never had much luck but have friends who have!

The room is very clean. I stayed at the 11th floor. It's called the Lakeview suite.
You could see the beautiful fountain and a lovely view of the strip.
Bellagio is a gorgeous hotel. The atrium is spectacular and actually reminded me of wonderland while I was there.

I guess it's time for a refresh, and by a refresh I mean a downgrade. 

I came here recently and stayed for half the week for an onsite conference. If it was not for my friends room who wasn't even part of the conference, I would not have been able to see the fountain show from my room at all.

Upon check in, after waiting over 10 minutes in this horrendous line, I was given a room where the bathroom was still uncleaned. It was so disgusting the toilet seat had some unknown smear on it and the shower stall still had remnants of hair and other people's soap. 

I had to leave to check in to the conference so I hurriedly found a cleaning staff in the hallway and requested a reclean of the room. I don't really know what they did exactly but it was definitely not up to my standard. The smear on the toilet seat was still there and I had to clean it up myself. 

Overall the room was dirty, not check in ready, and most of the fancy curtain trickery did not work since CLOSE actually meant OPEN ... somebody's bad wiring job!

The TV and its remote were half functioning, half of the time, and the whole room was dirty, dusty. You can tell it's already becoming run down, rough areas on the carpet and slightly unclean (stained but probably washed) sheets. The bedding was not great and their "majestic" headboard had so much dust on top you wonder when it was they last dusted the whole room.

For a place that prides itself in "luxury" and high quality service, there was no follow-up to my complaint and the whole stay just made me feel dirty. In comparison to the long list of choices of luxurious accommodations on the strip for around the same price, I am shocked Bellagio still has the audacity to charge the kind of rates it does. I've had far cleaner rooms in the Cromwell, Vdara, Aria, Cosmo, Paris and Planet Hollywood just to name a few where in theory the star rankings don't add up to what Bellagio is supposed to be. 

I am likely never staying here again unless they somehow give me some grand return gesture like a comped, premium, fountain room. And even then, it's not the greatest place.

Its nice but a bit overblown in that it is not as great as its reputation may have you think.  Definitely well appointed but the lay out of the casino and the restaurants leaves a little to be desired.  Of the casinos in Las Vegas, it is not on my top 5 list.  Although, to stay there is nice and the restaurants are good.

Casino is great but the security in maroon blazers are very rude, they just stand there mean looking and when you ask a simple question like where can I wait for security to bring back the ID I misplaced he rolled his eyes and said , and I quote " wait where they told you to wait " well ... That was the problem the security on the phone just asked what color shirt I was wearing, the lobby is pretty big and it was packed so I just needed to know an exact location no need for attitude by a security.

This is the best hotel I have ever stayed in!  This was the perfect place to stay for my first time in Las Vegas!  My husband and I went here for our honeymoon and they upgraded us to an amazing, huge two room suite with a sauna and jacuzzi bath tub at no extra cost!  They also gave us a jump the line pass for their famous buffet for free.

The bed was super comfy, the room was always clean and the pool was awesome!  There was so much to do in this hotel alone, that we really didn't need to go elsewhere.  Parking was also free whether you are a guest or not.  Staff was nice and helpful as well.  This is the only place in Vegas I will stay from now on (when we can afford it)!

My wife and I stayed here for our first wedding anniversary. We had always wanted to get a room there and splurged on a fountain view room (amazing!). The hotel is clean, staff is professional, great food and shows on site always. In particular, I would like to call out the services of Michael Williams at the front desk. That man was absolutely amazing! He was attentive and very clearly was motivated by excellent customer service, which he even exceeded that. We had had an unpleasant experience at the front desk the night before, but dealing with Michael shows it was just an anomaly. If he isn't running that hotel in 5 years, I'll be surprised. Give him a raise, promotion, clone him... Do whatever you can do take what Michael has and spread it to every employee there. Texas may not have wanted you, but I'm glad we ran into you in Vegas.

I gave the bellagio two stars solely based off the fact that the fountains are fantastic and definitely an added bonus to be able to see from your room.   That for me is really where the positives end. 

After staying at newer and more modern hotels on the strip,  The Bellagio looks very dated and washed out in comparison.  

The rooms are fine, the beds are comfortable and the view of the wonderful fountains is great. The lobby is dated and has no real offerings to anybody under the age of 50 years old.   There's no real entertainment in the lobby. They have a piano bar that is a complete snooze fest.   I've had a better time at an airport bar then I did at that place. You can be classy and still have a conversation above a whisper. It is vegas!!!

The pool area was not well thought out.  You constantly have to strategize on where you will move to avoid massive shadows by the buildings during prime tanning time.  Not great. The grounds are pretty enough but what good is a pool if you're constantly in the shade?!

Overall, I'm glad I stayed there but it's off my bucket list.  We got this trip comped and I would've paid to stay somewhere else instead.

This is one of the most beautiful hotels in Las Vegas. This 5 diamond resort includes many attractions, such as the the Conservatory which is a large garden which the theme of garden changes about 4-5 times a year including spring summer, holiday themes, Chinese New Year, and its most current being Under the Sea. Another known attraction is the Fiori Di Como, it is located in the Front Desk area on the ceiling, its a chandelier of hand-blown glass blossoms, very pretty.

Just around the corner of the conservatory is Jean Phillipe's Patisserie, which not only is filled which gelatos, pastries, crepes, cakes and chocolate truffles, but it also has a large glass enclosed chocolate fountain including dark, milk, and white chocolate. The casino floor has about 20 different eating joints, ranging from casual to fine dining and some even with fountain views and patios. They also have a high end retail shopping area with stores like Gucci and Louis Vuitton.

Which brings me to my next point and that is the Bellagio Fountains. They perform everyday, typically after noon every half hour and every 15 min at night. They played songs from Frank Sinatra to EDM. 

As you can tell, Bellagio has many free attractions so i definitely recommend having this as one of your destination resorts during you Vegas stay, even if its just to look around.

Beautiful hotel, nice accommodations, excellent service, but with some annoying drawbacks.

The rooms are great.  Beds and chairs are comfy, and there's twice-daily housekeeping.  The staff are especially friendly and helpful.

Every room has a safe, which is nice.  However, our room (and supposedly most of them) had a 22" CRT television.  It's not a big deal, but what's up with that?

The big, big drawback is the wifi.  In an era where McDonald's gives you free wifi. Bellagio charges $15 for 24 hours of wireless access.  Really?  There's not even a 3 days for $25 or such.  I had to get online to do some work, so I didn't have much choice.  My 24 hours ended, and I wasn't going to pay again for the few hours more that I would use before leaving.

Another annoyance is the unapologetic gouging in the sundries shops.  Does this really need to be a cost center?  $4 for a liter of Dasani?  I might have gambled in the time I spent walking over to the ABC store across the street.

All in all, Bellagio is an excellent destination.  I'll happily upgrade my review to five stars if they make just these two changes:

- provide free (or just some nominal charge) wifi
- upgrade the televisions

Stayed mid-week for a pretty reasonable price ($110 a night) -- had a standard room with no view, but enjoyed it.  The interior of the room was well designed, the maid service was good.  

Having stayed at a real 5 star hotel where you don't have to tip obscenely for exceptional service, I can't give this 5 stars.  But all the same, we really enjoyed it and thought it was beautiful, fun and a classic Vegas experience!

I absolutely love this hotel and casino. It is my favorite hotel in the Las Vegas strip. 

The garden its always spectacular and I just went recently to see their new spring display and it blows my mind how astonishing our looks. :)., they even had a harp player playing in the garden and the Serenity of it was a nice touch. 

The fountain show its always a must see and I fall in love with it each time I see the show., its the reason why I love the Bellagio.

I stay at the bellagio for one night and the room was very classy and trendy.  I wasnt a really big fan of their new decor but since we had a great view of the fountain show made everything worth while.  We ordered room service and the food was okay. The bed is absolutely soft and I just wanted to lay there the entire time! 

i love love love the jean philippe patisserie there they make the best crepe souffles ever.! I always order chocolate souffle with a scoop of Dulce de leche gelato and it is the best dessert I ever had.  

And lastly, bank nightclub I always have a great time there. 

Overall, I love the bellagio it has such a timeless taste to it and everything is great about this hotel & casino.

The wife and I stayed in the Bellagio in 1\/10 and loved it. We had a fountain view on the 18th floor. The hotel is upscale and really well managed. Our room was spacious and the bathroom was huge! The bed was soft, the comforter warm, and the walls were thick enough to provide a good amount of privacy (in contrast, see my review for Place d' Armes in New Orleans). We liked everything about it and would definitely stay here again. It was a top notch experience and as far as we are concerned it is the only place to stay.  

My main complaint was the number of people who ignored the no smoking signs and were smoking in non-designated areas. There was a large number of foreigners in the hotel so maybe they did not read English or perhaps they are used to smoking wherever they want. The casino is a smoking area but it was not as bad as Ceasar's Palace which was by far the worst we visited in terms of number of people smoking and getting a headache from all the pollution. 

The buffet is excellent. We had lunch there for $20 and breakfast for $15. It is so worth it. For lunch I was very impressed by the fact that the shrimp was fresh, cleaned, and firm. The various fish were moist and tender, not dried out at all. They had the best smoked salmon. For breakfast the variety is astounding, not just the usual. Had the best smoked trout and shrimp. I highly recommend this buffet even if you are not staying in the Bellagio. The lines were not that long, the most we waited was maybe 20 minutes when we went at noon for lunch.

I loved this hotel our room was so beautiful, clean, and comfortable. Yes pricey but hey you want the best you have to pay for the best. Even room service was prompt delightful. We came back to our room late n hungry ordered a cheeseburger OMG I was shock how good it was, and we realize is the same amount at a regular restaurant so we enjoyed our food and the stay at the Bellagio. The manager even sent us a box of chocolate for our anniversary: I will not be returning any time soon only because I want to experience the other hotels next time am in Vegas.

Wow this place has gone downhill, I used to stay here in my 20's and I loved it. This is honeymoon and the rooms are comparable to a Holiday Inn, the check in took a long time, that didn't put is off, the guy who checked is inn was nice but a little detached, I guess this isn't the Peninsula in Beverly Hills, where we just came from. The Peninsula in Beverly Hills has only a half a star more but boy do we see a difference, especially in customer service.

Honestly, fuck this place.  Lowest limit blackjack table they have is $25.  Beyond ridiculous. They should at least give you a heads up if they are going to be dicks before you book you room here.  So just a friendly heads up for anyone planning to stay here.

Note: This review is strictly about the hotel room I stayed in.

I was quite excited to finally get to stay at the Bellagio but was a bit disappointed.  The room was rather small and I had a fabulous view of the building generators.  Lucky me.  Beware - if you get an odd-numbered room in the spa tower, you will not get a view of the strip.  PRAY FOR AN EVEN-NUMBERED ROOM.

I did not appreciate that my hair-dryer would not turn on periodically and the toilet paper roll tube thingy would constantly pop out.  To my horror, I also only got a few good TV channels.  I was pissed that there was no MTV, VH1, Bravo, or Food Network.  So not cool.  Also, the shampoo and conditioner left my hair all tangled.  Although, I really liked the olive lotion.  Oh yeah, the internet connection was crappy.  

I however really enjoyed my in-dining experience.  I had the breakfast wrap with scrambled eggs, rice and refried beans.  YUM!  And the orange juice was truly FRESH squeezed.  I felt like a princess having breakfast in my wonderfully comfortable king-size bed.

All in all, I would recommend staying at the Venetian\/Palazzo instead.  You get a huge suite for probably cheaper...with a TV in the living area, bed area, and bathroom.  lol.  The Bellagio totally did not compare although it is a BEAUTIFUL hotel.  I love walking through it, but I would only want to stay there again if I got a nicer room.

My advice is to book at the Spa Tower. It is a piece of heaven away from the smoke and crowds of the lobby and casino. The room had a large window from floor to ceiling that gave a breathtaking view of Paris casino and the fountains. Room was awesome. I checked  out Paris, MGM, Mirage and Ballys casino and I couldnt wait to get back to Bellagio.

Where do I begin? 
Extremely overpriced. Nothing is complimentary, absolutely nothing. Came during MLK weekend and was hoping to get an upgrade for my wedding anniversary (passed my good friend Mr.Grant to the girl that was checking us in) but supposedly nothing available. In all fairness I was granted a higher floor with a more centered view of the fountain. 

The carpet, linens, furniture was clean. The pillows and bed were comfortable. The bathroom was nicely sized but the caulking alongside the shower edge was moldy and needed to be changed. I found a hair, a plastic wrapper, and a bandaid wrapper on the bathroom floor-but whatever.

The walls are paper thin and my room neighbor decided it was okay to turn on the TV at 2:30 in the morning. I noticed a lot of 'girls' & guests that can't handle their alcohol at 6:00 am!!!
Long walk through the casino to reach your room and the smell of cigarettes is overwhelming but the smell of cigars is worse and nauseating. The ventilation on the guest floors is bad-smokey, musty, moldy.

The overall decor and ambiance is nice but I most certainly wished I had booked in the Venetian or Mandarin Oriental. For the amount of money I paid, I would've gotten a far better deal + the crowd there is much classier than what strolls into the Bellagio. 

Bottomline, don't squander your money and stay somewhere else.

It's been awhile since i've stayed here.  Only stay if the rooms are free.

Given the thanksgiving weekend, the place was packed.  

The rooms are nice but need a little updating - where the hell is\/are  the flat screen tv's ?!?!  And a major ding - you got the nice bath tub yet no bath oil \/ bubble bath ?!?!  WTF !

Beautiful hotel. I was at the Aria for a conference but I wish it had been held here. The conservatory was absolutely beautiful; it piqued an interest in me to take advantage of some of the larger conservatories when I have a chance.

The Bellagio cafe was my favorite place to eat whilst we were in Vegas. The wait time was not terribly long and, being in the conservatory, it had a beautiful view. We ended up eating here three times during our stay because the food was good and the prices were reasonable.

The Bellagio is part of the tram network that goes from the Aria to Bellagio with one or two stops in between. It's free and runs every few minutes so it's definitely a transportation method of choice. The trip between the start and end points is about five minutes, so if you are too involved in your conversation to notice you're at your stop and have to go back and forth again (as happened to me), you can just enjoy the view of Las Vegas from the window.

The Bellagio is my favorite casino on the strip. To me it looks the classiest and has the best design on the outside. The inside is equally amazing especially the indoor garden when you walk in. Everything about this hotel screams baller. 

Gaming here is a lot of fun to if your willing to risk the cash. Your not going to find a table game less then $10 on a weekday and probably $25 on a Saturday night. Also, they don't spread low limit poker games so if you wanna look at flops then plan on playing 2-5 at the minimum. 

If you don't go into the Bellagio then atleast check out the water show on Las Vegas Boulevard. This is by far the BEST free entertainment in Las Vegas. I would wait for the titanic song by Celine Dion. 

It's......
...........Amazing.

Judgmental elevator attendant, a blackjack dealer who kept my money when he busted with a 22, and a lot of people who act like they just don't have time for you. There are also little-to-no perks for the cost of the hotel. This is the nicest hotel I've stayed in, but the experience was sub-par overall. Even uber cheap roadside motels have a refrigerator in the room where you can put leftovers or bottled water. Not here. I came here expecting everything to cost a lot, but I did expect the overall experience to be more relaxing. The check-in\/check-out times are also a bit annoying. I'll be glad to get to the next hotel tomorrow...

Stayed for my wedding anniversary. Pricy, but worth every penny. AMAZING view and service. Room was clean and comfortable.  Also, I'm a nursing mother and they did not charge me for a refrigerator to store my milk, even though they could have. Fabulous!

Hung out here in some of the clubs and lounges and walked around the casino. This place is very classy without being obnoxiously so. Didn't stay here at this visit but have stayed here before---it lived up to my expectations. There's an amazing selection of restaurants that I have been able to try out.  One of the hotels that I would stay at if I had to choose.

Definitely one of the best places in The Strip to be at for every single reason. Casino was good, this was the only place which was open with food after midnight (WolfGang Phuc). Though we did not go to the night club, there was a HUGEEE line when we were walking around. Oh god ! But, the best part is the musical FOUNTAIN just outside the hotel, which goes on for about 4 minutes every 15 minutes. DO NOT MISS this place if you are there at Vegas first time.

By far the best location for a hotel on the entire Vegas strip.  Stayed here the weekend we got married and they upgraded our room for us and gave us a perfect view of the fountains.

Yes it is expensive even with a deal through a major online package discounter, but we think it is worth the price paid.   The extremely comfy beds, the lighting, automatic curtains, the turndown service even the oversized bathrooms add to that the exquisite restaurants, gambling scene and nightlife bars and you end up with an experience that is very difficult to rival anywhere else in Vegas.   

They are also really good about organizing transportation for their guests!

Serioulsy over rated. This is not the place for those young at heart. The rooms are in dire need of an update. The rest of the hotel is beautiful but it was magnificent 8 years ago, now it's just good.

The service and the hotel was great. The buffet at the Bellagio is one of the best. Enjoy This hotel is in the center of the strip great location and the privat pool is awesome. If you can make sure you book in advance to see  O the circus soleil show exclusive to the Bellagio one of the best shows ever. It pays to get seats within the first three rows. Simply incredible.

Recently back from a first time stay at Bellagio. 
I can say the room is not too bad. It was comfortable. For the price I'd have expected more though. I would not stay here again for a few reasons. 
They have a very high resort fee. 36.00 after the tax added to the 32.00 fee. They don't want guests bring this up in question. Since it's not part of the rate, it's added on checkout. Very frustrating regardless if it's in fine print. And they claim it's for the ability to make room calls (who doesn't own a cell phone?), wireless and the use of their printer for boarding passes. All well worth 36.00...
Also the lobby is consistently crowded beyond belief- Long lines for checking in or even getting oriented. The elevator for the rooms is location on the opposite end of the lobby so a long walk anytime you want in\/out of your room. That was also very annoying. 
If you can good deal for the hotel, and don't mind paying the high 'extra fees' then enjoy, but for me there are better hotels to enjoy with less frustration.
great place to have fun and gamble and defiantly a superb place to stay at.

I stayed at the Bellagio back in February 2017. I was excited to stay since I hadn't stayed here before and it's the famous Bellagio. I'd been thru there many times since I go to Vegas every 2-3 months. The hotel decorations, casino, and buffet are amazing. The rooms fall short. I was expecting a room like the Cosmo or The Wynn but what I got was a room equivalent to the Luxor which is not bad but when you spend money for the Bellagio you expect a high end hotel. The best part of the Bellagio is the location. It's in the middle of the strip and all of the action. I loved that part of staying there. I'll definitely go back but will never book my stay here again.

Giggity Giggity.

Before my first trip to Sin City, a friend explained to me that each big property has a theme.  She described the Bellagio's theme as "posh".  I can not improve on that description.  :)  

I thoroughly enjoyed my stay here.  The beds are comfy.  They have GREAT black out curtains so you can sleep even when the sun is out.  The pools are great, and the pool bar makes a yummmmmmyyyy blended drink that comes with berries on top - so you can consider it a fruit serving.

The only minor downsides;
1.  despite a fleet of staff, check in and check out seemed to take a really long time.

2.  my room was on the strip side, and i saw a HUGE image of Toni Braxton on the side of the Flamingo.  Toni then entered my dreams, not in a scary way, but it was odd.

Sad to say worse experience ever in Las Vegas! Limo picks me and our clients and the A\/C does not work so we are riding in a Limo no water hot as hell! Now we arrive at Bellagio and guess what our connecting room is not ready keep in mind it's 5:30 PM check in is at 3Pm. I have had better service at Circus Circus sad to say. By the way we got 2 Suites.

Every couple of years my company has a huge conference. Previous locations were Chicago, Scottsdale, and of course Orlando. Employees usually come with spouse in tow and while we are busy being masters of the universe our better half's enjoy the amenities. This year the conference was held at the Bellagio in Las Vegas. Now if you know me at all you know I'm a gambling man and Craps is my game. As a matter of fact, Niki and I go to Las Vegas at least once a year to indulge in all the city has to offer. This occasion was no different. The hotel had everything covered and that included all the meals and entertainment. When you walk into the hotel you are simply blown away by the Chihuly installation on the ceiling. From the worlds tallest chocolate waterfall to the intense action found in the casino, the Bellagio never falls short.  

All the meals were superb ranging from steaks and pastas to lobster and sushi. Everything was top shelf and the service was impeccable. One night they hosted a private party at The Bank. The cocktails were flying off the bar rapidly while food was being served by several people walking around with big trays. Don't get me wrong I have seen all this before and done well but not to this extent. Everything was first rate and any want or desire fulfilled to expectation. I have stayed in many of the hotels on the strip but none in my experience can beat the Bellagio. Hands down my top pick for lodgings, food, entertainment, pampering, and last but not by far least, Craps baby!!!

I just went here for the first time, got a suite and was blown away by the decor, the view and the service. This is by far one of the best hotels I've ever stayed in. I usually try to pick a different hotel when I go to Vegas - but this time the company I was freelancing from paid - WOW~!
The room service was quick and the meals were great - exactly how I ordered. The coffee was not as strong as I would have like - but I'm a little picky about those things - :o)
I can't wait to go back and see "O"!

Absolutely love this hotel. I don't think I have come across one rude staff member. Special shout out to Ryder (lifeguard) at the pool who helped my son getting a life vest for the pool. Rooms are very nice. Especially the pillows. Minus one star for how expensive everything is in this hotel. $11 for a store bought sandwich that tasted like doodie. Would most definitely stay here again. Just gotta save all my pennies. Or win the lotto.

This is a 2 diamonds hotel? REALLY? I mean the fountain is great, the casino seems pretty sleek too but you don't need to be staying in the hotel to experience those right?

The room is decent sized but I got really annoyed today. After a long day of work I went back to my room to rest. And for me there's nothing better than a cup of warm tea. Couldn't find an electrical kettle. Nowhere to get any hot water either (I'm not used to drinking from tap) I thought this is basic???

So I called the front desk and the girl kept pushing me to talk to the in room dining who btw wants to charge me $4 for a cup of hot water. SERIOUSLY? The people were rude and at this point it's beyond that stupid hot water. 

Strange.. What is wrong with these people, she ended the conversation with "it's been OUR policy for 13 years" errrr maybe you should be less snobbish and try to say it nicer or something?

Oh btw they don't even have room slippers and toothbrush in their room, you have to request for those. Isn't this also basic basic basic hotel things? Are they trying to cut cost that MUCH?

Honestly I don't care much for the Bellagio, there are other nice newer hotels in Vegas. For my next trip I'll definitely look elsewhere. I'll probably swing by Mon Ami Gabi for dinner and shamelessly free ride on the fountain but you ain't getting a single penny from me hmmm~

Bellagio was originally named Beau Rivage but, the name was later changed to Bellagio. It's a beautifully water themed resort Inspired by the Lake Como resort of Bellagio in Italy. It's most notable feature is the 8 acre lake between the building and the Strip, which houses the Fountains of Bellagio, a large dancing water fountain synchronized to music. See my review of the fountains for more info on it. 

Bellagio was conceived by Steve Wynn and built by his company, Mirage Resorts, Inc. following the purchase and demolition of the Dunes hotel and casino in 1993. Bellagio was designed by DeRuyter Butler and Atlandia Design. Bellagio opened October 15, 1998 and had a construction cost of $1.6 billion. 

In 2000 it became a MGM Mirage property when Mirage Resorts was sold to MGM Grand Inc. for $6.4 billion by Steve Wynn to create MGM Mirage. After the sale of Mirage Resorts Steve Wynn started a new company, Wynn Resorts. 

All in all I love Bellagio! It was Steve Wynn's crowning achievement until Wynn Las Vegas was built. The atmosphere, fountains, food, shopping and service are all 5 stars. Tons of great shopping like Armani, Chanel, Dior, Fendi, Gucci, Prada, Tiffany and YSL in Via Bellagio! I have never stayed there so I can't compare the rooms but the hotel and casino are almost neck and neck with Wynn Las Vegas and that's saying alot!. Forget Aria and the rest of City Center and stay either here, Wynn or Encore. You'll have a great time. 

I have added a picture of Steve Wynn's original concept for Beau Rivage which later became the Bellagio. 

Insider tip: Check will the hotel concierge for times but, you can go on a free tour of all of the different rooms types at Bellagio daily around 3pm. And you don't need to be a hotel guest to go on the tour.

This casino is just beautiful...that is the best way to describe it! They had a really cool display with a huge bird house with cute little finches inside. Then all around it they had flower sculptures of birds and snails. Absolutely gorgeous!

Stayed Comp, so I can't complain for room rates (5 stars).

Parking is not very convenient to guest elevators (actually, it's no where close, even if you were to Valet), so that's about 2 stars.

Service is alright.  We got the room serviced once, and it was very tidy, but nothing was replaced (amenities) so we had to call (although they came very quickly).  Three stars for that.

Casino was my worst nightmare.  One star for that.

Overall, great room at an unbeatable price (FREE) but ended up costing me more in gambling than I would have if I had stayed at a different casino.  Wouldn't stay here again until I get another Player's offer.  Hopefully that won't be anytime soon.

Those damn fountains that go off every 15 minutes are IT.  I love free entertainment, I love "All that jazz...", it was so great!

Kieran and I ran from the Hilton all the way to the Bellagio (using the monorail of course), to catch the last night showing at 11:45pm.  We got the best seats and made it just in time (luckily I didn't stall in front of the Fendi store!)

He really wanted me to see it for obvious reasons and he was right, I loved it!  Pretty darn spectacular.  :)

The hotel itself is impressive. We spent our 5th wedding anniversary there and every birthday. Even stayed in the suite. Unfortunately our experience during our last visit made it our FINAL stay at the Bellagio. The staff behind the check in\/out counter was uppity. Yes this is a 5 star hotel but it doesn't belong to you to treat guests like criminal and accused us of creating a "conflict of interest among the staff". Staff need to be more hospitable to be working in hospitality business.

Full disclosure: This is only about the Casino, not the hotel or grounds etc which is beautiful. My gripe is coming to play the slots for a while til the water show started outside. Well, we couldn't get a drink to save our lives. We asked someone to call a waitress. Still no one came. We spotted a waitress but she tried very very hard to ignore us. We flagged her, she still turned and ran. That's when we cashed in and left. If you can't get your drank on at a casino in Vegas, well what is the point. Really.

Seriously MEH. I just stayed two nights in December and the experience was seriously mediocre at best. It's definitely old and it shows. Also, just because it's expensive doesn't mean it's good! Though there are perks like the central location, the fountain shows and the gardens, for the price you could definitely get better rooms in one of the newer hotels. I wasn't impressed by the service here, it seemed what they had REALLY paid attention to here was making sure they got you touching the shit in their mini bar or displayed snack bar. Everything was adjusted with springs and honestly it was annoying because it took up so much counter space. My friends and I had booked rooms with AMEX and were entitled to perks like room upgrades and breakfast credit and other dining\/spa credit. However, they were INCREDIBLY difficult and stingy with the room upgrades, and the breakfast credit. The staff, specifically check in, are really inflexible and frustrating to work with. The concierge also becomes unavailable after 9pm which might as well be noon in vegas time, kind of useless when they're dismissed that early. We also tried to see if we could get into the clubs (hyde and the bank) at the Bellagio for free since we are guests and it is stated that way on the website. Absolutely no one was helpful, and when we finally inquired the bouncer people at the entrance, they said it was $20 for girls and $30 for guys. It was the weekend of 12\/19\/2014 and totally dead and the club had maybe 10 ppl in line at 10. It was a pitiful scene and ludicrous that they still tried to charge hotel guests. 

We had two basic rooms adjoining and one room with the fountain view. The view was cool but worth it to pay extra $$? Not really. The other rooms were also just okay, fairly small with a small tv, two chairs, one desk and chair. It was freakin annoying how few outlets there were, especially by the beds. I had to unplug a lamp near the bed to charge my phone. There's also very little counter space to keep anything, because they have a huge spring-wired snack bar that charges as soon as it's touched and you also can't use the mini fridge to keep anything cool because it's again, packed and spring wired so as soon as you touch anything you're charged. I've stayed at Mandalay Bay, the Palazzo, Trump, etc and this place was worse than all three, only better than Luxor. 

Because of the breakfast credit, we had about $30 pp. We decided to eat at the Bellagio buffet but the "special holiday" price was at $38 so we paid an extra $8 per person. We were a party of 11 but decided to separate into 2 tables because if we sat together there was a mandatory tip of 18%. For a buffet?! Meh. The buffet was also pretty bad, think the much cheaper Paris buffet is better. 

The one good thing was the housekeeping service. They were very good about giving us extra towels (one of my friends had thrown up all night and we were in desperate need) and some extra toiletry items.

Stayed at this hotel many times and my favorite in Vegas!
You just can't beat looking out your window, facing the strip and watching the fountains blasting off every 30 minutes. Listening to Frank Sinatra & all the classics with some champagne, it can't get any better!

I love their water show. I'm super sad when I come to Vegas and miss this...but this year I was able to watch it four times back to back coz it was on every 15 minutes. I was a happy girl!
Hotel rooms are pretty and clean...well, for the price it better be, right?! (much smaller than what you can get from another hotel though) But....It was worth trying them out and seeing what the fuss is all about...hehehe
Pool is awesome...they also have classes like Kick boxing while your in the pool on the weekends. 
It is pricey but if you can afford it...why the hell not?!

The Bellagio hotel was pretty  but not worth the extra expense of the room and food within the hotel . I had to pay $40 every night in fees but never had the feeling that I was receiving anything special as a guest vs a visitor. There was no fancy water anywhere or special entrance and my biggest complaint is there was no coffee pot in the room. I did not appreciate being forced to purchase coffee from room service. The staff was all friendly and the cleaning team was excellent, even lining up our shoes. However my overall feeling was that the Bellagio simply wanted to make money in any way possible, including not having the most generic ammentity , a coffee pot. There was also extremely loud construction next to the bakery for 2 days of our visit. Also the fact that there was only one entrance for guests and visitors made the hotel always seem extremely crowded and loud. I would not enjoy staying again at the Bellagio and instead simply visit the hotel for the same experiences but without extra expenses.

Yeah, the Bellagio was just okay, I said it..  I think our main problem with the Bellagio was actually that it was exactly what we thought it would be; out dated grandure.  The rooms were clean and everything was nice.  It was just the sort of nice that would have been super nice 15 years ago.  Not out dated enough to be offensive, just noticeable.  For instance, what nice hotel still has a crt television.   I know they have to have 3000 rooms so the $100 per room upgrade certainly adds up.  
We started out in a suite but it was next to the elevator and literally every elevator that went up or down made a loud wooosh in our room.  The next day we had to move because we couldn't sleep and the only option was to move from a suite with a king bed to a standard room with two doubles.  We also lost what seem like insignificant amenities like full sized shampoo bottles and a sea sponge but those things make a noticeable impact when they are in direct comparison.  
The second main problem (and we have experienced this with a lot of the 5 star hotels on the strip) is breakfast.  When you are out there for business, twice a year, on your own dime no option for a quick morning coffee and muffin is a problem.  The fancy pants french place is close but the ordering process with the 30 ladies behind the counter expecting you to know your pastry order before you have been able to see the pastries and then waiting another 10 minutes after that to actually pick your muffin up is so excruciating it makes you want to give up your morning coffee and breakfast habit.
If the Bellagio were anywhere else it would be the nicest place we've ever stayed but it just didn't feel up to new Vegas standards.  It doesn't come close to the Wynn, Vdara or Aria and even our rooms (especially after the demotion) in Planet Hollywood, Treasure Island, Paris and Mirage were way nicer.  
Go to the Bellagio for a great casino experience and a splurge meal but stay elsewhere.

Great atmosphere and attention to detail. Stayed here for a few nights and we felt comfortable and not rushed by crowds. The staff is helpful and friendly. We got there in the morning and our bags were held until our room was ready. That gave us time to go for breakfast and the mall to shop around. Our bags were taken to our suite within 5 minutes of check in and we were given a small tour of it. Definitely coming back to the Bellagio.

This is the first negative review I ever post on Yelp ( or anywhere else).While I enjoy the view of the fountain and my overall Las Vegas trip, bellegio was such a disappointment. Several comments toward my stay of four days and three nights:

1. After the first night, no one came to clean our room. We have to go to Walgreen to purchase tissue and travel size shower gel the next day.

2. Until the third  afternoon before we step out, we saw a cleaning lady, and asked her to refill our supply. She told us she will come back in 5 minuets, and of course she did not!

3. We went to the pool, wishing the room is cleaned and shampoo and shower gel is refilled by the time we came back. But it was still not!!!

4. I called front desk and was holding for more than 10 minuets, before I even finish my talking, she told me she will transfer me to someone who can assist. I waited another 10 minuets and the person told me she is sending someone in minute. We were wet and waiting for the shower gel :((((((the person showed up in half hour while I already jump into shower without shower gel.... 

We went to talk to the lady in bell service when we came down and she seemed to be impatient and not understanding.. She thrown me a number to call if we still not get cleaning service. WTF!! We are leaving the next day and just want to let you know...

BTW, we were charged for early check-in which was not being told when we checkin and refreshment in mini bar. We did not even open the mini bar so I argue when the lady and she agree to waive it. Make sure you check the invoice before you authorize them you charge your card!!!

For the price, it was totally not worth it!! We should have pick Wynn or encore.
The Bellagio is the best hotel in Las Vegas,the buffet was magnificent,i actually won money on the slots. thanks bellagio

Quick and Easy:

- overrated
- overrated
+ amazing crepes!!!
- overrated
- how can anyone not see that this place ISN'T that amazing?

It may be amazing to look at, but it really doesn't have anything more or less to offer than most of the other hotels on the strip. Via Bellagio? You can do that at the Forums.
If you want to spend your first day at check-in and not by the pool by all means, reserve a room here.

Our last trip was very pleasant, when we return to Las Vegas it will be Bellagio. Customer service was excellent, starting at the check in to check out. We stayed 3 days. Our room was very clean, with view of city center and the pool. Bellagio buffet? It is the best....
Great buffet.  I had to subtract a star because they ran out of the chocolate cookies at 7:30pm...but I did have 5 other desserts that were quite good.

Unfortunately this is a review I must post . I took my girlfriend and her parents out to eat at the Bellagio buffet . Food was great service was good as well. As they waited in line for the buffet , I decided to hit the tables. I was playing black jack and the dealer there was very rude to me. I asked for my life card to be made while drinking my beer and sitting down to gamble , she made a rude comment saying how many hands are you playing ? There was no one there . I sat down for 200$ . She said ugh okay Hurry up!! I was so shocked and surprised her time of voice was very rude. I sat down waited for my life and felt as I was obligated to play , even though I was not in the mood. I ended up winning about 100$ tipped her 5$ at the end and she said that's it ??? I just walked away after that. Never ever met such a rude dealer. Btw the mlife card they were suppose to make me didn't work when I tried to use it for the buffet..... Overall just didn't like the vibe at the tables , everyone else enjoyed the buffet .

You should stay at world famous hotel in your life!!
But why I left only 4 stars.....coz too crowded.
There are not only hotel guests. It was bother me a lot...
Anyway I still love Bellagio so what??
:P

There was a lot of sinning going on all over the bachlorette weekend we attended, but the classy Bellagio really helped us do it right. Chihuly art in the Lobby, a plethora of good restaurants, one of the nicests spas I've been to, many pools to choose from, the decadent fountains which we could see from our room (which you can set to music by finding the hotel's station on the tv), and some awesome restaurant options. 

I always thought staying here meant paying crazy high prices, but we paid a standard room rate for vegas and got a very nice room. The rooms were large, room service and housekeeping were friendly (and generous with the chocolates), and there was lots of room for girls to get ready. I am for sure coming back. 

After the craziness we encountered in our wild weekend, it was so great having a clean, elegant place to return to.

I've been coming to Vegas since I was age 4 but this was my first time staying at the Bellagio.

From the time we checked in, service was first class all the way.  Of course, it didn't hurt that we got bumped to a suite, on the house.

The suite is what I dream my master bedroom looked like.  The drapes are all automatic.  We had a view overlooking the fountains and there was a T.V. channel set to whatever music the fountain show was playing, so that we could watch in tune.  The bathroom even had a bidet.

Our trip was magical and customer service was top notch.  The room service is perhaps the fast, speediest room service I have ever experienced.  Within 20 minutes of ordering my food, it was at my door. 

I am now officially a fan!!
One of the nicer hotel resorts in Vegas.  I like the atmosphere.  Every trip to Vegas, I seem to go there just to be there.  It is a nice hotel to be in.
It is the Bellagio. That sez it all. Great dining, gambling, and relaxing. How can you go wrong?

Just so everyone on Yelp understands, I was not the one who got married. My friend was. My friend spent 18,000 on hotel fees, the ceremony cost and eating at one of the Bellagio hotels. Although I do understand your hotel is popular, I am not sure why. Your hotel is over priced, customer service is terrible and the hotel is plain. 

Brides, ****Do Not go to the Bellagio for a wedding. Save yourself $3,000+! ***

I was really disappointed by the Bellagio experience I had. I stayed at the bellagio jan 15-19, 2014 while working for a conference. I was part of a video crew and worked primarily in the room so I spent about 8 hours as day in there. There were two of us in a 2 bed average room facing caesars. The room was clean apart from the bathtub which looked like it hadn't been wiped out in a month. The bathroom door lock was broken which was awkward because I had several crew members in and out of the room. 

There were two incidents that stand out apart from the broken stuff. One was that I woke up with a massive spider bite on my face. That's just nuts. Maybe cleaning and maintenance standards are just low. The second and more troubling incident was that we went to a dinner at the conference and we were out of the room from 7pm to 1am. When we returned the door was open. The staff that had done the turn down service neglected to pull the door closed after they finished in there. We had tens of thousands of dollars of photo & video equipment inside and while luckily nothing was stolen it was still very worrisome. 

All in all I wouldn't bother with bellagio again. I've had great experiences at Wynn and flamingo. It really feels like bellagio is resting on its history. It's too bad.

I've never been a guest at this hotel, but I will give it a decent ranking just for the Chihouly Ceiling of Glass Flowers in the main lobby. The ceiling is worth seeing and sitting there gazing at it from one of the brown velvet couches is FREE.

Came by for lunch the other day. Compared with the Aria, the catering is light years ahead. The shrimps that we had for our salad were huge compared to the ones at the Aria.

The meat quality of the steak was also top notch.

Lastly, the main difference at the Bellagio compared to the Aria is the better air quality (less dry) and the seats that are breathable with real leather (vs. the pleather at the Aria)

This is one of the elite places on the strip to stay, if you aren't familiar with it already then let me clue you in, Cosmo, Caesars, Wynn and Venetian are probably top notch for the strip places to stay, and Bellagio is probably in the top two.  the pool area is stunning, great spa, rooms are plush with electronic amenities like remote controlled curtains, large screen tvs, etc.  if you are lucky you will get a view of the fountains and the strip.  

I would definitely say (and I've been all up and down the strip) I'd make a return here, nice place with great restaurants (Harvest is top notch and casual).  The only thing I would avoid here is the buffet, it really needs improvement - but then again none of the mlife buffets are as top notch as Caesar's, Wynn or Cosmo.

Check in is ridiculously long process. There was a long winding line and it took about 1.5 hours to get through. The kids almost lost their mind. The lobby is super busy and loud. Valet parking is $18\/ day. For a high end hotel it had no high end features. You feel like cattle. The room was adequate- a step above comfort inn but nothing fancy. The room decor is stale - lots of weird orange and brown tones. Watch out for the mini bar. It's pressure sensitive and the slightest knock of any product will result in major cash charges. Our biggest disappointment was the fact that the big pool was closed for a private event. How you going to charge a resort fee then close the pool for another event? And why $50 resort fee? I didn't get anything for it.

Romance equals delicious Italian gelato for two whilst Andrea Bocelli's Con te Partiro plays in sync with the elaborate water fountain show in the background. Magical!

Simply walking through the lobby is impressive enough.

It was my first time at the Bellagio and after staying at the Hard Rock, and Cosmopolitan I've realized that the Bellagio is the way to go.  I'm in my mid 30's now and seeing all the teeny boppers run around at the Cosmopolitain drives me crazy and made me appreciate my stay at B more.  I prefer the classic luxury Bellagio exudes to the trendy it resort of C.  

The rooms are nice and the one we got with the view of the fountains was gorgeous.  This is definitely where we're staying next time we come in about 6 months!

First off I've been to every major hotel (nice hotels) in Vegas I come 2 times a year at least been here at least 50 times first time staying here like all hotels I stay at I always upgrade I stayed in the deluxe fountain room suite the view is great that and the maid service is great. The rooms are way small takes forever to check in service is extremely slow and it's always packed with people that don't stay here just want to look at the free shows. I would recommend the Venetian or Aria will never stay here again or gamble.

My wife was coming up and she has always wanted to stay at the Bellagio. I decided to surprise her with a premier fountain view from the penthouse suite. 

Well worth the smile on my wife's face! 

The service is top notch. We were picked up by limo at the airport. Our driver was awesome and very friendly. 

At the hotel everything was taken care of, we didn't need to lug our luggage around and checked in at the VIP lounge. 

The room was HUGE, the views were amazing. I can't express to you how comfortable the bed was. There were 2.5 bathrooms. The shower was a steam shower which was awesome. 

Everyone was extremely helpful. If you get the penthouse you don't have to wait in line for the buffet which saved us about 45 mins.

Beautiful hotel I come here everytime I come to Vegas. I come to see the flower displays that changes with each season. Excellent place to see natural flowers and get some beautiful photo opportunities. If your not staying I would make your visit short to not pay much for parking or to park across the street at the planet hollywood where the parking is free. Awesome water shows I think they are every 30 minutes.
Great hotel! Excellent Buffet!!! A little bit pricy compared to others, but it is worth to have a try!! The water fountain is just amazing!
Great 6 night stay. Very quiet, large rooms with a huge bath, great service and. Lovely pools . It was a bit crazy because of the new year but it was handled well.

With the 15-18 years this hotel has been in LV, I've just never given them a chance.  I was pleasantly surprised at the quality in the hotel. 

I'll be first to admit, I'm quite difficult to please, and they did the job. Got a nice upgrade for a minimal feed at checkin. Suite was very nice, and Surprisingly clean for an older hotel. Hallways leading to room were very classy. 

Room had a steam shower, which was incredibly nice, even had a subwoofer for the tv in loving area which was awesome. 

NOTE: don't book the "run of the house" they stuff you in whatever room them want... Bad view, smoking room, no bed choices, etc... So of course we paid for the upgrade after not knowing that. 

Staff was friendly the whole time, entire hotel was always very clean, and almost all the food we ate on property was very good. My one complaint was with the casino. Gaming cashier cages were "in-conveniently" placed wayyyy out of the way to make it extremely difficult to cash out. And they maintain a long line so it discourages you to cash out (was a 15 minute wait) one time.  Slots are also very tight, worst I've seen in Vegas after trying 20-30 machines, never won a dollar or ever got above what I bought in... Learning lesson. Poker dealers were a bit rude too, but I've become used to that in Vegas as well. So you loose a star for your sucky gaming, but everything else was wonderful.

Just returned from a fabulous anniversary trip to Las Vegas. We booked a fountain view room at the Bellagio and we were not disappointed, the lady at check in asked if we had a preference for floor and we told her to give us the best in her opinion, so we were placed on the 28th floor. The elevators are a thrill ride, LOL ZOOOOM! We walked in the room and WOW! The Eiffel tower at the Paris and the entire fountain area like a postcard!
 Best room I have every had in Vegas. Comfy bed and pillows, very clean and fully stocked (but pricey) mini bar. LOL, But vending and ice was just up the hall. 
Casino was fun. better class of folks for the most part, but still a party atmosphere. Actually didnt do too bad and came home with winnings! 
WE do tip well, so we had some really good bell & valet service. Really not sure why anyone would complain, unless nothing pleases them. It was one of the best experiences I have had traveling, and the place is JUST GORGEOUS!! The flowers alone are worth the visit! 
The resort is not for folks who want to get stupid and loud, head to hard Rock if thats your thing. It does have that high end elegance that many casinos and hotels are missing in town.
Also if you LOVE high end shopping ( even if its just the window variety) you can spend a day inside and around the resort. its located in a fun spot on the strip. The money they didnt get at slots I spent at Giardini for beautiful Italian ceramics! Better than a cheap T-shirt, LOL.
Then there is Jean Phillipes Patisserie, with the giant chocolate fountain. Not just decadent sweets, but great Panini and crepes for lunch, and we made it our go to for coffee and Brioche for breakfast. Grab something and go sit by the pool with the paper ( Only for guests) .
Awesome dinner on your checklist? We chose Le Cirque at the Bellagio.  If French food is your thing,and you like to dress to impress, its one of the best. The service was amazing, the decor & the plates were wonderful and the food Gourmet. They helped me arrange a surprise for our anniversary and presented the table with a Beautiful cake from Jean Phillipes in our anniversary colors! 5 star+ to their whole team!!
I cant wait to return again!!!

Really beautiful hotel. I couldn't get enough of the water show out front! Reminds you that you're on vacation and you can enjoy things here with friends and family that don't involve gambling. They have a beautiful garden room here too. 

The staff is very professional and friendly. The only thing is that I think this hotel is overpriced but I guess quality doesn't come cheap? I had a view of the whole Vegas strip and got to watch the water show from my room. 

I recommend this hotel for a honeymoon or a family vacation! Classy.

I absolutely love this hotel for many reasons but the main one is customer service! 

I am so so sad that our Company's convention will no longer be here but I will continue to return for play visits.

5\/5 Customer Service. 
From the moment we pulled up in the Taxi everything was superb. Our bell guy was enthusiastic and charming. Gave us all the info we needed without asking... Where to go, who to talk to, how long it would take to get our bags etc.

Checkin in was quick. Receptionist was friendly, bubbly and broke down any upgrade options without sounding like she was selling them. 

Every security was so nice. Always an acknowledgement each time we passed them. Hello, good morning, evening, night etc. I was in the main tower and walked over to visit a friend to the Spa Tower and boy was that a looooong walk. The security guard on her tower told me without me asking since he saw my key color, about a shortcut through the pool when I went back. Now thats being attentive! 

The person I was most blown away with is someone I only talked on the phone to and never met. I woke up super sick the next morning, called in room service. I ordered my meal and my voice was almost gone, she sounded so genuinely concerned for me. She suggested i get the chamomile tea and she would ensure i had extra lemons and honey to soothe my throat. I didn't even think about it and it was just what I needed.

Pool Cafe is great. Margaritas are delicious and the salads are just amazing. 

Gardens are always impeccable and smell just wonderful.

I love their new email checkout. Very convenient and wonderful for business expenses as I was able to email my invoice to our accountant within seconds of checking out.

My only disappointment is that we did not get to try the buffet. Due to our long convention meetings, lines where always long the 3 times we went. Too long to wait but maybe next time. I will ask when the shortest wait time is.

This might have been a four star review. We spent 2 nights here, 2 rooms, one for my elderly but active parents who traveled from Palm Springs to meet us. Each of us upgraded our rooms upon check in. Everyone was very nice checking in. Mom was especially thrilled since they arrived early & the front desk was so accommodating letting them check in early. I heard about that numerous times. The Bellagio won her over on that one thing alone. Drinks at the piano bar were fine, breakfast in the Bellagio Cafe was much better than we expected. The place is lovely, clean, room was quiet but then..... We checked out. Mom was charged extra for checking in early. Did anyone tell her this when she asked if she could check in early? No, of course not. They're answer was 'it was on your confirmation letter sent at the time of booking'. Seriously, it's a standard long email that she didn't get, because she didn't book. I did. I wasn't there when she checked in. Just basic, gracious, customer service would entail informing your guest of the extra charge. Mom will never go back. Mom will tell every single friend & human she encounters. She is livid. Upon our checkout several hours after Mom & Dad, I found 4 things from the mini-bar charged to our bill. I politely pointed out the error. The nice young woman explained everything is on a sensor, 'perhaps something was bumped?'  Oh gosh that's possible I tell her. My husband put his leftover $170.00 steak in the fridge saving it for our flight. That's it she says. She's happy to remove the charges but now she must charge us $50 for using the refrigerator to store our leftovers. ARE YOU FREAKING KIDDING ME?  Oh yes. Evidently there are '3 signs on the fridge'. So up to the room I go. No signs anywhere on the fridge in or out. Back down I go luggage in hand, pictures of the fridge on phone. This time I'm told the sign is on the Fiji Water bottle and basically they aren't budging. After spending thousands of dollars on their property over two days it comes down to this. I'm just appalled. I am a business owner, I understand the hospitality industry, I know good service. This place doesn't care if you come here or if you come back. There are too many choices in Las Vegas. Do yourself a favor and choose a property that values your business.

Amazing, amazing, amazing!

First time staying at Bellagio and it definitely lives up to expectations.  We arrive around 11 and were able to check in early. This is a definite plus!

Our room was super neat and clean. The restroom has a shower and an amazing looking bathtub.  Ample closet space, a flat screen, and drawers for storage.

The best and most unexpected part? The amazing music they play throughout the hotel! 90s pop and r&b, how awesome is that!? Hello NSync, Craig David, and Jesse McCartney :)

I've been in Vegas multiple times but this was my first time staying here.

The location here was convenient, although the hotel now looks like a little midget next to the City Center Extravaganza next door. The rooms were insanely small compared to THEHotel, Palazzo\/Venetian\/Wynn\/Area; granted that those are much much newer.

Snootiness of the staff definitely needs to be cut down a notch. I get that they used to be THE place to stay but I can get a much nicer room at other places for a lot cheaper without the attitude.

I'll admit... I love the no child policy the hotel has. Getting nipped in the ankles while walking around Vegas rubs me the wrong way. Who takes an infant to the second hand smoke infested town!?

The hotel itself is gorgeous, the conservatory is beautiful and they have huge gorgeous flower arrangements throughout the entire place. I guess that's why they charge an arm and a leg for a room that doesn't even sport flat screen TVs!

We were lucky and they upgraded us into a lake view room where we were super high up and dead center to see the fountains.

Made a special trip inside to see the conservatory.  I really enjoyed it.  On the way back out, I plopped myself down at a $1 slot machine and put $40 in.  I played for about 25 minutes before I lost it all.   Never once saw a cocktail waitress anywhere nearby.  Slots are tight, and cocktail service is becoming almost non-existent in the slot areas at many of the casinos I visited.  They should do better if they want to bring guests back.  I heard on the news today that visitors to Vegas were down by 11.5% during the month of May.

I absolutely love this place. It has a calm feel to it and is beautiful. The garden is amazing. Never seen anything like it and the people there are so nice! 
The only thing I did not like was the Buffet. Too expensive and not that much variety. We ordered room dine in the whole time and it was great! I would definitely recommend this hotel!

beautiful hotel, prime location, nice pools and amenities, great nightlife and restaurant options, and awesome casino.

no complaints here -- can't wait to come back!

the fountain show is beautiful!

Large and luxurious are the keywords for Bellagio.  We stayed in a L&L room with a great view of the fountains and a spacious bathroom...that's always good because, ya know, I always like to have plenty of room when doing my thing in the morning.  When you're blurry-eyed from a late night at the tables, you don't want to worry about your toothbrush falling in the toilet.  Oh, and the bed was one of the most comfortable I've encountered in a hotel.

L&L also applies to their buffet.  I am not a huge buffet fan, but their brunch buffet has a huge variety of high-quality choices.  If you're trying to eat healthy, there are plenty of delicious choices that won't pack on the pounds.

The pool area is very pretty but of course gets crowded on a sunny day.  Try getting there before 11am.  The pool bar has some great drinks if you don't mind paying the prices (I had the frozen mango belini, my friend had watermelon juice - both delicious!).  If you need a cab, skip the monstrous taxi line in front of the hotel and instead go to the little north entrance where you might only have to wait a minute or two for a cab.

As one would expect, the casino tends to be higher limit tables.  You'll find only a very small number of $10 on a weekend night, and NEVER any $5 tables.  The dealers are friendly and make the games fun.

Gorgeous hotel\/casino. We haven't had the pleasure of staying at this hotel yet, but we always stop by on our trips to Vegas. 

Lobby and decor: 

I love the glass flowers on the ceiling of the lobby and the beautiful floral arrangements they have, that are constantly changing. 

The little garden area with the gorgeous flowers, decor, and etc. are all so beautiful, we walked through this conservatory a few times. 

Staff: 

We had a really chatty blackjack dealer, who was kind of annoying, because she kept stopping to deal to talk to us about her days in the '80s when the hottest drug on the market was cocaine. Go fig. 

The other dealer we had was lovely -- funny, talkative, but not distracting. 

However, the rest of the staff we encountered to ask for directions to the restroom\/whatever were all super-nice, friendly, helpful, and cheerful. 

Casino:

Plenty of tables, at least one poker room, tons of slot machines, and many other games. 

Buffet:

I love the breakfast here. I also really like the desserts here during lunch. I haven't had dinner here yet, but I'm dying to. I'm a sucker for a buffet, when the food's delicious.

Shopping\/etc.: 

I love the Via Bellagio shops and the tram to the Monte Carlo\/Aria. 

Fountains of Bellagio Water show:

BEAUTIFUL. I almost cried during one of the shows. 

Can't wait to stay here soon! I am also dying to see O.

This place visually is nice, as far as the attitude of staff and service don't expect too much unless you are the money mogul type. This place is ran by old school people that still lives in the 1930's. They try to pass off as if they are hardcore bad asses or something, especially on the craps tables.

I am sorry to say but this place is stuck up, but hey, i guess it is to be expected that's life.

RE:  Water Fountain show only - - Always enjoyable. They vary the music & water fountains often so it doesn't get tedious to watch.       TIP: View from the Linq's High Roller is really great (but don't get to hear the music).

Visited October 2016

favorite hotel yet. when im in vegas i barely spend anytime in the hotel room, so i sometimes feel guilty about paying so much for a room i will barely see. 

but the bellagio is special. i cant get enough of the fountain or the conservatory, as touristy as that may sound. plus its in a prime location on the strip, in my opinion. Also, its classy. not to sound pretentious, but gambling def has an ugly side and that seems to comes out a lot more if you happen to be staying in hooters or whatnot.

For an upscale hotel, Bellagio falls pretty short. It definitely has a grand atmosphere and looks classy; I felt more comfortable walking through the casino and shops at Bellagio than the casinos on the other side of the strip. The hotel, however, did not impress me.
