The best-located hotel in Vegas! And maybe the most photogenic one. We stayed here for 5 nights and it was great! The decorated garden\/ courtyard is amazing and I always look forward to the new theme. 

The staff is amazing from the front desk employees to the elevator guards to the staff working on the casino floor. They are all helpful and great. The view from the room is amazing especially if you have the fountain front rooms. you can see the show from the comfort of your room with the perfect view of the Vegas strip. 

One thing that disappointed me was their brunch but the vast shopping center made up for it. This is all it's form a true luxury hotel. 

I love the jean Philippe cafe here!

Bellagio is like the woman who get's better with age. 4 stars. Bellagio will always get high stars from me. A true mainstay. To this day I think it's traditional architecture stands above the hip and shiny buildings that have been erected around it in the recent years.
Stay there for 1 night. Hotel was great. Clean and nice. And, yep!~free wifi!~

The belagio is one of those hotels that if you aren't staying here, you need to go see anyway.
The dancing fountains are a spectacle that you really need to experience in person for the full effect. Every 15 minutes a new song and show, splendid really.  This always put a smile on my face when walking on the strip but don't stop there! GO INSIDE. The lobby changes with the seasons and always has something interesting and beautiful going on.  
If it wasn't so pricey I'd stay there immediately, I lucked out and went for a business sort of deal so the room was free. I was on the side of the hotel, up high, but man was it fantastic.   

The H club or whatever it was called, Tree something... I dnno but that wasn't what I expected it to be... In a good way!
Place was awesome with a rock band playing, an open patio view from behind the fountain of the strip... Just gorgeous!

My complaints... Don't really have any, there was a charge on the bill for something I never heard of but they took it off with out hassle.  
  The pool area here was great too the drink service was extremely slow though, man were they hard to get a hold of, even after you ordered your drinks. (And I guess I wasn't a fan of the amount of kids there... Really ruining the mood for the topless sunbathers and my sunburnt relax-mode before my flight home.). Oh which brings me to an awesome little tidbit, I had checked out but my flight wasn't for some time, they held my bags and gave me a day pass to the pool so I could have a little relaxation before going home!!  Very nice.

I didn't get a chance to try restaurants in the hotel at all but I did have an Ultipro conference with a band, catered food, go-go type dancers... It was pretty sweet and the food wasn't bad for that at all. If I had some more money this town and this hotel would see me a bit more for sure.

this place is simply amazing...  from the beautiful people to the great restaurants to the amazing service to the chihuly glass...  this place is first class all the way.  

never stayed here, but i make sure to spend at least one evening here each time in vegas.  this place is the place to just take in everything and enjoy the classier side of gaudy vegas.

one of my favorite things to do is to sit on the outside of the petrossian and check out the hotties walking by.

I guess I've been spoiled by staying in the Palazzo, Veentian, Wynn, Palms and Cosmopolitan. The Bellagio is reasonably priced and good for the budget conscience. The rooms are dated and the service is horrible at the front desk, but housekeeping, bellmen and valets were very friendly. (See what tips do!) 

I will not stay here again, and would rank this in the second tier of Vegas hotels like Ballys, MGM, Paris, TI and other such properties. I was there this trip for a convention and made a reservation very late, hence, I got stuck in the Bellagio. 

The amenities are second rate compared to other similarly priced properties.

In my opinion, what gives this place it's 5-star quality is the BUFFET! OMG!! Sure, it was a bit of a wait to get into the place, but once you were in, you didn't want to leave! Oh how I miss the endless supply of succulent king crab legs and the tables full of desserts and other good things! *sigh*

Well, if you must know why else this place is a 5-star hotel read on...

I stayed at this place with the bf and this is by far the cushiest (is that a word) place we have stayed at on the strip, thus far.

The lobby was an amazing place to walk into, the shopping was great, the service was quick and friendly, the rooms were immaculate, and the casino was *gasp* CLEAN and on the quiet side.

What made the lobby so great was its super-tall ceiling and its look of "cleanliness" (as compared to the cheaper hotels on the strip). I also liked how the public bathrooms were supplied with two-ply toilet paper. I know it sounds funny, but hey, in my opinion, that's how you rate the grandeur of the place.

As for the room, I loved the SIZE of it, the fountain view, and the never-been-touched look of it; it made me not want to touch anything for fear of moving something from its place! The look of the room also made me feel like it was okay to sleep on the bed because there was no evidence of raunchy lovemaking or anything of the sort. =) 

The bathroom was as immaculate as the room. This was one of the first hotel bathrooms in which I was not afraid to take a nice long bath in the tub.

All in all, great room, great price. I definitely recommend this place to everyone!

On a side note: if you have the time and money, go see Cirque du Soleil's "The 'O'." This show is conveniently located in the hotel. =) Good times...

The best hotel I have EVER step foot in! I went here to celebrate my sister's 40th birthday and decided to splurge on the hotel stay.  It was not a disappointment.  It's hard to say if any hotel is worth the price as the Bellagio, but they made sure to help you feel like you were getting your money's worth.  

It's always the little details that impress me.  The turn down service at night was always on point, after a long day of walking in the 110 degree heat in Vegas.  The chocolate mints next to my bed, were perfect for when I had a sweet craving but was too lazy to get up and search for sweets.  The comfy robe provided was wonderful because I didn't pack my robe since I was pressed for space in my suitcase.  Oh lawd, and the view!! 

Sweet baby, Jesus!! Our room overlooked the Bellagio fountains and it is so mesmerizing! I really don't know how my experience could have been better.

The staff was always so pleasant and helpful and actually acted as if they loved their job! I bet if I worked there, I would have loved my job, also.

Now, I will let you in on a secret: the Bellagio has 5 pools in the front of the hotel that appear to be private, yet I discovered them by looking out my hotel room.  The staff appears not to know what pools I am talking about but I am NOT crazy and the next time I visit this hotel, I will find these pools and swim in them ALL day long! 

Initially, I was going to give Bellagio 4 stars because I didn't think they had any penny slot machines in their casino, but I found them and hence I shall reward them with 5 stars!!! Ta Daaaaa!!!!

NEVER AGAIN!!!! Paid 1400$ for a 2 bedroom suite , was charged for items that were just moved , not open not used just moved ! Called front desk they say "you moved the bottle around so you were charged" OMG this is unbelievable! NEVER AGAIN! front desk were the worse ever!

Better than average accommodations. Really long lines for check in.  Valet parking is the way to go, no fee just tips.   All restraints are overpriced and not worth the money unless your incredibly lazy and don't want to walk anywhere.
It's the Bellagio so obviously the good and rooms are amazing...and you never know who you'll run into.

It was good, see? Real good.
 
Good:  
- Clean room.  I've watched too many YouTube videos of maids cleaning a room, wiping out a drinking glass with the same rag they cleaned the toilet with, etc.  This didn't SEEM like that.  Not one of those carpets that you want to line with towels before you walk across it.  The room, in both furnishings and cleanliness was a A+.

- Super nice staff.  From check-in to cleaning people to Concierge to Checkout.  A couple of semi-crazy people checking room cards at the elevators... crazy in a good way, making the guests who didn't speak English laugh.. felt uniquely American.  Personality over formality.  We're all in this together, let's have a good time.

- all the lines were short... maybe just a result of this being the lightest visitor week of the year, just before Christmas.

Bad:

- I could use a little more transparency on what the room is going to cost.  You think you are paying $161 per night then along comes the Room Tax, the Resort Fee and the RESORT FEE TAX.  The Resort Fee is kind of bullshit anyway... but a Resort Fee Tax is kind of like finding out the alien's anal probe is ELECTRIC.  That $161 just became $215!

- when did hotels stop putting coffee makers in the room?  I just want to get my day going without dropping $40.

- most of the blackjack tables were minimum $25. That gets expensive quick (or in this particular case, you win a lot of money quickly).  I'd like to play a ten or fifteen dollar table to at least enjoy a couple of "free" cocktails before I go home crying.  (On the other hand, if you are in a hotel with $5 BJ tables, you're rubbing shoulders with chain-smoking tank top dude who is trying to find the perfect 99-cent shrimp cocktail so...)

- the blackjack dealer.  Bob or Dave from Glen Falls or Great Falls, New York. Within 8 minutes of sitting down he was spending more time talking than dealing.  And you were quite clear what his politics were.  "We keep paying into Social Security and they tell us that it's going to run out!  But they don't run out of welfare money, do they??"  I really enjoy bullshitting with a blackjack dealer or bartender... but you're kind of a captive audience so when they go all Rush Limbaugh on you, they kind of have your attention.  But at least deal the effin cards while your irritating me. It was like playing Gai Pow at the Republican Nation Convention.

- the gym location.  Super great gym.  Best gym I've ever seen in a hotel.  Almost the best gym I've ever seen OUTSIDE a hotel.  But that morning trek to the gym is a private thing.  You're in your work out clothes, no make-up on (wife), sweaty on the way back to the room.  And the only way there is down long rows of blackjack tables and right through the lobby where there are billions of people trying to roll luggage and you just want to get to the gym.  Also, do you really want your visitors' first view of your wonderful lobby to be people trekking through on the way to the gym?

But, overall, really nice place and wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

To be honest at first I didn't want to stay here as it seemed like it might be a bit 'tacky' but after being recommended by a few good friends we decided to book in as part of our US trip for 3 nights.

How wrong I was! Upon entering the driveway it was just 'wow' all of the way. The reception was massive and they had plenty of staff ready to book you in. The only one downside was that we had to go into a smoking room which did have some smell left to it but was gone in a matter of hours and reception did tell us we could change later that afternoon if it was still bad.

The room was very spacious and the bathroom was huge. The resort is massive and trust me it will take you some time to explore. The gym had a great setup and has plenty of equipment- no waiting like at the gym back home!

We gave the buffet a go and just like everyone said it's a must visit. They make just about anything there and have heaps of options to choose from.

All up well worth the stay and couldn't believe the price compared to other hotels in the USA.

ps. the blinds in the room operate by a switch - we spent a while trying to force them open haha!

The best hotel I've stayed at in Vegas thus far. Very luxurious and clean. My friend and I were upgraded to a suite free of charge, which was pretty cool. 

Our room had a spectacular view of Vegas (at night, the view was awe-inspiring), very soft and plush bedding, a mini bar, bathrobes and slippers and decadent little chocolates on the nightstand every morning. 

The bathroom needs it's own review on here :-). Our bathroom was almost the size of our room (seriously!!) Separate glass-enclosed shower, mammoth whirlpool tub (big enough to sleep in), double sinks with granite counters, huge mirror, makeup mirror, a phone (haha) and designer toiletries fit for a king or queen. 

I'm talking 20+ bathroom items (razors, shave gel, q-tips, mouthwash, shower caps, hairspray, lotion, combs, 3 toothbrushes, hair gel, sewing kit and more, ...on top of all your standard items). My friend was floored by the bathroom and spent 20 minutes getting acclimated to all the wonderful features, amenities and products. 

The botanical gardens are lovely and a very nice welcome.  Be sure to catch the Bellagio Fountains water show for some cool entertainment (shows every half hour, every 15 mins after 8 p.m.)

Outside you can take a dip in or lounge by one of their 5 refreshing, beautiful pools.
Simply heaven!  Rooms were amazing!  Staff was amazing!  Hotel was amazing!  Botanical garden was amazing! No complaints on anything! Amazing weekend!  Didn't want to leave!!

Very nice location right on the Bellagio pools. You need to be a hotel guest to get in. The menu is a little overpriced but the food is surprisely good. The New York Steak sandwich is to die for. Too bad the french fries are too dry. The Tuna sandwich has nothing spectacular with not so much taste to it but ok I guess. Very good place for friends visiting Vegas (and staying at the Bellagio).

Ehh. The rooms are decent. Even though it was a lake view room the feeling inside didn't feel too luxurious as it did panoramic view at the encore. Better than having no view at all but ehh. The service was exceptional though, they keep it clean and fulfill your needs. I mean I wouldn't stay here again with so many options but it's not the worst choice either.
Reserved king bed. Got two queens. Waited 30 minutes to check in.  Rude front desk. Never again at this hotel

Had a great stay in the famed Bellagio. Our suite had a wonderful view and i got to take a million syncronized boomerangs (if unclear what boomerang is, please google or better yet, download the app).

Our suite was upgraded and we had a huge bedroom and private bathroom space which was great because now nobody was fighting about taking up too much space while getting ready. I can get used to this deluxe suite life haha 

We also ordered room service twice and the lady who served us and took the order was a hoot. The food was ok but atleast it was available at like 2ish which is what matters when you are too lazy to go out

One of my favorite things about the Bellagio  is their yearly chinese new year display which changes according to the chinese calender. This year it was the rooster and that means, alot of synchronized boomerangs :)

Bellagio has it all (almost): indoor shopping, restaurants, glass flower ceilings, a unique Chinese tradition and a great location on the strip....not to mention the hoards of tourists.

Stayed recently first in a fountain-view room, then in a corner-fountain-view penthouse (had credit card points to use; would not have spent the $ otherwise).

The views of the fountains and the Strip (and the mountains, for that matter) were unbeatable. I wouldn't have thought I'd want to sit in a hotel room to watch water be shot into the sky, but sure did. Over and over.

This isn't a negative per se, but I have to admit that although the fountain view room was 100% fine and the penthouse enormous, I kinda like the Venetian more for the "over the top holy crap how much marble can you have in one place is the phone gilded you know you're in Vegas" feel. 

I think Bellagio caters to folks who have money and so aren't looking to be "overwhelmed" by opulence because they're used to it. Which is fine, I just like being bowled over.

Was oddly underwhelmed by the spa. Well, let me restate. Totally blown away by the size of it; getting from the locker area to treatment rooms involved what seemed like a quarter-mile walk through an uber-contemporary series of hallways. 

My body scrub and mini-facial was fine but--and this is due in part to my choice of services--I feel like I paid a heck of a lot to have someone rub some salt on me, for me to take my own shower to wash it off, then coat me in goo. And when I heard the telltale "beepbeepBEEP" of a Clarisonic face cleaner, I was like, "Seriously? I'm paying you to clean my face with the same exact gizmo I have sitting on my bathroom counter at home?!?"

The buffet is AMAZING. Just typing that made me drool. I ate my weight in sushi. Which in no way stopped me from also eating lamb, sea bass, goat cheese, mousse, key lime tarts, peach sorbet...

Cirque's O show. Come ON! It's stupendous. Sit a ways back from the stage, though, and you get to actually see more (like the underwater action). You can't swing a dead contortionist without hitting a Cirque show in Vegas, but THIS is the one to see.

I would certainly stay here again. It's beautiful, the service is perfection and it's well located for all things Strip. But if you're price sensitive, this is not the place to go!

Omg so as of june 8th 2016 now you have to pay to park on any MGM PROPERTY ..... what a joke as we got out our car and eneterd the casino thats all i heard people talk about .... that it was ridiculous that now we have to pay to park at a casino ..... come on vegas its bad enough that people come here and spwnd hundreds even thousands and now you want to rip people off for $$ for parking ? What a joke MGM needs to get it together and fast cause word is that caesars Ent. Is ahead of the game as in gambeling and more people staying at their hotels

This place has the best SHOWS and I still haven't had a chance to see all of them.

My most recent trip here was to go see Ciruq Du Soleil O but unfortunately the tickets were too expensive and I had waited too long to get them. I had seen the offers online but even then the tickets were expensive. I will have to get them way early in advance for my next trip.

Aside from the shows this casino is fairly nice. I think the have the second most shops behind Caesar's Palace. There are multiple levels for shopping which is nice but it is easy to get lost if you don't know where you are going. Trust me, you can see the look of confusion in the eyes of people as they walk from level to level.

The gambling is fun here. There is a big sports betting area that is wide and spread out at one corner of the casino and then there are several machines to play throughout. One of the things that I noticed early on with the table games is that the buy ins are a bit higher here than at some of the other casinos on the strip. 

Lastly, the restaurants are really GOOD. GOOD like celebrity chef status cooking your food good. And the pool area is FANTASTIC. The pool is AWESOME and was packed when I went over to check it out. Be advised that you need your key card to gain access to the lower pool area. 

#highlevel #eloquent

Went to Vegas to get married, and were given a stay at Bellagio as a wedding gift. 

The hotel and grounds are beautiful. The staff is attentive. The fountain show is great. What wasn't great was the housekeeping. Our room was never completely cleaned (garbage not taken out the entire stay). 

When we arrived, our wedding clothes were in need of serious freshening-up because of incompetent airline staff on our flight out. The Bellagio staff got my wife's wedding dress and my tux cleaned and pressed in a matter of hours. They got it done, and at a fair price. 

The food was good, but nothing amazing. The valet staff was very prompt and efficient, as were the belldesk staff. 

It was a nice experience, but I don't know if we'd go back on our own.

The hotel is beautifully decorated, and very clean.  Spacious rooms and friendly, fast room service.  The smoked salmon eggs benedict is fantastic.  I love the VIP lounge with the snacks and drinks.  Always the most friendly staff.  The pool smells wonderful with all the beautiful flowers everywhere.  Lots of trees, so you can find a chair in the shade if you want one.  And the music is at a pleasant volume.  Fix was a great restaurant, but a little too pricey for the food you get.  Lily is a nice lounge and not too crowded when I was there.
Overall, always a wonderful experience!

I'm spoiled rotten. Where do spoiled rotten people go to enjoy themselves away from the privacy of their own home? The Bellagio. 

It's one of the nicest hotel's in the whole world. How many places can say that? It has more quality diverse dining than anywhere else in Las Vegas. Nothing about the Bellagio is overlooked in your stay, the room service is to die for. I'm so addicted to the Bellagio waffle and freshly squeezed orange juice. If you wanna go out to eat you have Fix, Yellowtail, Noodles, Sensi, Prime, Micheal Mina, and so much more.

I could spend days outside in the pool, it feels like you are in a castle. 
Yummy strawberry mojitos. Warm towels and Evian spritzers. I feel so much relaxation there, almost a sleep like coma. Definitely good for my tan.

Shopping, shit. If I won the lottery I will move into the Bellagio faster than you can say 'congratulations.' There's a lifetime of shopping, Chanel, Gucci, YSL, and so much more! 

The rooms here are off the chain. Amazing views in the executive suite, the spa tower is large and luxurious. Everything inch of this place is grand, fabulous, all around Italian Palace that still feels like home. 

Watch an unreal show like"O". If you decide you wanna get a nightcap, go to the Carmel lounge drink some whiskey or aged tequila.  Get even crazier at The Bank nightclub! 

I think I might even get married here someday, I love it that much.

P.S Look in the Bellagio Poker Room, you might see my boyfriend Adam playing. 
Stop bye, have a drink.

I really want to give it a 5 star, but I just can't. The staff was all 5 star, but the room was only a 3. The location is really good, a 5. I would consider this pretty much the middle of the strip. Our view of the fountain was the only good part. The window was kinda awkward and I thought small. I have stayed at many other strip hotels & when I upgrade to a better room & pay more, I expect it to not just be a better room, but an exceptional unobstructed view. I felt that the curtains & how the window is in the corner of the room, that it was kinda weird. In almost all of the other hotels I have stayed at, they have a tv in the bathroom & double sinks. This was not the case. The pool area was calm & got plenty of sun. There was more then enough pool loungers available. I would give the pool a 4. I am being a little more picky with this hotel as it boasts itself as high class. I would say The Delano or The Wynn are a higher class, but Bellagio has the better location.
I prolly won't stay here again since I have had better experiences at other hotels in Vegas.

Very Disappointed! The size, decor and amenities in the low ceiling room was what you would expect in a mid-range motel. The single sink bath had serious plumbing problems and a broken mirror. Check-in and check-out at the under staffed front desk was chaos. No queue line just a free for all. The common areas were fine, not special, but rough around the edges. The base boards were scuffed and wall edges were chipped. The conservatory was very nice.

For the first time in a Vegas hotel we were disrespected by staff 3 times. The hype and price do not match the reality.

I've stayed at the Bellagio a number of times for work evens and think it's one of the best hotels in Las Vegas. It's a nice, upscale hotel perfectly situation on the Strip. It's extremely close to the Cosmopolitan and Aria, which means you're a very short walk from even more dinning options.

The hotel is clean and the service is excellent. The casino smells less smokey and is less seedy than many hotels in town. There are a lot of restaurants to choose from and a number of high-end, luxury boutiques. I did not have time to go to the spa but I liked the fact they offered a day pass at an affordable price.

The Fountains of Bellagio are a "must see"  as the water is choreographed to move to a concert of opera, classical, Broadway and pop tunes. It may sound a little cheesy, but it's definitely worth checking out either from outside (facing the hotel), from the hotel terrace or from the window at one of the restaurants.

Given it's Las Vegas and a luxury hotel, the prices are not cheap. You'll be hard pressed to find a glass of wine under $15 or a coffee under $5.

The rooms are comfortable and offer black-out curtains, a bathroom with both a shower and large tub and flat screen TV. My only complaints are the pillows all were lumpy as if they were stuffed with cotton balls, and I could hear the guests talking in the next room and doors closing, but that's pretty standard for most hotels in Las Vegas.

I've stayed at the Venetian a number of times as well, and much prefer the Bellagio.

Hands in the air, shoulders shrugged, not sure what to say about Bellagio. I am a frequent Las Vegas visitor, I have stayed at just about every major hotel\/casino on the strip. On this last trip the purpose of my trip was work related, at least the first few days were dedicated to business. My employer made the travel plans and booked us all rooms at Bellagio. First off it is a perfect location located smack dab in the center of the strip and all the action. The lobby is beautiful, the entire resort is beautiful and clean. All that being said I still have a hard time giving this place more than 3 stars based on my own personal preferences and experiences. Check in lines were a joke, I waited over 35 minutes in line to check in and then waited another 30 minutes for my bags from the bell desk once I got to my room. I requested and paid extra for a room with a fountain view, about $30 a night extra. When I got to my room all I really had was a view to their parking deck and a corner of the fountain pond, what a joke. When I called down to the front dest to ask about a different room they could not accomodate me.  As beautiful as this place is it feels a little stuffy to me, I like a more upbeat vibe in a casino.  IMO opinion this place is more suited for an older crowd, I think my parents would absolutely love this place, I prefer the Cosmo next door and that's why when business ended I grabbed my bags and checked in next door to the Cosmoplitan for the weekend. On a positive note the Bellagio has an amazing fitness center, one of the best I have used while staying in Vegas.

A few friends and I stayed at the Bellagio for a weekend on our way to Hawaii. I did extensive research before our trip... Being from California I always used to drive to Vegas for the weekend but usually stayed at Circus Circus( a cheap yet comfortable place) This time I decided to  splurge and we booked the Penthouse Suite. It was wonderful! We arrived after a long (delayed) flight. Check in went very smoothly... I do wish that we had booked a fountain \/Strip view though. I wrongly assumed that all of the Penthouse suites offered them. That being said, the view of the mountains was very nice as well. Next time! The room was amazing... huge, with his\/her bathrooms, great raised bed... basically everything you can think of. Considering the size of the hotel I was expecting service to be slow and impersonal. Just the opposite actually... we were always greeted with a smile, "no problem" to our requests, quick room service( hour) and personable staff.

We ate room service three times... dinner on first evening(bad jet lag!), and breakfast on the last day. Quick, efficient and reasonably priced. 

Yes... the lobby\/restaurants\/bars\/casinos are filled with tourists from other hotels and well as the Bellagio. And what do you expect? It's Vegas! All of the hotels are like that... we visited other hotels as well during our stay. One shouldn't miss having a drink at the Fontana Bar to watch\/listen to the fountains. Then we hit the Blackjack tables.

We tried the breakfast buff on the second day. We had received "line passes" but when we arrived there was no line and wondered to ourselves why one would need these passes. We found out when we left breakfast and saw that a huge line had built up! The breakfast was astounding... great selection of choices. I ate so much that I was still not hungry at lunch time.

They do nickle-and-dime you..., . However, we had no troubles with our mini-bar. I have stayed in hotels with overly sensitive mini-bars and experienced problems. At the Bellagio we used the mini-bar a few times... and wrote down exactly what we took. During the check out, only the items we took were on the bill.

Walks within the hotel (point A to point B) were long... you almost always had to walk through the casino (of course). But that just gave you a chance to people-watch in my opinion. The corridors looked long, but we lucked out: our room was just a few feet  or so from the elevators. 

Tao was ok... great service, but the food was only so-so. I wish we had stayed at one of Bellagio's restaurants. But we wanted to see as much of Vegas as possible during our short stay. Next time...

You'll have a great time staying at the Bellagio... as long as you are aware that it is a huge complex, lots of tourists, with resulting lines. But it's Vegas! 

All in all... loved the Bellagio!

Though I don't gamble too much I love Vegas for the atmosphere and restaurants, and of course alcohol.  When it comes to food Vegas knows how to put out a spread... 
The Bellagio buffet is one of those 5 star spreads.  Even If you are the pickiest person you can find something to eat at their buffet.  I've been there numerous times and found that if you manage to go right when they are switching from breakfast to lunch you can basically have that many more choices to choose from.  Their steak madallions are succulent, crab legs to die for and so much shrimp its incredible.  It is definetly worth the price you pay for the food you get.

A very lousy experience for the price. It was something to try once, but from now on, my money is much better spent at a cheaper resort on the Strip.

Key issues:
- We had a Fountain View room and the windows were not cleaned on the outside - so when you went to enjoy the view that cost an extra $80 per night, you instead got a view of a bunch of dirty spots from a window that hadn't been cleaned in months. As such, it was impossible to get photos of the view from our room because the camera picks up on the crud on the window.
- They don't comp your drinks when you are playing video poker at the bar - Excalibur does, without question. The bartender did not communicate this policy to me before asking what I wanted to drink, so fine, I guess I'll pay for it - but a Maker's Mark was $18! Are you joking? It's a shot that cost you $0.50 to pour. In San Francisco, one of the most expensive markets in the US, this drink costs $12. When I complained to management about this, they very reluctantly issued the refund as if losing hundreds to them in gambling wasn't enough to pay for their liquor cabinet.
- Our check-in agent, Lexi, was rather rude and condescending and sounded like she hated her job or at minimum, hated us - and this was before we realized Bellagio was a huge waste of money, so we were actually quite pleasant at check-in.
- It was impossible to get in touch with my host after the initial reservation booking. I tried three times and each time he was either out of office or on the other line, and when I left a message for him, he would never return my call.
- @Bellagio never responds on Twitter, and neither does the Twitter handle for MGM Resorts International, so they have very bad customer relationship management.

Worse yet, the responses from Guest Relations to other people here with complaints contain very empty promises to fix things (yeah, right) and only expects you to come back and try again (Edit: See?). I won't be back again, and I think I'll take some matters up with my credit card company unless Bellagio wants to grant a credit back themselves for a lousy room and lousy service.

Long story short, stay at a Caesars property.

AWFUL SERVICE -- GAVE AWAY MY RESERVED ROOM & REFUSED TO GIVE ME ELECTRIC WHEELCHAIR THEY WERE STORING FOR ME

Despite having a confirmed reservation for a room with 2 queen beds, the Bellagio did not provide me with a room with 2 queen beds as promised and instead informed me upon check in that only rooms with a single bed were available. Despite leaving a confirmed deposit, the hotel gave my room away to another guest!

In addition to failing to provide me the room with 2 queen beds I left the deposit for, the hotel promised to provide was acceptance of an electric wheelchair rental prior to me checking in and delivering that wheelchair to my hotel room. This is an important promise of the hotel, as the wheelchair is essential for mobility and to accommodate a disability. The hotel promised that it would accept the delivery of the wheelchair before I checked in, and then have the wheelchair delivered to my room and waiting for me and available for use upon check-in. Despite the hotel receiving delivery of the wheelchair prior to my arrival, the hotel refused to provide the wheelchair to me when I checked in, and did not provide the wheelchair to me until the next morning. This is because the hotel gave to another guest the room that was reserved for me (where the wheelchair was supposed to be waiting), and then the hotel staff informed me that the hotel transferred the wheelchair to a locked storage room, and that nobody at the hotel would have the key until the next morning.  Which means that when a wheelchair was needed the first night, we would have to call security and request they would temporarily loan me a manual wheelchair on an emergency basis -- and have a watchful security guard escort my group the entire time the wheelchair was being used to make sure we didn't go off property with it and so that it was returned to the hotel.  It was such a humiliating, unconscionable, and demeaning way to treat a handicapped customer.  

Shortly after check in, I spoke to a supervisor at the hotel and was informed they would move me to a room with 2 queen beds the next day. But the hotel subsequently refused to honor this because the hotel gave away to other guests my promised room type A SECOND TIME. It is inexcusable and unconscionable a hotel the quality of Bellagio would refuse to honor a confirmed confirmation, give away a guest's room not just once but twice--and then also deny a guest access to their electric wheelchair necessary for accommodating a disability.

Hey Big Spender! That's the song I remember blaring to the fountain show, which burst practically an upside down waterfall into the air. I think it tries to add a bit of class with signature flash to Vegas, and for the most part, succeeds. Their lobby is pretty with these bright floral lights on the ceiling cascading their shades onto the marble below. (I can't do the description justice without making it seem tacky. Sorry!). They have a wonderful room for brunch with tasty eats and also where you can look onto the strip. When I went, it was too cold to go to the pool but that was beautiful too. And let us not forget or pay homage to the much overlooked gelato store with a delightful hazlenut flavor. It loses a star because when I was there, the crowd was a little too old for my taste.

This is a great hotel. Almost everything about our stay here was perfect. The front desk was very helpful at check in. I booked a package that had early check in if available so they called to get me a room that was ready for us before the normal check in time. We ate at Cafe Bellagio for a late lunch\/early dinner and it was really good. I had the burger and it was good. My dad had the turkey burger and like it. We went back for breakfast. We check out the pool area briefly at it was very nice. We sat up on a patio overlooking the pool having a drink. It was a great spot to relax in. This was one of the best stays I've ever had at a hotel anywhere not just Las Vegas. However I was not happy when I went to my room a half hour before my late check out to take care of some work that popped up and saw housekeeping in my room. She looked shocked that I was there and seemed to have no idea I was going to be there. The room was a wreck. The bed was pulled apart and she didn't believe me that I was supposed to be there. She had no idea what to say when I told her to open the closet and see that my bags were still there so I had to go back in. One only nice thing about this bad experience was that she asked to to put my key in the lock to see that it was my room and I could be there at 3:30. I always like that when they ask you to use your key to help keep you're belongings safe. Although it worked the first time she made me do three times before she let me get my stuff. I had told the front desk I would be using the late check out when I checked in the day before and verified it on my way to breakfast this morning. Still it didn't get to housekeeping. I also told her when she asked if we wanted service when she saw us in the hall in our way to breakfast. I wasn't super surprised that she went in but the state of my room was a shocker. I read online that a bunch of people who booked the same packed as me had housekeeping go in but promptly leave when they realized they were using the late check out. I'm not aware of anyone having their room torn apart while it was still theirs. I don't know but I suspect that she figured with a half hour left before I was supposed to check out I wasn't coming back and wanted to get my room cleaned so she could leave. What a way to sour an otherwise perfect stay. I'll be back and give the Bellagio another try but I hope I don't have the same issue because then I won't be back. Its not worth the hassle and frustration.

i always stay at the cosmo but my husband got an comp room here so we decided to check into the bellagio too while staying at the cosmo to see what it was like.. and i was fairly impressed. 

yes the cosmo is very hip and trendy but the bellagio had a little bit of more classy, more "home-y" feeling and was def. more toned down than the cosmo. 

the rooms are very classic and beautiful., i especially liked their bathrooms. we also got a room of the fountain view so all we had to do was turn on the TV to the channel that had the music from the fountains and we got to watch it from our room. very nice and relaxing. 

the only thing i didn't like was that the rooms that we stayed in was super far from the pools.. 

besides that i would def. stay here again.

Surprisingly this spot did the trick for my creeping hangover after an all too long night of pretending to be rock star!!! They don't deliver but you can do take out so that you can enjoy your meal poolside!

I'd highly recommend the chicken sandwich. It's ginormous so share it with a friend or two! It also includes chips and pickles. The staff were super friendly even offering complimentary coffee to go (I can only imagine what I must have looked like to warrant this offer but anyhoo). Everything tasted fresh and was prepared in a timely manner. 

If want a meal that you can eat while sitting by one of the many pools at the Bellagio then I'd definitely recommend!

Only reason for 4 stars was my 35.00 bacon and eggs!  I make good money and I have to tell you.  Some things feel like to much. Lobster I get. Steak I get...... Hmmmm Beacon & eggs? 

Plus tons of passing through traffic from other hotel peeps. Feels like Disney Hotel. Great if your up for stopping and taking peoples pictures. Hey sometimes I like the kids and family picture day feel :)
  

The Hotel is very nice and people great.



Verses the others? 

Aria: less crowded and better priced food, cool vibe
the Venetian: Has cool vibe and bigger rooms 
Wynn: Dull feeling.  To stuffy and staff not as nice
Caesar: Up beat and like the feel.  Nice remodeled room and great location

Hey I go a lot :)

** Walk Through Review **

Our hotel, Aria, offered a shuttle service that ran to the Bellagio which was nice because it was a quicker and easier way to get more towards the middle of the Strip. We had looked at staying at the Bellagio and if we return I would definitely consider booking a room here. The casino has an old Italian style with lots of similar art and design. 

Overall, the hotel seemed to be a little more on the upscale side than some of the other casinos I visited. Everything seemed extra clean and the staff were very friendly. 

The Bellagio also offers a free attraction out front in the form of the Fountain Show. Every fifteen minutes or so the show starts in the giant lake and lasts for the duration of a song. The fountains and lights are all synchronized to the music and makes for an entertaining show. It is really surprising to see how high some of those fountains can shoot. This is definitely a must see attraction!

I'm still a big fan of the Bellagio, but one simply cannot outrun time.  The rooms, while clean and fairly spacious, do not keep up with the newer hotels and the newer towers at the older hotels.

The quality of the gaming area and restaurants remains the same, although I was disappointed during my last trip where the single large baccarat table in the general baccarat area was either closed or failed to get a game of more than one person going.

Finally, with a more particular gripe, I don't like the fact that they discourage people from cashing out their baccarat chips at the regular casino cage.  No, buddy, you are not doing me a favor by cashing in the chips "just this once."  You should be more than happy to do it as a matter of customer service.

Too bad you can't have negative stars.  1 star is a huge compliment for these buffoons.

I hit the Double green on Roulette and THEIR system crashes.  I complain to the staff and they show me the TINY sign on the machine that says "System Errors void all bets." What a bunch of JERKS.  Lost the money I bet and they didn't honor the win.  

They could easily have rewound the cameras and seen that what I was claiming was true and yet all they did was give me an attitude& treated ME like I was the one who was wrong even though I had TWO eye witnesses sitting right next to me.

WHAT JERKS!!!!!

A conference brought me to the Bellagio for the first time and I have to say, I really just felt kinda meh about the whole place. I've always had it pegged in my mind as one of those "pillars of the Strip" or however you want to phrase that, but I really felt like these guys were resting on their laurels. I toyed with 2 stars, but ultimately decided 2 would be a little harsh.

Pros: I was able to check-in pretty early when I arrived....like noon....and my room was clean and ready to go - bonus! Always nice not having to wait. I also got a room in the Spa Tower which was pretty nice as I guess they had been recently renovated? Spacious room + comfy bed + roomy bathroom = happy me.

Cons: no coffee pots in the rooms. I know that everywhere in Vegas is just trying to get you to "spend spend spend," but seriously - no coffee pots?! Am I expected to go wait in a long line downstairs for coffee at 6:00 am? That sounds like a terrible way to start the morning. I also can't stand how crowded the Bellagio gets, but I don't see how that's really their fault. People really start crowding into the place around noon-ish, and it only gets more congested as the day goes on.

On account of the crowds, I'd probably choose to stay elsewhere on the Strip if it were up to me.

I don't often write reviews when the experience is still in process, but sometimes you just need to get something off your chest.
First off, hubby and I had high expectations of Bellagio.  Five star, fountain hype, and overall presentation would have expected that.  When we travel, we do travel very well, and Bellagio has fallen short on a few areas.
We reserved a Deluxe Fountain View room.  I love the fountains.  On an earlier trip, watching the fountains was a highlight, and I was looking forward to a good book, curling up while hubby was at a convention, and gazing away from my comfy perch at leisure.  Well, deluxe fountain view rooms start at floor 9, and we got put on floor 9.  That means my view is over the roof of the lobby and accompanying spires, and yes, I can see it - but disappointing.  There is a premiere fountain view, but I didn't think I had to upgrade to the very most expensive room.  I was wrong.  It's just frustrating to think we were the next to the highest price room there is, and then getting on the elevators for the lowest floors there are every time depressed me a bit (28 floors I think, divided into 4 elevator lobbies).  And they don't do the fountains during the day, and I didn't realize that part, either. Enough of that.
Dining options were fine, enjoyed breakfast in the Cafe and had a good panini at a little cafe near the pool.  The pools are nice, but hitting them just after 10 am on a Tuesday morning there were no chaises with umbrellas or shade available.  I went to the farthest pool a(there are like 5 pools) and was perfect for about an hour until the sun shifted.  Lots of options, but 4,000 rooms = a lot of sunbathers so be warned.
Casino is huge, but we're not gamblers.  To me it is a hassle to have to walk a million miles from the parking garage or breakfast to guest rooms elevators thru the maze of casino - but I know they are all that way.
Check in was fairly easy for us, but the concierge has had what I consider too long of a line the whole time we've been here (3 days as of now).  We had ordered O tickets and the box office line was 30 minutes for pick up, again disappointing.
The room is a good size, but not plush.  The linens are not really up to par for our expectations.  Bed is the same, OK, but not really 5 star.  Shower is generous size, but water pressure and temp was only OK.  Tub is neither oversize nor jet in my book.
Housekeeping has been fair, day 2 our room did not get vacuumed so we returned to pretzel crumbs.  I did not use the tub, but saw evidence of hair in the drain that they missed.
And night 1 and 2 there was no chocolate left on pillows, but night 3 housekeeping came knocking around 5:30 rather insistently and handed me chocolates in person, then a few minutes later a second housekeeping came barging in obviously unaware we were here.  Odd, on many levels.
It'll prob be here 10 years before we return to Vegas, and when that happens I'll do my homework on hotels and not pick one because of a favorite memory of fountains.
Stayed with a friend for one evening and hotel was amazing. Ordered room service at 4am and hotel staff was very kind and even brought us extra goodies. Highly recommended.

So we came to Vegas again and thought we'd try the Bellagio. We live in Dallas and frequently go up to Choctaw or Windstar. Both have their pros and cons- but we thought the Bellagio might be a bit more special. The double queen is mediocre, if you even lift a snack off the tray to look, you're billed. The bathroom has mildew and mold in the shower, peeling wallpaper and the cheapest toilet paper any hotel could buy. This is the Bellagio right, not Best Western?

The toothpaste we brought with us was dried up, so I  called down to the concierge to ask if they might bring us some toothpaste. Bear in mind, for us and the staff that work here, the hotel is huge. Usually you might trot down to pick it up, but as it's the 'Bellagio' we figured customer service would be great. NO.  The concierge actually seemed incredulous that I would ask. He asked me if I wanted 'delivery'??? I know it's a long way, that's why the onus is on them to provide customer service- Am I mistaken? Does EVERYTHING here have a price? 

The rooms have no amenities other than what you would get in any hotel room, BUT there is no space for anything in the fridge, there is no coffee maker, there's an iron, hairdryer and an ice bucket. Woo hoo. So, can't brew a cup in the morning, have to order it in, minimal bath products, didn't expect to have to beg for anything here. But as the concierge put it so nicely, we COULD pay to have anything 'delivered'. 

Maybe they don't have to work that hard to keep customers coming, personally these are just a few small things that mean I don't consider this hotel any better than a Best Western. 

Expected more, should have had lower expectations.

Only reason for 4 stars is the food lines are always so cluttered and not very well directed. 

Other than that. Lobby is perfect with the Dale Chihuly glass art. I always go to the store, and garden. Those are always my first stops!

We've stayed at the Bellagio a few times and it is definitely one of the most spectacular resorts on the strip.  We had the premier fountain view room and watching the fountain show is one of the reasons I chose to stay here.  I also love the beautiful conservatory, gallery of fine art and all the shops and restaurants.  My all time favorite Cirque du Soleil show "O" is at the Bellagio.  The only downside is that it is very crowded especially during the holidays.

Bellagio is one of the casinos I've heard the most about in Vegas, so I had to give it a shot... and I was not disappointed! Besides the casino, they have the aquarium area with lots of beautiful flowers in the shape of animals and huge fishtanks. They also have the longest chocolate fountain in the world, which is showcased through this hole-thing in the ceiling, standing proudly next to its Guinness Book of World Records plaque. There is also the fountain show out front, which I actually missed but I'll be sure to see next time I go. The Bellagio is a fun and scenic place in Vegas to walk around, escape the heat, and gamble a bit :)

What an incredible hotel!!!! The size, the people, the staff, THE ROOM!!! I had the most incredible room ever.  It was a suite on the 21st floor that overlooked Caeser's Palace, Paris & the Fountain SHOW!!! What better than coming in and watching the Fountain show from your room.  I also got an eyeshot of downtown from my room too.  Even the dealers on the casino floor were so friendly and talkative. They all had personality and I've NEVER been to a casino and seen so many dealers with personality.  It was fantastic.  Even though I was losing most of the time I kept playing just because it felt great to be around the dealers and even talk to some of hte other guests that have come around the world.

Wi-Fi: Free"  It is not free.  Bellagio is like that old saying "That will be extra". It works intermittently and it's very slow. Oh well, I'm not in Vegas to stay on the computer, anyway.

Check in is a disorganized mess. Ever hear of velvet ropes, Bellagio?

The room was nice and tidy, and I liked the light switch controlled draperies. Otherwise, it's a room.

Not a fan of the resort fee concept. When your coloring is something like Conan O'Brian's, one resents paying for a pool. I did manage a visit or two, but the rest of my time left no room for using the pool, and it was cold, so it was a waste of money.

It's a very crowed, pretty hotel.

You'd figure that as nice as this hotel is in the lobby area the rooms would be amazing as well. Unfortunately that is not the case. 

Half of the light bulbs in the room no longer work. There is no HBO or premium movie channels on the TV. The restroom looks like it is straight out of the 1990's with mold and peeling wallpaper. If you get a room in the secondary tower be ready for a very very long walk. 

I'd recommend staying at the Cosmo, Mandarin Oriental or Aria instead of this place until they start remodeling some of the rooms.

So classy my tax bracket went up just being here...

I then proceded to Riviera to lower it (I hid between a couple of old people).

Beautiful hotel. There's a chocolate waterfall in one of the stores that's hypnotic. Yes, chocolate waterfall... I will do your bidding...
Nice rooms. Even for a Thursday it was very busy. Too many shops for my taste but it was a nice hotel for the night.

The Bellagio is the first mega-resort that I remember, with all the artwork and the upscale mall and whatnot.  Throw in the fountains and you have a true resort, as opposed to a sprawling property, like Caesar's.  I can't speak to the rooms, as I've never stayed, but the sheer elegance of the property is impressive.  Even now, as long as it's been since it was built, it still looks nice.

I remember when the Bellagio was being built during one of my first visits to Vegas. It was something pretty amazing and daunting to see at the same time... people putting together this massive\/expensive project.

Since then I had always wanted to stay and be an alum of the Bellagio experience. This was the first time I was able to do so and it was all thanks to Travelocity which put my 3 night trip for 2 people, round trip tickets and 2 shows at just over $1000. Of course this meant that I was put in their least expensive rooms.

When you walk it, you can feel the luxury, the grandiosity of it all. Truly spectacular and everything in the lobby is what you would expect of the hotel. However once you get into the rooms it's something of a different story.

There is nothing inherently wrong exactly, but we had 2 rooms. The first room had bad air conditioning. When you come in from a day of walking up and down the strip you really want to relax in a room that is nice and cool. They then moved us quickly to a different room to accommodate us which I thought was very professional of them.

The next room had a good air conditioning, but the lamp in the bathroom had a busted bulb. During the afternoon, their concierge is often quite busy to the point that you're on hold for 5-10 minutes. But once you're on the phone with them they are polite, nice and never seen irritated or annoyed. 

Without the problems we encountered, I would say that the rooms are what you would expect from a hotel like this... that would put the number of stars at 3. Nothing mind blowing or awe-inspiring, but not necessarily anything negative (even though I was a little peeved about the little things wrong with our room).

They do have room service and claim to "fulfill your every need". Apparently if you are craving some type of food, they would find it for you if they don't already offer it. However, I'm sure you'll be paying a pretty penny!

Overall, not a bad experience and the hotel met my expectations. That's why it received 3 stars instead of anything higher. I didn't include the fountains\/restaurants and conservatory because those are things that are rated independently of the actual hotel itself!

The room type (tower fountain view king) of my reservation was sold out upon arrival. Although hotel is very nice to upgrade us to a suite, the room was filled with cigarette smell. And after complaining for couple days hotel could still not find alternative room for my wife, my 9 month old son and me. Housekeeping came in with ozone machine and tried to get rid of the smell. We had to leave the room for a while, which was really inconvenient. Smell only got lightened but still exists. 

Upon check out, I called a day earlier to ask for a late check out. Front desk said hotel can extend check-out time for an hour to noon. But housekeeping started knocking at 11 sharp EVEN WITH "DO NOT DISTURB" LIGHT and came back again at 11:30 to see if we are leaving. 

Communication between housekeeping and front desk is definitely having some issue. Otherwise there wouldn't be an issue of checking into a non-smoking room smell like ash, or keep asking guests to leave like we are being kicked out.

Although the fountain suite was nice, it will be hard for me to recommend to others with the issue listed above.

I stayed here with two friends earlier this Summer. I was excited. It's THE BELLAGIO. It always sounded so fancy and luxurious!

The lobby is beautiful. It's just like I would have imagined. Lots of marble, etc. The rest of the hotel is pretty meh. Casino is fine, but not really that amazing, just nicer than most of the others that I've seen. Conservatory is kind of pretty, but when you actually get in there it's sort of cheesy. The nicer restaurants were pretty good, while the others were pretty average.

We reserved a fountain view room, but the room they placed us in actually had a charming (not) view of the parking garage, with a teeny tiny view of the fountains out of the very left of our window. Come on. If you didn't have a fountain view room available that's fine, but at least let us know. We paid extra for absolutely nothing. We called down to the front desk and they were very unapologetic and unhelpful. I expected much better customer service. Besides that, the room itself was very disappointing. It is expensive to stay here, and I would have expected a really wonderful room, but no. It was like any other boring room in a very average hotel, and actually not as nice as some places I've stayed in DC or NYC for less.

The only part that I really enjoyed was the pool. It was like being in Greece or something with all the fountains, and the different pools. The décor was beautiful. You could rent one of the cabanas, but I don't think it's necessary. I do wish they had one pool that was specifically for children and that children were not allowed at any other pools. I hate to be a grouchy adult,  but no grown person enjoys being splashed in the face. 

Vegas is a "special" sort of place, and I don't think I'd really want to stay anywhere else. Most places look so gross! But it's not much of a recommendation that I would stay at a hotel only because all the other options are so horrendous.

Elegant, beautiful, and well set up; this place is great. It also has the best most convenient parking on The Strip.
I just wish it wasn't so expensive to stay, eat, or shop here.

Had to stay here for a conference. Meh. It's okay, I guess.
The staff are friendly enough, and the room is clean and spacious.
But the amenities are lacking. The hallways stink of cigarette smokes. 
I understand it's Vegas, but there were loud drunk people late into the night, and I even witnessed someone spitting on the floor in the lobby. Yuk. 
The chihuly installation in the lobby is absolutely stunning to look at but the downside is that there are tons of people day and night taking selfies in front of the art piece right in the middle of everything near the entrance, and getting in and out of hotel was very annoying.

We realy liked the rooms, and the water show is on point at night. Its also close to the strip but it lacks restaurants and the ones they do have close pretty early. Over all its a great hotel and we would stay there again.. Shauuu!!

The Bellagio is by far my favorite choice of hotels in Vegas. The rooms are elegant and I like how the hotel is close to many shops. The water show is a must-see, of course. They have nice restrooms and everything in there is pretty clean.

We stayed at Bellagio during President Day weekend.   The hotel was clean and beautiful.  But the service was horrible.   They keep charging us $50\/day for refreshment in the minibar even if we never touched a single item in the refrigerator.

The Bellagio is not the cheapest place to stay on the Strip, but you know it's going to be quality. The room will be clean, the beds will be comfortable, and the little things you expect to be done will be done.

If it's your first time in Las Vegas, it's kind of fun to watch the water show from your room if you have a room over looking the water.

My fiance and I went here for our 9th year anniversary. Everything started with the check in. There was this really creepy dude checking us in. He hardly spoke and what he said was odd and cryptic. We both felt rather sketched out by the experience. We got a corner suite. The hotel is pretty nice. Lots of marble. The room itself felt dated. The lighting wasn't organized very well. You had to run all over the room to turn off lights. The shade near the tub wouldn't go down when you pressed the button. You just had to wait until it was ready to go down. The sofa was stained in places. Our bed had deep indentations because the mattress was clearly OLD. The service was subpar at best. I arranged to have flowers delivered to our room while we were out during the day. They dropped the ball. I had to call down to the bell stand to get them and was admonished because apparently, I did something wrong. I ordered the flowers through the concierge, they set the expectations and I followed their directions. I'm not sure what else I should have had to do. When I called the concierge I asked if there were any romantic things to do, just hoping for suggestions. She sounded like I had asked her to save my relationship or something. It was odd. I felt like the question was out of place. What else are they there for? We mostly ate out at other restaurants during our trip but one night we decided to keep it simple and try the buffet. HUGE MISTAKE. It was simply horrible. The food tasted old and what was fresh, was not good. The place smelled and the staff was embarrassingly disorganized. We played $40 each to eat and barely ate a plate of food it was so bad. I wouldn't stay here again. The service didn't meet my expectations for the price we paid for the room. Based on the reputation of the place we were horribly disappointed. I would have given it one star but we had a really nice bellman on our way out and one night this really cool and sweet person helped us print our O tickets.

Beautiful hotel. The displays are amazing and we couldn't get over the amount of fresh flowers.  There were long lines for checkout and checkin.  We paid for fountain view room, but while we could technically see the fountain, we were in newer part of hotel and really looked over a parking lot.  When I called to complain about this, I was on hold for 20 min and got the response that I could pay more for a better fountain view. Pool was nice.  Despite the annoyances listed here, this is a high class hotel and I would stay here again.

*review for the garden*

such a beautiful display of plant-life for everyone to enjoy!!!

and... well...
i'm at a loss for words because this place seriously takes my breath away!!

*sigh*

I did not stay here, but I love the attractions here!

Two things to love here:
- Water fountain show (which can be seen outside of the strip)
- Garden of flowers 

What I love about Bellagio is their garden - how they change the atmosphere every season. And every time a different décor. I love the use of the flowers and pieces. Everything is so colorful and this is what brings in the tourists and crowds. 

I don't blame them! I am forever a fan!

P.S. You can ride a tram to Aria from Bellagio! (Hollah!)

Bellagio will always be the center of the Strip, no matter what they build. 

This is the best casino floor in Vegas: fantastic people watching, lively Vegas vibe, big gaming action, and the home of poker outside of LA. In the fountains, they have the best (free) attraction in town.

Bellagio is a great casino resort, from A-Z. The newly remodeled rooms are a big improvement & the amenities are all you would expect from a 5 star hotel. Steve Wynn built the Bellagio & his legacy definitely remains. But he's been gone for a few years & nowadays the Wynn\/Encore property trumps all.

Love the Bellagio and its where we stop all the time! But this time, its like the whole casino was playing a trick! there were no ashtrays anywhere! We had to walk around for a while to find 1 random ashtray, and a couple of gamblers sitting next to me made the same comment. We eventually starting taking the ones we found with us from game to game. At one point, I asked someone who worked there what was up. Where were all the ashtrays! So, if you want to gamble at Bellagio, take your own ashtray, or do what we eventually did, which was just ash on the ground, which made it VERY dirty. Not sure if that's the intent of Bellagio, to hide all the ashtrays so that customers just ash all over the place? I dont feel guilty about doing that, and leaving the butts at the machines. Put the ashtrays back!
The water show was great. Walked around ans was truly gorgeous and next time maybe we will stay there. I did four because i did not stay there or buy anything.

Our favorite place to stay in Vegas!  It may not be the newest property, but the rooms are updated frequently, everything is clean and the clientele is classy.  It is very relaxing once you get past all the tourists in the lobby and atrium.  We have enjoyed a lot of pool time and many meals at Olives.  We prefer the Wynn buffet but this one is still pretty good.  The fountains are still impressive and a must see in Vegas.

5 stars: It was my first time staying at Bellagio, so I was super excited especially after hearing how great it is.  Location is awesome, right in the middle of EVERYTHING. Not to mention I scored an awesome deal by using a promo code I found online averaging my stay to $100\/nt.  Compared to some other older casinos on the strip, you don't feel like you're suffocating in cigarette smoke.  

3 stars: I do hope that Bellagio will one day realize that they need to update their room decors.  It's a bit old fashion for me....I did afterall just come from staying at The Hotel...so I couldn't help but compare the 2 places.  The rooms were also a lot smaller than I expected, but you're not suppose to be in your room while you're in vegas, right?
Stayed here when I was in Vegas and would stay again. Friendly staff, good service, nice views and location. All that's needed in a hotel

What another great stay at the Bellagio!  I stayed here the third weekend of August with three of my best friends for a send off before one of my buddies from college headed off for the Navy.  Although I've stayed all along the Vegas strips on my frequent trips, I stayed at the Bellagio the very first time in March of 2012, and based on my first experience, there was no way I was going to pick another hotel to stay in August.

The service was second to none--valet service, bell desk was phenomenal.  Check-in was fast, despite the lobby being slightly crowded. I had originally booked the basic room, though the resort was busy, and the check in rep was able to give me an upgraded room, overlooking the gorgeous pool.  

The room was again, in excellent shape.  Big rooms, clean, and somewhat close to the elevators (my preference).  

Service is all about the Bellagio.  My friends and I were ridiculously drunk, and yet, they met our expectations when it came to room service.  No mistakes, like I've had gone thru with some of the other hotels.  

Let me also point out--so my friends and I were getting really drunk before we had plans for the night, and so after taking like 5 shots or so of Gentleman's Jack, we were slightly late in getting to dinner at Paris--Mon Ami Gabi.  The concierge called the restaurant immediately, and didn't have to worry about being late.  Honestly, it's the little things, esp with service, that makes a big difference when staying in a 5-star hotel, like the Bellagio. 

Their casino floor is pretty nice--classy Vegas looks all around, and the staff on the gaming floor is once again, amazing!   Prompt service--had won a small jackpot, but really didn't have to wait too long for them to bring the forms out to me.

The pool is to die for!  Well, to me, it's pretty nice--three or four different pools, quick service once again, and oh yeah, did I mention, cute girls too! hah  Although it was slightly crowded, didn't have any trouble finding chairs--plenty of space.

Whenever I return to Vegas, Bellagio will be the hotel I'll be staying at.  Although I am interested in staying at other resorts, such as the Cosmopolitan, Wynn, or Palazzo, I am forever grateful for the effort and high-quality service that the staff provides me.  Again, it's a big A+ in my book!

Hands down, the best casino on the strip.  The rooms are fantastic.  The 24 hour Bellagio Cafe won't make you puke (the Wynn's will).  The $6 chai at the Italian cafe is *almost* worth it.  The poker room is one of the most challenging in Vegas.  There are a bunch of cliche high end luxury stores for people lacking any fashion sense whatsoever.  What more can you ask for?

I spent three days here on a family vacation. We booked this hotel because of a deal they had to get a discount on Ka. Overall, the bellagio is a nice hotel but not quite worthy of its reputation. It's age is beginning to show and there are simply superior alternatives for "5 star" vegas luxury. 

Do not stay on the top floor of the hotel (26th in the spa tower)! There was a fairly loud and annoying buzzing sound not just in the room but the entire hallway. I'm not exactly sure what it was, maybe the central heating system? At any rate, I went to switch to a room in a lower floor (16th) and it was much quieter there. The first really cool thing I discovered was the power curtains. They have controls for them built into the walls at 3 different spots in the room. Now I realize this is probably nothing special to many people but it's the first time I've ever been in a room with this feature. The view was nice also. In the morning we could see the mountains in the distance and at night the strip lights up. One nearly inexcusable fault is that the standard rooms still aren't equipped with flat screen tv's! I was impressed with the availability of chinese channels. That made my parents happy. The furniture was a mixed bag. The chair's were very soft and comfortable but the drawers and tables looked kind of old and don't stand out from those in any other hotel. The bed was nice and firm, but the blankets were a bit too heavy and the pillows too soft. The closet was small but it had its own light. The safe was too small because it is taller than it is deep, so we couldn't even fit a netbook in unless we propped it up vertically. I really liked the bathrooms. It was a double sink with a separate tub and shower. The shower had a place to sit and the tub was large enough to fit my whole body. The makeup mirror was small but had its own light and was double sided, one side was a normal mirror and the other side was a magnifier. My only minor complaint was a little bit of cracking and peeling in the corners, but it's not something I would have noticed if my mom hadn't pointed it out. Check in and check out was a simple and painless affair. We checked in around 6pm and there were plenty of lines so we didn't wait that long. Check out can be done from the tv, very neat.

I didn't actually go swimming since it's december, but I did walk around the pool area and it's fairly nice. The scenery is pleasant and they have i believe 5 pools although only 1 or 2 were open due to it being winter season. There were plenty of seats and since the bellagio is a more expensive hotel I would assume the pool won't be too crowded even during the summer. Be sure to bring an extra towel to cover the chairs though because they were surprisingly dirty. The only other downside is that even there main pool isn't particularly large so tough luck for those who like to race and swim laps. 

I won't spend too much time on the rest of the hotel since it's available to non-guests. The conservatory is perhaps the best thing about the hotel, it's beautiful, a perfect picture spot and best of all, free. Be sure to go early like I did, though because it gets insanely crowded. The casino is decent, although of course the table limits don't exactly cater to poor college students. I did find one $5 blackjack table at around 5 am though. When it's busy the $10 tables are usually filled up so most people will have to play at $15 and up. Took a peek in the high roller section and lol'd at $500 slot machines. Amazing that there are people who can afford to blow more money every 5 seconds with the push of a button than some people make in a week. The atmosphere in the casino is alright, not too crowded but not too empty, and the clientele is older than average. In any other city, I'd be very impressed with the shops at bellagio, but this is vegas and it's pretty ordinary when you consider all the other great places to shop on the strip. I didn't try any of the restaurants or spa since that stuff is ridiculously expensive.

The quality of the staff was a mixed bag, but mostly positive. The majority of the clerks, dealers, security, and housekeeping were friendly and attentive as expected from a hotel like the bellagio. Unfortunately there were a few real sourpusses who were rather curt and seemingly annoyed with their jobs.

All things considered, the Bellagio is a good to very good hotel, but definitely not great. I probably won't be staying here again since there are just so many great options in the vegas strip.

At times, I hessitate giving a place another chance.  In this case, it was necessary because I use to LOVE Bellagio.  Once again, I've fallen in love with everything about it!! 

As a MLife platinum card person, I was in the guest line which was very short.  The lady behind the counter was super sweet and professional.  She asked the reason for our visit and I told her it was for our anniversary.  She quickly called someone and got us an offer for a Suite.  We agreed to the low increase and took the upgraded room.  

Our room was clean and well decorated.   Felt like home because one of my living rooms has the same color scheme and coffee table.  

The shower was a steam shower as well which was fantastic!  The jacoozi tub was incredible!  They had little packages of Epsom salt, loofah and bath gel.  The comfy robes that I love were in the closet.  It was like being at home with my comfortable things around me.  

As far as the hotel, it was cleaner!  That really worked on the ornaments\/decor and brought back the shine luster of the glass.  The staff were all super friendly and helpful throughout the resort.

Room service at Bellagio is on my top 5 in Vegas list.  It's always delicious, quick and easy.   There are great options to pick from.  Over the years, we've had everything on the menu and were never disappointed.

As far as restaurants, they are all amazing!  I'll writee separate reviews for those.  

So glad that they have fixed all issues that bothered me last time.  It means they truly care and want us to enjoy our experience at Bellagio.

Thank you for a lovely stay and keep up the great work!!!

We really enjoyed Bellagio!!  Our room was very comfy and had an amazing view of the fountains.  Housekeeping was very nice and attentive.  I loved that this hotel seems to be a little bit quieter and slower paced than some of the other hotels we've stayed at on the strip.  We will stay here again for sure.

This was my first time staying at Bellagio, and I was impressed, but not blown away. I think they have such a huge reputation that I was expecting there to be unicorns and red carpets and free personal assistants. 

The check-in was easy enough, and the flowers and decorations were really very nice. They also have the casino machines turned down, so there was no loud "ding ding ding"...I guess this is a positive, but that sound is just synonymous with Vegas so we didn't get that adrenalin rush. 

We got a complimentary upgrade (MLife) to a lake view room, which was a lot of fun to watch the fountains and listen to the choreographed music that played through the TV. 

But speaking of TVs...seriously it was an old tube! And small at that! I agree with other posters that this is just weird. The room was pretty standard, nothing too special. The turn-down service was nice, though, and the shower and tub were very spacious. 

If you go, request a room near the elevator or you will be walking for miles. The other nice thing is the tram that takes you to the Aria\/City Center....still, though, this hotel is so spread out, you will be walking a ton no matter what. 

Lastly, I'm not a huge fan of the casino here. It's always overly crowded and the servers are slow and\/or non-existent. 

I was there on a comp, but I do not think I would pay the money myself to stay there again.

The hotel is very beautiful. As is typical of a Vegas casino, the cigarette smoke is bad, so the ventilation system could be improved. 
The rooms are of an adequate size and ours included a view of the fountains\/strip. 
The wifi is included, but the frustration over it working for social media, isn't worth using it.

While the design and decoration is stunning, the lack of customer service is as stunning for a five star hotel. Every staff member I came into contact with was rude, curt and just plain unfriendly. I work in HR and seeing this type of behavior makes me think it comes from the top.

Went back for a second time, still one of my favorite hotels.  I found a deal at http:\/\/www.myCheapVegas.com where I got free O tickets.  Anyways, used the "free upgrade" trick I learned from the same website, and got a nice fountain view room.  Even won a few hundred bucks playing poker there!  All in all a wonderful stay, and would highly recommend it to everyone else.

Very bad service  they mean by the Front desk. They don't try to help to customer by the desk. If you lost the key forgotten you never go back to your own room. They don't allow. Never go back to again.

I came here a couple months ago with my mom and brother for a trip to Las Vegas. We did not stay in the hotel, so I have no opinion on that part of it. 

Walking through to the casino, it is gorgeous! I love the decorations, the garden, the ceiling. It's so much fun to just stop and admire everything. 

The fountain show is amazing. Totally worth a stop by here. My brother and I stopped by one night, and then we stopped again with my mother a couple days later. We all loved the fountain show, with the lights and the music to go with it. 

The casino is quite large. I think we lost my mother once or twice inside while we were there. We managed to find her without much problem. But it was definitely easy to get lost inside. 

I thoroughly enjoyed my experience here, and am looking forward to coming back again. I'd love to stay here, because it is so beautiful and a fun place. 

Review 117 of 2017.

Recently spent my honeymoon there and have nothing but great things to say about the Bellagio. First, suite was ready for check-in at 11am. Major plus right there. Second, everything about this hotel is just absolutely beautiful. We stayed in a corner Saloon suite (wished it would have overlooked the pool or fountains but the view of the mountains is beautiful.

Spent a lot of times at the pools and the sports book, waitresses and staff were extremely friendly and helpful suggesting places to go outside of the Bellagio. Pretty much the perfect hotel experience from check-in to checkout.
ストリップの中心にあり、どこに行くのも便利です。湖側の部屋は目の前にエッフェル塔や観覧車を望めます。また、噴水ショーも部屋から見ることができ、特等席で見ているような感じです。部屋も広くてきれいで、バスとシャワーがセパレートなので、日本人にもオススメです！
