We love this hotel. It is our first choice when we plan a Vegas stay. My only criticism is their "special rate" offers. I get these regularly all though the summer. The last time I tried to book a stay during one of these time frames no rooms were available, even though I had just gotten the brochure that day. This continued all summer long and I never was able to take advantage of the offer. Seems like someone in marketing should be paying closer attention to room availability.

Highly priced hotel rooms with no spectacular views = a huge dent in your wallet. If you're looking to just stay at the Bellagio for their service then go ahead, but if you're looking for great view and cheap stay then this definitely a no go. Unless, you want to fork out $500+ for a night here then you will be stuck with "nothing to look at when you're looking out of the window view", but if you have a lot of money I'm sure you can get a room with spectacular views of the water show or the whole strip. Only suggested if you want to over pay for your room.
This is a classic hotel. It just never gets old. I love this place I have stayed here like three times and I love it. The rooms are very clean and nice.

The Bellagio is one of the nicest hotels on the strip, but it'll appeal to an entirely different crowd than some of it's peers in the "upscale" hotel ranks. It's got a more more grown-up feeling than some of it's contemporaries and probably appeal more to business goer's than people looking to go clubbing. 

 Whether you are staying at the Bellagio or not, there are plenty of reasons to wander past the famous fountains and see what's inside. Restaurants, bars, a Cirque show (O) and my favorite; the seasonal gardens. 

 The themed gardens are admittedly my favorite part; right now they are made to look like tulip season in Holland, complete with windmills, canals and gorgeous flowers. During Christmas time they have the most amazing decorations; every few months they change it up a little and it never fails to impress.

This is the 2nd best hotel on the strip...I recently went to check out all of the new competition on the strip and I can say nobody comes close to the Bellagio.. This place has everything food, casino, scenery and so much foot traffic (one of the busier hotels and its for a reason)...

Front desk wrote down the wrong room information on our room key packet. She always said the wrong room number too. woke up the guest who was staying in what we thought was our room. No apologies or (2) craps given when we called asking what was going on. She could of atleast sound apologetic but no, just brushed off and gave us the right number. Like it happens on a daily basis. Def going back to the mandaley our next trip around. Never had these issues when we stay there.

Day two - bathroom lights blew up when I tried turning the lights on after a quick shock. What the hell?!?.

What's not to like about this hotel and casino except perhaps the price tag. It's tough to pay $200+ per night in Vegas when you are used to pay less at other 4-5 star hotels. Nevertheless, I have had the opportunity to stay at this place several times. The experiences have been wonderful every time. The facility is beautiful and clean. The hotel rooms are immaculate. The hotel service is above par. The water show in the front is spectacular. If you have not stayed here before, try to at least once to experience one of the top 5 hotels in Vegas.

So, I have stayed in tons of hotels; here's my take;;
5 stars for parking. Lots of it. 
4 stars for check in staff. It was packed, there was a wait, but we got the room we needed, (2 beds)
5 stars for the foyer gardens - SO BEAUTIFUL
5 stars for the FULL SIZE GYM
1 STARS for the gazillion people everywhere
1 stars for the fact that you have to walk through the casino to get TO the rooms. 
5 stars for service.(extra towels, ect) 

Overall, I would recommend this place.

Easy on and off the freeway and valet parking is super speedy.  Great place to take the family and out of towners if you live in Vegas.  We usually visit the atrium and then coffee next to the museum in the back. There is plenty to do at this hotel and the buffet is great too.  In fact, the least impressive is the atrium compared to the other things you can do at this hotel.  Once you have seen one winter display, you've seen most.
Great guys, very helpful reservation (Rosie) she was so friendly, room was great, foods are delicious...

My husband and I are Vegas regulars. We go at least annually. We try and stay @ a different hotel each time & were excited to try bellagio.
Upon check-in I was less than impressed. We arrived prior to 3 which is actual check-in time. They informed me that I'd need to come back or call around 3 to see if they were ready for us yet. I found that to be irritating, especially when the Wynn called us when our room was ready on our previous trip. However, I obliged.
When we finally got into our room, it was very basic. 2 queen beds, TV, the usual. Our 'mountain view' as they informed us was really just the view of the freeway.
The pools were very nice. We decided to splurge one day and pay for the cypress VIP pool. This was a nice option with no kids. The fee was $150 & that literally bought you a comfortable chair. Needless to say, we won't be doing that again! 
Also be on the watch for their $20\/day resort fee. They don't totally disclose it to you. 
The stay was comfortable. I was expecting to be blown away, but wasn't at all. The location of the bellagio makes the rating 3 stars vs 2. We will not be returning to the bellagio! We'll stick to the Harrah's hotels!

The hotel was nice however it's not worth the price per night in my opinion. 
We requested a non-smoking room and all night I smelled cigarette smoke, I'm guessing coming through one of the vents. It was nasty and I didn't want to reek of cigarettes. 
Beautiful water fountain show and elegant decor inside.
However, it's highly overrated.

Puh-lease.  I expected way more from a 5-star, AAA 5 Diamond luxury hotel. The downstairs public areas are 4 to 5-star, whereas the rooms and everything else were more befitting of a 3.5-star hotel.  Our stay was comfortable, but we weren't as wowed by it as we were by other hotels. The man who checked us in was somewhat dismissive.  However, the man who checked us out was fantastic.  The hotel was beautiful, but the room was a little disappointing.  It can be a crapshoot here.

Pros:
-beautiful downstairs: front desk, garden exhibit, shops
-huge gym with tons of equipment
-relaxing pools
-Bellagio Fountains
-moving sidewalk and escalator takes you directly from the street to the hotel entrance
-old-school feel
-central location

Cons:
-small casino (I struck out, but others in my group were hitting it big)
-standard hotel rooms are small
-not enough plug outlets
-toiletries: shampoo & conditioner were poor quality
-no coffee maker, no laundry bags
-boring place to be, especially compared to other hotels' multiple attractions

I recommend staying at other hotels.  This one was nice and comfortable on its own, but so-so and boring compared to other properties we stayed at, like Mandalay Bay.  Besides, the main draw is the Bellagio Fountains, which you can view just by walking by.

Amazing! I've always wanted to stay at he Bellagio and it lived up to all my expectations. We booked a fountain view room and the view was amazing. Spacious, luxurious and the best view on the strip. Front desk staff was friendly although lines were long. Definitely recommend checking out online to avoid the lines. We ate at a few cafes and the service was great. My only complaint was we left our room about 11AM  to go down to the pool and when we came back at 3 our room still had not received service. There was a voice message stating we had to call to get our room maid up, a little annoying but if that's my only complaint then not too bad. Would most definitely stay here again!

Quite possibly the most amazing hotel I have ever stayed in. Everything was perfect from the white glove door to door service of the bellhops to the overly accommodating concierges, to the finely appointed suite....my God, the shower! Typically I judge a hotel room by the comfort level of the bed and the type of sleep I get, but in this hotel I was just enamored by the bathrooms. My posse and I stayed in a standard suite, nothing fancy, but if this is what not-fancy looks like then I'm sold. We had a great deal through vegas.com for my 25th birthday and figured "go big or go home". Sure it's pricier than other hotels on the strip, but indulge, I beg you. For special occasions, or those with expendable income, do yourself the favor and splurge on a cabana rental and see "O". The tickets may be more expensive than any other Cirque show, but you will never be able to see it anywhere else and come on, you don't even have to leave the compound.

 If you're looking for free stuff to do after blowing all of your money at the $50 buy-in tables, look no further than this hotel for it's beautiful Chihuly glass both on it's signature ceiling and located throughout the casino floor, the fountain show out front that will leave you feeling like you're on the set of Oceans 11, or the beautiful indoor conservatory and botanical gardens.
With endless choices of cuisine and five-star shopping, you really don't need to leave the hotel at all.

It's great that Mlife hotels are now part of Hyatt!  We used Hyatt points to stay for free.  But you still have to pay a $35 resort fee and $13 for parking!  It's crazy that you have to pay for parking even if you are a guest!!!  However it seems like all the hotels are charging now.  The hotel itself is getting old, but the rooms are still nice and clean.  Service is great--That's one of the things we expect from Bellagio is top notch and friendly service.

My stay at the Bellagio was nothing short of amazing. A fountain view with access to the Chairman's lounge is the only way I'll ever be able to go back to Vegas. The buffet? Not that great. Air quality in the casino? Awful. But macarons and coffee with a splash of Bailey's available when I need it, WORTH IT. Also, those slippers? Never wanted to take them off. The Chairman's lounge is so worth it, skipping the lines for registration and a limo to and from the airport. YES. 

The real reason for my five stars--I started my period early. So I hadn't packed tampons. I call our VIP number:

Me: Hi, I uh, have a weird question.
Lady: Yes, ma'am.
Me: Well, I know sometimes at hotels if you forget your toothbrush or something they can bring you up one. 
Lady: Yes.
Me: Uh, you wouldn't happen to have any tampons would you?
Lady: Yes, ma'am. We can have those right up for you.

AND IN LESS THAN 10 MINUTES I had 6 (yes 6!!) tampons delivered to me in a cute little Bellagio gift bag. I also feel like they left me extra chocolates during turndown service that night which is always appreciated.

I feel we were in one of the hotels in Atlantic City. It's very casino-hotel-feeling! Over-all, it was ok. We stayed for 2 nights.. played a little bit and went to the bar. Walked on the strip. It was fun. Had a great time! Hotel staff are courteous. Hotel is pricey... what would you expect a summer weekend nights?! Had fun though!

Stayed 3 nights at the Bellagio for a business conference.  I love the fact that in addition to the great overhead "signage" showing directions to things, they have staff in crimson colored sport coats stationed throughout the hotel to assist you with additional directions or with sort of "cliff notes" concierge services (such as where to grab a great cup of coffee to go).  The smoke smell management for the casino area was the best that I have found.  Room was superb.  Plenty of choices of pillows, huge variety of lighting.  Would definitely go to Bellagio again.

The Bellagio Hotel is clean, the grounds and atrium gorgeous, great attention to detail with the floral arrangements and decor, and customer service is outstanding. There are some great restaurants and bars on property. I've been staying at the Bellagio at least once a year for the last eight years and unfortunately, this year I noticed some wear in the sleeping rooms. The mattress and pillows that were in my room need to be replaced. The shower door was showing it's age. The turndown service with chocolates appears to have been discontinued. A bit of disappointment, but I will be back.

It's 1:02 am and I can't sleep because of the night club Chateau ACROSS the street!!! How annoying! I'm staying at one of the nicest hotels in Las Vegas and I can't sleep because of the night club across the street. I'm so annoyed right now. I've called the Bellagio, Paris Hotel and the Las Vegas Police Department to complain about the noise. It's ridiculous that I know exactually what song is playing at a night club across the street from my hotel. Not to mention its Tuesday. I know I sound like an old fart but if I want to sleep in peace and quite I should be able to.

Well, it's Las Vegas, so I guess it "is what it is". Lots of crowds, and lots of staff attempting to make it a good experience. The people were fine all around, but at the end of the day the "House rules" really or inconveniencing for this particular guest.

I came to the hotel just for one day - I was here for a conference. I was the last speaker on the last day of the conference. My speech was it 12 noon and I asked only for a late check out till 1 PM. There would be an exorbitant charge I was told, for my request of a one hour extension.  This meant that, in the minutes before my speech,I had to pack up my room in a hurry.  It was a disservice not just to me but all the attendees of the conference there to learn. And to the company that brought me here to speak. It was a simple thing, small thing, but it says something about an enterprise that is so inflexible.

I have been here many times and this place is great!  The ambiance is rich, but not uncomfortable and the service is always top notch no matter where you go.  I stayed at the Venetian and other hotels and always feel like I am at an amusement park, but the Bellagio is classy and doesn't need to do all that crap.  Had a wonderful room overlooking the fountains, the Cafe was excellent, and Diane Diaz in the Fontana room had my guests entertained.  Will definately come back!

The young girl in the pink shirt working at 10 AM 5\/20\/13 gave great service, but the Af-Am male working the small window bar\/cafe with the sandwiches wasn't the best service. Ruder than the folk who serve at Subway, and the sandwiches are pre-made... The water coolers next to the cafe were all out, and nothing was done about them. We would have to ask for water at the pop-up cafe window...which was slow going if you were behind people ordering food\/cocktails.

As for the cafe proper, we had to wait an HOUR for the falafel to be made. The staff had gotten confused somehow. There were no vegetarian entrees that could be served to go (poolside), so we asked for the falafel to be made to go. They obliged us, but waiting an hour for the food wasn't what we expected. They had given us fries on the side, however...don't know if that was part of the mix-up, or if it was to apologize for the wait.

The hotel is beautiful, the room is immaculate. Free internet. Friendly helpful staff come to our room twice a day. Valet is excellent. 

Two things to improve: more fresh air in room and the compression on the Video Monitor (TV) is sooooo bad everything looks like it was shot on 3\/4" video tape from 1989. Movies like Die Hard look like garbage thanks to over compressed video.

Convenient for a quick breakfast in the warm morning sunshine. I had the blueberry pancakes, which come served with cinnamon butter and syrup. Yum!

Service was friendly and attentive. Not a bad place to eat and enjoy the view of the pool.

Very disappointed with the bar next to the sports book! Trying to watch the Dodger game and the bartender is telling me that other games have priority! Really?! Hockey and lacrosse? The game is nowhere to be seen on any TV and I placed my bet here and was hoping to watch the game. Totally ridiculous! There are multiple baseball games being shown and the bartender is telling me there is only one baseball game being shown. I'm staying here and my boyfriend and I have been gambling and spending money here. Very disappointed!

As a special trip, we splurged and got a Bellagio partial Lake View Suite which cost a ton but was a once in a lifetime sort of thing for us. We both loved the room. Huge layout with three bathrooms total. His a her bathrooms with giant hot tub, giant steam shower, power drapes with a incredible view of the fountains, giant screen HD TV's, mini bar, sitting area and super fine service. Fist time I have ever had a room with a door bell. It was like a condo. With this room you get VIP status with private limos from and to the airport, special line passes for the taxi and restaurant lines and a private executive lounge with all sorts of drinks and goodies. They will service your room twice a day if you like with a turn down service in the evening. We spent as much time as possible in the room and were sorry to go. What an experience. Would do it again.

First time staying at this specific hotel. Great experience. Hotel is really clean, and the restaurants there are beautiful. We ate at Yellowtail, which had really tasty sushi, but don't expect to get full off of a couple entrees. We had a beautiful view of the water show from inside the restaurant. The buffet there was also tasty, but nothing special. Scenery and decorations at this hotel are breathtaking. 

I was also extremely pleased with the customer service provided in the Chanel boutique. The young lady that helped me was a sweetheart and she was able to help me find what I was looking for. 

Definitely coming back again, especially since we hit a $2,000 jackpot on the $.01 machines :)

We checked in for or anniversary weekend at about 8pm on a Friday. After a typical long wait in the 'check-in' line, we finally got to our room with 20 minutes to spare until our dinner reservation- only to discover our room wasn't clean.

It took another 20 minutes to hike back to the check in desk to get another room. Incredibly frustrating given we booked a fountain view room and checked in so late that the last issue you expect to arise is a room that's not even ready for you.... 

We ended up being 20 minutes late to our reservation and were lucky they didn't give our table away. While the Bellagio is a great hotel, it was clear through out our stay that they don't have the logistics in place the truly manage the size and capacity of the whole resort. We would likely opt for the cosmopolitan or aria in the future. The Bellagio has become outdated and overrated.

Lovely rooms, friendly service.
We were there at Christmas, very busy, lots to do, very good restaurants within the hotel and plenty outside.
Decorations for Christmas amazing! Pools good.
Would definitely return.
June 2016

This hotel is pretty much amazing. I love how great it looks from outside and the water show is fun to watch table side if you're dining in one of their many renowned restaurants. The rooms aren't that amazing in my opinion but everything is definitely high quality. Their pool is huge and looks great on a sunny day. They offer any type of gambling you may be searching for and have an endless choice in food, from buffets to restaurants.

This is an overrated hotel. Is the fountain pretty? Yes. Is the observatory lovely? Yes. Is the Chihuly glass ceiling in the lobby worth a look? Yes. 

Other than that, I can think of no other reason to be here. Five minutes in this hotel and my sinuses are stuffed and my eyes are dried out. I can literally feel the cigarette stink sink into my skin and clothing. It's like walking into a gas chamber.

You'd think for a supposedly upscale hotel, they'd have enough air venting systems in place to combat the throngs of visitors that come through. Ugh... stay away...

(Wow, I think I just became one of those non-smoking snobs...)

I really enjoyed my time at the Bellagio. This is a nice hotel.

Aside from the obvious awesome fountain show, I gotta say this was my favorite casino. Just got good vibes here. My wife and I dressed up all fancy like and went and gambled here. The slots were slots, but they seemed well maintained and classy.

After that, we went and hung out at the blackjack table. Must have spent a good hour or two there just hanging out and betting low. You know, sometimes it isn't about winning. We had a really good dealer. She was really charismatic and had some sort of accent I couldn't place. The wife and I would switch out so we weren't hogging two seats. The dealer really made it a group activity and a lot of fun. By the time we called it a night, I really felt like I had bonded with the random other people at the table. Good time was had by all. They though we had just gotten married cause of our outfits, and we didn't say we had been married now for a few months. Whatever, it was our honeymoon!

So in the end, I really enjoyed our visit, and we took some beautiful pictures of ourselves out in front. Thank you Bellagio for the most fun and romantic night of gambling ever! ^^

Wonderful hotel with amazing decor and ambience. Best restaurants and best buffet on the strip. I like staying here as its centrally located and has the best service.  Also really nice pool area.  Love Olives restaurant with view of the fountains too.

We've stayed here three weekends ago and we were stoked about getting a high-end stay and at really good rate. When I was younger, I've envisioned staying at one of these hotels to be like a vintage palace but only to find that wasn't the case.

The rooms were just okay and it was just a standard room.  Really, I was holding my breath before opening the doors thinking yes! a high ballers dream stay! when we opened the doors and turn the lights on then I thought hmmm...similar room like TI's but just slightly above average from that.

We had the fountain view room which was cool, you get a good clear view of the fountain along with the music playing when you have it at a certain channel though your TV. The bed comfort level was okay, spacious bath with tub, decent closet space and of course a flat screen tv.

The biggest cons that bothered us was the room temperature! We set the room control temperature at the lowest setting but we ended up with a not so good night sleep man, we had a warm night! I had to do away those comforters.

The casino level is in decent size, the club atmosphere that friday night was bumping with hoochie mamas waiting to get in The Bank (Club). Next morning only to find no more hoochie mamas but many golfer types and football fanatics during that Super Bowl weekend who were looking to eat or gamble.

Maybe I'm just spoiled from staying at many different hotels, hip, vintage,boutiques, motels you name it, but to pay for a high rate here for me, nah! I'm just glad we stayed here it did satisfied my curiosity and there goes one for my list of collection hotel stays in the Vegas Strip.
I thought because we pay a little more we would get better service. Nope!! The belagio will nickle and dime you all the way out the door. And if you have an issue, don't worry they don't care.

Room service food here is GOOD!  It's not crappy at all; it's high end restaurant quality.  I got the potstickers, but I had a hard time deciding what to get.  Got upgraded to a room with a partial view of the fountains and got to see the strip too with the old $20 trick.  The fountains can be slightly loud when they do the full blast super high stream thing.  It ends at midnight so it may not be a big deal.  It didn't bother me, but whenever it would do the full blast stream, I'd turn and look wondering what the noise was each time.  So it's noticeable, but not alarming or scary.  This hotel was cold, in the hallways and public areas.  Love the brunch here and going Caesar's for Nobu or shows.  Caught O here and loved it!  Would def stay here again!  Just might be my fave spot for the room service alone!

My first time in Vegas would not have been nearly as wonderful an experience if my friend and I had not stayed at the Bellagio.  Growing up traveling a lot, I have stayed in a many hotels, but the service at the Bellagio is comparable to none.  From the moment my friend and I arrived, we were upgraded to a room with a view of the fountains.  After my friend was hurt on an escalator the staff at the Bellagio helped bandaged her foot up, and even took off a charge for an outside call when her phone was lost.  I had a drink explode in my luggage ruining the majority of my clothing.  For a very reasonable price everything was dry cleaned and brought back up to me within 12 hours.  I cannot say enough positive things about this hotels.  The dealers at the blackjack table were extremely friendly and the Hyde is absolutely gorgeous- even just to grab drinks and some appetizers before the night life beings.

I initially had high hope for this hotel, I don't know, probably because of the overall reputation of the hotel. We stayed here and got the normal room during the EDC weekend. 


PROS: 

1.)The overall condition of the facilities is very good. Clean, but kind of dated

2.)The casino was great. Huge, with great selection of games, with the dealers having a great personality.

3.)Unlike some other previous reviews, I thought the check-in process was very easy and they took care of our requests rather painlessly. 

4.)The housekeeping was decent, but came at odd times. If you need anything extra, though, it almost seems like they're taking inventory. Kind of strange.

5.)And overall, the hospitality of the HOTEL service staff was EXCELLENT. (Everyone saying hello, Food service, different story)

6.)The pool has a fantastic ambiance, but nowhere near the size, or quality of Caesars.

7.)And of course, the fountains!!


CONS: 

1.)Given the reputation and what the hotel is trying to market themselves as, the "elegance" of the rooms were disappointing and very plain comparable to others. (I recommend Caesar's, Palazzo, or even Aria, if looking for bigger, better or comfier rooms)

2.)The choice of foods were so-so if not spending $100+ per person. The buffet was less than stellar (food=bland, selection=no bueno) as compared to the Wynn and Caesars. The fine dining restaurants are excellent, the rest? Not so much, very, very, very plain, and overpriced. 

3.)The Bellagio Cafe put us (girlfriend and I) on a 30 MINUTE WAIT late night, with about 6 tables in the restaurant (about 5% full restaurant), and sat a party of 7 before us, who arrived 15 minutes AFTER we did. To the point where the party apologized to us, and the couple in front of us, who was there 10 minutes before us, as we watched them get sat.

4.)Wi-Fi is the horrible (included in Resort Fee). No matter where on the resort you are.

5.)There never seems to be enough taxis at this hotel. The line is relatively short, but you will wait, because taxis seem to not like the Bellagio. Unless "O" is showing.

Overall, not a bad resort to go to, but for the Guest base that they are looking for, there are so many better options such as Caesars, Wynn\/Encore, or even Venetian\/Palazzo. If you are going to Vegas to strictly look at the fountains and no other reason to leave the resort, then stay here. But I guess Bellagio has seemed to rest on its laurels and chosen to not make significant improvements to try to keep up with the likes of Cosmopolitan, Aria, Caesars (classic, yet updated luxury), or Wynn\/Encore, which are a much better "bang for your buck" luxury resorts with so many higher quality amenities.

By far the most elegant and gorgeous hotel on the Strip, complete with a bevy of dining and entertainment options ranging from casual dining, bars, and gelato to high-end designer stores, ultra fine dining, and a new and pretty chic nightclub, The Bank.  Everything is wrapped up in a style that really sets Bellagio apart from anything else in Vegas-the hotel, casino, etc. is designed in the spirit of the comune of Bellagio in Italy.  The staff is second to none, be it room service, the concierge, or the waitstaff at any of their restaurants.  The fountains in front have become Strip icons and synonymous with Las Vegas.  If you're looking for an experience that's a step above the rest of the Strip, look no further.

Do not stay here with so many other options.  I stayed because of Mlife comps.  When the room was booked my offer code had a $50 resort credit.  When I checked in the said they did not see the credit.  They made a phone call and confirmed the credit was added.  When I checked out of course there was no credit.  I called and accounts receivable said no credit was ever offered.  They were supposed to call me back I haven't heard anything.  Since it takes a half hour to get in touch with anyone calling back is not worth my time.  I would suggest Venetian, Palazzo, Wynn, or Encore.

The couple we traveled with also had a negative experience.

While I wasn't a hotel patron here, I did get to experience their stunning gardens, couture shopping and eye-appealing fountain show. 

From my walk-through and brief time at Bellagio, I will say that the Bellagio is stunning. 
But, even with its beautiful aesthetics, I'm not sure if this would be the place I would want to stay while in Vegas. The hotel patrons seem a little stuffy to me. 

An absolutely gorgeous place to visit. Really cool shopping and food selection. And, of course, there are the Bellagio fountains. I'd rather stay elsewhere on the strip and just pay a day-time visit to the Bellagio.

I've been here many times just as a tourist of the lobby (the beautiful, famous Chihuly glass flowers on the ceiling and the awesome Conservatory display during Christmas and Chinese New Year) and of the Bellagio Fountains (one of the most iconic displays of Vegas ever!), but I finally had the opportunity to actually stay here.

And I got to stay in a gorgeous 1-bedroom suite on the top floor! The suite comes with a free line pass which allows you to cut in line at the Bellagio Buffet and Café Bellagio restaurants at any point during your stay. I love the Bellagio Buffet, since it's a pretty good value for the quality. Just remember to charge everything to your room so you can get Hyatt\/MLife points for it. :)

Speaking of points, be sure to have your Hyatt number AND your MLife numbers ready at check-in, so you can earn points on both loyalty programs. Who doesn't love double-dipping!

The suite was awesome. Our suite had a gorgeous living room with lovely furniture and a half bathroom, which I presume would be for visiting guests. The desk is also out in the living room.

The bedroom has a nice comfy bed and 2 full bathrooms. One bathroom seems to be for the woman (hairspray, etc included) and has a jet whirlpool tub, while the other bathroom seems to be more for men (has shaving gel and a razor) and has a standing shower with a built-in wet or dry sauna!!!! I cannot tell you how much my husband and I loved having our own bathrooms. The "woman's" bathroom is also significantly larger than the "man's" bathroom. :D

Both bathrooms also have built in mirror TVs. Meaning, the TV is part of the mirror, and when the TV is turned off, it becomes a mirror. So cool. Because of this, the suite actually has 4 TVs (one in each bathroom, one in the bedroom, and one in the living room).

Nice soft fluffy towels, and very comfy bathrobes. Great amenities. Loved our stay here and only wished it was longer!

I've stayed in a lot of hotels on the strip, but the Bellagio?  HOLY SHIT.  It's prolly the most...decadent.  I've always visited, but never stayed - til this year.  Surprise for me!  Happy birthday Lily!

And what a surprise it was.  Our room was a junior suite and we had a full view of the strip and the water show.  The bed was comfy, the bathroom was GIGANTIC, and the staff was v. courteous.  

The casino didn't reek of smoke and the art\/glass work all over the hotel elegant.

This hotel is beautiful.  Hands down, one of the nicest hotels I've ever stayed at.  Period.

Love it love it love it, even though rooms are nowhere near the quality & luxury of Mandalay Bay, the Hotel, Palazzo, Wynn, etc..  Service is top notch everywhere, the atmosphere is elegant, common areas are beautiful, food and drink are quality, the fountain show from water-view rooms is lovely at night and you can play the music that goes with the fountain display on the hotel's tv channel, your fellow patrons are (usually) fairly classy and those who expect service and class are generally not disappointed.

Every staff member I encountered was very kind and very helpful. I opted for room service two of the evenings during my four night stay and it was some of the best food I had while in Vegas. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay again. However, if you're a light sleeper, I do not recommend staying in the tower that faces the fountain. There is a fountain show every 15 minutes between the hours of 8pm and 12am and the fountains are very loud! If you're not in Vegas to sleep, it's worth the view!

We just came back from our 3 nights, 4 days trip to vegas. Stayed at Bellagio for the first time. 
I have to say it was very disappointing. I love the shops, Garden and front fountain at Bellagio. However the room was nothing close to what I expect and for the price we paid. Mattresses were very uncomfortable same as pillows. I'm not a very picky person or someone that travels in bubbles. But their room wasn't even clean enough. The blow dry had only low bottom which feels like a fan! I called front dest. to my surprise they said all their room has same quality of mattress and pillows. They were nice enough to send new pillows but we ended up sleeping without pillows for 3 nights! They said they will send a different blowdryer which they never did and after 2request I gave up! The glass window even was closed and sealed, still was bring cold breeze inside room. We didn't like the rooms at Bellagio at all. Without mentioning any names, we've stayed at least 12 other hotels ( few of them even 3 stars) and they were all much better room. Would never book or stayed there but will definitely go back for Garden and shopping.

We chose Bellagio which was highly rated on various websites, which is in the middle of the Vegas strip near everything.  Our room was gorgeous and clean, which included a large tub and a spacious shower.  The staff were extremely helpful and friendly from start to end.  Our room had a superb view of the strip each day.  We enjoyed a few of the restaurants at Bellagio.  Though pricey,  they were worth it.   My minor complaint, which I'm sure is with my most of Vegas  patrons is like most hotels on the strip, we were charged an extra "resort fee".  I believe the resort should simply increase the room rate rather than use the resort fee excuse.  We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

I was very excited to stay at the Bellagio for the first time. I have stayed at other MGM properties and this one was next on my list. Our stay was great until the morning of checkout. I stayed at the Bellagio with my mother and my baby daughter and we had a pretty long night. I was under the impression (based on my hotel booking info) that check-out was 11am and we had time to sleep in a little before hitting the road. At 9:16am there was a knock at the door. It took a second to recognize what was happening and get out of the bed. Then a second knock and someone (from housekeeping) was opening our room door. Luckily the bolt lock was used, otherwise she would have walked right in. The unfortunate part is the knock and the subsequent attempt to enter the room woke up my mother and my baby who were both extremely tired. When I poked my head out the woman was speed walking down the hallway and did not offer an apology. If it is hotel policy to check guests' rooms prior to check-out, I get it...it is just bad policy. The reason for the score is not because of the entry into our room, but for what happened when I called Guest Services to understand why this happened. When I called, the young lady did not identify herself nor did she say "Guest Services," so I had to ask if I called the right department. I began speaking and she was very short with me, and was not treating me very courteously ( I did not expect that from the staff at Bellagio). I then told her that since she was being so short with me that I would like to speak with a manger and before I could finish my sentence she placed me on hold. At that point, one of the managers Chris came on the line. I explained what happened and his response was, "Well I don't know what their process down in housekeeping is, I'd have to call and check." No apology, or empathy. Then when I mentioned that the young lady who answered the phone initially was very curt and did not speak to me in a professional manner, he said, "Well there are six girls up here, I don't know which one you spoke to." So I kindly informed him that I would be writing a review and sending my feedback to corporate. It wasn't until that point that he offered an apology. I was upset about being woken up, but I more disappointed at the lack of customer service from the front desk staff. I will never stay at the Bellagio again and I will make sure I share my experience with others. I am very disappointed.
Awesome hotel, great shows and great restaurants. The fountains out front are really nice and something you should make time for.

I am not a big fan of hotels in Vegas, but this hotel is conveniently located to the conference center where many shows are held every here. There a couple of good restaurants inside the hotel. There is also a central bar (eye candy) that has a dancing area.

** Casino & Shops only **

I love going to Bellagio.

Besides being one of the most beautiful Hotels on the strip, I love going to the fountains,Shops & Conservatory & Restaurants  here! 

Been to the casino many times as well. I love the lobby area with the glass they have it is really amazing with the glass on the ceiling.
It is definitely a classy hotel, the floors are always so clean,

Been here so many times over the years I still take photos!!  This is a must stop when coming to Vegas. There are some good restaurants here too!

I have never had the opportunity to stay here, Maybe sometime but I hear the rooms are really nice!

I love coming every season too when the conservatory changes the theme. That is amazing in its self!

Make sure to make this one of your favorite hotels too!

I expected worse considering all of the 3 or below star reviews on this place.  I don't know if I agree with people who say this "isnt a real 5-star hotel" -- it's at least 4.5*'s in my book, and Im very particular about hotels.  The most important thing for me is the decor of the room -- most hotel rooms just have dark, dingy decor -- especially after staying at NYNY, MGM grand and Planet Hollywood, I know this for a fact.  That or the rooms are super outdated.  This was one of the prettiest hotel rooms Ive stayed in.  Nice and spacious, with beautiful modern deco decor.  I had a pool view which was gorgeous.  The room was clean and everything looked new, and there were robes in the room which is always nice.

The people at the front desk were okay.  One guy was not personable at all but the girl I spoke with while checking out was better.  Nothing over the top though - Ive had better service at 4* hotels on that front.  

My main complaint here was eating.  There arent a lot of choices. Im traveling alone and I dont want anything fancy, which is the class that most of the restaurants there fell into. A lot of stuff closes early too -- Jean Phillipe closed at 11pm here but at 12pm in Aria, which is weird.  The gelato place closed early too.

 They also charge $10 for a bottle of fiji water from the mini bar which is just absolutely outrageous.

The gardens are always gorgeous but I really loved their design for chinese new year.

I've stayed in almost all of the 5 star hotels on the strip, and I would put this hotel right up there with rest.

My last visit to Vegas I stayed at the MGM and I had a good time but it was such a long walk from everything that it was exhausting just thinking about going out. 

This time I stayed at the lovely Bellagio which is in the middle of all the action. It was much better.

The room was a fountain view room which was richly decorated with a large bathroom and large comfortable king bed. It had mechanical blackout shades to cover the huge picture windows showing the fountain if you wanted to sleep in. Which I did. So that was nice. 

The fountain view was beautiful. My favorite thing. Especially at dusk when the lights looked lovely but you could still see the blue of the water and the rest of the strip. I attached a photo. I could sit and watch the fountain shows from my room and have the best view anyone could possibly have of them with no crowd. 

Loved it. 

The staff were all friendly and accommodating. There was a minor leak from the shower into the floor by the right side of the bed but since there wasn't another fountain view room available I dealt with it. 

I loved the buffet, the shopping, the food, etc.

Bellagio is nice and I hope to see "O" one day there -- need better planning.  It's not my favorite hotel to stay but many of my friends love staying here.  

But when I'm in Vegas, I make it my mission to feast at the Bellagio's dinner champaign buffet!  For $40, you just can't find a better deal anywhere on planet earth!  I come to Vegas not to gamble (no dinero and bad luck at gambling) but to feast on the buffets, watch the shows and catch up with friends who live in various places in different continents.  My favorite buffet is Bellagio's.  (The rooms are nice -- seen the rooms my friends stay at this cool resort -- I prefer staying at Mandalay Bay.). 

Everything at Bellagio's buffet is exceptionally fresh, nicely cooked and delicious!  The desert is simply to die for.  The trick is to pace yourself and be very nice to the folks who attend to your table -- my buds and I stay for a couple of hours and pre-tip our servers generously in advance.  Eat everything in moderation and you will get your money's worth.

After a two plus hour eating and catching up with my buds (including our female friends), I go nap in my friends' rooms at the Bellagio while they go gambling and shopping.  (I don't gamble -- I spend my dinero on shows and more food.). 

One can eat like a King or Queen at Bellagio's  buffet.  Give yourself at least 90 minutes and you will get your money's worth!   The food is fabulous!!!'

Bellagio is one of the most iconic hotels on the strip that has been around for a long time and is still a popular destination.

The hotel is classy and one of my favorites to visit.  I will never tire of watching the fountain show outside.  Depending on the time of day, there's a show every 15 or 30 minutes.  The conservatory is another must-see when you come here.  They change it up five times a year (Chinese New Year, spring, summer, fall and winter\/Christmas).  It's a beautiful display of flowers and plants put together in creative ways.

I was excited to finally stay here for the first time recently.  We were in a Resort Queen Room in the Main Tower and honestly it was a little underwhelming.  They recently underwent a renovation, but our room still looked dated. Compared to hotels I've stayed at like the Venetian\/Palazzo and Wynn\/Encore, the room didn't feel as luxurious.  

They charge $10 per day for self parking ($18 for valet) now, but on the bright side you get in-out privileges at all the MGM hotels once you've paid.  It would be nice if parking was included in the resort fee for hotel guests since it's already so much money.  They should just charge visitors.

Most of the restaurants here are sit-down and on the pricier side, so if you want something more casual and\/or affordable, you'll have to go outside the hotel.  I haven't been to The Buffet in awhile, but I remember it being one of the better buffets in Vegas.

As hotel guests, we were able to get into The Bank and Hyde without paying cover or waiting in line which was nice.  Granted, neither of these night clubs are the hottest in Vegas right now.  But if I had to choose, Hyde was the nicer of the two.

Bellagio will continue to be one of my favorite hotels to visit.  But for what you get for the price, I would probably stay elsewhere on the strip.

The Belle of Las Vegas Blvd! The mister and I went during the Thanksgiving weekend. We booked a deal from Expedia, a flight and hotel package. Bellagio received $120\/night from the deal. We were there five years ago and the property has been well maintained. We received a room overlooking the pool in the main tower. 

The downsides of our stay is the housekeeping. Upon inspecting the bathroom, there was visible urine stains on the toilet seat. eeeewwww! We found this is to be unacceptable and the mister called housekeeping to take care of it. Also, found a cash ticket under the sofa seat for $1.62, finder's keepers! Another dislike was the long lines for the popular two eateries, the Buffet and Cafe Bellagio. On Thanksgiving day, the lines for the Buffet were too long and went beyond the guest elevators. We dare not to go on line that day, it would feel like being at Disney or at the DMV. I did wait almost half hour in line for Cafe Bellagio. That was torture! For dining options, I feel that Bellagio should have more casual dining options. A majority of the restaurants are high end but most are only open for dinner so that leave you with the buffet or cafe bellagio. 

What we loved - the Beautiful display of gardens, the mister said the gardens reminded him from the gardens from the film, Avatar. Gambling here is okay. The mister and I were fond of the computerized roulette game as you play with other players while watching the roulette table on the flat screen. The SPA! OMG, I had the best time. I will write a separate review for that. Also, we enjoyed our dining at Olives and Yellowtail. The mister and I dared to go swimming at the Pool in fifty degree weather! It was the first time that I saw a lifeguard dressed head to toe in sweats and a hat. Also, the Belle is in a great location - across the street from the very convenient Miracle Mile shops and close by to Paris and Planet Hollywood. What we loved the most were the fountains. During the day or night, the fountain show is awesome! Would stay again at the Belle.

Bellagio Hotel is absolutely beautiful!! Gorgeous hotel, love the fountains. The staff was super friendly and helpful. Cafe Bellagio was where I chose to eat and I'm glad I did. The food was amazing! Thank you Bellagio for a wonderful vacation.

Nobody cares about the rooms in their hotels in Vegas. Or at least, from where I've stayed, that seems to be the attitude. That said, Bellagio's rooms are comfortable and quite lovely, though not as luxurious for the price you're paying. However, what you are paying for is the feeling you get as you walk under the Chihuly (sp?) ceiling in the lobby, through the Conservatory, through the casino and into any of the delicious restaurants. And if that's what you're looking for with your Vegas experience, you are absolutely getting what you paid for.
Beautiful!  This hotel is well known for it's dancing water. The architecture inside is outstanding.

I decided to spend birthday in Vegas & stay at the Bellagio. I just called the concierge about 10 minutes ago to inquire where I could buy myself a birthday cake. The lady suggested their in-house pastry place,which is predominately chocolate, which I am allergic to. When I tell the concierge this, she in a snippy &  matter of factly tone replies "well I won't be able to help you. " End of conversation. I will not be staying at the Bellagio again. Next trip, I will return to The Wynn.

Bellagio did not disappoint. Beautiful decor, 5 star service, great room overlooking the lake and the fountains. 

Room was very quiet even though the hotel was full. 

Of course, everything is expensive, but you know that going in. It's the Bellagio.

It was a good experience and a beautiful suite and we were happy until we tried to leave.  First of all they said the bellman would be up to our room in 15-20 mins. We called after 1\/2 hour and they told me he would be up soon. Then after 45 mins we flagged down a bellman and he said he wasn't there on the floor for us. He said he would check when he went down. Then after about 1 hr 10 mins he came back and said they didn't have our name in the queue! But meanwhile my husband walked down and saw that the bell desk had arranged to get our car from the valet and my husband waited outside with it while I tried to get our bags there. The bellman wouldn't take our stuff out to the car and told us that we had to take a claim check. But claimed that it would get down to valet before I did. So I went straight to the bell desk downstairs and gave them my ticket. They said they would bring it over to our car as soon as it came down. So I went to the car. I started making phone calls to see if people could help pick up children from school since we would now get caught up in traffic and would be too late to pick up from school. 15-20 minutes later, I went back to the bell desk and our stuff was just sitting there against a wall. After we finally got the stuff into the car, we saw the low tire pressure light but thought it was because it was a little chilly. 40 minutes later, we were stranded on the side of the I15 with a blown out tire. Now we are in Barstow being charged an arm and a leg for a tire that appears to have been damaged in Bellagio's care!  Also they grossly understated the amount of our gambling bets on our mLife cards and gave us a sad comp. Horrible trip.

My fiancé and I visited Las Vegas for my first time yesterday. Our first stop was the Bellagio. We played in the casino and passed by Hyde, where she asked the doormen what the cover was to get in. The gentlemen said no cover charge. We got in line, where our IDs were scruntized thoroughly by a man at the door. He scratched on our IDs and examined them over and over. He then claimed that my fiancé's ID was fake. (Our ages are 29 & 28). He then said he had to take her into a back office room to verify her ID. He threatened that if I came with, I would be arrested for trespassing. (Keep in mind all I told him was I didn't feel comfortable allowing her to be alone in Vegas in some undisclosed room in the Bellagio without me.) To shorten the story, once we were escorted to the back office room, the three men asked for our personal information (such as our social security numbers - which we refused and insisted on talking to the police ourselves if we had to disclose that information. Which they did not allow us to do.), and the harassment continued. We were threatened that if our IDs were fake that we would be banned from the property along with several other properties. This is the first time I've ever been to Vegas and I'm curious why the Hyde didn't have the usual ID scanners like most other bars or nightclubs usually use. After they were gone with our identification and we were forced to wait like criminals in this small back room with handcuffed benches and surveillance cameras, they came back and said her ID was real but now my ID was fake. I asked how is it that I can fly from Florida to Vegas and TSA verified my identification but yet it fails to pass here... the one gentlemen's response was that TSAS security and scanners aren't as efficient as theirs (what!?). Finally after almost 45 minutes of this harassment, we were told we weren't allowed on the property and we're escorted towards the entrance to Caesars Palace. At no point did either of us fight or argue. We cooperated through the ridiculous situation and are embarrassed this happened to us. We somewhat feel this was discrimination due to the fact that we are an interracial couple. We dress well, we're already spending money in the casino; so why were we harassed so very much and in such a criminal manner? We will be sure to tell this story to friends and associates. I would advise to spend your time and hard earned money elsewhere in Vegas.

Still my favorite casino as well as favorite place to stay on the Strip. Seldom does it reek of smoke in the casino and I appreciate clean air. (Being one who kicked the habit, I can certainly appreciate an individual's need to inhale, but now that I'm over it, I'm over it!!) I appreciate any business' endeavor to let the smokers smoke and the non-smokers not get a whiff of it, especially while delivering cocktails in a timely manner. 

The Conservatory is always so lovely and the Chihuly ceiling at reception is exquisite. I've had nothing but excellent service from the dining room to the hotel room, as you'd expect. Especially a treat is a room facing the fountains. 

Thanks, Bellagio!

Beautiful hotel and casino right on the strip. We didn't stay here but right when you walk in you feel like you have money...it just reeks of wealth!  If you don't get a chance to ever stay here you must go and at least try the buffet.  Best buffet I've ever had....$30 all you can eat and drink (champagne).  

We didn't even get a chance to check out the pool or garden area because of this awesome brunch, but it sounds amazing from the other yelpers reviews...maybe next time:)

Went here about 2 weeks ago. Booked the 2 bedroom penthouse suite with a view. As we arrived, we went to the VIP check in area. 
It seemed for a "VIP" check in area we were waiting An awfully long time. And not once did any of the front desk say he will be with you shortly or even acknowledge us. Finally after about 45 minutes of waiting we finally get checked in. After getting out keys she said the room is a smoking room and that all of the top floor suites are smoking. What??? Why on earth would they not tell us this as we booked the room? I have severe allergies and even the scent of smoke aggravates them. So after we say we do not want a room with smoking finally the lady says well we could put you a few floors down under where you would be at originally but the view is not going to be as nice. Ok whatever. We just wanted to get to out freaking room and relax. So she then points us in the direction of the elevators through the casino floor? Huh? I just heard her telling every single guest before is to use the VIP elevators right near check in! I called her out on them and she was just like "oh well if you want I use those they are right around the corner" etc. what the heck? I still have no idea what that was all about maybe she was just being a bitch because we were upset about them trying to give us a suite with smoking. I'm top of that we were in one of the nicer sweets so we were paying a pretty penny so the least she could do is tell us where the VIP elevators were. The room is big but it was OK kind of not the Decour that I would have expected. Yes I've been a bit spoiled staying at the Wynn and the encore. But for the price we paid we would have expected something a little bit more upscale. Anyhow I will not be staying here anymore I should have stayed at the win again like my first instinct told me. Staff is not very friendly and environment is just lackluster

This hotel is terrible. I am here with my husband for the weekend and have a six month old son at home with his grandparents. I am still breastfeeding and arranged for the hotel to help me send frozen breast milk home to my baby during my stay. I called a month ahead of time and was told by multiple concierges and business center personnel that this would not be a problem and that they provide this kind of service to moms all the time. The only reason I chose this hotel or came on this trip was because of how confident they sounded about being able to get this done. 

Well I am here now and was given the run around for over an hour this morning. The bottom line is they did not uphold any of their promises to get the breast milk back to my baby, in fact they don't even know how to handle such a request. They have my calls on file but they were not prepared to do what they guaranteed they could do and wanted to charge me five times more than what they quoted me to get the milk home IF they could figure out how to do it. What happened to they do this this all the time??? I am completely appalled. When I asked for some kind of compensation they said they could give me $100 and that's it. Are they crazy??? What kind of treatment is this? It's nice to know the Bellagio doesn't care about feeding babies!!

The Bellagio lives up to all the hype. 

Beautiful-BEAUTIFUL Hotel....everything about it screams luxury from the artwork, decor, shops, restaurants, and rooms. 

Speaking about the rooms....as comfy as they are---they're much smaller than at the Venetian. But the beds and bathrooms are deluxe! When booking your room, definitely ask for a lake view! 

But here's the thing. If you can swing it, get a Private Cabana for the pool. They're equipped with flatscreen tvs, snacks, drinks---and you can even have your massage done there. :)

We just returned from celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary at the Bellagio. The staff was attentive and accommodating. We were always greeted by friendly smiles and offers to help. Our room was both beautiful and peaceful with a fantastic view of the fountains. Our vow renewal ceremony was surreal; every detail was perfect.

Boyfriend and I checked out of our MGM Grand suite and came here for a night before flying out. We had a water show view from our hotel room, which was pleasant, but also a bit loud. We spent most of our time in the MGM before and felt that this hotel was geared more toward quality than quantity of visitors (very beautiful botanical garden when you enter through the main doors). Much easier to navigate and a significant number of waitresses in the casinos. The location is also very convenient, as it is almost in the heart of the strip. Everything was easily a 20 minute (or less) walk from our hotel room, and we could be at Caesar's\/Planet Hollywood without breaking a sweat.

It's a great area to stay in if you're looking to be very centralized. If you book a room, I feel that it's not a big deal to have a view of the water show in your face (sure it's cool to have a view from your window and tune into the channel, but it's annoying to hear it every 30 minutes when you're trying to take a nap). Also definitely check out the shopping area if you enjoy designer brands!

Das Bellagio ist für mich das schönste Hotel auf dem Strip mit seinen Wasserspielen immer eine Augenweide wert. Die Zimmer sind sehr schön und wenn man noch dazu im 20. Stockwerk wohnt einen tollen Blick auf den Strip und die Wasserspiele.

Stayed here for one night a couple of weeks ago. Everything was pretty darn great! Only complaint is that as someone with pretty bad allergies to smoking (as it turns out) it's impossible to get into your room without going through the casino. (I guess that's all hotels for ya). 

(+1) Very polite and quick service. From check-in to check-out everything was very smooth. Clean room, great bathroom, gorgeous decor. I know it's expected but I was still very pleased. We didn't try pushing our luck with the $20trick but I heard many people get bumped up that way. 
(+1) Great deal on seeing O if you book a room here. Ultimately was the reason we stayed at the Bellagio. Not only do you get a discount but you also get special seats that are in a zone you otherwise won't get. 
(+1\/-1) Concierge was very polite but overall worthless. They didn't even have other perks like buffet passes. 
(-1) As mentioned above the entrance to the rooms (elevators) is smack in in the middle of the casino. Yucky smoking people everywhere. 

Overall: I'd consider staying here if I had a conference in the hotel or wanted to go see O or got a great deal on the room. Otherwise I feel like Cosmo or Wynn have the style beat.

My favorite hotel so far as compared to Luxor and Monte Carlo.  We stayed at the Bellagio over Mother's Day weekend and got a pretty good deal off their website (less than $200\/night for a regular room).  It's a central location on the strip and right next to the newest City Centre - where you can walk to or take the free tram that goes between Monte Carlo, Aria, City Centre, and Bellagio.

From the minute you enter, everything within is clean and gorgeous.  Check-in (and check-out) was quick and easy.  The rooms are fairly spacious and the large bathroom consists of large shower stall and separate bathtub, his & her sinks.  The shower pressure and temperature, however, were inconsistent and the toiletries were weak.  Otherwise, the rooms were more than adequate and comfortable.  We stayed on the 24th floor and never waited more than a minute for an elevator.  

I personally was not a fan of the pool area.  You take the elevator to the pool level below casino level, where you grab towels.  Then you have to wander out through a maze of poolside chairs and various pools to get out into the sunlight.  (When it's time to go back inside the hotel, there are signs pointing you in the direction of the exit.  That's how large the area is!)  The poolside area itself just felt overpacked and chaotic - not the relaxing poolside experience I was looking for on my vacation weekend.  I also noticed they didn't seem to enforce any security to ensure you were a hotel guest, and wondered if there were any non-guests utilizing the facilities.

The resort itself is gorgeous, from the lobby to the conservatory to the fountains.  There's plenty of dining and shopping options within.  It's also home to Cirque du Soleil's O (my favorite cirque show ever!).  A large casino with a good variety of games to win (or lose) some $$$.  Overall a good deal, but I don't know if I'd feel the same if it was over $300\/night for a standard room.

This review is mainly to reflect our opinion on the hotel room. We had a luxury room with $30 upgrade for the fountain view. We were there for only 1 night. Once we got into the room, as usual, we checked if everything was okay so we wouldn't be blamed for something not done by us. We found 2 lights not working, and 1 pillow was missing. So we called for fixing the light. One of our door card keys didn't work too. Since we didn't have enough time (just one night), so we rushed to the pool to enjoy our time, and then went to have dinner. We went back after dinner and ready for bed, and also enjoyed couple fountain shows from our view. Then I found that the pillows had stains, and my husband also found some food debris and trash between the bed and the wall, so we felt grossed out. We were struggling if we wanted to complain right away but we got too tired, so we decided to complain the other day. We didn't get the door card key fixed right away because of the long long lines at the registration desks. We really didn't want to waste our only night there with fixing this and that. 
The other day when we checked out, we told the registration desk how dissatisfied we were. She apologized and told us that they would have given us a better room if they told them earlier. But I explained to her that we only had one night and didn't want to spoil it by switching rooms and fixing here and there. So she offered to waive our upgrade fee of $30, which is fair enough for us. So it was resolved.
But I wouldn't want to go back staying at Bellagio hotel rooms again, because with that price, I could have better rooms at Aria and Venetian, and we like the rooms and everything better in Aria and Venetian too. Bellagio room is nice but not nice enough for that price. So it's okay to experience it just once and not going back again. And the beds aren't that comfy, probably because it's getting old. The shower water pressure wasn't that strong either. It's an old hotel....nice outside but not inside. We had better beds and shower at Aria and Venetians.....so.....with all these comparisons, Bellagio room wasn't that great. If there was no fountain view, there is nothing good about the room for us. We felt that the room isn't clean as a whole. I felt a bit itchy the other morning. Yes probably we could have better room if we complained earlier. But I still think that a 5 star should have every room cleaned well at their first round, shouldn't need to wait for someone complaining to clean the room thoroughly, meanwhile we felt that the rooms are very clean at Venetian and Aria. 
No bellagio anymore for us.

Horrible experience!; staring from checking inn, till last minute of checking out. 
Took them over two hrs to check me inn, then they moved me to different suit next day, to the suit that I reserved initially. Checking out, being on hold over 45 minutes to talk to front desk to get my final bill, they comped me with 200 dollars, not to mention, that I gambled over $....this is embarrassing. Would I ever think to come back to this hotel???? I rather stay in MOTEL 6 and do not have all the hostel that I went thru.
Think twice before you plan your vacation by staying in Bellagio hotel

Considered one of the "better" hotels and is home to the "must see" fountain show. 
However, it's not nearly to the standard they set for themselves. Yes, they have an awesome pool (which you get a mandatory charge for) and a well kept casino. BUT the rooms are just decent. Our room had stains on the floor, the bathtub had hair, and black spots on a towel..errr...

We checked in LATE (like 11pm) so there was only a 10 minute wait at check in. During the usually 3pm check ins, expect to wait 45minutes. 

In the event you have children, this hotel is not at all kid friendly. I was standing on the "walkway" not too far from the elevators waiting for my husband to come down (he forgot his phone in the room). A security came up to me and told me I had to keep walking or go back to the tower elevators since I have a kid. Mind you, I was not standing near any machines or tables.

If you are child-free, aside from the casino, there are "the shoppes" where you can buy designer. You can also take the free tram that connects 3 surrounding hotels.
Again, trouble with the service in the casino...We couldn't find the tram so we asked one of those people in the burgundy jacket for direction and this guy acted like he own the damn hotel. 
This was a constant pattern. I wouldn't pay the hefty price tag for a decent hotel.
Vry nice building of hotel... Beautifull interior part of hotel... I was visit 2month ago... Rooms r so clean .. I liked the hotel very much....

Still my most favorite casino in Vegas.  I didn't stay there on this particular trip but have stayed twice in the past.  The rooms are ok but the casino is especially nice.  It's not the seedy, nasty kind of casino but a place that you can hang out in all day and feel very comfortable.

My husband and I recently stayed in Bellagio for our anniversary; we asked for a room on the fountain side, and the view was so wonderful. We LOVED it and it was just so romantic to watch! As far as the room itself goes, the decor and general condition of the room was on pretty outdated. The layout of the room was also just not great, we ended up dragging chairs in front of the window, as they have the sitting area of the room facing towards the bed. When you have the fountains outside the window?? The bed was nothing noteworthy, and the sheets had a weird smell. The bathroom had mold in the shower, and all of the drains were very clogged and drained incredibly slow. Also, you are not supposed to touch any of the items they have in the room; snacks, drinks and the mini-bar - they cost an arm and a leg and automatically get charged to you if you even move them, let alone eat them. They also have their mini fridge so stuffed full that you cannot place anything of your own in there. I would rate Bellagio 5-star for the view, 2 or 3-star for the room. If it's your first time to Vegas, and you want to see the fountain view in the evening, I would recommend the room - just do not expect to get your socks knocked off by the room itself.

I had been looking forward to staying at The Bellagio Hotel for over 10 years, I once thought it out of reach. I still hold it in high regard and think it is one of the best hotels on the Strip. But after having stayed there for a weekend, the romance has worn off, it's just another hotel, and I doubt I will ever stay here again.

I wanted a transformative experience, impeccable service, and memorable experiences that confirmed what I had always believed The Bellagio to represent.

But alas, I came away with more than a couple of sub-par experiences.

Throughout our entire stay, this hotel was super busy. At any hour. The minute we got out of our elevator, there were hoards of people, of course it was worse at night. If you want a little space wandering your hotel, this is not the place to stay.

I had two nights booked, separately so I called ahead to make sure the reservations could be combined and we wouldn't need to change rooms. But we showed up and still had to have the reservations combined into one stay. And even that didn't stick. The next day we were locked out of our room mid-day because the keys for the first reservation stopped working. A 10 minute wait and security let us into our room. A call to the front desk brought a promise of new keys, delivered within 30 minutes. An hour later, no keys. Another call and the front desk said, "you'd better come down to get them". Worse, the front desk clerk giggled at me when I told her I'd had to wait an hour for naught. No apology. Not a big deal, right? Keys can be a problem, no? I agree, it's how it was handled.

Our room was nice, but not spectacular. The room we paid for could have been on any floor between 9 and 28. We were on floor 11. That was disappointing. The front desk clerk should have listened when I told him I had wanted to stay here for many many years, he could have provided us the best possible experience, but no, he didn't. The room was well done, nothing out of place (apart from a bag of mini bar snacks left opened). The bathroom was the best part, large with a nice-sized glass shower. I was also disappointed that our view of the fountains could only be taken in when we huddled by the window; I'd wanted to sit in bed and watch the show!

We spent some time by the pool. It was early November and not that warm, but we weren't the only ones there. Service was non-existent! Others were served but no staff ever came to ask for our order.

We faced the Fountains (Fountain Deluxe Room) and one terribly surprising aspect of our room was noise! Between midnight and 4 AM both nights during our stay, noise from the club in the hotel woke me up. Thump thump thump for a few hours. Another surprise was noise in the hallway. Both nights there were very loud groups of people hanging out in the hallway for more than a few minutes. I probably should have called the front desk. It was just surprising for a hotel of this quality that there was so much noise coming from outside (the nightclub was directly below our room) and inside (the hallway).

Our housekeeper was the same person over three days. She was very kind and gracious. We sought her out when we left to thank her for her service.

Perhaps when one day money becomes no object, I will return to The Bellagio. But for the immediate future, there are many nice hotels along the Strip that will provide just as comfortable accommodations for a much fairer price. I'd really hoped, spending such a considerable sum, that we would have been treated as special, valued guests, but we weren't, we were just a couple of other guests in a huge hotel on a busy weekend.

My first and last stay at the Bellagio. I booked 3 rooms, months in advance for my daughter 40th. Birthday. Since, our arrival  everyone had  an attitude or was rude to us.  Maybe they are been treated bad who knows. At check-in the blond older lady with her I-pad on hand kept telling me to go away. Check out here in Vegas is not until 3 pm she keep repiting. Maybe because the color of my skin did not match hers. She probably taught I did not understand . Next, when we got to,the rooms the mini-bars were a mess.  Bottle water half way used. Have of a sandwich in the fridge. We called front desk to let them know nothing happen.  The only good service we got at he Bellagio Cafe, give all the people that work there 6 stars. The service was more then excellent.  I give the Bellagio 2 stars.  I have always stay at  theAriaor the Wynn I should stay with what I know.  Bad,bad service. Make your employees happy. Management most be doing something wrong to their people because they are not happy campers .

Once again this casino has a great interior design. I'd love to stay here if I had a chance, but fact of the matter is my sister lives here and I'll probably will never get a chance to stay at any hotel here in Vegas. I can't really review much about this place as I just came here to walk around and it was connected to Venetian and we were in the area.

One thing I did like about this place is that this hotel is famous for it's fountain water show. Usually when I'm in town we always come see this show even though its the same every time. It's just cool to check out because it's pretty famous and has been in a few movies (oceans 11). Other than that we don't come to this hotel for anything else, so I can't really review this place any higher than other hotel\/casinos.
Beautiful art work & flowers everywhere.  All the staff were helpful & pleasant.  Very clean & well maintained.

Very nice indeed.  Of course, just approaching the resort is impressive with the fountains featuring their musically choreographed magic every 15-30 minutes and the long circular walkway.  Upon entering the lobby, your eyes are immediately drawn upward to the Dale Chihuly hand-blown glass flowers exhibit that is always captivating.  Then there is the ever-changing botanical gardens exhibit... it's currently a forest setting with toy trains cutting through the foliage.

We were lucky enough to have a buddy working at the Bellagio and he was able to get us on a list for the pool.  The poolside scene was very calm and composed... a huge difference from the raucous MGM Grand.  The landscape is classic Roman and majority of the pools are frigid fountains... but that's ok because it's 100+ out there.  Due to this fact, we found ourselves spending much of our time sipping refreshing cocktails like mojitos and their fabulous Mai Tai's... they are really amazing with fruit and topped with powdered sugar.  Nothing at the Bellagio is cheap, from the drinks to the sunscreen to the clientele.  There were MILF's, escorts, bachelor parties, euro trash... all eager to spend a pretty penny.  Definitely a true Vega$ experience.

TERRIBLE.  They charged me for buffets that came with my reservation.  When I called after I checked out about this, they said that's not what my reservation said (I have a screenshot of the reservation details, explicitly saying two free buffets per night).  Then they tried to turn it around saying I had 4 people (it was just me and my partner doing a couples getaway, so false) and requested a roll-away bed (??! Also a straight up lie) so they couldn't do anything about it.  DON'T let them trick you or turn it around on you.

Had never been here a was pretty stoked to get my chance. I had heard amazing things and definitely did not disappoint. 

The bellagio is the nicest and most expensive hotel I have stayed at in Vegas. The Friday they Sunday cost me $800 but with the resort fees and etc it was over $1100. A little pricey for a weekend in July but I knew it was 5 stars and my gf is worth it. 

The rooms are immaculate and the sheets, pillows and beds are plush. The eoom was cleaned very day perfectly and the staff was nice. The check in did take a few more than I am used to but it was Friday afternoon so it was busy. 

I would definitely stay here agin but maybe have to look for a special rate. We did not gamble here as the tables were very high minimums.

Never stayed here but the casino is nice and the buffet is the creme de la creme of buffets.   the only thing is was I never have experienced such slow (actually non existent)  cocktail service.   didn't even get a drink to drown the sorrows of loosing my money while playing roulette.

This was the nicest hotel I have ever stayed in in my life! Granted it was my bachelorette party and my MOH decided it would be fun to get the penthouse suite overlooking the strip!
Our room was in the center of the Bellagio, so when you first walked in you were blown away with a wall to wall window showcasing the strip and the fountains. There were 3 1\/2 bathrooms, 3 beds, a sauna, a huge jetted tub, walk in closets, a wet bar, built in speaker system, living room, dinning room, and amazing service. Let me tell you, this hotel "room" was bigger than my apartment and I am NOT rich by any means so this was quite the treat for me and my girls. 

Other than the room, service was great, all the restaurants we ate at in the hotel were great, and I really felt like I could just stay at Bellagio and never leave. Usually when I go to Vegas I want to go all over the place, but here everything and anything you would want or want to do was there. If I had the money I would totally do it again!

Omigoodness where do I begin. We jus left the bellagio. Last nite.
First off wayyyyyyyy over rated and over priced. 35 dollars a day to get a microwave in your room. No personal mini fridge. No jet tub. Also they need wayyyyyyyy mor drink waitress because I put about 30 on the slot before one ever came to take my drink order . This happened everytime I sat down to play slots. Let alone a pint of 1800 tequila was 30 dollars at the gift shop. It was gonna cost us 80 a pint if wehad it delievered to the room. Not including delivery. Expected way mor from the buffet. Prime rib was good but that's about it. O yea and the carrot cake was yummy. Obviously the fountain is goregeous at nite. The hotel is jus super gianormous. I prefer a smaller hotel. Really ,when people stay there I don't kno why its so xpensive. Maybe just the name or the fountain. But honestly I wouldn't stay there again. There's many mor updated hotels in Vegas that take better car of you.I had a much better xperience at the palms.

My newlywed wife and I stayed at this hotel while we got married in Vegas this last week. I had made arrangements several months in advance to ensure we had a beautiful stay for our wedding and since it was my wife's first trip to Vegas.

I reserved a resort king tower fountain view room for 3 nights, and even after being an M life member receiving 15% off entire order the reservation ran a little over $1200. Everyone and their mom praised how great the Bellagio was so the price didn't matter to me. 

Upon arrival, my wife and I flew into Vegas fairly early in the morning. We checked in and our room wasn't ready yet (understandable since it was 10 am) but they said they would text us when it was ready and in the meantime they have a complimentary bag hold so we wouldn't have to carry our bags all over with us.
