That was great, although almost every hotel has this. We check our bags with a man at the bag hold and since we just arrived I hadn't even had cash in my wallet. The guy that checked our bags was so incredibly aggressively asking us for a tip for just holding our bags he insisted I go to an atm- for what maybe $2 I would give him??  Completely unprofessional in my opinion. I work in service and granted a tip is nice it should never be asked for. We didn't tip him but we did give the man who dropped our bags when our room was ready $5. 

Our room was on the 23rd floor and it was truly immaculate. Every star I give this hotel is due to its beautiful infrastructure, and the hospitality the housekeepers gave us. Nina prepared our room and it was gorgeous. We took several baths because was a personal hot tub so big. The bed was like sleeping on a cloud and our view was unreal. We got to see the Bellagio fountains like never before and it brought tears to my wife's eyes. You can play channel 22 on TV and hear the music that goes with the fountains right from your room. I thought it was special that we got a relatively close view to the fountains most likely because I put in our reservation we were getting married and it was our first time to Vegas. For that whoever placed in our room, we thank you!

As far as the rest of our stay, we were fairly disappointed with the customer service aspect. My wife and I are lesbians and several times felt like we were profiled by Bellagio employees and received looks like we shouldn't have been there. Which is really disappointing as I spent close to $2500 in total over a 4 day span: including reservation, dining at Bellagio restaurants, and gambling at the casino. I'd just like to add that we are in our 20s and we don't dress dumpy, my wife and I were probably the best dressed in that whole hotel compared to the trailer trash dressing people that filled the casino. Regardless each time, when using the guest elevator we would be asked to show our room card. At night, everyone is asked but during the day they profile and as several people would walk past without showing their key we would be pulled back and asked. It felt degrading and I almost wrote to the concierge but decided against it since I don't plan on staying at this hotel again due to these small inconsistent terrible service experiences.

We ate at several restaurants that were amazing, Yellowfin, Olives, Lago to name a few. The only restaurant I would not recommend is Cafe Bellagio. Decent menu that is way overpriced and once again horrible customer service. 

I had included and requested for the Bellagio to add any extra romantic touches since we were getting married Saturday the 21st. Upon arrival there was nothing in our room. I had checked the amenities list and adding romantic touches threw there would be several hundred more so I decided to just leave it out. We got married Saturday and when we came back to our room the Bellagio sent a letter saying they were happy we chose to spend our special moment with them along with a box of chocolate. I figured they would have also left a bottle of champagne or even cider as that should be complimentary for a multi billion dollar hotel but nothing except a small box of what we thought were store bought chocolate. That was all fine but I guess I just expected more especially from what I've heard from different people. I recognize this is 2017 and everything costs $ now but I hope the Bellagio retrains their team on what customer service means. Every department but housekeeping and maybe the concierge was unimpressive. 

Overall, we loved our room and it was worth the money to see my wife as happy as she was with our VIP view of the strip and the fountains but we both agreed next time we will stay at a surrounding hotel that is equally nice but has better service and is more LGBT friendly.

Who can forget Oceans Eleven and the beauty of the Bellagio? 

The gorgeous dancing fountains, the magnificent gardens, the glass ceiling, the amazing shopping, the friendly staff, and the breathtaking decor.

Love, love, love! Apart from the Venetian, this may be one of the most romantic hotels on the strip. Perfect for couples, and pretty good for large groups as well. But if I was in a large group, I probably wouldn't want to stay here because of the intimate aura and atmosphere of the place. 

ps. There is also some great little restaurants to tickle your fancy (just don't forget to leave an arm and a leg to take care of your bill).

My stay at the Bellagio was fine, as always. This is the first time I've reviewed it, though, and there were a few things that were off. First, the price does not match the quality. They are much more expensive because of the name and history but the actual quality of the rooms is above average compared to others on the strip.

The restaurants are great, albeit overpriced again, but the fact that we had to cross the street to Paris in order to get a decent lunch (the first two restaurants that we went to at the Bellagio itself were not great) is a shame. They need to feed people during the day as well as at night.

Excellent hotel which lives up to its fabulous reputation.  I just checked out a few hours ago.  The hotel has beatiful rooms, sufficient registration clerks, lovely scenary, excellent maid service  and a wonderful location.  Bellagio also has complimentary  24\/7 boarding pass printoff kiosks!

This is probably one of the few hotels I have to visit every time I'm in Vegas.  It's not just a beautiful place to stay in (I love the suites that face the Strip), but simply walking through the hotel is an adventure in and of itself.  Every few months or so, they change the decorations in their botanical garden to match the theme of an upcoming holiday or season.  It's always magnificently and artfully displayed, so make sure you bring your camera!  Sometimes, they may even have a little bird or butterfly exhibit (I think this occurs during the Spring time).  I also love the glass blown flowers on the ceiling of the lobby.  It is definitely worth seeing!

There are also beautiful couture shops and boutiques.  Bellagio has a great selection for those high end shoppers :)

If you're looking for a great show, catch O - a Cirque du Soleil show with a water theme.  Breathtaking acrobatics and costumes.. love it!

Last but not least, the Bellagio has a beautiful water show.  I think it comes on every half hour, and it takes place right in the Bellagio fountain.  If you have a room that faces the Strip, you are in luck!  If not, don't sweat!  You can get front row views right on the Strip!  The water moves with the music, and when it crescendos, you can hear the thundering of the water.  It's truly a spectacular to see.  Check it out!

we booked a 2 rooms here a month ahead of time, but when we got to Las Vegas to check-in it all went bad. 
they casino had cancel one of the reservations without prior warning or cause. it made the trip the worst to be scrambling to find a solution. they didnt offer any apology or anything for the matter.

I think the hotel is great, but for that price, I'd expect more. We got 2 suites... both NON SMOKING. 1 of them sort of smelled like smoke and the other smelled like someone was sitting there and smoking! 

Other than that the bathrooms were just good, but not spacious like the Venetian's. I expected more, but Bellagio didn't really deliver. The lobby and everything downstairs was top notch gorgeous though. Give and take... price versus comfort, I give Bellagio 3.5 stars. If my room hadn't smelled like smoke, 4 stars.
One of only three casino resorts in Vegas to earn the AAA FIVE DIAMOND award.  The master piece of Steve Wynn prior to his current master piece and also a five diamond resort, The Wynn.

This place is just amazing , stays here Saturday night it was a fast check In and you can also check in Mobil, clean place, clean room with a perfect view, would have to come here again next time to enjoy the pool. Parking is $15 a day though.

Das Luxushotel Hotel Bellagio liegt direkt am Las Vegas Strip und ist für die einzigartigen Wasserspiele bekannt. Es gehört zu den größten und besten Hotels in der Welt und wurde im Jahre 1998 eröffnet. Vorher befand sich auf dem Gelände das Hotel "The Dunes".

Seit 2010 gehört es zum Verbund der MGM Resorts International, zu dem auch die Vegas Hotels Mandalay Bay, MGM Grand, Mirage und New York-New York gehören. Das Hotel Bellagio war in der Vergangenheit Kulisse für die Hollywood Filme Ocean's Eleven und Ocean's 13. 

Das Hotel hat nach dem letzten Umbau 3.933 Zimmer und ist der Landschaft des Comer Sees nachempfunden. Die Hotelausstattung ist auf höchstem Niveau. Die Ladenpassage "Via Bellagio"mit Designerboutiquen von Chanel, Hermes, Giorgio Armani, Gucci, Prada, Yves Saint Laurent, Fred Leighton und, Tiffany & Co. Ist spektakulär.

Ein großes Kasino mit 10.800 m² und 100 Spieltischen mit Blackjack, Caribbean Stud Poker, Craps, Keno, Let It Ride, Poker, Pai Gow Poker, Roulette, Sportsbook, Big Six, Baccarat und 2.500 Slots befindet sich ebenfalls im Hotel. Im legendären Bobby's Room wird um mindestens 20.000 $ gespielt.

Darüber hinaus gibt es zwei Hochzeitskapellen, Theater, Bellagio Gallery of Fine Art und etliche Restaurants, darunter auch das Restaurants Picasso mit zwei Sternen sowie Le Cirque und Michael Mina mit je einem Stern.

Herzstück sind sicherlich die "Fountains of Bellagio" mit einer computergesteuerten Wassershow, die zu wechselnder Musik tanzen. Die Vorführungen finden Montag bis Freitag von 15:00-20:00 Uhr alle halbe Stunde und von 20:00-24:00 Uhr alle Viertelstunde statt. Am Samstag, Sonntag und an Feiertagen von 12:00-20:00 Uhr alle halbe Stunde und von 20:00-24:00 Uhr alle Viertelstunde.

Ein wirklich faszinierendes Hotel, wo man für kurze Zeit vergisst, dass man sich direkt am Strip befindet.

Oh the humanity!  This is a swank place overrun by people who enjoy a faux oversized Liberty Bell and dancing fountains.  The shops are posh but unaffordable for little people like me.   That said, I was impressed by the $1695 laptop bag in Prada....  Gorgeous!

The casino is well maintained and not terribly smokey, which is always a plus in my book.  

Sorry I don't have more to say about it, but we were just passing through ...

LOVE the Bellagio. The Garden they have there is changed seasonally and is always breath-taking. The fountains of course are famous. I watch them languidly lick at the sky in the setting sunlight from my desk at home. There are great restaurants there and the amazing Cirque Du Soleil production, "O" has residency in the theatre. 

It is always VERY busy and the valet can be jammed and is occasionally full. There IS security at the elevators so it is a bit of a pain for gentlemen seeking company, but in my professional opinion, the hassle is worth it.

The rooms are lovely and have great views and the 4-Star rating is due ONLY to the hassle of the valet and security. It deserves a 5-star rating as a hotel\/casino for the general population.

Get here early... the line gets really long during lunch time.

Service is fast and the menu looks really good. We all split the turkey club and Greek salad. The turkey club was delicious.... hearty, with soft bread :) The portion size was big enough for two people (esp if you're going to be sitting out in a bikini afterwards). 

The Greek salad, which was recommended by the server was not so great. It lacked spices and the chicken was dry. Don't get it.

Stick to the sandwiches. Awesome spiced fries too :)

If classic style and slick decor is your thing, then look no further than the Bellagio Hotel. The Bellagios hotel is considered an iconic landmark in Vegas, located at the middle of the strip. 

Pros

Location: By far the best thing about the Bellagios. It's  a 5 minute walk to Caesar, Cosmo, Planet Hollywood, Paris and Harrahs. 

Room: I was fortunate to stay at the Salone Suite for a great price. The amenities was fantastic and more than you could ask for in a hotel. I had the corner room with 180 degree view of the fountain:

Bathroom: As a girl, the bathroom set the tone for the experience. It was a gigantic marble white bathroom that's the size of a Las Vegas standard room. The bathroom has a comfortable jacuzzi with an amazing view and plenty of counter space to do your makeup. 

Fountain: Nothing like water pulsating from the ground in unison with music through the ages gets you going :) It starts at various times depending on the day of the week and within every 30 minute intervals. It's pretty majestic and its worth to stop by if its your first time in Vegas.

Been staying here for the last 10 years every time we fly into Vegas. Before that, we stayed at the Venetian when their first opened. Our casino host here takes really good care of us. Nothing compares to the beautiful view of their fountain from our room. Love it here!

Paid extra for a room with great fountain view, but no coffee! LOL

The Christmas decorations are very admirable and everything else looks classy. We had a room with a great view of the water fountain show, but we paid extra for it and didn't have any coffee or tea maker in the room. This is so inconvenient for guests who would have to go downstairs to get in line to purchase morning beverages or call for room service that takes quite a while. What's the reason for not having these available in the room?

Nothing special about the staff...they're there to work but not make you feel VIP. *wink

Well my husband and I haven't left the hotel yet, but I had to write a review. I love, love, love this hotel. There is not one thing negative to say about this beautiful hotel. Lovely room and it was very quiet and clean. Bed was very comfortable. I want to live here. They have everything you could ever want right here in the hotel. 
The most impressive thing was that every person we came into contact with in the hotel was very nice and polite, from the front desk all the way to the housekeepers. 
Thank you Bellagio for a wonderful 3 days. We will be back!!!!!

I fell in love with the Bellagio when I visited ten years ago. I swore on my next trip to Vegas I would stay there. So when I decided to spend my 40th birthday in Vegas, I booked the Bellagio. I was so excited. My excitement started to wane at check in. I waited in line for nearly 40 minutes until I was finally called to check in. This wasn't at a prime time of day, it was at 11:50pm.  By the time we got to check in, it was after midnight. The clerk was nice enough, she asked if we were celebrating anything. I explained it was my birthday. She said Happy Birthday, then proceeded to check us in like normal. No other mention of my birthday. It was no different than an average hotel check in.

The room was pretty. It looked toward the strip, but the view was mainly of a large roof top. No plants or anything, just a painted roof. The cable didn't work at all. The toilet didn't work right. My biggest complaint was the toilet paper!  For $300+ per night, I expect at least quality two ply toilet paper. This stuff was what you find in road side stops... rough and useless. A call to the front desk took at least ten minutes to get a live person to answer.  If you so much as rearrange the minibar, there is a $50 fee.  Also, there was something in our room that made both my husband and my noses run as soon as we walked in. I was blowing my nose the entire time I was in the room but would stop when we left.  The room seemed clean so I have no idea the source. I'm allergic to cats and mold so neither is a good sign. 

There were barely any toiletries. There was one bar of soap which had to be used at the sink, shower, and soaking tub. The shampoo and conditioner were decent quality.  Also, no extra toiletries. I forgot my razor and was out of luck. I've stayed at chain hotels that provide any forgotten items!  The escalator to the strip was also out of order. With the hotel sitting off of the strip, those extra stairs a few times per day really added up. 

The smoke smell was extremely heavy as soon as you walked into the lobby. It clung to our clothes just walking to our room. The buffet was over priced for a Saturday brunch and wasn't impressive. We also went to Hyde night club.  It was fun, good music, but really small and tons of roped off areas.  After looking forward to staying here for years and paying a premium, I am sorely disappointed. 

Pros- the pool area is absolutely gorgeous. Conveniently located in middle of the strip. Lastly, the fountains are amazing.

The front desk was exceptionally slow and rude. I don't feel like a paying customer at all...
We booked a fountain view double queen room, but we're told the first night that 1. we did not pay extra $30 guarantee so we get either king fountain or double queen non-fountain, and 2. we can get room change the next day and 3. the prices are the same.
The next day they sold out again and we were unable to get our room because we booked only for 2 people, and only booking for 3+ will guarantee double queen fountain view. 
They gave us ambiguous reasons with no consistency at all.
Finally we were referred around several times because non of them seem to keep a straight story and we waited more than 15 minutes for the manager and got a $30 discount out of the $200+ room cost.
Will not recommend to anyone. Just view the fountain from the outside and absorb the beauty, staying here will totally ruin your holiday mood.

Chilling in front of Bellagio.. Michael is going to bet on the Pacman fight!! $5 patron shots... Wooooooo!!

One of the premier spots. Bellagio has been around for a while now and other hotels are up and coming in Vegas. But they still can not beat the water show in the front of the hotel. Amazing. 

The lights and atmosphere of the show just tells you, YOU ARE IN VEGAS!!

The rooms are standard unless you get a special suite and then that is really expensive. When we stayed her for one of my friends bachorlette celebrations it was fun. We had room service cause of our hang over the day after.. man that was some good breakfast. 

If you get a chance to stay here do it. One of the best hotels I have stayed at yet!

I would have given 5 stars if I was rating  on beautiful, clean rooms and overall "look" of this beautiful hotel, however if you can't provide me the basic necessities when I am traveling for work, it's a 1 star for me. 

Upon check in I requested a mini fridge for my room since I bring healthy food with me when I travel to keep a consistent diet. They told me it would cost $50 a day if it wasn't for a medical necessity. Really?  

I get up at 5 am every morning and like to have coffee before I work out. Try getting coffee before 6 am at this hotel without walking all the way across the entire hotel from the spa tower rooms. I called the front desk to ask for a coffee maker for my room and was told no. 

This is why I stay @Courtyard Marriott every chance I get because I automatically always get a mini fridge and coffee maker. Traveling for work is an inconvenience as it is, but not having the things that make me comfortable away from home was disappointing. 

Stay here if you aren't working and like to sleep in and you'll be fine.
The Mecca of swank.  Beautifully decorated for Chinese New Year  for year of the horse.  Awesome breakfast buffet.  I Just feel happy here!!

Stayed here for 3 nights and upgraded to a king bedroom in the main tower at check in. Be aware that if you upgrade it is $50 per day, which means I paid an extra $150 on top of everything else. I wish that was more clear when we received the offer, but it's ok because our view was amazing! The 27th floor had a center view of the water fountain show, the Eiffel tower, the Ferris wheel, and so many lights.

The hotel is in the middle of the strip with easy walking access to Caesars Palace and Planet Hollywood. You can get dropped off by Uber but cannot get picked up since there is no designated pick up area. The taxi line moves fast and is convenient.

I would also recommend checking out using the television in your room to avoid the long check-out line in the lobby.

We've been to Las Vegas about six times.  We've visited Bellagio for a meal and shopping, but this was our first time to stay there.  I would say that in many ways the Bellagio is the best on the Strip.  The location couldn't be better.  The interior decor and finish is exceptional.  I'm a bit of a furniture enthusiast so I notice things like the chairs.  At Bellagio you can sit in a $1,500 designer Louis XVI chair while you eat your crepes in the marble promenade.  Most of the other casinos use something more like a $200 pottery barn throw away chair and serve pretzels and hot dogs.   Walk through the casino floor and listen to Frank Sinatra and you get a classy feeling.  Other casinos?  Well, I remember hearing Sweet Home Alabama several times and I felt like I was back in college looking for someone with a beer bong.  I guess there is something for everyone but the Bellagio just feels right for us.

The location is in the heart of the strip and it has many beautiful attractions that don't have a fee (rare in Vegas).  Subsequently, it gets very crowded.  That is the major downside.

The food ranges from "good" to "unbelievable" depending on your budget.  I've seen other reviews that complain of $8 rolls, but c'mon people, this is Vegas.  They get you in with a low cost hotel room (we paid $155\/night total) and then you pay to play, eat, drink and enjoy.  

I didn't see any $8 rolls while I was there.  The food prices seem reasonable for a luxury hotel.  I would even say it's cheap compared to others.  I've paid $30 for breakfast at The Le Meridian in Munich and it is not nearly as good $15 breakfast buffet at Bellagio.  The service is good as well.  It's not great, but what do you expect at a buffet?  I never found myself needing more coffee.  That's enough for me.

The standard room is decent size and comfortable for staying a few days with two people.  It would be cramped with four.  I've had better and I've had worse.  We stayed in the Spa tower and had a full view of the fountains.  That was nice.  

I selected "No" on the "Good for Kids" rating.  There are not really any attractions or activities for kids at Bellagio.  On a personal note, I really can't understand why you would bring kids to Vegas in the first place.  It seems like a good place for getting away from kids to me.

I expect that we will stay at Bellagio on our next trip to Vegas.
So much smokier than where we stay.  It gagged is to just have a drink there. No ty!   We prefer the WYNN

I like coming here to see the conservatory & botanical gardens. Every time I visit Bellagio the gardens has a different theme, style and alot of colors. AND the bathrooms on the first floor by the parking garage entrance \/ exit are super clean !

Beautiful place to be.. you won't regret it!! =) Everyone will cater to your needs or answer you questions and won't leave you hanging wondering where your going and what not. Pricey, yes.. but so worth it!!

One of the high end casino at Vegas.  A must stop.  A very large elegant casino, nice high end shops, the best fountain show ever, great rooms and a tram that connects you to other casinos like the Aria and Monte Carlo.  Next door to Cosmopolitan and across the street from Paris and Planet Hollywood. And on the corner  with a bridge to connect to Caesars, Flamingo and Bally's.  What a great location.  So why only 3 stars?  The shops are nice but the mall is small.  When you see the Caesar Forum or the Miracle Mile Shops or the Grand Canal Shoppes, this one will disappoint you.  The high end restaurants are kind of boring.  The reward program doesn't reward you.  I seem to lose here more often than the other casinos.  If the rates are reasonable, I would stay here all the time, but since they are not, I don't.  It still a must do while in Vegas.

Absolutely beautiful hotel. Was just in town for one night and didn't wasn't to stay at a loud trendy spot so stuck to what everyone knows is the best!

Can't go wrong with the Bellagio as a solid Vegas choice, would love to come back and stay for a few more nights and really get to enjoy everything is has to offer. 

We dined at one of their newer restaurants, Harvest. A farm to table concepts, it was absolutely delicious! I order brussel sprouts wherever I can and these were hands down in the top 5 of the array of them I've eaten. 

Ohh and French toast room service was everything I've ever wanted after night out!

The Bellagio, several years ago, was "IT" as far as Vegas hotels go but today it's less than "IT"-way less! 
Yeah "Dancing Waters" is still very entertaining but...you don't come to Vegas just to see bubbling waters (well maybe some folks do.) 
There was a big reservation screw up caused by passing on my reservation to two online services and then to the Bellagio. To their credit the hotel staff did their best to rectify the problem-but it shouldn't have happened in the first place.
For those that come for the gambling the casino floor is still an attraction but there've got to be at least a hundred other places in this town just as good for giving your money away. At least the casino floor here is a bit quieter but no less congested.
As for the hotel part of this the rooms are just rooms no more no less-well maybe less as there are no outtake fans or heating lights in the bathrooms, the minibar has stopped being a refrigerator which people can use for say leftovers and things they might buy outside of the hotel (perish the thought.) The free WIFI is almost always painfully slow. The beds are comfortable if you like to wake with severe curvature of the spine.
On the good side it's centrally located so almost everything on the strip is within walking distance. The enormity of the place is still impressive although other newer hotels do a whole lot more with the same space.
So I definitely won't be staying here again next time but still I say that with the knowledge of what it was and what it meant to the town's popularity and growth.

They don't Deserve one star for room it's not been sprayed for bugs and so it's not maintained properly yo the high standards they claim this 4 star hotel is to be. My daughters room has bugs and a moth issue. Costumer service is not helping...  it's late at night and they can't sleep. They called several times with nobody helping. We have serval trips planned to Vegas this year with large conventions and plan to stay at a hotel MGM doesn't own. Terrible experience. Can't sleep an need manager who has authority to step in or they will be online and calling agencies to complain and warn the public about this hotel issue that's kept quiet!

I am normally a fan of Venetian, but stayed at Bellagio for the first time even though I've been to LV almost a dozen times.

I originally booked a Salone Suite, but I tipped a nice, beautiful may I add, girl at front desk to get an upgrade to Bellagio Suite.  I originally just wanted an upgrade to one with a view, but Bellagio Suite will do just fine =D  Also picked up line pass for the buffet, thank you Hilda.

I checked out the floor plans of the Salone Suite, but was not familiar at all with Bellagio Suite.  Let me sum it up with two words: three toilets.

Room service was fantastic (exceptional service on the phone and on delivery), and I have to say that it's actually worth ordering in for one night, so you can enjoy your meal looking over the fountain water show.  "Her" bathroom had a jet tub thing, and "His" bathroom has steam thing.  Sorry for my poor diction.

Usually, I don't play table games, but decided to spend some time playing a little this time around.  Had a good time talking with the dealers, getting drinks from super hot cocktail waitress, and breaking even =D  Yay!

Amenities, of course, are fantastic.  Lots of shopping + top-notch staff + must-see conservatory + another must-see fountain.  It sure is on the pricey side, but I felt that it was worth it.

As a side note, I was out by myself one night to take pictures of the fountain water show.  So I had my usual gear (tripod + camera), and I am not kidding you... at least 15 people came up to me in 30 minutes, asking me in one shape or another "do you know when the next show is?"  And of course, I said "every 15 minutes until midnight" (it was around 8pm at the time).  I must've looked like an employee or something.

Even if you don't stay here, you must at least visit!

Stayed here 2\/21-2\/23.  The room was nice, quite large with a great bathroom.  We arrived about 8pm Friday night and the woman who checked us in said the hotel was almost sold out and offered to upgrade our regular room to a suite for an extra $200\/night.  We had already paid about $260\/ night for this room and expected it to be a little more than average.  I was underwhelmed.  We were in the spa tower with no view whatsoever, and our sheets had lots of little holes in them.  The casino was very smokey (and I am a smoker), buffet and room service was good... but I'm sure there are better ones in Vegas.  I did like that everyone wasn't in party mode 24\/7. (I am 25, my boyfriend is 33).  We had a nice mix of fun and relaxation.  Over all, the hotel was ok.  Everyone we talked to was friendly, we just expected a little more.

Pretty much what you expect from a Las Vegas casino hotel located on the strip... A little bit over-the-top and interesting place to hang out if you want to gamble and people watch. All in all... Not really my kind of place but could be fun for others.
I've never gambled here but i love walking through this place.  It is beautifully designed and the water show is always a treat.

Bellagio is one of the most beautiful hotels on the Las Vegas strip, and it offers some of the best service as well.

The casino are is gorgeous, the pool is gorgeous, the women are gorgeous, and everything is just gorgeous.

The hotel room is nice as well, and whether you have a fountain view or a view of the pool, it's all good, because both views are great. 

I spent a beautiful 3 days by the pool and got a nice tan.

Still the best hotel in Vegas in my book, has the classic Vegas feel, and beautiful inside and out. Can't go to Vegas without watching the water show in front! The lobby's colorful glass ceiling is one of my favorites, along with the garden. I'd say the only con is it's a bit of a walk to the strip from the front of the hotel.

This is a review for a Bellagio penthouse suite...room 31055 if you're wondering.

I stayed at the Bellagio the nights of 9\/7 through 9\/9.  The cost of this penthouse suite averaged about $600 per night.  While that sounds expensive, similar sized suites (1500 sq ft) at the Aria and Caesars were significantly more expensive.  What does one get at a Bellagio penthouse suite?  

     - comp limo service to\/from airport (tip the driver, of course)
     - private check-in area with wine, snacks and other beverages
     - floor-to-ceiling windows with push-button activated drapes
     - 4 (!) flat-screen tvs
     - wet bar with MINI-FRIDGE!!
     - powder room, men's bathroom AND women's bathroom
     - men's toiletries included shave gel, mouthwash, toothpaste, toothbrush and razor (weirdly, this was a highlight for me)
     - men's shower was marble with a bench plus a steam function
     - women's bathroom, fwiw, had a whirpool tub and a bidet  (How do you use a bidet?  Don't know...didn't want to find out)
     - bed was absolutely the softest thing I've ever laid on
     - line pass to the cafe and buffet

The view in this room faces north towards Caesars and the valley.  Try the sandwich at check-in to see if you can upgrade to a room with a strip\/fountain view or pool\/Cosmo view.  Thanks, Bellagio, for a wonderful time.

The physical building and rooms are beautiful. The buffet, Noodles, and Jean Phillipe Patisserie were overpriced, but really good. And, uh, the elevators were quick? I'm running out of good things to say about them because...

they charged $12 for an ethernet cable and still charged $12.99\/day for access. And, it's $25\/day to use their fitness center, EVEN IF YOU'RE A GUEST. That's just insulting.

Check-in also took forever, even with a dozen people at the front desk.

Really disappointing, considering the price.

Eh. So many tourists. There are a lot of nice things here. The restaurants are phenomenal. I wish there were less tourists here. The shopping selection is amazing.. once again... too many tourists. Eh.

We stayed at the Bellagio during our first visit to Vegas recently.  We were there 2 nights in the Salone Suite and it was spectacular.  Check in was a bit long, but the front desk was very accommodating offering water to everyone that was in line.  The gentleman that checked us in went out his way to find the exact room I wanted.  Food was great @ the hotel and hotel was beautiful!   As soon as we left, we already made plans to return the following year. See you soon Bellagio.

One of my favorite Vegas hotels. I've never stayed in the hotel, but you don't have to stay in a hotel in Vegas to like it!

The almost magical Bellagio fountains out in front of the hotel display an amazingly well coordinated light & water show set to great music (like Frank Sinatra)! It's cool during the day, but it's so much better at night when the lights in the water add another level of cool to the display!

The lobby has a beautiful blown glass ceiling in a rainbow of colors. Just beyond the lobby is an atrium that always kind of seems like a piece of Wonderland. The decorations they use change depending on the time of year, but it's always amazing and beautiful. This last trip out to Vegas, it was like you were bug sized in a huge garden---towering flowers, huge snails, big birds, kites attached to the ceilings, etc.

The casino is your normal casino, but it just has an air of being classy, which I enjoy.
very nice, clean, non-smoking rooms. casino area is nice, but not as nice as Encore. service is very good.

My husband and I don't go to Vegas to gamble. We go for the shows, food, and for the experience of staying in a themed hotel. This being said, this review is more about the hotel itself rather than the casino part of it. 

This stay was my husband's surprise to me for my birthday in May 2011. I was thrilled we were finally going to be able to stay here and it was everything I had hoped it would be. Starting off, check-in was great. A little bit of a wait, but the desk clerk was efficient and friendly once we got there. We didn't feel as if we were being processed thru a cattle call and as an ex hotel careerist, I was impressed with the process. 

The room was spacious, clean,very classy and yet cozy. I loved the colours - not garish, not over the top, sort of soothing greens, tans and golds, actually. (My picture doesn't do it justice, really) The first sight we saw as we entered the room was the view: Las Vegas Blvd with the Paris across the street. Directly in front: the fountains! YAY! There was a channel on the TV which piped the fountain music in so you could watch the show and hear the music that was playing all without leaving your room. The view is one of the best we've seen in Vegas. Yes, you saw some rooftops of the buildings lining the fountains below, but it was minimal. I love, love, loved this room!

There is a varied collection of restaurants and shops in the complex. We did lunch one day at Olives. I had the Beef Carpaccio. (even tho' I had no idea what carpaccio was) LOVED it. And we enjoyed High Tea at the Petrossian Bar - what a lovely, relaxing experience! 

All in all, one of my favourite places in Vegas so far... possibly even better than the Venetian for me! Would love to go there again!

It's 10:00 a.m. and already 90f! Making a commitment to walk 10,000 steps a day, I ventured out from my room from a neighboring hotel and began my trek. 

I spent the first 3,000 steps wandering through the A\/C accommodating Bellagio Hotel. Possibly the most ornate and ever changing public area in all of Las Vegas. The lobby, art exhibits, and botanical garden are a fantastical journey to enhance. 

I walked well over half my goal enjoying every step. Yes, the fountains are iconic, however there is so much to behold in the Bellagio!

By far the worst hotel I have ever stayed at. I was at the bank and there security stole my vape pen. And they banned me from all MGM properties, well whatever I'll stay some where else and by the way keep the delta 9 pen losers!

Our first stay at the Bellagio was unfortunately marked by sewer gas smell from the shower drain. I asked the front desk twice to help, but no resolution yet. The property looks nice in pictures. It smells terrible.

Update: on checkout, the front desk had said they had credited us for a night, but looking at the emailed bill, there is no credit. I held on the phone to get a customer service agent for ten minutes and just decided to email them.

If I'm in Vegas there is no other hotel I will stay at besides the Bellagio! I've all ways had the best experience there, win or lose you will have a great time regardless.

My trip this weekend was amazing Until went to pick up my car up from valet. When my car pulls up I notice a huge scratch on the wheel of my car and I instantly go to the valet booth so they can come see the damage. I'm approached by an upset supervisor of the valet named "Joe" he right off the bat said " I'm sorry I don't believe you that scratch was already there, and made a comment on how I was being petty and must have lost when I was gambling"  I replied you have to be kidding me!!! He laughed and said we have everything on camera and I'll show you. We go to the booth and watch the footage of me pulling up, we zoom in on my wheels and their spotless!!!! He doesn't apologize, he just stays quiet and says "let's fill out an incident report"  the Bellagio had the best customer service in the world I can't believe they would hire someone like Joe! 

I get back home upset due to the damage on my new car and the disrespectful comments made and I get a call from a regional claims administrator Named Jacob Schwoob. Now this is the ideal employee of the Bellagio!!! He listened to what happened, looked over the report, watched the video evidence of my car and made sure everything was taken care of to the best standards! He quickly apologized for valet supervisor and assured me that's not how the Bellagio treats they're guests. Most important of all he genuinely seemed concerned as he addressed my issues. 

Its employees like Jacob Schwoob that keep me coming back. You can't let one bad apple ruin your image of a great place!

Thank you again Jacob for the kindness and sincerity!!!

Love the Bellagio! You have so many choices in Vegas. I've been there many, many times. I wanted to complement the property on the exciting and fun vibe, while my room was perfectly QUIET. I was so happy. Unbelievable with a million things things going on ....your room will be a nice place to rest and relax. The tub was huge and you must take the time to have a bath while you stay! Also, the service is fabulous all over the hotel. Lots to do, places within walking distance for eating and shopping, and plenty of great places to eat and drink right inside the Bellagio.

FOR THE SERENITY GARDEN ONLY!

I loved this part of the Bellagio. I would have to say that this was the only publicly serene spot in all of the chaos of Las Vegas. It was definitely one of the highlights of my trip to Vegas. I got some really cool photos with my boyfriend and I remember the energy just feeling very flowing and tranquil within that area.

I stayed at Bellagio for my 21st birthday weekend! They have a lovely Botanical Garden where they display seasonal exhibits. On my stay it was close to lunar new year so i was able to see their lunar new year exhibit. There was a rat representing the year of the rat! 

The room itself was pretty spacious with switches by the bed for the curtains scrolls which was awesome. I didn't like my room all that much because my window was not facing the musical fountain show. The service here is def. very friendly and everything in this hotel and casino are kept clean. 

I have seen their "O" show twice and it is still amazing. I don't think I will be back to the Bellagio the next time I visit because I want to give Wynn or The Venetian a try. Bellagio has been around for a while and some things in the rooms are starting to get old. I would like to give Wynn a try since its pretty new. Overall, I had a great trip.

Who doesn't like the bellagio? This place was the first, the original, it's set the stage for the upscale hotels. 

It's oceans 11 just walking in here!

This hotel is stunning, and lives up to all that hype. In the span of 1 year, I visited Las Vegas 4 times, and it seems like the display at Bellagio is constantly changing. In the Conservatory & Botanical Gardens area, they had new displays for Chinese New Year, they had new displays for Christmas...pretty much keeping up with Walmart's shelves, if ya know what I mean!

You can't help but feel classy and elegant walking inside here. Bellagio also has a huge buffet, and their famous watershow at the front! They also have a great club, Hyde, within the casino, and the casino itself is well kept.

Bellagio is beautiful no doubt. Customer service was great. As a couple we saw many families (kids) it really made me miss my kids (ouch). The gambling area was pretty quiet for a Saturday I heard no machines or people buzz with excitement. We gambled every other few hours and nothing. We went to mgm and Caesars and their machines kept us entertained. We didn't feel the night life vibe at bellagio. Shopping was rich so you have to be super rich or like getting in debt to shop here. We chose to eat outside from here. Oh and yes like reviews the bed was uncomfortable to soft for my taste.

A definite pro was having a room with a view of the fountains. Coming in second were the buffet (ugh so good) and Jean Phillipe's bakery (again, so good). However I did find the front desk to be the largest pain. With rooms going at the rate they are, you would expect expedient customer service. We must have waited for 20 minutes before we checked in. No one was managing the check-in lines, resulting in swarms of groups (Seriously, send ONE delegate. Your entire party doesn't need to be present to check-in) crowding around the check-in area with no clear definition of any lines. For that reason, I have to rate them kinda low. Everything else was fantastic, but that introduction to the Bellagio made me a bit grumpy.

Nice hotel on the strip.  Suites are spacious with an old school flair.  Not a great selection on restaurants so we usually go off property to eat.  The main atrium area is beautiful and changes seasonally.

I stayed at the Bellagio in September, and the decor and vibe of the resort blew me away. Bellagio offers five-star luxury when it comes to its rooms and suites, its dining opportunities, and its spa and pool area. Room rates are reasonably priced for a hotel at this level, especially if you're an M Life member. The casino floor offers a vast array of table games and slot machines, with a variety of limits. The rooms are very spacious and luxurious, with full tubs, separate showers, comfortable beds, and cozy furniture. The upgrade to a lake-view room is definitely worth it, as you can see the Fountains of Bellagio right outside your window and use the TV to play the song to which the fountains are choreographed. It's very easy to access the Strip and other resorts from the Bellagio, which makes it in an ideal location for those who like to venture out to other properties. All-in-all, the Bellagio is a very classy and luxurious environment to stay in, and I will definitely recommend it and hope to return in the future.

Don't get me wrong, this is a very nice hotel! My personal favorite part of the hotel would have to be the pools just because there were a variety of them and I spent a good portion of my time there ;) The look of the hotel is very regal, and there are good places to eat within the hotel. Room decor fit the whole "theme", though it wasn't anything that I would say 'OMG awesome!' to. Though a good place to stay, I would probably stay elsewhere next time I'm around.

So me and my husband stayed here twice and both times we've gotten the same room (Tower Deluxe) with the same view (mountain and pool), just a different floor. Here's a few rants and raves about this place...

I want to rave about the grandeur of the hotel. Even though this hotel is not the newest on the Strip, it still holds the dignified air of elegance that no other has come close to. The room was nicely decorated as well as the lobby (albeit crowded) and its corridors\/hallway (quiet and respectful). We had a corner room so we had more windows than usual (including one in the bathroom) and one less neighbor to deal with. The room was clean when we arrived unlike our first stay, we had a gum stuck in the menu booklet (ick!). Housekeeping was prompt, attentive and very friendly.

As much as housekeeping is part of my rave, they are also part of my rant. True, they would come and clean your room as soon as you leave (they'll ask you if they see you walking down the hall) or give them a call but they were not very thorough. After getting back to the room, I noticed the bathroom floor had not been swept.  Same thing with the shower room. One of the face towels in the drawers had a strand of hair in it! One of the rugs for the tub had a stain on it. It was a quite disappointing. Their website might describe a flat screen TV but, you can't fool me, the room had only one CRT TV. Wallpaper was peeling in the toilet room and there were plenty of scuff marks around the bedroom. The automatic sheer curtain control was not working properly nor was the vanity mirror. At the end of our vacation, we tried express check-out but were billed incorrectly. So we dragged our bags and suitcases down and waited in line to check out with the rest of the crowd trying to check in. 

This hotel is not self-contained. Lunch options and cheap dinners are quite limited as well as nightlife (The Bank is a whole other review!), you have to cross the street to be satisfied. I can't say much about the casino because we're not gamblers, although I did win a few bucks on the slots. No incessant air fresheners wafting through the public areas, just the occasional cigarette or cigar smoke. They do a good job of filtering it. And even though I did not go, the swimming pools look awesome. 

Overall, Bellagio is a nice hotel. I would come back, even if it's just for the pool or getting a fountain view room.
Absolutely beautiful hotel and casino! 5 star service. Very clean. My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon and they went above and beyond for us! Definatly coming back!!

A long over due review and I actually feel guilty about it since the hotel was perfect.  A while back my friends and I decided it was time for a much needed girls only vacation.  After doing some research, I came across a deal for a stay at the Bellagio and airfare that was too good to pass up.  Within 2 days we had decided to take a trip and made the reservations.  When we arrived, we were immediately greeted by a someone who took our bags and we walked up to front desk.  The glass blown flowers are so beautiful and can't be described by words or even by pictures (its the background on my phone).  The flower "garden" too.  So amazing.  We got to watch them replacing some of the flowers and got to have a few roses.  Anyway, back to the topic at hand.  Check in went as smooth as possible.  We were given a room with a great view of the mountains.  They even apologized for not having a room that faced the strip.  We all thought the mountain view was much better anyway.  
The room was nothing short of gorgeous.  We walked in to marble floors and a very large hotel room.  To our left was  one of the nicest bathrooms I have even seen.  A huge bath tub, large stand up shower and a generously sized counter top.  (only problem, glass shower and no separate sink or toilet does make it a little different for 3 girls to share a hotel room and get primped for a night on the town)  The beds were soft and cozy.  The room pretty much catered to your every need.  There were even buttons on the wall to open and close the shades.  
After we settled into the room and played with all the gadgets, we went to investigate.  We wandered the hotel and discovered the gelato shop (a theme in a few of my other reviews) and many of the other places in the hotel.  All amazing and beautiful.  The next day we stayed by the pool, all day.  We went made our way through the conservatory and to the pool.  We got a prime seat by one of the many pools to choose from.  They had free ice water with lemon but we were on vacation and wanted some booze.  The prices were NOT cheap but the amount of booze made it worth every penny.  The drink I loved was something with monkey in the title.  Basically a lot of booze, ice cream, banana, and coconut.  
What really sealed my deal with the hotel was the exceptional customer service.  After our night at the pool, we were ready for a night out.  We had passes the Bank, the club in the Bellagio.  We were told to present them at the front of the line and we get in ahead of everyone and get comp. booze.  When we got to the entrance, there was no organization.  No line, just a mob of people.  I asked someone who worked at the club what we do and he was so rude and quick to brush us off.  We decided to go to margaritaville and had a great time.  The next day we went to the concierge after a day at bootleg canyon.  We explained the situation and, let me tell you, they jumped on that like flies on ......  It was explained that they don't OWN the club but also made it clear that they were, in no way, trying to distance themselves from the issue.  They said something like "We have a give and take with the club.  They rent from us and we will promote the club.  However, if they don't treat our guests with respect, we don't have to give them the business."  Well put!  They went out of their way to make sure we had a good night.  Even before I got back to the room, they had called to let us know what was going to happen that night.  They had contacted Pure nightclub (we had indicated that was where were going that night) and provided us with the number of manager and told us where to go to make sure we were taken care of.  That meant no cover and free booze all night long.  Now that is service!  Top it off, an unexpected visit from room service at 9pm with chocolate covered strawberries in a bowl made of white chocolate.  Amazing touch.
I know this review has gotten a little long and I am trying to not go into every detail of my trip.  I just want to try to put into words how much we enjoyed our stay at the bellagio.  The stores, the restaurants the pool, the flowers, everything.  This hotel made the trip as amazing as it was.

This place is like the Sirens that trapped Odysseus in the Odyssey.  Tempted by its beauty, I partake in its craps tables on multiple trips, and knowing that I shouldn't go but still enchanted to do so, I proceed to get bent over and figuratively have my wallet taken. 5 stars for the beauty of the place, -2 for all the times I've been robbed there.

The Bellagio ushered in a new era of elegance and decadence for the Las Vegas Strip.  Prior to its opening, the newer casinos were going down the whole family friendly lane, and then the Bellagio came with it's wholly adult, sophisticated feel.  

The botanical gardens alone are worth the trip.  They change monthly and have never failed to impress.  You can sometimes smell them before you see them.

The gallery of fine art was another first of its kind - the first time great works of art were brought to a predominant Vegas resort and it still remains one of the few truly artistic attractions on the Strip.

The bars and lounges are all great, but for a real treat as a tourist or for an out of town guest - have a drink on the balcony of the Fontana Lounge at night while the fountains go off.  That's pretty spectacular.

Let me preface by mentioning that I stayed 13 stays for 34 nights at the Cosmo in 2015 and decided to make the switch to Bellagio for 2016 and beyond in late 2015 for a few reasons. Amex FHR benefit, Hyatt Diamond Status, and MLife Platinum status, among others. 

We arrived at the Bellagio and stood in the VIP check-in line for Mlife Platinum members and were eventually waited to a regular attendant because of the absurdly long wait in the VIP check-in line.  I explained we'd like to upgrade to a room with a view (I mentioned I was Hyatt Diamond and was told that "that didn't matter here") of the fountain and the attendant tried to sell me a Penthouse Suite only. I explained I just want the "Deluxe Fountain View" room and that I would pay the difference if needed.  The attendant said no rooms other than the Penthouse Suite were available for our stay with a view of the fountain and they were completely sold out. I looked online and saw that on Mlife.com, Bellagio.com, AmericanExpressFHR.com, Hotwire.com and others this room type was available for me to book right there on the spot. The attendant said those were all incorrect (which I cannot believe) and that room type wasn't available and that "next time I should book the right room" when I asked him to clarify he said "A room with a view I mean".  We ultimately stayed in a room facing the convention center roof. Every room I have ever stayed in at the Cosmo has had a better view than this room we were put in.  The most disappointing thing is that there were rooms available for our quick one-night stay that could have sufficed for our needs. 

Additionally, I booked the room through American Express Platinum Travel and on the booking at says a couple things.  First it says I would receive a $100 room credit. Every time I have ever used this at any Amex FHR property it has been a room credit. I made a reservation at Olives a week in advance for dinner knowing the entire town would be packed. When I checked in I was informed the $100 credit was only good at like 5 restaurants.  This created a huge issue in terms of planning our evening. Also, for breakfast I have been able to use Breakfast as room service... With Bellagio it was $30 only at a few places. We went to the Bellagio Cafe which was buffet food plated basically... Terrible food and very expensive.  The Amex FHR benefit is a total waste for this the Bellagio.

Again, I reported to management and they didn't care.  

Upon check out I explained the entire check-in and dining issue to the attendant and manager and neither cared at all. I would have expected the manager to comp us at least the resort fee or something. I explained I stayed 13 stays for 34 nights in 2015 at the Cosmo and was using this stay as a trial to see if I wanted to make the switch. Needless to say, he didn't care.

I can say the room was spotless and the grounds are of course beautiful. My wife didn't believe Bellagio was a AAA Five Diamond resort given how much better some other resort properties we have stayed at were though.

I imagine that if Bellagio contacts me I might get an "I'm sorry" or "We don't have control over the American Express FHR relationship" or "We aren't a Hyatt property so of course you don't get Diamond benefits..." 

I hope to be wrong though.

Bellagio is a beautiful and classy resort. The gardens, which change seasonally, are always breathtaking and a great spot to take some pictures. Room service food is better than Venetian and Wynn. I don't like that most of the blackjack tables here are automatically shuffled. I also don't care for the $25 resort fee, which is a rip off. It's suppose to include Wifi access, which is horrible, and use of the fitness gym. Who really works out when they are on vacation?

By far the shittiest casino in Vegas! 700 bucks for 2 nights...could not turn air below 65 in room, what a joke. Everything in here is way overpriced compared to everywhere else. Room service food was awful. Smoking on the steps by pool and apparently sitting under there dumbass rope is highly illegal since pool closes at 6. Really, 700 bucks a night and I have to stand to smoke! Took an hour to check in, I mean what's the holdup, sign here and here's your room key. Overall awful!!! Will never even step a foot in this shithole for rest of life!

I'm starting Vegas Week, reviewing all my Vegas hotels I've been to in the last year.

Let me start off with Bellagio is fine as they come, beautiful entrance, beautful fountains, beautiful valet service. 

You walk in, you SMELL....
Flowers Galore, Beautiful Glass Sculptures, beautiful orchids, etc... every season the terrarium on the inside changes for the season. 

It's all white marble, they have great gift shops, as well as the WORLDS LARGEST CHOCOLATE FOUNTAIN! Willy Wonka would be proud of Bellagio.

The Casino is awesome, Bellagio is ALWAYS Packed, 24\/7 it's super busy. Really a tourist attraction, staying here can get frustrating!! 

We saw "O" get the Handicap seats if possible AMAZING, Chairs Move, easy access to bathroom, if your drinking!!! 

The Casino is awesome, very big, more flowers, and anything you'd expect for a 5 star Hotel Casino. The restaurants are amazing as well, very good. I would go on, but instead I will just post photos of my Bellagio adventures.

The hotel is undoubtedly beautiful. However, all the beautiful places can be accessed without being a guest. We had booked one of the suites facing the fountain (don'y remember the name) at the price of $200 The room wasn't as beautiful as it appeared in the website. it definitely is a beautiful hotel but its casino, restaurant and the garden, like all other hotels at Vegas are open to the non-guests. The only plus point was the fountain that we could see from our room. But we couldn't hear the music from our room :(. Also, since there is so much to see outside one's hotel rooms at Vegas that we did not spend a lot of time watching the fountain from the room. The staff did leave a tiny bouquet with a hand written note (we appreciate that) by the assistant manager (or somebody important) in our room with some chocolates on our anniversary day.

The refrigerator in the room was stuffed with goodies...but you had to pay for them.Don't even think of removing anything from the refrigerator, they have sensors that bill you if you remove anything from it. When my husband went to confirm about the refrigerator that was supposed to be in the room (included in the room cost), he was told that one without the goodies could be provided at an extra charge of $50 per day. 

Overall, the stay was good but not worth the money spent. Save your money for some thing better.
I had the most amazing time in Vegas. Stayed at the beautiful Ballagio for Valentine's 2015. Just and awesome time.

I am an MLife gold card holder and got an amazing rate at the Bellagio for my 4 girlfriends and I for a 4 night stay (we went to Vegas to see lady Gaga). The rate was crazy cheap, but I earned it due to my love of slots and freebies (I have a card for everything!)

Checkin at VIP was second to none.  No having to wait in line like a herd of cattle- it was refined, classy, and welcoming.  A glass of wine and a chocolate dipped strawberry along with a beautiful front desk agent and handsome bellman awaited our arrival.  I was disappointed that my touted "comp upgrade to a fountain view room" was not available (well, not for 2 rooms close by each other), so we settled for "sunset view" rooms near each other.  (Would be nice if they blocked off our rooms beforehand!)

Skip to day two and three and four.....housekeeping was fantastic (we tipped well each day though), rooms nice and clean, restaurants great, staff friendly.........except the one night when I went to the VIP desk myself and it was closed and I encountered the outright rude "mole lady".  (I call her mole lady because I was so appalled by her attitude (spathe story is coming!) I didn't notice her name, but rather her large mole over her lip).  I'm not making fun of facial features, that's not the point, my point is her treatment of people.....

Let me begin by letting you know that I was in the hospitality business for 10 years- worked my way up front a front desk agent in a tiny hotel to an Assistant General Manager of three large properties in one on the worlds' most famous ski resorts.  I know hotels.  I know good service, and I know outright shifty service. Miss Mole noticed I was trying to get in to the VIP area and told me it was closed.  I told her my key was acting up (probably from being next to my credit cards).  Now, Vegas has its share of female companions, if you catch my drift, and she gave me the third degree about my room key as if I was a hooker! I presented my ID, my name, my address,my friends' room number and she still treated me like an unwanted guest.  I was not dressed provocatively at all (a blouse, jeans, and boots, something I'd wear to work on jean Fridays!) so I didn't look like a hooker but she treated me like one.  I was so upset.  I know they have security protocol, I appreciate that, but they way she treated me was appalling.  I did inform the VIP desk the next day and they apologized and said they'd talk to the manager.  

Even though that happened to me, the stay was great.  What a gorgeous hotel.  You will not disappointed (just stay away from the mole lady!). And get an MLife card-it's worth it!

We stayed here in 2009 for our honeymoon. Our room was a lagoon view suite and it was a real treat. 

I've been back to Vegas and stayed many other places, but I have to say Bellagio is my favorite hotel\/casino. I love the ambiance an color of the casino floor. The restaurants are excellent (Circo, Prime are my favorites) and it just feels timelessly classic. I know Wynn and Encore are newer and now there's the Cosmopolitan and others, but I think Bellagio will stand the test of time.

Had a really great stay here and after seeing other supposed high end hotels on the strip, I'm glad I stayed here. I'll mention the amenities and restaurants here that I used. First I had booked a room that faced away from the fountains because you're never in your room anyway, and when you are, you just want to relax and sleep and not listen to lots of noise outside. The standard king room was very comfortable, quiet, and restful. Nice large bathroom with two sinks, glass shower and jacuzzi tub.  I asked for a lower floor so I could be first on and off the elevators. The pool area gets pretty busy by 11am but still possible to find a spot after that. I wouldn't say that the pools had a real party atmosphere to them, but more relaxed. The gym was very big and had a lot of free weights, machines, and cardio. I ate breakfast twice at the Jean Phillipe bakery and I highly recommend the Forest crepe. I also ate dinner at Fix which was good but expensive. All the food and drinks are overpriced but that is too be expected. All the staff I spoke with were professional and polite. I would definitely stay here again.

Simply overpriced.
Bad food, stagnant atmosphere.
Why am I still here?

I'm admittedly a bit of a hotel snob. When it's a five star hotel, there are certain amenities that you get used to or expect, and while Bellagio certainly isn't the worst hotel I've stayed in, it's not the best. 

Check-in was a bit of a wait, standing behind hordes of tourists, but the staff were pleasant enough. The foyer, with its grand Dale Chihuly installation, is admittedly rather lovely.

Our room was nice- spacious, clean, and well-equipped. Our view was of the pool and spa area, and on the 20th floor- we didn't hear a peep from any of our neighbours, which I appreciate. The bathroom, while spacious, had a shower that didn't drain well, and the shower head was small and needed a proper cleaning. I realise this is the most 'first world problem' thing I've probably ever said on Yelp, but the towels were incredibly rough and scratchy. The bed was large and a bit firm, but very comfortable.

The pool area was nice, but the temperature of the pool was borderline freezing- my companion didn't want to get in- I swam one lap in the large pool and got out shivering. I'm not certain if the pool is heated, but if it is, they need to heat it a bit more. Drinks by the pool, as expected were somewhat overpriced ($40+ for a Hendricks gin and tonic and a double rum and coke), but that's Vegas for you.

All in all, our stay was pleasant, but not enough for me to insist on staying again. Next time I'll probably check out Aria or the Mandarin Oriental for a bit more of an upscale  experience.

Our first time here and it was a good experience.  Rooms were clean and well maintained.  We had a fountain view but I don't think it's worth the extra price as you are up and down the strip all day all night anyways.   Pretty central location and easy to get around.  Room service is awesome especially if you are tired out and just want to kick back.

I am a big fan of The Bellagio and usually stay there a few times per year. About 5 years ago, I would have given this property 5 stars, but I think that they waited a little too long on their remodel.  They finally have most of the rooms updated (e.g. Large TVs, automated curtains,etc.). I just wish that they had come up with a more creative update than copying The Aria's room design.). That being said, it is still a very nice hotel with lots of things to see and do on site.

Here are some suggestions for making the most out of your stay:

If you buy a soda at Palio, Snacks, Jean Phillipe or Gelato-- save your cup. They usually don't mention it these days, but refills are free any time with a plastic Bellagio cup. 

If you don't have a Players Card, GET ONE.  Even if you are gambling a small amount you still will qualify for at least some "express comps" and often there are sign up bonuses for new players.   Even mid level players often receive offers for free or discounted rooms. 

If you want to go clubbing, call their concierge and ask them to put you on the VIP list for almost any club in town. It should save you on admission price and wait time--especially if you are going to a club at any of the MGM properties. 

Use the free tram at Bellagio to check out Aria and Crystals shopping center.  You also could ride it to Monte Carlo and check out the free Blue Man Group parade-- apparently they march through the casino right before their show. 

If you want to see O or a show at any MGM property, talk to the Players Club.  If you play at all, the players club can help you reserve a seat in the VIP block for the show. The casino usually blocks certain seats in the first dozen or so rows for players.  If you don't have enough for a comp, then you pay full ticket price but you still get the best seats available. (We sat behind George Lucas and next to Channing Tatum at the Michael Jackson Cirque du Soleil show thanks to the players club at Bellagio!)

I've been staying at Bellagio for over 10yrs during my trip to Vegas for the MAGIC trade show and it gets disappointing each time. I usually stay at a suite but this trip we had an offer for a free accomdation from the hotel.
The room is bit small and crowded but what can I say ?? It was a free room... Lets talk about the bathroom.. I can hear everything that's going on in the bathroom from the bed.. Yeah.. the embarrassing noises... I mean I could hear my hubby taking #2. 
Well not only that but the house keeping is terrible. There was no shampoo, only1 bar soap, no tooth brush. I had to call the housekeeping and ask for it.  After a shower, I wiped the water on the floor with tissue and the tissue turned black. I mean don't they mop the floor at all?? So nasty!!!!! I told myself I am not walking around bare feet in this room!! 
 I looked down at the main room counter, you know where they place all the snacks and goodies on the right side... No surprise... The snack stand was piled up with dust!! It probably has been seating there for a while.
It looks like none of the snacks has been restocked for a quite sometime.
I attach the picture so I hope you can see it with your own eyes because sometimes the review can be over exaggerating so i am supporting my word with a proof. It's my first day staying and I am having a terrible experience!! Definitely Not staying here for my future trips!! NEVER!!!

You really can't go wrong with a fountain view room. The only reason I wanted to stay here was because of Ocean's Eleven. No shame. 

Nonetheless, if you opt for a standard room, then take the extra money and go to the Mirage or even the Venetian...you'll probably get the same view of the freeway or some back alley parking garage.
The Maid stole my chips which I left on my wayroom desk. Astonishing，shocked me！ God will punish him or her！

Stayed here over Christmas for the first time and while we enjoyed our stay we would probably rethink coming to this casino again over the holidays. It was just waaay too busy. D:

Pros:
-Central location
-Updated rooms
-Casino wasn't too smoky
-Pools are open all year round unlike many other Strip hotels because they have...
-Heated pools!
-Jean Philippe Patisserie right off the lobby (get the Nutella Brioche!!!)
-Always beautifully decorated Conservatory (but go early morning or late night to avoid the crowds)
-Lots of great shopping (if you happen to win the Megabucks lol)
-Check in was fast. (I have VIP check in but the regular lines weren't that long either.) Check out was easy too whether you're VIP or not as you can do it thru TV and see your charges on it as well. (We had to call the front desk to do it as we had a late check out and it wouldn't allow us to do it thru TV. But it was still super easy and quick to do it that way.)

Cons:
-Our room wasn't cleaned well. Fingerprints on windows, peanuts behind curtains, a whole chocolate chip cookie under nightstand. Wow. (But the housekeeping staff was always friendly.)
-Way too crowded over the holidays as the Conservatory is such a popular tourist attraction. Elevators for garage were often backed up.
-Driving into the casino off Las Vegas Blvd was challenging because so many cars would just stop to watch the fountain show when it was going on blocking traffic. We're still on a road, people! We have places to go...money to lose! Haha
-No real line for checking in. You just stand behind other guests waiting to get helped at each individual window but if that person is taking a long time, the person next to you who might have come after could be helped first if their window is faster. Not really fair but it wasn't too bad as lines weren't very long anyway. 

So all in all, we really liked Bellagio and would stay again but during busy holidays, we would probably stay at Aria instead as it's just a lot less busy there.

Bellagio is a new Vegas classic, and I love it. Everything about the Bellagio feels right to me. When I go there, I feel right at home. Maybe because it is the first Vegas casino I ever stepped foot into, or maybe it is its signature scent. Whatever it is, I am always happy when I am here.

I am in love with the conservatory, and I can still be sucked into a good fountain show. I always drag visitors to see the chocolate fountain, and O is my favorite Cirque show without question. If there were some disaster and I had to be trapped here, I would have no complaints. I would eat crepes, drink smoothies, and occasionally splurge for a meal at Sensi. Then, I would retire to my room. 

I have few complaints about the rooms. Everything is always fresh, and the curtains are motorized. Granted, the TV is a little low tech, and there is no TV in the bathroom. But, those are minor details.

Throw in the great location, and I think that Bellagio without a doubt offers a complete package.

Horrible disappointment.  Originally had booked a reservation with my Hilton timeshare, but work wanted to put me up in Bellagio.  The service here is the WORST!  Took over 5 hours to get my room.  Only 1 person issuing keys...and she went on break.  When I asked the person who was sitting next to her, doing NOTHING, she said that only that 1 girl knows how to work the key machine.  Unbelievable!!  I wished I would have just stayed at my timeshare.  This casino is overrated and overpriced.  Never again.

Beautiful Bellagio!!!

The room we stayed in was spacious and very, very clean. The furnishings had a modern touch. Bellagio staff were ALL professional, wonderful and friendly. The valet staff were fast and efficient. You can even call from your room to get your car ready. 

Everytime I call the front desk, housekeeping, concierge and valet. Whoever receives my call always acknowledge my name..."Good morning, Ms._____, how can I help you?" They always made sure they are polite when they answer my call. AWESOME! FABULOUS! AWESOME!

I do agree with the other Yelpers about the housekeeping staff. They do a very good job ALL THE TIME. They clean our room twice a day and they always do a fabulous job! The bedsheets and pillows were so comfortable to sleep on.  I made sure to leave the housekeeper a tip everyday.

One night I wanted to use the bath tub but there were no bubble bath soap around so I called the houseekeeping office and I spoke to a lady staff, she told me that she'll send me some bath salt. After 10 minutes, a housekeeping staff brought me a little bag of toiletries, including bath salts for my bath. AWESOME!

Bellagio fountains were amazing to watch. I don't get tired watching it everynight.

Cirque de Soleil "O" was a must see show!

Checking in and out was very easy, they have a huge front desk to easily accomodate everyone. You can even check out from your room via the TV. But I chose to check out in the front desk because I wanted to have a receipt.

Slippers were also complimentary!  Yehey!!!

Bellagio is definitely one of the most beautiful hotel I had stayed in the Las Vegas strip!

Bravo Bellagio!

I really like the Bellagio.  I loved our room and the fluffy robes and comfy beds.  There is a plethora of places to shop, eat, lounge and of course, gamble.  It is also gorgeous with it's famous glass ceiling, gardens and fountains.  

What is great about these casinos is that even if you are not staying at the property, anyone can enjoy what they have to offer and the Bellagio is one of my favorite places to go even when I am not sleeping there.  My husband was a fan of their Poker room and it ended up being one of his favorite spots to spend 2 hours and $300.

Came here on business on the companies dime, I had great customer service and the room service was gnarly, pricey but gnarly. I enjoyed tanning at the pool and at the pool bar drinks were very reasonable, I guess if you get effed up they figure you will go inside and loose your shirt lol the bank lounge is pretty dope be dressed to impressed! There was many restaurants in the hotel to the point you didn't have to leave if you didn't want to. I didn't get to try those because I was there for 2 nights and had to split. Getting in and out was kind of slow but that's how it is at swanky hotels, I could tell it wasn't deliberate. People should some times look and listen and not blame the employees for moving slow and Blame the chuckle head patrons for holding up the line. I've seen people be an utter knob and want a bell hop to take 2 bags to their room mean while you have a couple with a shit load of bags having to wait because someone wants to feel superior. **scoffs** giving 4 out of 5 stars because I had static with dude checking me out. He claimed they don't hold bags after check out. I said they do in nyc, this audacious mofo said well go there and have them hold your bags. I wanted to rip his tongue out but a more experienced person took my bags, gave dude some reprimanding, and apologized. I got my bags held for free and a free ride to the airport compliments of the hotel for dude sassing me.

The Bellagio can be summed up in one word...Class.  My wife and I stayed at the Bellagio for a week and loved every minute of it.  Rooms were first class and the service was fantastic on every level.  

One small tip about staying here:  pay the few extra bucks to stay lakeside.  Its worth the money to have the view.

I'm anxious to try the Wynn, but I just can't get myself to leave the Bellagio.

- Bellagio from LAS: $16 ish bucks via Taxi.  

-Check-in : was kinda confusing. There are no formed line of any sorts. Just look for who ever is gonna be done and line up behind them. 

-Rooms:
Ask for a newly renovated room. I think the smaller non-lake view rooms have been updated. New rooms have big flat screen TVs, powered blinds, big soaking tubs, and turn down service. Don't touch the alcohol or snacks u will be charged. 

-Restaurants- theres a coffee joint a short walkaway from the elevator, a chocolate\/ ice cream shop, a steak house,  sports bar etc etc... you basically never have to leave if your rollin in cash. Unlike me there r  some cheap places across the street. 

- The free Internet kinda sucks. My iphone almost never got online.  

- The location is great. As of right meow it's in the middle of the strip. Ur gonna like that when walking up and down the street. 

- I'm not a smoker.  Not that there's any thing wrong with it. And while in Vegas i wasn't use the non-Californian smokers. It just makes me ill.

When I stayed at Wynn Las Vegas, that was my favorite hotel. Then I stayed at The Venetian, and that became my favorite hotel. Now that I've stayed at the Bellagio, this is definitely my favorite hotel in Vegas. 

Location - Perfect location. It's located right in the middle of the strip that it's so convenient when you have reservations and shows throughout the strip. 

Service - Excellent. Concierge. Front desk. Cafes. Shops. Restaurants. All excellent services.

Amenities - Wifi was decent speed. Not the fastest. Rooms are stocked with essentials, such as iron & board, blow dryer, refrigerator (snacks at additional cost), and shower essentials. Now the shampoo and body wash are of descent quality, but I think they can spend a little bit more. After all, this is the Bellagio. 

Atrium - Their décor changes throughout the seasons. They had the spectacular Chinese New Years décor during my recent visit with the elaborate figurines, flowers, lanterns, music, and everything was breathtaking. If my mama was there, she would have loved it and spent nights just mesmerizing over the designs and beauty. 

Casino - I haven't gambled in a long time, so I don't have insights. 

Awesome stay at the Bellagio!

I am so glad we stayed at the Bellagio!

Though expensive, it was worth every penny.  We even paid extra to secure a room facing the fountains (highly recommended).  Our room on the tenth floor was very spacious and elegant, with one of the comfiest hotel beds I've ever slept on.  And the bathroom?  Exquisite.  With a glass standup shower and a deep soaking tub, my husband and I felt like we were living in luxury.

Other furniture in the room included a large TV unit with built-in closets, a desk and chair, and two comfy arm chairs with a small table and lamp.
