Came down to the bellagio for dinner and some gambling. Even though someone was sweeping the floors when I walked in they were pretty dirty. I felt like the security guards were harassing and not in the slightest way friendly. I understand that I'm not the highest roller in the casino but I still feel like I deserve common respect. It seems like the security guards are just running wild on a power trip. Feel free to ask me for my ID but I expect the conversations to be peaceful. I'm not entirety sure why the security guards think there job is to be tough and mean to the guests and not just protect them. Either way I brought a couple grand with me down tonight for some fun on the tables and it looks like I will be finding a different casino to play at.

It has been a dream of mine to stay in such a beautiful place and I am glad I did for my first time in Las Vegas. I loved the grand entrance, with the sparkling horse and colorful  flowers on the ceiling.

The pool area was so majestic and I felt like a princess, it was so relaxing. I only ordered room service for breakfast and it was good--not the best, but not bad for the $30.00 @ the Bellagio. The room service delivery lady was nice and upbeat, definitely much needed after a crazy night out. The room was nice, but the closet was really small...

This would have been a 4 or 5 star review, except for an issue I had with the little shop (before the elevator near the conservatory). I bought an iPhone 6s charger because I had forgotten mine.It went for $26 and you could tell it wasn't the best quality, but it did the trick. The next day, it stopped working. I know the receipt said, no exchanges or refunds on electronics, but I figured they'd make an exception--since it was clearly a product defect. I went back twice and the ladies said no! I even went to the concierge and asked, they said they knew it was the USB port. Yet, nothing happened. No refund or even a loaner charger. Come on Bellagio...I was really feeling this place.

Will I return? Eventually yes, it's a beautiful and classy place. But the search continues for my Utopia in Vegas!

This is just a review for the hotel room itself.   It was just okay for me.

Good points:
:: Bathroom ~ Love the large bathtub and the ambiance.  The bathtub was so relaxing
:: Closet space ~ Thank you for split closets on the sides of the television.  The split closets also had individualized spaces for shoes, so you could separate them without taking floor space.
:: Chocolate.  2 milk chocolates are left whenever they clean the room.
:: Late check out.  Thank you for allowing us 1.5 hours to relax before our flight.  Nice!

Bad points:
:: Full length mirrors.  Really?  The only full length mirrors are inside the closets that DON'T swing open all the way?  The angle of the two rooms I stayed in were facing away or towards the sun.  Not good Bellagio.  Back light or direct lighting is no good when getting ready.
:: Lighting.  Very sexy and relaxing during the evening.  But if you're getting ready for nighttime clubbing or dinner, then it's not so good.  It would be nice if there was a brightness gauge.  
:: Chocolate.  Boo.  The 2nd room we checked into did not have chocolates.  You forgot =(
:: Shampoo and conditioner.  Could it get any cheaper?  I did bring my own, but thought I would use it one night.  My hair has never felt drier or with the least amount of body before.  Could Bellagio not get a deal with a better company?  =(

The hotel itself is pretty awesome.  Beautiful Christmas decoration set ups, the night life is fun ~ hung out at the Fountain Bar with a live band, ate okay food at the Bellagio Cafe, and okay food at the Snack bar.  

So good to visit, not the best to stay.  I expected more with the prices.

I have yet to stay in this hotel, but I'd imagine the accomodations would be in line with the common area. I love walking through this place. Having a cocktail at the piano bar, or shopping the retail area. The staff does a very good job at keeping the common areas clean.

This place is great! The only reason why I'm giving the 4 stars instead of 5 is because Mason, the bellmen, decided to steal the $40 I paid for the dry cleaning and charge it to my room. When I order the dry cleaning they told me I had to pay cash or drop a card at the front desk. I knew something was up when he arrived 30 minutes late with no receipt. How low! Is $40 worth it Mason?? 

Everything else was great. Katya checked us in early and was really nice & professional. The room was awesome! I would stay there again. Hopefully Mason, the cash pocketing bellmen will not be working.

We always have a great stay here, although the glamor may have faded after 15 years and it may have lost some of it's pezazz now that the Aria and Cosmopolitan have opened up next to it the past couple of years. We still find the Bellagio sophisticated and warm at the same time. The restaurants in the Ballagio are hit and miss I will have to say. But the staff is pure class.

No, it's not worth it! Bellagio overcharged me and their accounting department never got back to me (I asked them for an itemized receipt 2 weeks ago). When I called them, I was (twice!) put on this music-less "dead" hold for 30-40 minutes. They're so full of themselves, they don't provide good customer service. Their wi-fi needed fixing when I stayed there. And by the way, the woman at the buffet was super rude to me. Finally, the famous waterworks never happened while I was standing outside in the cold waiting (though i asked the staff and they said they're up and running). No, don't waste your money! I won't and won't let my family and friends do that either.

Bellagio!

I'm a frequent Vegas visitor because not just for some gambling fun, but I love the city itself for being such a fake tourist destination!  What that means is that if I wanted to see the world, all I have to do is drive 4 hours from LA-LV and I'll get to see all there is to offer.  From Tuscany to Paris, New York to Bali, Dingy to Magnificent, you name it, they got it.  It's such an awesome town not to mention the buffet situation that they got there!  No wonder why I love this city so much!

Bellagio!

It's a beautiful name and the hotel itself is magnificent as well.  I still remember back in the days when it was completed and how awesome it was with the fountain show and the look of the building, but now, it still retains that allure of beautiful "Fake" Tuscany view" that they offer.  It never gets old.

The hotel is definitely an upscale location with the focus on classy and rich clienteles, however, their service I gotta say is absolutely fabulous because they treat everyone the same!  (at least from what I saw and what I've experienced)

From checking in we were treated great and was upgraded to a lake view room without additional charge!  Service was fast and friendly and in no time we were in our rooms.  The rooms were decent size, has a slight run down look because it has been here for some time now without much of a renovation job, but still it's in great shape and super clean as usual.  The hallway had the perfect lighting and it just simply felt very nice walking down the aisle to your room.  (I'm not rich guy but this place sure makes you feel like one with very minimal effort!)  One small gripe about this place is that they still don't have LCD TVs....  What's up with that?  But that's ok.... room is still awesome and the view was gorgeous!

Speaking of the view.. we were able to enjoy all the water shows (every 15 minutes!) from the comfort of our room with stereo soundtrack of the water dance.... (well!  look those sad people down there.. in the heat, squeezing each other to death in 105+ weather just to see a water show... I'm in my room with the temperature at 69 enjoying a nice glass of whiskey on ice....sounded so snobby doesn't it?....  But man it feels very nice there!)

Now the casino itself is no joke either.... terrific decoration all around and gaming tables starting from the lowest at $15 for BJs, $10 for WAR, 25 for Pai Gow, $10 for crabs, $10 for roulette, etc... so better have a budget ready if you know what I mean?  But since it caters to a high end clientele, you will see lots of $100+ bets all over the place....  (If only I have that kind of money to burn.....that would be nice.....)

Went over to the pool since it was about 104 the day we spent there... very lovely roman style pool with 6 different pools spawned around the pool area.... 2 larger than full size swimming pools, 3 fountain included pools just for chillin' and R&R, and one small hot tub section as the mingle station!  LOL!  All were really nicely decorated, terrific service, and awesome views all around!

Despite we stayed there we did very little gambling because of the high cost.  However, we did enjoy everything else the hotel had to offer such as the pool, restaurant, bars, conservatory, chocolate fountain, etc..  (hopefully I'll have the time to include each of these that I've mentioned)  But one of the most important things to remember about Bellagio is the following.

Service?  Service..........yes........ we're talkin' about service.........

I've been to Palazzo not too long ago.... super high end hotel but service was slow as snail and wasn't attentive at all.  Bellagio service is no joke.  Everyone from the bellboy to valet to janitor, to reservation clerk to housekeeping to mechanics and to some dude that just work for the hotel was extremely accommodating.  Opening the doors, greeting customers, and housekeeping doing their best to make sure the guest having the best experience possible is completely transparent and on full display.  They will always go out of their way to make sure you feel like a king here!  Just ask the housekeeping ladies for one of the most delicious chocolates from Bellagio and they will make sure you get enough of them while you are staying with them!  They are just so nice all around and all you guys know how much I love a terrific service!  So a good tip was left for every single place we visited while we were in the hotel!

One final tip!  For me, I'm not rich enough to stay in Bellagio on a consistent basis, but a good way like we did is to pool the money by having some friends to go along and everyone split the cost!  This way you can save cost while enjoying one of the best hotels available out there in the world. 

So next time you are in Vegas and have a little bit of money to spend, save yourself a few hands from the blackjack table and give Bellagio a stay!  I'm sure you will love it!

I enjoyed the Bellagio. Best of all was its location on the Vegas strip.  The hotel is quite large with great rooms that have great views.  As a smoker, the hotel that offers smoking rooms that are beautiful is a definite plus.

IMO, the pool area is the best part of this hotel.  It's open from 9a to 4p and offer full waiter service to get your drink on.  Great towels and beautiful pool area makes it enjoyable for both families and adults.

Here's a tip!!! If you plan to come here for New Years... they close the streets at 4 o'clock.. there's no way in to the hotel.. so if you come late your ass will be walking. Again They block all the streets from the freeways and the side street.  Trust me I walked!!

I have to say the Bellagio's location and facilities are great, clean and pleasing to the eye. I will say though that the customer service is lacking especially in the concierge arena. 

My cousin lost his ID at "The Bank" (club inside Bellagio). The next morning, we called up the security lost & found who collects everything left behind at The Bank the night before. They said they couldn't help and would need 24 to 48 hours to process everything. I said, well he has a flight soon, so can we just come to the Lost and Found and sift through it. They said no. Nothing can be released for at least 24 hours.

First off that is a ridiculous rule especially when it comes to Identification purposes. What are you going to do in Las Vegas without an ID showing that you're 21 years of age? As a result we then called the concierge. Evelyn answered the call. I let her know the situation. She said she couldn't help and that we should file a police report and to use that paperwork to get onto the flight at the airport. I said, wouldn't it be easier if you just walked 50 feet to the L&F and sifted for my cousin's ID instead. Just look for a Michigan license. And she said she couldn't and wouldn't do that. Horrid service. 

Bottom Line, eventually my cousin did find someone at the front desk to go the extra mile, but that was literally 5 hours after starting the process. I don't believe this would have happened 5 years ago. Service is deteriorating at the Bellagio. Evelyn and the other 4 people we spoke to, really need to be re-trained. I don't understand how a 10 minute fix turned into a 5 hour debacle.

There are so many nice hotels in Vegas now, I won't be giving them my business again.

Wretched service by Evelyn in the Concierge Dept.

This was my second stay with Bellagio. The service is great, the facility beautiful and the location perfect. They need to add new songs to the fountain show... The classics are nice, but it gets old. 

They also need more $10 min bet tables on a holiday weekend. We left the area twice for this reason.

But every time we came back, we were thankful to be staying at the classiest establishment on the strip.

Ate lunch here every single day we were in vegas...it's nice and breezy, by the pool but covered, so a nice reprieve from the sun. It's expensive, but it's the Bellagio so not exactly surprising.

The olive egg salad sandwich is awesome, so is their Jalapeno Hot Dog. Charge it all to the room and just make sure you've had a drink or two before you check out.

Okay, I walked through  and was quickly , most friendly greeted by the craps table dealers. They taught me , I won $93.00 dollars and cashed out.
The air is great in in this place, people smoke but it isn't bad in casino area

We booked a VIP suite but did not get VIP treatment at all. Tattered blanket, clogged drain. I needed to argue with VIP manager (she wrote her name is seifert but not sure as she was not wearing a name badge) for me get the right to be on VIP line to get to the buffet. She said VIP privileges are suspended during the holidays. I booked that VIP room mainly for VIP privileges Ma'am, as written  on your hotel's website. Should they insisted and renegaded on that, that should be considered False Advertisement. I think this manager failed in many areas, starting with arguing with customer rather than solving the problem immediately, not wearing name badge, not making the situation as a chance to win my business back by just listening and asking if there is anything else she can do to make my family's stay more enjoyable. The highly advertised VIP lounge is no more than coffee, sofa, apples, a few pastries, soda, water, bottled juice. Room dated, being an older hotel probably explains the plumbing problem. If I will go back to vegas, I will probably seek out the newest Hotel and book a regular room..
one of the best.  The light display at Christmas is wonderful.  Classy hotel, great food and wonderful light show.  Stay here if you get a chance.

This is perhaps the nicest  and classiest Hotel Casino in Vegas. We did not stay there however we did spend over an hour admiring the Garden and gambling. We were parked on 2B around 11:00AM on Friday Oct the 7th, our day of departure.  **WARNING TO EVERYONE**:We were told by LV Police after the fact that thieves are targeting Rental Cars ( easy to identify by their sticker). Our luggage   was lifted from the trunk either at Bellagio or Treasure Island which was our next stop around noon.

My experience at this hotel was a nice one. The rooms are nice. My only complaint is that I find that their air filtration system isn't as good as even the MGM grand as it was probably one of the smokiest hotels I encountered.  Smoking is one of the number one issues for those of us with health issues. I still want to enjoy myself without having to deal with bad air. 

Apart from that the cirque show was amazing.  It almost brought me to tears. If I wasn't sick I would have enjoyed it more as it was a little too warm and stuffy in there but over all it was my favorite part of my Vegas experience.  

The Prime steakhouse is also worth checking out if you want a good meal. I loved my steak. 

I took 2 stars off for the smoky casino and hotel.  I'd say the stench of cigars had to be the worst. I coughed a lot while trying to get outside to fresh air.

We stayed here the weekend of August 15th and we had a great experience. It is a beautiful hotel and the service is beyond excellent. The rooms were modern and the bed was very comfortable. Our room only had one bath robe so we called the front desk for another one and they actually brought us two more within like five minutes that were the same robes they use in the spa and they were heavenly! Much better than the regular ones in the room when you get there. But this hotel is crowded all the time! There are so many people walking through that you are very slowed down when you're trying to leave. None of the other hotels we visited over the weekend were as crowded as the Bellagio. Also, our visit to the pool was very disappointing. There were no lounge chairs available and getting a drink took a very long time. But overall we were very pleased with our stay here.

I really hate when companies sacrifice customer satisfaction for "green" environmental hipsters. 

Here are my complaints:

1. My room was super hot and uncomfortable because the staff turned off the air condition! It had just driven an entire day in the desert heat, lugged my bags to the room and I am greeted by no AC because they are trying to be green. Ugh, this is VEGAS, its not suppose to be green. By the way, turning the AC on pull blast did not cool down the room for like 6 hours. 

2. They will not change the bed sheets unless I read this stupid little card about how making them change the sheets is going to destroy the environment and place it on my bed. This is gross in my opinion. The housekeeping staff need to change the sheets for good house keeping unless you ask them not to.( not the other way around)  

3. The mini bar would charge you if there was any weight difference places on it. Lets say you throw a toy football and it hits this minibar, they will assume you took something. It also took up valuable real estate in your small room. 

4. Old fashion TV really dated the room. Very small.

Ok, here are the positives. 

1. Best free show in vegas, the water show in front. 
2. Best dessert in vegas, the " Intense chocolate dessert in their candy shop" 
3. Beautiful decorated hotel, conservatory, butterfly garden, landscaping on the indoor garden. 

4.The people staying at this hotel are not your jersey shore types or drunk frat boy.
5. Great location to access the Vegas strip and other hotels around, city center,etc.. 


I would recommend this hotel TURN ON THE AC in the guest room so they won't arrive to a sauna from their trip and revamp the rooms with something a lot nicer. Look at the trump, look at the encore, these are nice hotel rooms, the bellago hotel room average but not what you expect from a 5 star hotel. 

Whatever they decide to do, keep the AC on in the guest room please!

If you're going to stay here, get a room with a fountain view, it is totally worth it! The TV has a channel synced with the fountain music so you get to experience the show...every 15 minutes
The hotel is definitely getting outdated and I think they are able to maintain their prices due to their older clientele-this is where my grandparents would go. 
It is a nice place to visit as in go walk through the conservatory and see the fountains, they are a beautiful part of Las Vegas but I don't recommend staying here. For the same price (or slightly cheaper) you can enjoy better accommodations at The Cosmopolitan next door or The Palazzo down the street.

This is a live review of the check-in process.  In the check-in line at 3:32pm, on a Sunday in June.  The line is deep, 4 roped lines deep.  Rather ridiculous.  At Aria, owned by the exact same company, they have electronic\/digital check-in.  I'm talking fast, fast, fast (nod to Mr. Wolf of Pulp Fiction).  So, what's the problem, Bellagio?  And you have to pay to park at MGM hotels, including this one (starting 6-6-2016).  I believe in "voting" with the dollars I spend, so already I know I will not stay here again.  There are too many other choices.  Ok...Finally made it to the front of the line at 4:00pm sharp.

Hmm...I'm surprised by all the five star reviews. I feel like people are reviewing the buffet and not the actual hotel and its amenities. 

Environment:
Amazing from the outside. It's known for the huge fountain and its nightly shows with music and coordinated water works. The lobby has a grand entrance with a beautifully decorated ceiling and the garden past the lobby lines. The Bellagio is beautiful and gets five stars on the decoration and interior. 
- As a guest, I had to check in at the front, walk all the way through the casino (of course) and then to the guest elevators. The guest elevators are right next to the buffet which means traffic jam! Conveniently, there is a lobby store across from the guest elevators that has everything from drinks to Bellagio robes for purchase. The guest elevators are also conveniently placed close to the back of the hotel and the pool. 
- The pools (are there four?) are spread out and so are patio chairs for lounging, but when I went there were only a few chairs available out of thousands and I went on a Thursday! I can't imagine how packed the pool area is on weekends. I wanted to get a drink but the cocktail waitress never came around so my bf went to the bar and spent $30 on two margaritas. Yikes. Anyway, if you use the pool, be sure to get comfy with those around you because it's a tight squeeze. 
- Cafe Gelato sells gelato obviously and the sorbetto is great too. 
- Cafe Bellagio is next to the garden and the food is decent (that's another review). The only thing I didn't care for was the location of the cafe. It's relatively far from the guest elevators; I guess the floor plan designers wanted guests to eat at the buffet more so than the cafe. Shrug. When I'm on vacation, there's nothing better than rolling out of bed and going to grab a quick breakfast at the hotel's cafe before hitting the pool - I just have to walk a bit further when staying at the Bellagio. 
- The room is nice; the bathroom is the best part with a tub as well as a shower. The shower head is a rainfall shower head which was nice. The bed was not soft and the pillows were hard as rocks! I guess not many people sleep in Vegas so beds were not a priority. 
- Gambling at the Bellagio - don't do it. I have never won, minimum bets are high, and you could probably make your money last longer at another casino (like Planet Hollywood across the street!)

Service:
I was disappointed in the service. The front desk was polite and friendly, but it was downhill from there. The lobby store cashier miscounted my change and then made me wait for her to open the drawer while she filled out paperwork for her manager. The cocktail waitress at the pool was nowhere to be found. The buffet staff was subpar (please refer to my review of the Bellagio buffet) and the cafe staff was dull (to be reviewed soon). Don't these people smile? WHY SO SERIOUSSSS?

I guess it's more fun "watching" than "staying" at Bellagio. 

Overall the hotel is nice but nothing special. Room is spacey (but again nothing special). Service is the real problem here. Long waiting line at check in & check out; staffs are very unfriendly (if not to say rude). The invoice came out all wrong (overcharged) and when calling them, we'd been placed on hold forever before finally talking to another very rude customer rep.

I do hope that i'm just a few unlucky ones, b\/c Bellagio is still a nice place to me. However after this incident, I think i'd rather stay at Venetian or Cosmopolitan.

i adore las vegas. call me crazy, but i can't get enough of that place.

the first time i visited vegas i stayed at the bellagio, and that experience is perhaps one of the reasons why i keep going back to sin city.

i love how big everything is! huge lobby, huge floral displays, huge! if you like things quaint, this is not the spot for you. actually, vegas really isn't the spot for you, either.

i had a spectacular experience at the spa. every detail was delightful and my masseuse was kind and very skilled. i wish i could have spent the day in there. too bad i had to catch a flight.

my favorite aspect of being a guest at the bellagio is getting a cafe au lait and a delectable pastry each morning from jean philippe patisserie. what a treat!

next time i'd love to try THEhotel, but i will certainly return to the bellagio someday.

Unfortunately, this has to be the first negative review I've written on Yelp.  I stayed there a few weeks ago on a family vacation.  It's a very beautiful hotel, but they didn't change the sheets between my visit and the last person so I have to ding them since it's such a basic expectation.  Especially when it's so expensive to stay there!  

When I went to bed on my first night there, I had the above-bed light on and when I pulled the covers off, there was a big black thread on the sheets.  No big deal, but as I went to brush that off of the bed, I then noticed that there were 3 short beard hairs, bits of what looked like earwax, and a few other black specks of unknown origin.  I probably wouldn't have seen those things if I hadn't had the above bed light on.  The housekeeping manager was apologetic and had the sheets changed, but it was still gross enough that I feel I need to warn people...

Maybe this was an out of the ordinary occurrence, but it made me wonder if other people just haven't noticed the condition of the sheets because they didn't happen to look.

Quick Tips:

1. The fountain shows are approximately 15 minutes apart and run even into the night.

2. You can find comps and room deals both on smartervegas.com and through the MyVegas facebook\/iphone app.

3. There are quite a few famous restaurants in Bellagio and among them in Sensi, check them out near the Bellagio garden exhibits.

4. Bellagio boasts the largest chocolate fountain in the world at their installment of Jean Phillipe Patisserie.

5. They are the last stop on a short tram between the Monte Carlo, Aria, Vdara, and Bellagio with an entrance a little past the gift shop area towards the conference room area.

Bellagio is an iconic hotel. Featured in so many TV shows to movies (remember Ocean's!?) and has been around for quite some time. The hotel is loved by many because of the beautiful fountains that go on a water show every few minutes to the fact that they are a 5 star luxury hotel.

The hotel campus boasts some of the best views on the strip. They are located almost in the middle of the action across from the equally beautiful, but dated Paris Las Vegas and next to the Cosmopolitan and Aria. 

There are many things to do besides gambling when staying at the Bellagio. Their pool is rather famous for its collection of fun fountains to swim under to the more refined atmosphere of other pool goers. I also can't stop raving about their exhibits that they change up every few months. We are about to visit for Christmas and can't wait to see how they've transformed the Bellagio gardens area. 

Besides the gardens and the pool, Bellagio is sandwiched between two high end shopping areas. The Crystals shopping center is reachable by a short tram ride and the Bellagio is connected to its own series of shops.

One of the main attractions of Bellagio is heading to "O" the highly acclaimed cirque du soleil show. I've personally never been to the show due to its price, but it comes highly recommended from friends who have been wowed by the experience.

And, of course, I can't forget to mention their own wonderful places to have food. From Jean Phillipe Patisserie which boasts the largest chocolate fountain in the United States and the best cheap eats such as pressed chicken basil paninis, to the more upscale Sensi restaurant, these are all awesome places to check out. Their buffet needs a little updating, but it's still a good stop for those who want to try it.

Now, why after this pretty much gushing review does Bellagio only deserve 4 stars? Well, the rooms are still pretty dated and a little less advanced then the newer Aria Las Vegas. I think that the price point for the Bellagio is a bit too high. They probably estimate the value of their rooms based on the fact that it is one of the most iconic landmarks on the strip.

Still, I prefer the rooms over at the Aria. Good luck to those staying at this awesome place though, I hope you all have a wonderful time!

My first time staying at the Bellagio and now my last.

Took over 10 minutes to get the attention of a bell hop and over 30 minutes to get bags from the bell hop up to our room...would never happen at the Venetian.

Ice machine broke after not even filling one bucket with ice...would never happen at the Venetian.

They wanted to charge us $20\/day to have a refrigerator placed into our $1000\/night suite...would never happen at the Venetian.

They wanted to charge us $2.50 for every shot glass extra over 6 for our $1000\/night suite...would never happen at the Venetian.

They would only let us take 2 waters at a time out of the VIP lounge (which is tap water bottled in Ontario, California)...would never happen at the Venetian.

They refused to give us late checkout on a Sunday...would never happen at the Venetian.

MacCellan 18 is considered a comp...would never happen at the Venetian.

Never again!  Bellagio can keep relying on its fame to keep tourists coming, but I've had much better experiences at Venetian and even Wynn.  Service was poor for such a highly rated establishment.  I shared my preference for Venetian with one of the staff workers as I was leaving and she agreed with me that Venetian was awesome!  High rollers will enjoy Wynn better and younger crowd will enjoy Venetian better.  And to cap it off, I never, ever win when I'm at Bellagio :(

But 1 star for the steam shower.  I haven't seen that at Venetian or Wynn.  Very nice.

From the moment I tried booking a room to the time I left... the customer service alone had me regretting booking a room here in the first place. 
I called on a Friday to get a rate for Saturday night check in and check or on Sunday. I was quoted X amount by Deanna. I had to check my funds and asked when I call back can I  speak with you, Deanna has stated she made a note on my account (mlife). I called back five times and turns it Deanna had left foot the evening. I spoke with krissi and Esmeralda about the X amount I was quoted, they turn around and quote me a Y amount. 
I escalate this further to there manager, Ron. He was very rude, talked down to me, and unprofessional in general. 
I called back and some with a Chris who was the supervisor of everyone I had already spoken too. He was shoot to resolve the situation and then some. 
It's just unfortunate that people like myself pay a lot of money to get treated like garbage by the customer service reps. Especially at an establishment such as Bellagio. The customer service alone is making me not want to go back. I have gotten better service at Luxor, Rio, geez, even Riviera. If I am paying $200+ a night, I expect to be treated like a week paying customer. Because after all, it's people like me (worker bees) who keep these type of hotels going.

Will never book at this hotel. I booked three hotel rooms -- three King size beds, non smoking rooms -- for my colleagues and I for an important convention taking place in Vegas weeks ago. Although hotels.com gives you the option to pay later, I paid immediately so that I don't have to worry about this. Our flight arrived at 12:30 am Vegas time, and we were exhausted. Expecting to get exceptional service in a so called five star hotel, we were met with rude staff, a rude manager, and complete disorganization and lack of professionality. I was given a king size bed SMOKING room and was told I COULDN'T get a non-smoking room until the next day despite the fact that I booked and paid in advance. My other collegeues room was placed in another tower with two queen size beds. Upon bringing this issues to the attention of the manager, she didn't even bother taking the time to fix the situation. This service is not what is expected from a five star hotel. Clearly, this facility and its employees need to get their priorities straight or soon enough the Bellgaio will go out of business. 

I've been to other five star hotels across the U.S --Ritz Carlton, The Langham, etc. and these hotels clearly know how to treat its patrons. 

Save your money, time, and energy and book elsewhere on the Vegas strip. There are a lot of options and this hotel certainly lost our business for good.

Beautiful beautiful! Classy and spacious and always clean! This is my first time there and I would say I am coming back!

Navigating the place was a little tough as signs aren't easily seen due to the color choices but I noticed if you walk the perimeter of it, you'll be able to find places!

During the holidays, I saw that they had the conservatory and this year's theme was Picasso. Walk there and it is like an enchanted forest filled with holiday decor! Perfect if you have little ones and want pictures to capture the memories!

Walk a bit further and you'll find the Guinness world record for the largest chocolate fountain!

We stayed from 11\/26-11\/29 in a spa tower suite---which was beautiful, spacious, and clean.

So, my boyfriend surprised me with a spontaneous trip to Vegas for my bday 11\/28. Surprisingly, we found a SUPER great deal on the suite, which was amazing.

The hotel was ELEGANT and GORGEOUS!!!!  We used the concierge desk to help us book tickets to a few of the shows (which were also great). The person at the desk who helped us was Patti. She was VERY nice, professional, helpful, and had a delightful attitude.  She was so great that we wanted to tip her, but wasn't sure if we should. The bellman were also great and very helpful.

The reason I am giving them only 2 stars is because of a few quirky things that happened....things that you wouldn't expect of a hotel of this magnitude.

1) The first night, we decided to order room service. The food came in a timely manner and was hot and delicious. However, I did ask for my burger to be well done...which it wasn't. I also asked for A-1 Steak sauce but they never sent it. 

1a) The next day we headed out pretty early and returned to the suite around 2:45 am, only to find that our room keys didn't work. So it took them almost a half hour to let us into the room...ugh!

2) Once in the room we see that it hadn't been cleaned....at all. The room service tray with now rotting food was still there. When we tried to speak to someone about it they asked if we would like to put in a request for daily cleaning. HUH???? Even in the shabbiest hotels\/motels daily cleaning is the standard. Apparently, there was no manager who was available to speak with us around 3:30am. Then I asked if they could take the cart with the food out of the room. They said someone should be around in the morning. 

Sigh!

We didn't let those things sully our trip but was disappointed that the Bellagio wasn't attentive to our issues, AT ALL. We plan to go back in the spring but doubt we will be staying with them again.

I'm a Vegas local so that means going to the strip when a friend comes to town. The most recent visit my friend was totally comped.  That was great.  Her room was quite nice but nothing outstanding for the price.

We ate at the steak restaurant and the service and view were excellent.  Two ladies and I think we got the best table there.  Waiter was spot-on with timing and service.  Food was a whole other story.  Mediocre at best.

I have had 3 previous visits and none were good.  Couldn't get served at an empty bar when I was with 2 girlfriends and there was only one cocktail waitress... who was chatting up the only 2 other people in the place (guys)  had an employee play a prank on me in taxi line which could have been deadly.  Slot machine failed and waited more than an hour to get my money out.  Long lines at cashier.  

I would go to Wynn, Venetian or Palazzo first.
What i like best about this hotel was the casino. Food wasn't great and hotel rooms needed to be remodeled!

Massive hotel. Nice place but expect to wait in lines for everything but gaming. The a\/c in my room was loud and if you want to have coffee - forget about it. No coffee in the rooms, you need to buy it downstairs.

Worst experience ever! I wish I could go lower than zero. All the crab were frozen. They were so cold that my eight year old complained his fingers were hurting. I took a batch to their steamer and it still came back cold after steaming. They were rubbery like they were old. I had to get butter more than once because it would solidify from tge cold. Then there's the service. The ones in our section had to be over 80 years old each. I felt so bad that our server could barely lift a single plate no less a few stacked filled with food we hated. I even think we got food poisoning from them. Three out of four of us felt nausea after because we ate the different crabs.

I will NEVER go back! Forget about free, you couldn't pay me to eat there again.

oh how i love the bellagio. i highly recommend staying in a baller room or suite. i think everything about this place is fabulous, the pool cafe, the fountains, the cheesy music channel in your room that plays the fountain tunes, and that chocolate business at jean-phillippe. 

i also won gambling, that was hot.

I was just in Vegas for the first time and managed to score a good deal for a few nights at the Bellagio. Before I left, I had mentioned to a few friends that I was staying at the Bellagio and everyone's eyes lit up when they heard Bellagio, and couldn' believe that I was going to stay there. That reaction alone and all the hype around the Bellagio got me really excited. 

When I got to the Bellagio I first overwhelmed by the amount of people in the lobby alone. It was huge and filled with people, but definately decorated well. The italian blown glass on the ceiling is amazing. We got a room in the spa tower that which was decent. I'm a regular business traveler and have spent way too many nights in hotels so it takes a little more to impress me. But the bed was really comfortable and the bathroom was nice- double sinks, shower and separate tub. 

The room service is phenomenal. I think I would stay at the Bellagio again just for the room service.haha j\/k But it was good. The casino was always crowded to the point that I was annoyed, it was hard to walk from one end to the other because there were so many guests and tourists walking, stopppign and looking at everythign that was going on. Thankfully I managed to find an alternate path through the casino which made getting around easier. 

The pool was great and also very crowded. We had to walk around quite a bit to find an emply chair. After I found a spot I laid out for a while and then when to dip myself inthe water to cool down. There were a few kids in the pool which was annoying they were jumping aroudn and splashign water, which I wouldn't have minded if I was at a waterpark, but this was an elegant pool with fancy fountains....

Overall I liked the Bellagio great location and great hotel, but i think rooms could use a little improvement.

Always a great stay. Came to work a CNY Gala. The service is always amazing. Food is delicious and the beds are extremely comfortable. The in room dining operators were the most helpful people after a long day's work. Not a total fan of the new interior decor of the rooms, but it does not take away from the comfort and luxury of Bellagio! 

Can't wait to come back

The lobby is nice and people are friendly, that's all good until you get to your room.  First the window were so dirty that you could hardly see outside.  We had ticket from a dry cleaning from the people who stayed there before us that wasn't clean.  The table lamp wasn't even hook to the electricity so I had to crawl under the table. And the worst part, we had molds in the ceiling of our shower.  We asked the front desk to have someone come and clean it but it never happened.   I would not recommend this hotel.  there are so many other hotels that are so much better.

Sigh. I miss here. I miss the bed. I miss seeing Chanel from the bedroom window. I miss the fountains. Those clever dancing fountains. We watched them for hours, listening to the music through the tv. The pink panther one was so cool! And the last one of our 3 day stay was the US national anthem. Perfect ending. 

So very glad we stayed here on the last leg of our honeymoon. Easiest the best hotel have ever stayed in. Room was divine. Overlooking the fountains. With electric curtains. A marble bathtub. Biggest shower I have ever seen. Softest, comfiest bed ever. And lots of little goodies like mouthwash. sewing kits, chocs on pillows etc. 

The Conservatory is breathtaking. Had to hold back tears as walked around all the fresh flowers and general beauty of it all. See it both at night and in the day.

Swimming pools and our door area is outstanding. So Italian and classy. Loved and adored. 

Noodle restaurant is great and well priced. Didn't try buffet as line looked way to long at all times but heard good things. 

Hotel is obviously busy as everyone wants to see it. Just go with the crowds, don't let them put you off staying here. 

Loved the via shopping centre too. Sigh.

We had a partial lake view room in the spa tower.....

The Good.....
1. Beautiful common areas
2. Free
3. The amenities rocked!!  In addition to the normal stuff, they also included hairspray, a toothbrush, bath salts and a loofa. (I am not sure if we were given extra stuff because we were on a suite floor or if this is usual)
4. The Buffet (Yum!!)
5. View of Paris from our room at night was stunning
6. Fountain show
7. (Steam) shower was large and had good water pressure
8. Bose clock radio

The Bad.....
1. Crowded common areas
2. The room we reserved was sold out so we were downgraded
3. Customer service was a little suspect; none of the employees went out of thier way to smile or be helpful 
4. The view of City Center from our room.  Yuck!!
5. The room in the spa tower had two beds and one chair.  Only one of us could sit and watch the lake show at a time comfortably.  Seriously, could they not have put a second chair in the room?
6. The toilet faces the shower and there isn't that much space between the two. This seemed like a bad layout.
7. They piled the pillows in shams and the duvets that they (probably) use on the beds in the room.  (This is where the extra chairs should have been.) They never actually made the bed with these items durring our stay.  
8. Television was small, had bad sound and was dated - 27 inch rear projection.  

Overall, I don't think we would pay to stay in this hotel because we always felt that we were an after thought. We stayed at GVR and Palazzo during this trip and thought that there rooms were much nicer in those two hotels and we were treated much more kindly at both of those hotels.

I've stayed at many hotels in vegas over my time but the last 3 visits for me has all been at the bellagio. The service starts at the bell desk and continues till you get to your room. Everything is what you expect it would be and it continues to wow me every time. 

I've stayed in both the spa towers and the casino towers and I'd prefer the casino tower. It feels a little closer to everything. The Jean-Philippe cafe is a great place to have a coffee or pastry. The buffet is great and crowded. The sportsbook is a decent size. Of course the conservatory is a big attraction and it doesn't disapoint. 

I could go on and on about everything in the bellagio but I want to talk about the convenience factor. It's location is perfect to everything. The Caesars palace is on one side and the Cosmo is on the other. Want to explore further and not walk? Towards the spa towers is a team that takes you to aria and Monte Carlo. 

If you get a chance, get one of the suites. You will be happy.
Took 40 minutes at check-in and we couldn't even get the fountain room we booked. So mad! We will NEVER stay here again!

Bellagio is such a pretty hotel. They're probably known for the botanical garden. It gets quite busy during holiday season. 

But what really surprised on my recent visit is the parking FEE!!!! Yes, they charge parking now. To be more specific all the M Life hotels charge for parking. What?! I understand and I don't understand. I'm sad. But it's still worth coming here to enjoy the botanical garden and to take nice photos. You have to move on with time right!?

Hubby and I chose the Bellagio for our anniversary getaway. We were able to check in early, and Fatima at the front desk kindly upgraded our room for our anniversary. The rooms were very nice, clean, and didn't smell like cigarette smoke. Everyone was very attentive and friendly. 
We also liked that the hotel was conveniently located in the middle of the Las Vegas strip and close to all the attractions.
Definitely would recommend, we had a great time!

Food: 5\/5
Service: 5\/5
Cleanliness: 5\/5
Decor & Style: 5\/5

One of the best hotels in Vegas. Room service was perfect, decor\/style was beautiful, and great selection of restaurants. The location is right in the middle of the strip so you can't beat that. Had no problems booking connecting rooms and they honored our free breakfast credits every day as promised through an American Express promo. One of my favorite hotels to stay at in Vegas, if not the absolute fav!

Spent 3 nights at the Bellagio in March 2013 with a colleague.   Watch the fountains but stay elsewhere.  Long lines to check in, talk to a concierge, eat in the cafe, etc.  Sheets and towels in our room smelled strongly of ammonia bleach. The bottom sheet on my bed had multiple patches and was scratchy.  The pool area is nice if you can manage to avoid the cigar-smokers.  While the staff people with whom we spoke were uniformly helpful and pleasant, the operation itself gives the impression of a  huge, impersonal mill. Never again for this traveler.  Maybe it was a great place once but it has deteriorated.

My Gosh, I don't even know where to start with this review !! This hotel is the most beautiful one I've yet visited in Las Vegas !! We had the beautiful view of the  waterfall in our room. It was so beautiful to see all of the Vegas strip at night from our room. The lights at night and the night life is a must see from the room. The room service food was always delicious!  Everything is so close to our hotel. The pool was so relaxing ! I can't wait to come back

This stay has pushed me to write my first review! I was very disappointed when my wife and I first arrived to check in for our room, we were told that the room was booked and no longer available. We just found out we are having a baby, and wanted to watch a concert in Vegas and celebrate with a room with a fountain view. So we chose the deluxe fountain view, weeks in advance. However at check in time, we were bumped from that tower and pushed to the back tower. The receptionist had no reason except that they had overbooked and we could try to get an upgrade the next day. We asked to speak to the manager and she just said he\/she would say the same exact thing. We got an upgrade the next day, after wasting our time the next morning trying to get the next available upgrade and finally move all our things to the correct tower which we had booked in the first place. 

All in all, the hotel was nice, the staff could definitely be improved. Dealing with them made me feel like I was at the DMV or calling the IRS. Caution when booking your room! Do not get too excited to have a fountain view, because when you drive there after 6 hours, you will be disappointed that they gave away that room to someone who just walked in because they don't know how to manage their own hotel. 

Honestly, I would never stay here again. Also the buffet food was not that great. While waiting in line at the Cafe Bellagio they skipped over us and seated several other couples before us, so we just left and went the the Snacks shop which was the best food\/experience at this hotel, gaining them 2 stars.

My recommendation would be to stay at another hotel and just visit the Snack shop and see their decor.

I booked a room in Feb. of this year for a hair show.I requested 2 queen beds, since there would be 3 of us sharing a room (which I stated on my reservation). When we arrived at the hotel on 6\/22, Trisha the the reservation clerk told us unfortunately all they had was a room with a kingsize bed.when I told her that wouldn't  do she just stared back at me and did this half grin half smirk. After about 5 min. Of this nonsense I asked to speak to the mgr. who told me there were no other rooms available except for a smoking room(none of us smoke) and I guess to make it seem like he was doing us some huge favor he told us he that a family had already reserved it but he would let us have it (really?). This is supposedly  a 5 star hotel but the way they handled the situation left a very bad taste in my mouth and I will not be returning. P.S. The rest of the staff were extremely kind and welcoming.

Get a fountain view room for  a spectacular view of the fountain that sounds like thunder when turns on. Like all hotels here, be prepared for gambling Halls and walking long distances that serves to burn all the buffet calories...
Rooms are well appointed, ask for non-smoking or put up with stale tobacco. On fact all around you will smell the stench so come prepared for a sore throat and itchy eyes at the casino.
Spacious rooms with convenient safe in night table, stocked mini bar, amenities a scale that didn't work and wasn't replaced even after asking... Free wifi. There is a definite need for more lighting in the rooms.
This hotel is not about gimmick and more about elegance and cordiality and I appreciate that. 
Will come again.

It has been almost a year since our last stay at the Bellagio, and in my opinion, things have gotten even better. Perhaps it is the newer competition that has driven Bellagio to step up its game.

My newest favorite at Bellagio (and it's really not that new, just new to me) is the VIP Cypress Lounge at the pool area. Drop $75 a person, per day, and you get the most comfortable lounger, freebies like mini cups of virgin smoothies, cool cucumbers, and tasty orange sections. More importantly, you get personalized attention when you want it. Service is with a big friendly smile. The patrons there seemed less inclined to show off their bodies and tans, and were a more mellow crowd than the groups fighting over lounge chairs and umbrellas, drinking carelessly, shouting and causing a ruckus. It was so relaxing. This is the only way to do a pool day at the Bellagio!

Another thing I noticed was the abundance of drink attendants throughout the casino. They were actually more personable than ever before. No waiting to flag someone down, having to spend more time at a slot machine because you're tied to it waiting for the server to bring your drink order. 

One of the major standouts to us was that we ate at fewer Bellagio restaurants this time and tried a couple of sister restaurants to Bellagio's greatest Yellowtail (Japanese) and Picasso (French). We ate at the recently opened Kumi (Japanese) at Mandalay Bay and Julian Serrano (Spanish Tapas) at Aria. They were a disappointment, to say the least, compared to their Bellagio outposts. Bellagio definitely scores way ahead of the other MGM properties in the restaurant department. 

As an aside, the new alliance between MGM\/M Life and Hyatt is a real bonus now. If you are a member of both frequent guest programs, you can earn points and stays which is a real plus for us Hyatt die-hards. Stay and spend money at Bellagio (or any other MGM Las Vegas property with a few exclusions) and you can earn Hyatt Gold Passport points and stay credits. Finally, a quasi-Hyatt presence in Las Vegas!  Just gives us more reason to head back to the Bellagio!

Most of the hotels\/casinos in Vegas are basically the same if you're just looking for a place to crash after a night of partying\/gambling. However, if you're looking for good service and good food, then you'll have to fork out a bit more. 

Bellagio is one of the best hotels on the strip because 1. it is right in the middle of the strip, 2. it's got a beautiful water fountain show. For some reason, no one is immune to the magnificent display. 3. Plenty of 5 diamond restaurants, and 4. The Forum shop is right across the walkway at Caesars Palace. Well, that's all I really care about, food and shopping. It's a beautiful hotel with fantastic views. 

On the downside, if you don't get a fountain view room, don't bother staying here. Too much foot traffic, very crowded, and not kid friendly. we only stayed here because our little ones love water fountains, waterfalls, and anything water related. 

We stayed here last xmas and they were out of suites with the fountain view so we booked 2 rooms. unfortunately, the rooms were not connected which is my only complaint, but at least we got our fountain view. Pretty much stayed in our rooms the whole time. tried to eat at the buffet and one of the upscale restaurant twice, but it was too smoky for our little ones so opted for room service instead. They really do live up to their 5 diamond standard when it comes to food.

super excited for our trip to Vegas, we decided to stay at the Bellagio since it is one of the most well known and spoken about hotels on the strip. we booked our room months in advance and took advantage of a military discount which seemed to be VERY reasonable. unfortunately, when we arrived at the hotel, the fees and taxes ended up adding almost $100 extra dollars onto our bill making it much less reasonable. when being in Vegas, we don't actually spend too much time in the room, so next time I would probably opt for the cheapest one instead. 

the parking was convenient and free. it is a bit hard to find, but make sure that you take advantage of this rather than the overpriced valet services. our room was spacious and beautiful. we booked the King suite room which had a spacious bathroom with a large tub and shower. there were remote controlled curtains and lights. unfortunately, even being in a nonsmoking room, we could blatantly smell smoke in the bathroom. I am guessing that the vents located in the bathroom area are connected to smoking rooms but it was unpleasant. it was so bad, that I was actually nervous we might get charged if the cleaning crew thought we had smoked. 

although we were well aware that we would be charged for eating or drinking anything from the minibar, I was disappointed that there was no place to put our own personal belongings in the fridge. when paying hundreds of dollars a night for a room, we couldn't even place our water bottles in the fridge without being charged. I understand that this is protocol, but it seemed a ridiculous and money-hungry rule. 

we quickly got over these few annoying things and went out to enjoy our time at the hotel. we spent some time in the casino, had a few drinks at the bars, and then ventured on out to the clubs located in the Bellagio; Hyde and The Bank. My friend experienced extremely rude employees at Hyde. one of the gentlemen laughed in her face when she asked if a certain area was closed for a private party and simply walked away without answering. the bartender did the same thing when she made a somewhat difficult drink request. I was okay with continuing on with our night here at Hyde, but the disrespect forced her to want to leave. 
 
in the morning, a woman of the cleaning crew came to our door at around 8:30am and knocked multiple times until I finally got out of bed to answer. she realized I had been sleeping and asked when we were leaving. I told her that we would be out by 11:00 (checkout time) and she asked if it would be earlier by any chance so she could clean our room. I was baffled. At this point, we packed up our stuff and left early because we felt unwanted. 

I gave a 3 star rating because the room was nice and there was lots to do within the hotel, but I was overall disappointed by the customer service. I am hoping that this was a rare occurrence and we simply had bad luck...

This review is only for the hotel room. We stayed here and fit 6 girls into one room which had 2 queen beds. The room was spacious and clean with ample fluffy towels for us all to use. The walls were thick so we weren't woken up by next door noises or construction. Half of the group had never been to Vegas so it was great to see how enthralled they were with our hotel over the weekend. I think the Wynn, Bellagio, and Venetian are in a class of their own. You can tell they spend a lot of time and effort to attract a better crowd than places like Imperial Palace or even the Mirage (which smelled like smoke when you walked in). The year of the rat floral exhibit was breathtaking, just like how they like to do it. They have an ample supply of places to eat, drink, and club for all different price ranges unlike places like The Wynn which is all expensive. The water show is also a plus and it's free. Everyone gets so excited about it, I've seen it a dozen times and still love it. It's funny though cause if you think about it, it's just water.

We come every year, and the quality of the Bellagio remains high.  The service and attention to detail makes it our destination when coming to Las Vegas.  You can not ask for a more upscale experience.

My husband and I go to Vegas a lot and have stayed at most of the resorts on the strip.We stayed at the Bellagio this last weekend for a quick  trip. We booked a regular resort room and to our surprise found that we had been upgraded to a suite for free. The room was beyond expectation and we found ourselves spending more time in the room than the casino. We will definitely be staying with Bellagio from now on.

My husband and I hotel hop for this birthday bash. So that weekend we decided to stay at three different hotels and one of which was Bellagio. This place is really nice and we came back again for the summer. It gets really crowded sometimes but it's all worth it because they have everything here. Love their buffet for dinner and the Cafe for brunch. My family are always here for the buffet and brunch whenever we are in the city. Can't miss it.

Just returned from a two night stay at the Bellagio.  

The good:

* Beautiful ambiance in the common areas.
* Fantastic central location.
* Lovely shops to drool in.
* Very delicious room service.
* Excellent customer service from everyone we encountered.
* Complimentary upgrade to a Fountain-view partial suite when we let her know it was our anniversary.
* Lovely room with nice lighting and a very comfortable bed.
* Big, beautiful glass shower and good sized bathroom.  Very important to us.
* The light in the closet turns on when you open it.  Nice touch.
* Beautiful pool area.  Comfortable chaises and huge towels.  They responded to the warm weather and at least opened part of the area, even though it was February.

The surprisingly underwhelming:

* Cheap and somewhat dirty fixtures in the bathroom.  
* Underwhelming provided toiletries.
* Low-quality towels and robes.  Not luxurious at all!  
* Noisy.  I'm not sure if it was the specific position of my room but we got quite a bit of noise from other people's toilets flushing and the explosion of the water in the fountain show.  This is not something I typically notice or complain about so it was pretty bad.
* $20\/day resort fee for internet.  You can't tell me their cost for wifi isn't covered by the already high cost of the room.
* Very limited television options.  Obviously, one doesn't come to Vegas to watch TV but when you're laying in bed, eating your delicious room service, you want more than a couple channels.  See above remark about the resort fee.  Isn't this the sort of thing that 20 additional dollars per room\/per night could pay for?

I'm torn about my experience here.  It is a lovely hotel and we were treated very well.  I suppose I expected all of the small details to be as luxurious as their reputation and the cost would suggest.  Many of the highlights of the Bellagio can be enjoyed without staying there.  I was not disappointed but unless we got a fantastic room rate, I think I would stay somewhere a bit less expensive and use my money in the Bellagio shops.  Prada, you're on notice...

When you visit Las Vegas, you would never missed the music fountain show. But it is not the only reason you would be to Bellagio again and again, for there were a lot of surprise to you. It has amazing show, very delicious buffet and brilliant decoration of the hotel. You will get new surprise that it have total different theme decoration in its one big hall. You couldn't stop taking photos in there.

I have been waiting my whole life (okay more like 3 years) to stay here! I had heard nothing except great things about the hotel here and I just don't see what all of the hype is all about. 

We got a great rate of $250\/night for a king room but then there are taxes and resort fees which make this place around $300 a night. The rooms are cute but nothing special. Looks like a slightly nicer Hyatt in the actual room. While the soaking tub was nice and our view was great, nothing really made this place pop. 

And this place was PACKED. I know casinos generally are but compared to other hotels that we walked into, this one seemed especially crowded. 

The best part was probably the maid service (which was exceptional, thorough, and they really went above and beyond to organize and clean up) the pools, and the conservatory. Everything was high-priced and overrated otherwise. There were 5 or 6 pools that were gorgeous & clean but they filled up really quickly. 

There are so many great hotels on the strip...not sure if I'd come back here again. Maybe to visit the conservatory or to go to Jean Phillippe Patisserie but probably not to stay.

Amazing rooms! Big bathrooms, clean room, and was very comfortable.

HOWEVER, customer service could use a lot of work.

Incident #1: At the front desk, there was a trainee (she was really nice!) and in back of her, there was this scowl-muffin of a trainer who doesn't know the concept of smiling.  (Had an icy tone and everything)

Incident #2: The person who brought up our luggage to our room (bald guy) had an attitude. After he put our luggage in our room, we remembered we had a luggage rack, so we asked him to put them on the rack instead. He got this attitude like he didn't want to do it, like it was such a hassle and just tossed it haphazardly. And then after that, he immediately started to walk away like he wanted to leave as soon as possible. Hello, we want to give you tip?? He took it but he didn't even say thank you and just walked away. 

Yes, we asked him to put the luggage onto the rack after he put it on the floor, but was it really THAT big of a deal that he needed to get thattt mad??

Incident #3: There weren't enough amenities, so we called them to see if they can bring us a little more. The person who answered was nice and she was helpful but the person she was requesting to was taking FOREVER ("We'll be up in 5 mins", my butt). We had to call FOUR times and it took THREE hours, and to top it off, they finallyyy came at 1am....when we were just about to sleep.

What happened, Bellagio? I thought you were one of the nice hotels in Vegas? Customer service can make or break a business and I've had awesome experiences at the other strip hotels, so personally, I'll stick with them. Thanks for the room anyway.

So I've never stayed at the hotel... but I am a fan of the free stuff here to do if you go to Vegas.

1)  Catch the water\/fountain show.  

2)  Visit the garden inside the hotel.  

Both are beautiful and amazing.  On my most recent trip the fountain was synchronized to Christmas carols sung in Italian and the garden was all decked out for the holidays.  The fountain show is every 30 minutes (I think) and the garden is always open, but generally crowded if you go in the afternoon or evening with people taking pictures.

The Bellagio also has a chocolate fountain that will temp you into buying overpriced treats and is home to O, the amazing Cirque du Soleil show.

This is a gorgeous hotel in Vegas, and Steve Wynn's first.  The man is a master of design.  You've seen the fountains in countless movies and TV shows.  Check it out!  Fun to walk around in, and the Botanical Gardens are beautiful
Great shopping, great atmosphere, Simply one of the best hotels in Vegas.  Always great for people watching!

OK. So I'm on my very first solo trip to Vegas and I'm on my second day of play.  I'm running on this newfound life motto of "why not?"  Rather than think too much about things I'd like to do, I just DO IT.  You know?  Like, "I feel like going to Vegas.  Even if it's just me on my own."

"Well, WHY NOT?"

Granted, doing Vegas alone is quite a different experience than going with a group of friends, but it's a nice experience nontheless.  Getting to do anything I want, whenever I want without having to meet up with a group at predetermined times.  I just want to get LOST in my own world and so far, it's been very enjoyable and relaxing.

I'll be honest though, I would not have done this spur of the moment trip if it had been the Imperial Palace or Circus Circus offering me complimentary rooms nights.  I can't justify being grossed out and sleeping on box-spring mattresses, even if it's free.

[Full disclosure]

But complimentary rooms at Bellagio? With $150 in Freeplay and a two-for-one "O" by Cirque du Soleil tickets (which sadly, I can't use)? I'm so effing there!

*Yesterday* After a 4 hour drive (that flew by surprisingly quick), I pull up to the resort at approximately 6 PM.  I slumped up to the registration desk flustered and ready to unwind...carrying 3 different bags and a heavy sack filled with snacks and bottled water.  The friendly receptionist kindly welcomed me, and after a friendly inquiry, I was upgraded to a strip and fountain view room!  So a complimentary room, with a free upgrade to a gorgeous view of the Fountains of Bellagio.  F YA!  It was as simple as smiling, being friendly, making eye contact and asking politely!  Everything is..."so far, so VERY good."

Usually when people go to hotels, (especially) five-star hotels, there are a lot of nice things adorning the space.  Like pretty furniture.  Plasma TV's. Plush bathrobes.  Has anybody here actually never had the sinister urge to take these things prior to checking out? (Aside from toiletries and such?)  Let's be honest with ourselves now.  But in my case here, I don't want any of those other things.  If I could get away with it, I would TAKE THE BED and everything part of it. The throw pillows, the mattress, the sheets, the...EVERYTHING.  I have never had such a great nights sleep.  I have stayed at this hotel before, but not when I have an entire King sized bed to myself and sleeping completely buck naked, rolling around in my sleep.  If not for the casino calling out to me from the ground floor, I probably would have dosed off for 24 hours or more.  Those beds are THAT decadent.

There were a few disappointments with the room and a hiccup in service, which doesn't constitute a full 5-star Yelp rating.  Noticed a few things about the room that doesn't go on par with the 5-Diamonds the resort proudly boasts.  I will give it that Bellagio is now an aging 11-year old property.  However, I couldn't help but notice a couple of lights were burned out in the restroom.  The restroom door lock (not like I needed to use it though) was busted.  The air vent panel was loose and coming off the wall.  Also, the front desk swiped my credit card, but I was unable to access the internet or order an in-room movie.  Had to call down and have that fixed.

The casino itself is not that large, but because of the way they designed it into partitioned areas, it seems to go on forever. There's lots of variety in terms of table play options and a vast array of slots in all kinds of denominations (though majority of these machines are really showing their age).

A few other things I've noticed: the hotel's public areas are PACKED with gawkers, like other Yelpers have noted.  It's definitely not a fault of the hotels, if anything, it's doing it's job of drawing in hundreds of spectators  by the hour.  But damn, try squeezing through the sea of flashing SLR's on tripods in the registration lobby and groups of people frozen in still life, with their jaws dropped gazing at the Conservatory Garden displays.

Anyway, I'm off to shower and heading back down to the casino.  Later!

P.S. their turn-down service chocolates are divine.  I could eat a whole bag of those in one sitting.

I stayed at Bellagio for two night last week and I loved this hotel\/casino.  My room was stunning!  The bed was a dream...I slept like a baby!  The casino floor is well designed and clean.  They will comp  your drinks at teh video poker bars as long as you play two credits.

I also left my ipad behind, luckily realizing this before heading to the airport, and the staff was very caring and prompt in getting my belongings back to me.

There's been plenty of reviews about this place so I'll make it brief:

What I like:
- It's the fucking Bellagio.  While that probably meant more 10 years ago, it's still a great casino to stay\/visit.
- Rooms are nice and pretty comfortable.
- The location is excellent - right in the middle of the strip.
- The restaurant options are solid.  I actually liked the Le Cirque here better than in NYC (better service IMO).
- Buffet is good.  While it's not the best in town anymore, it's still pretty decent.
- Beautiful garden and lobby area.

What I don't like:
- As expected the table games cost more here.
- Love the luxury stores but wished they had more mid-tier shopping options
- Traffic in this area sucks ass.  Here's where the prime location can also suck.

Generally speaking you can't go wrong staying here.  But if you're not a high roller or in the mood to spend a ton to eat all the time, you may want to gamble\/dine at one of the many casinos nearby.

Went to the Bellagio buffet. It used to be great, but expensive. Now they've cheapened it down - serving average items prepared in a mediocre manner - and it's still expensive. Run away! Better meals are available all over town at cheaper prices.

Very nice hotel. Beautiful, large and clean rooms. However, customer service was not so great. Overall, the place just felt stuffy and staff was not very friendly. Upon checkout the girl at the desk didn't even bother to ask us how are stay was or thank us for staying there. She just said hello and then handed us our bill. I am fairly easy to please, but when I'm paying for a hotel like this I expect you to at least pretend you appreciate my patronage.

I love the Bellagio o go there all the time with my family and friends. But the last time I attended they had horrible staff service and the room we checked in was not clean! We pay all this money to wait for our room to be cleaned when they should have done it already. Then we ordered room service and they took about 2 hours to bring it and to top it off all the food was cold. They need to work on their staff before I ever attend to that hotel again because that was terrible.

Has to be one of the best hotels I've stayed at in Las Vegas.  The rooms are spacious, clean, and cozy.  My only issue with both my stays at their hotel is the fountain. The first time I stayed here, I felt that I lucked out with views of their infamous fountain from my room. But if you're one trying to get to bed early, the sounds of the water crashing down and the bright lights have you tossing and turning all night.  My second stay was facing the fountain as well but I was prepared with ear plug and Capt N Morgan. By the way, I cannot comment on the price because both times were paid by someone else. 

As for the casino floor, Bellagio has a lot to offer. The Conservatory, Gallery of Fine Arts, conference rooms, restaurants, and their poker room are all favorites of mine.  Although, I've never had the stack or the skills to ever play in Bobby's Room, it's just an amazing feel knowing that million dollar hands are played out almost daily. 

If you've been to Las Vegas, you know all about the Bellagio. If you're looking to visit, make this a stop. No expense needed for the fountain and people watching.

The Bellagio as expected is opulent and refined. The staff that greeted us was friendly and efficient. The lobby, gardens, and conservatory are all beautiful. The room is just a room. It is a hotel room with nice amenities. We stayed at many hotels on the strip and the Encore is the better choice for rooms and pools. The Bellagio pool area is beautifully landscaped.  The problem is the service at the pool. The wait staff is absent and when they are visible they do not ask to provide any service. It can take a hour between drinks and it gets frustrating when our plan for the day is pool and relaxation.

Bellagio is a beautiful hotel. Its HUGE and has every amenity you can imagine. Check in was smooth. That being said the rooms are on the small side and though the bathroom was nice I would have liked a fan, just a basic thing a five diamond bathroom should have.  Would I stay here again? No. It's too large and the number of tourists is just ridiculous, random people always taking pictures and it's just too crowded.

This hotel is very disappointing. We had a suite which we found was worn out with clear signs of age to the carpet as well as broken furniture. We attempted to order room service and were told the wait would be over an hour. We attempted a second time and the wait exceeded an hour and when I called back they informed me that they actually did not have the things in stock we had ordered. This place is way over-rated and is a far cry from a 5 star hotel. I will take my business to the Wynn or the cosmopolitan in the future. Even the Venetian is much better than the Bellagio. I relayed my concerns to the hotel management and nobody replied.

The Bellagio is absolutely beautiful hotel. Room service was very fast with polite waiters. Food was well-prepared. Pool staff were welcoming and friendly. Will definitely stay here when I return to Las Vegas.

This hotel has kept a classy traditional vibe. I love the new city center but it's too modern. Here you find an oasis and it's never ending. The decorations and gardens change all the time. It has great club like the bank where the promoters aren't pushy and your typical sleezy. Gambling here is great with 10 and 15$ tables. The water show is amazing. Only wish they would play the traditional music or something good during it. The Bank is my favorite night club! Tip your waitresses on the Black Jack tables before they ASK YOU (tacky).

If you're Jed and Ellie May Clampett, you come here to feel like the rich folk do.
If you're really rich, you wouldn't come here. 

First off, check-in; it's a cattle call, have fun with that. 
     
Then fight your way through the cows to your room. 
The room looks like rich-folk stuff until you get up close. 
The fabrics are worn and dirty. 
Looks better from the door. 
    
There is no mini-fridge for personal use; insert silent scream here.
 Look for one of those at Motel 6. 
     
Snacks are under laser-lock. Breathe on one and your room is charged. 
Ellie May would think that was cool.

There are Yelpers who say the service is excellent; that's true if you bring a suitcase full of cash and flip it open when passing employees. 

I assure you that if you leave your suitcase full of cash at home-there is no customer service. 
I would italicize those last five words if I knew how. 

Morning: want some coffee?  
Long lines at every lobby cafe, staffed with stoic women in hair nets handing out plastic-entombed croissants.      

To avoid the lines and the depressing cafeteria atmosphere, I walked through 68 miles of corridors to a charming coffee bar I had passed the day before. 
I found it.  
It was closed. 
It's not open in the morning. 

A coffee stand not open in the morning.  
I was ready to commit a crime-of some sort.  
I couldn't think of what, but I really wanted to.

I thought, Starbucks. I'll go to Starbucks. Starbucks treats me like a queen, this homicidal-suicidal feeling will go away. 
I found one, in a different hotel, far, far away. 
I walked. 
And you know what? 
The Starbucks in Vegas hotels aren't like regular Starbucks.
They don't take the oath to smile and please, and they don't read the book on how to make drinks. 
They charge you extra, too. 
     
I walked the 648 dusty, hot miles back to The Bellagio. 
I passed the coffee stand on the way to my room. 
It was open.
 
I looked at the pool, and hope returned to my heart. 
It's beautiful and I felt like Ellie May would if she could see it--all impressed-like. 
So I went down there. I had to wear my suit because there's nowhere to change by the pool. 
Who knows, there probably is but I didn't see it.

I felt real awkward 'cause I didn't bring some classy suit cover-up thing.
I walked through the Bellagio corridors with a bath towel wrapped around me. 
I looked like a twelve-year old at camp.
 
The lounging area around the pool is deathly quiet. 
You will like it if your hair is white, you smoke, you're silent and you don't like getting wet. 
I have never been to a pool that quiet. Everyone was just sitting, smoking 
and staring. 
Fun times.
Fun, fun times
I was afraid to talk above a whisper for fear of setting off someone's pacemaker.
     
No one was in the pool.  
We wanted to actually get in said pool, but it seemed uncouth and disruptive.  
We braved it, but being in a pool made us want to talk, laugh and play, and we couldn't. 
The smoking, staring people wouldn't like it.  
I got out, wrapped myself in the towel and dripped back to my room. 
      
The next day we walked by the pool at Caesar's Palace. It was full of   
smoking people; laughing, splashing and jumping. 
I cried a little inside.  
                    
                              
All in all, I didn't like The Bellagio.

we usually get lucky with our favorite slot machine "top dollar"
the best strawberry daiquiri.  
the best cirque show in vegas "o"
we love to vist the garden

My boyfriend and I stayed here for our anniversary. I was blown away by their attentive customer service. Checking in was a breeze, and at the desk they said they saw the note that it was our anniversary, so we got a free upgrade! In addition, a guy came by with ice right away without us asking (although paranoid me threw it away because I don't know where it's been), and when we left for dinner and came back, robes and chocolates were laid out on the bed for us and everything in the bathroom was arranged neatly.
