All of the employees greet you sincerely when you cross paths with them. I love the staff here, everyone is so helpful.

This review was for the buffet, um it took them about an hour to sit a party of 16. Then when we paid they wanted to seat the ones with the champagne deal on one end if the table and such. The food was good really yummy. I enjoyed it.

A\/C didnt work that well...was kinda warm throughout the night..

Air vent in the window was taped shut which was odd... they used white duct tape  go figure.. not sure why they did this...

Vending machine on 4th floor had super stale starbursts... Maybe it was because no one buys the $2 starburst... Hard as rock.......

But my brothers room on the 36th floor was great...

Probably just a one off..... Still a nice hotel.. just not a good room this time...

Disappointed.  Was really excited to stay here since it's supposed to be one of the nicer hotels, and could finally afford it due to a corporate discount.  But after the treatment my family and I received here...definitely not coming back.  I've stayed at Hampton Inns nicer than the Spa Tower, but the real problem was the rudeness of the staff.  I noticed a lot of other people commenting on this if they tried to change rooms, etc.  But we didn't ask for anything extra and still couldn't avoid the attitude of the hotel employees.  I don't know the details of my mom's experience with the concierge but she came back to the room upset one night after trying to pick up show tickets she reserved with the hotel a week ago, which the people at the front desk wouldn't give her until she talked to about 5 different people.  My experience was at the pool one afternoon, I decided to treat my sister and I to some cool drinks and ordered two when approached by a server.  She came back with only mine and I casually asked her if my sister's drink would be out soon, and I about fell out of my seat when she, practically screaming, said that I never ordered another drink and she would have written it down if I did.  My sister and I looked at each other in disbelief and said politely that she must have confused us with some other guests and she replied even more defensively, "No! She said she was full and didn't want anything and I even asked if you wanted anything else!!"  I was in shock, so shocked I foolishly gave her back my credit card to charge for the additional drink without asking to see her manager.  When she got back I told her I didn't appreciate being called a liar, and of course she said "I didn't call you a liar!  I'm sorry I didn't hear you!"  All I can say to that is, sign me up for a job at the Bellagio because all the time I served food to people I never got to be so rude to customers.  Seems like fun!  Anyway the Bellagio didn't seem to get the memo that there are other nicer hotels on the strip now and they probably want to treat their guests better to avoid losing business.  Even if you can afford it, the cheaper hotels are way more fun in my opinion anyway, especially the casinos  :)

If you're in Vegas you MUST see the water show here. The fountain goes off about every 15 mins. The ambience within the hotel was beautiful and the staff were extremely friendly. Definitely considering staying here during my next visit.

I love the Bellagio (I love Venetian, as well, but Bellagio to me is just terrific).  Classic design, top-notch restaurants (like Le Cirque), Great gaming areas, White-glove service. A great spa.  Yes, it costs a fortune - but to me - its worth it.

And those fountains - what fun!

I love it here!  Touristy bliss.

Pros: 
- Quick check in (because we arrived at 10pm)
- Excellent housecleaning 
- Gorgeous fountain show (best at night with the different lights)
- Botanic Garden 
- Pool (only for hotel guest... I didn't actually use this because we went in July, so I wanted to stay indoor with the air conditioner than in the scorching heat),
- Chocolate fountain at the Crepe
- Excellent food at the Buffet ( I went to Wynn for buffet, and the price at Bellagio is slightly cheaper than the buffet at Wynn. More selection of food than at Wynn!)

Cons:
- Long lines at check out!
- 27" (not flat screen tv)


--------------
Overall, it was a beautiful hotel with many to see. We stayed here for four days, and services were excellent. The hotel is also right in the middle of the strip, so you can save a lot of walking from one end to the other. We stayed at the spa tower and had the view of Eiffel Tower and the fountain. The room was big (est. 600 sq ft), huge bathroom, and comfy bed! Even though we did not stay in the room that is facing directly at the fountain, we were still able to see a portion of the fountain. Night view of the strip is gorgeous from the hotel. Definitely will stay there again!

We stay here every year, and almost everything here is unbelievable, except for the service on the casino floor. It has to be one of the worst on the strip. I don't even enjoy gambling here anymore as I can't get a drink within an hour of sitting down at a slot machine. I'll stay here again, but I'll go somewhere else to gamble.

If you have a choice to stay at the Motel 6 or the Bellagio pick the Motel 6 at least then you know what to expect. Check in they try to make easy but I got run around to two different rooms and the third time asked for upgrade got a view of the freeway. First room had a sign on the shower door that it was inoperable until the next day. They apologized but continued to not have their act together for functioning rooms. 
The hotel itself has clearly gone down hill, worn carpeting, heavy draperies hark to an era gone by... like the 90's maybe. 
I stay in Vegas often, save yourself the aggravation and pick any of the other strip hotels for better style and service. The Venetian, Monte Carlo, Paris, Mandalay Bay, they all put this place to shame.

The Bellagio is one of the best hotels centered on the strip it's close to everything I would recommend staying at a less expensive hotel everything inside is a bit pricey but it is nice to splurge and have a getaway The room is excellent and have a king size bed and everything was well kept and maintained make sure you look for excellent price on The Internet and we came during March madness like every hotel it to got some age

ok seriously this place sucks,might as well throw your money on the ground and burn it. I swear its gonna come out one day that all these casinos had more then an edge in their favor. the hotel is grand but like all casinos they have lost the old school service. I practically have to beg for a meal or a comp and frankly i'm sick of that bs. bring back the goodfellas they knew how to at least give you a feeling that you're money wasn't spent completely in vain. Just another example of over priced,under serviced and overall bad value for money spent or risked...welcome to the vegas facadeafarce....

Wow, has this place gone way downhill. Absolutely filthy, disgusting and dated rooms. The grout on my shower was covered in mold and was coming off the walls. Upon checking in I also found hair on the toilet, candy and rhinestones on the floor. I'm low maintenance and had my room cleaned once on my three night stay. My thoughts of the room not being cleaned properly was proved when all the in room snacks magically appeared. I didn't even notice it, all 12 or so snacks were missing. I hadn't noticed as I was there for work and was in and out of the room. Came back to the room the second day, and there they were. Proves they did a rush job, and did not clean the room. And the candy was still on the floor. Absolutely despicable.  I also did the online survey and requested a call back. Not a peep from anyone. So many more properties to choose from on the strip. Don't waste your time here.

First of all I liked to thank the management of The Bellagio because I misplaced my Cirque De Soleil ticket at the Casino and they immediately called me since it was forwarded to their lost and found department. Thank you so much for the honesty and fast communication.

For the show, they delivered as what we expected. I liked it because it was indeed an entertainment, circus and show at the same time. I liked the choreography, music, production and how graceful the performers are. I was amazed that there was a pool in the stage lol. Would I recommend the show? Yes I will. :)

They don't let kids in if they're not accompanied by adults. Definitely a place for business. The garden is always decorated nicely-- the last time I went, it was outfitted in the Chinese New Year dragon year theme. The cafe is speedy and has a nice selection of breakfast foods and the buffet is full stocked. The rooms are clean with the classic upscale hotel feel. Watched the "O" performance here in the theater and was very impressed-- minus the smell of chlorine the whole time.

Pro tip: There are complementary chocolate-covered strawberries in the VIP lounge. For VIP guests only though ;D

4 Stars for the unique and dazzling fountains.  Never tire of it.
3 Stars for the great restaurants in the lobby.

2 Stars for the standard rooms.
No dressing gown came with ours and it was very vin ordinaire.  Room service is slow so order breakfast room service say, around 11pm and it should arrive in time.
However, the room was incredibly clean and clean goes a long way in our book.  Need we tell you NOT to lounge on the comforters:  that applies to the Bellagio, to Wynn and to Motel 6.

The Conservatory is a pleasant addition. 
 
Not calling a hotel cheesy-looking is an accolade in Vegas.  The  Dale Chihuily glass installation in the Lobby ceiling is a seething mass of color and quite dramatic.

Everything was as promised, and I must say I was very satisfied with the establishment after my stay. I look forward to staying with them again the next time I am in Vegas! Thank you David for helping clear up my fears.

-***UPDATE: I was contacted by a manager with the Bellagio, after a couple of clarification messages back and forth I was made an offer to satisfy the situation to the best of the managers ability. In a month I have an upcoming trip to Vegas and am looking forward to staying at the Bellagio now to see if they've kept their word. I expect all will be well as David was extremely professional to communicate with and genuinely seemed to care that my trust in the company was reinstated. Thank you for your help Yelp! And David as well!***



I purchased tickets through the box office for Circ du Soleil "O" (the show itself was wonderful, that is a different story). during the purchase my credit card information was given to the agent, and according to my credit card company was used to make an illegitimate card on which someone attempted to withdraw 1,187$ from the Bellagio cash machine. I reported this to 

1.) call center during my request to speak with a manager prior to my arrival in LV, was told that oh well, the charges were declined so no harm no foul! (hmmmm yea there was harm and foul, due to my card being canceled related to fraud one day prior to my trip and i had to travel without it so a great deal of my plans were canceled because my high limit signature visa was unavailable, not to mention i was 1000 miles from home without a security fall back card.)

2.)after the show i reported directly to security office, was hassled for going to the office to begin with even after i argued with the agent at the archway and told him that i was instructed to report there to get a security\/fraud agent. finally i was directed to speak with a gentleman named Calvin who did at least seem responsive to my concern. He took a report and told me someone would be following up within a day or two. needless to say i am now 5 days later and long back home and have yet to hear anything from security regarding the breech. the box office was the only place that had the CVV number from the back of my card and few purchases were made on this a brand new account so the odds of a breech coming from anywhere else with the same information is astronomical (larger than hitting a jackpot for sure).

I am absolutely positive i will never stay with the resort, MGM Grand treated my party with nothing but the best and we were in a moderately priced room. if i can figure out how to i have the call centers agents call recorded as my phone records all incoming and outgoing calls and will post so people can see the type of treatment you can expect from this "high class" establishment. trust me: take your money else where on the strip and avoid this den of thieves at all costs!!!!!

I've never stayed at the hotel so this review is strickly for the seasonal botanical displays.  We never miss stopping in to see the beautiful creations that change every season.  And all made from flowers and plants!  If you've never been, it's a must!  It does get crazy crowed tho so be patient and enjoy!
Used to be a great Hotel- Now- WORST  hotel for customer service in las Vegas..

This is a great hotel & i have very much respect gratitude & love for the people that work here. My late fiance worked here & she would always tell me that this was BY FAR her most favorite hotel..she used to dream of working here & she finally got her chance..i would like to thank each & every employee from the executives on down for the love respect and support that you've shown me while my fiance was sick and then passed away you were at her memorial.. Thabk you for being the wonderful people that you are!

The Bellagio is over rated. Lots of eye candy but no substance. High price for watery drinks and indifferent service... if you can get service. They rely on sheer numbers rather than repeat business. In fairness, the problems seem to be the result of poor management. The rank and file employees are working the best they can.
Fui a ver cirque du soleil, O,  increible. El mejor espectaculo es 100% recimendable para toda la familia. No me hospede en el hotel en si, pero lucia increible

Wow!  Supreme service and quality here.  I like it better than the Encore, other than the nightclub (XS rules above all).  Bellagio's bathroom and supersized tub are so elegant.  All the staff is wonderful and the entire complex is top of the line.  The maid service is excellent as well and very respectful.  Much more homely feel than other hotels in Vegas with all the bells and whistles.  I can't wait to visit again!

Excellent proximity on the strip to everything else. hotel is beautiful and staff is caring.

How exactly do I describe my weekend here?
1. Roll up in Taxi to Bellagio.
2. Go to private check in counter for suites (If you booked a suite, there is a private check in room with pastries, drinks and  other awesome treats).
3. Check in and roll up to my Penthouse suite.
4. eat, gamble, drink, watch tv & sleep.
5. wake up in the morning hungover. opens curtains with remote and seeing the Vegas Eiffel Tower in front of you not missing a single angle.
6. check out & go home and be sad to go back to a regular size bedroom :(

Be sure to check out the Bellagio Cafe and the other fine dining restaurants (PICASSO). Skip the buffet as quality has declined over the years.

casino dealers here are filled with stories about Antoine Walker, Shaq, Justin Timberlake and other celebrities. they are quite amusing.

I LOVE the Bellagiol!!  

The suite I stayed in was crazy fabulous....I just wished my own room in my apt. was 1\/2 as gorgeous.  And the bathroom....mmmm....I could've just stayed in my room throughout my whole trip.  The hotel has everything you would want here.....from yummy chocolates to massages\/spa treatments.  

Best of all, I didn't spend a dime to stay there since I was only there for "work."  :)
How to say about this luxury hotel? Room is fine, service is fine, food is fine, but feel not convenient for family stay, specially if u have children with u.

I've been to the Bellagio a few times and it's always fun.  Located at a great spot on the strip.  Seems to be the epicenter of great spots; restaurants, shopping, etc.  The fountains out front are gorgeous and if you are unhappy with your room they will move you somewhere you like.

My friends always get a room with a fountain view.  They usually have a drink and watch the fountains before heading out for the night.  One other thing we usually do is reserve chase lounges at the Cypress pool.  It's not cheap, $75\/day, but it's worth it.  Great service and staff, and no jockeying for chairs.
If you're a gambler the casino is supposed to have the best odds in Vegas.  I don't know about that but the dealers are friendly.  I'm not much of a gambler so you'll have to see for yourself.
If you've never stayed here I encourage you to give it a shot.  If you don't like the smell of flowers when you enter, the 2 story chocolate fountain might get you.  Whatever your flavor, The Bellagio, while not cheap, is worth the visit.

Bellagio is luxurious. It's fun, the pool is amazing. The food is ok, I dropped some serious coin.

I really wanted to leave happy. There were moments of great happiness, but there was an underlying taste of soulless-ness that wouldn't go away. 

Maybe that's just Vegas?

Love the rooms here, beautifully appointed rooms with great view.  Prime is very good, with so many high end shops in the hotel you never have to go outside... Well the fountain show is better viewed at night so it is recommended to go out for that at least.

The room was very nice considering it was a "standard" room. My only complaint about the room is that the bed was WAY to hard for our liking. The casino it's self was pretty crowded, I think most people walk through because if the shopping or just to walk through and check out the hotel and the beautiful decor. We went New Years weekend so there was still decorations up everywhere. When we did win Bellagio was where we hit. Check in was a nightmare, not because if the staff or anything but because if the amount if people checking in. We waited a good 45 minutes just to get to someone at the desk. Overall it was a pretty nice hotel but I think I'll stay elsewhere next time.

Stayed here last week for a reunion. This is more about the restaurants than the hotel. The room was ok. The restaurants however omg.  For breakfast I had lox and bagel. One bagel a few capers rotten tomatoes which I had to send back, a decent amount of lox for one bagel with a smear of cream cheese that was not enough for both sides of the bagel. And a coffee. Price before tip $30. Ok don't care about the price just the rotten tomatoes, chincy cream cheese one bagel. Come on. Then dinner at the steakhouse. $80. For a piece of Chilean sea bass about 5 ounces. But cooked ok. Then dinner at the fix. Shitty ambience no tablecloths. And a 4 oz piece of fish for $48. Plus 12 for 8 sticks of asparagus and 15 for a shot of Macallan 12 yr old scotch.  Wtf.  Is wrong with these places?  It's not the outrageous pricing it's the cheap tiny helpings.  I won't stay at this place again. It ain't worth it. Actually not good. Then there was the bar with a $15 glass of house chard. Charge what you need to but give the customer a decent amount for our money or go lay down by the side of the road like so many of your old competitors.

My girlfriend and I enjoyed the Bellagio in all respects.  We won and lost a little at the casino.  We absolutely loved the water fountain outside.  I think we saw 6 separate shows over a weekends time.  We ate at their enormous buffet and talked about it weeks before actually sitting down at a table.

Most of all, we enjoyed the show O, the Cirque du Soleil show performed in water.  Such a wonderful show as I was engaged every single minute.  I had been to Kooza in Denver, CO and kind of had an idea of what to expect, but it was better than I imagined.  Moving stages from dry to large pools, acrobatics, swimming performances, a true treat.  I can not wait to find another Cirque du Soleil show wherever I am next.

We did not stay at their hotel, we just enjoyed everything Bellagio had to offer.

I loved the Bellagio. The rooms are clean, look new (even though they are not) and the staff were top-notch at check-in and check-out. The bell desk was very helpful with our luggage and getting a taxi.  I would have loved to try the pool, but - winter in Vegas is COLD!

The Bellagio is close to the heart of the Strip, so if you aren't too lazy to walk a bit you can get around pretty easy. 

Why only four stars? Honestly - it is the prices. I know it is a 5 star hotel. But do they really need to charge my life savings for a glass of wine? And the fitness center - just to use the treadmill (for one day) will cost you $25. Yes, you get access to the hot tubs and sauna and steam and all that - but really. $25?

Let me start this out by saying that I love Vegas. I've been there quite a few times and have only ever stayed at the cheaper strip properties like The Flamingo and Excalibur. 
Staying at the Bellagio was a true treat. The hotel  staff was super friendly and took care of all of our needs. The concierge has to be the greatest asset of this place. We used the concierge to get us into all of the best clubs with no cover and no wait. We had a full lake view room and could watch the fountain show from out room day and night. The pool is very well manicured but seems like it was made for laying out more than actual swimming. The atmosphere there is very relaxed. It's a fabulous place to stay if you'd like to splurge a bit.

My ONLY complaint was that most of the dealers here treated the younger looking guests very rudely. Beware of Sandy the Black Jack dealer. She was blatantly rude to everyone at the table and I'm really not sure how she has a job there.

The Bellagio is a beautiful hotel. It houses some really nice restaurants and bars, has a beautiful botanical garden and a candy shop with a flowing chocolate fountain, and even has a gelato place.  The rooms are nice and clean but the front desk service leaves much to be desired.  My reservation, which I had booked and put down a deposit for months in advance, was completely changed from the room I had reserved. I was given a room without the view that I reserved. I got no sleep the 1st two nights due to a rowdy guest that security finally removed the 2nd night due to the entire floor complaining. I had to speak with multiple managers and be quite insistant before I received reimbursement for one night for the lack of sleep . For giving me a different room they gave us vouchers for a meal at the cafe. I had to rrquest a manager after that meal to get the cafe to honor the vouchers.

I'll be back but not to stay...just to walk through and enjoy the views.

Lovely and luxurious as ever, Bellagio continues on a path of elegance and decadence 17 years after it's grand opening. 
 Though I have visited property many times, it's the first time I actually stayed at the hotel for a work conference. 
 First tip- if you are a conference attendee, spa tower is where you want to be, located a few steps away from hallways and ballrooms of the convention center. 
 Though I couldn't snag a strip view, I was quite happy with 26th floor room and view of Rio and Palms.
 Everything about the hotel- beautiful conservatory that was reset to Sakura blossoms only day prior to my arrival, to  tempting, jaw dropping Jean Phillips displays, actual room, beautiful immaculately manicured floral arrangements that get carefully tended to daily- all of it is lovely, charming and inspires feeling of style, elegance and luxury. 
 You simply never want to step out into reality and want to stay in this make believe world. At least as long as the company will pay, lol.
 Everyone I encountered at Bellagio, every last employee was exemplary- friendly, accommodating, incredibly polite and simply operating on a different level. What's more astounding is that they made it feel like a norm and made it look effortless. The bar employees at Bellagio set makes you cringe when you think of some of your better experiences elsewhere. I'm not sure I want to stay at another hotel anymore!
 Simply unforgettable stay and many thanks!
Great Hotel. Love it

Do not stay here and expect your things to be safe.  We had our iPad stolen out of the room safe and they will not do anything about it.  The worst customer service I have ever dealt with.  We were treated like liars.  I would expect this from a 2 star hotel but not the Bellagio.  

Update:  
Contacted customer service after Lori P. of the Bellagio told me to and yet again a horrible experience.  They are refusing to do anything about our stolen iPad that was stolen on their property by their own staff.  Really, Bellagio...you are a joke of a company when you don't even stand behind your employees that you hired...not me.  I lost more money in your casino than the cost of an iPad but it's the principle of the matter.  You took my iPad from the room safe that you provided as a safe place for my belongings and I want it back.  The saddest part of this whole ordeal is that no one has even offered an apology.  They just keep passing the problem to someone else.  I can't tell you how much time I have wasted on the phone talking to these inconsiderate people.  As a doctor, I don't have a lot of free time to spend on hold waiting for the next person and the next person...  I guess they are too busy counting the billions of dollars they made last year to deal with my petty issue.

I love the Bellagio.. it sucks they don't have minimum bidding.. but either way Steve did a fantastic job on creating a journey of beautiful italian architecture and real style to his casino.. a must visit or stay at when in Vegas!!!

This is a pretty dam good casino. It's  a flashier version of the Wynn casino. Everything is very high class. From the shops, the restaurants, bars, and the vibe. It's the casino that you show off to your hot girlfriend coming in from Utah. It's not necessarily the casino to try to meet and socialize with people. As the people here seem very snotty and into themselves. I call it a "show me" casino. Everything is about showing off. Which isn't a bad thing. The music in the casino is decent too. The sportsbook is very gorgeous as well. I also hear good things about the nightclub here.
Still a nice property to visit. The gardens never disappoint. The fountain show is still great. Every visitor that I host always enjoys the Bellagio stop.

Deeply disappointed is the only way to describe our recent stay at the Bellagio. As expected, the grounds and hotel were meticulously maintained but the service was simply awful (especially the concierge, front desk and management). The view from the spa tower is the worst view on the strip. Purchased a high end spa package for the wife but advertised services were omitted and when discussed with management, they could really care less about making amends; main pool was closed for 50% of our stay so they could book a private party; arrogant unpleasant attitudes was prevalent by staff were and these just some of the issues at the Bellagio during our stay. I was so turned off by the Bellagio that I will not support any MGM property ever again. Much much better service at their competitors for the same price.

The worst hotel check in experience I've had ever in my life. The receptionist had a major attitude and extremely rude. She even threatened me to call the security because she didn't want to look into my booking voucher and honor the agreed "resort fee". I don't know why hotel with "5 diamond award" hired people like this lady. She is a disgrace.

THE WORST HOTEL EVER IN TERMS OF SLOT MACHINES\/customer service at slot machines. Put money in to play slot machines & wasn't able to cash out. Actually, the entire floor had problems with cashing out so they had to hand payout everyone. Waited over 30 minutes for payout. No apologies. No explanations. Manager came with attitude. Not coming back - except for the beautiful flower  opt :)) They only had 2 people doing this hand payout thingy

Stayed here Labour day, love this hotel and not only because a friend works here. Everything you could want under one roof. Love the gucci shop and the noodles restaurant -tip get there early before the queues. It's not too expensive for what's  on offer- could live in the bathroom alone which has a shower that could fit five people ( I didn't test this!).

Loved the fountains and our room literally overlooked them centrally as well as the Eiffel Tower. thanks to Henry on reception for his recommendations of how to spend 24 hours in Vegas, we loved it.

Ok so as I'm writing this review I'm so mad because I'm literally in the hotel sitting in the room and like a dummy I listened to my husband who wanted to give it another try to come again , I'm very disappointed with the service . Is 12am and I'm tired and cranky . We booked two suites and when we checked in they told us they didn't have suites with the view of the strip that you had to book it in advance . When you are booking it doesn't give you that option .  to top it off when we get to the suite after we asked the young lady at the front desk  not to put us all the way to the end because we didn't want to walk guess what ? She did . she didn't listen went in one ear and out the other . She gave us the suites on two different floors .we asked to speak  to the manager and he wasn't helpful at all just like the host . Is funny on the phone they are so deceiving being so nice that everything is great but when you arrive is another story. last year the last three times we weren't treated nicely neither . He manage in site wasn't  very accommodating or helpful at all and stuck us at the check in VIP that we don't like . Like I says just because we aren't millionaires they should still treat us like they care . My husband still gambles a good amount of money so that should count for something . I literally wanted to go get a suite at another hotel but since we paid . We didn't want to loose our deposit. Don't come to this hotel if you expect excellence because you won't get it

The Bellagio is one of Las Vegas' most iconic hotels, and I expected big things from a recent weekend spent there. I was disappointed on several levels, including a particularly embarrassing incident in the room that the hotel didn't quite go far enough to address in my view.

We wanted a strip view room, and the only one available was an ADA accessible room in the Spa Tower. The view was nice, but the shower door seal keeping water from leaking out of the shower was entirely insufficient. Every time we showered the entire bathroom floor (which is marble) was completely covered in water. Upon wiping the water up, the towels were covered with black, indicating the floors had not been properly washed in some time. This was gross, and not something I'd expect from a five-star hotel of the Bellagio's stature.

After using up all the bath towels wiping the floor, I called down to housekeeping requesting more. After about 15 minutes no one had showed up yet, so I decided to take a shower using the small remaining towels, assuming housekeeping would leave the towels outside the door when I didn't answer it. While in the shower, I heard housekeeping knock at the door and announce themselves a few times, which I ignored, assuming they'd just leave the towels when no one answered. I was mistaken. I noticed his voice grow louder, and decided to investigate. I opened the bathroom door, planning to put on a robe to answer the knock, only to find myself face to face with a housekeeping employee, naked as the day I was born. He had let himself into the room, apparently ignoring the international symbol of a shower being on meaning someone was likely naked within. This was, as you might imagine, rather offputting.

I went down to the front desk and after about 20 minutes was able to speak to a manager, Gilbert. He was reasonably apologetic, said he'd wave our resort fees (~$44 per night) and follow up with housekeeping. Personally, if I was a hotel manager, I'd consider such an incident a Defcon 1 type situation and go to the ends of the earth to ensure the customer was properly restituted for something like that. I certainly didn't book an expensive room at a five-star resort expecting my privacy to be so egregiously invaded by housekeeping. Needless to say, that incident sullied my perception of the hotel irreparably.

I also encountered several surly dealers, including one woman who rather curtly told me "guy, things change" when I politely inquired about the 6:5 odds on blackjack at a $25 per hand table (which is categorically obscene). Out of curiosity I wandered into the Baccarat lounge, and smiled at a blackjack dealer at a $1,000 per hand table. She sneered at me like I was a piece of garbage. It's true $1,000 per hand is too expensive for me, but I was well dressed and had a pocket full of money ready to spend.

Bottom line, the hotel is beautiful, the fountains are one of the best free shows in Las Vegas, but it seems the hotel staff could use some serious retraining in the basics. I will not be returning to the Bellagio, either to gamble or stay.

Whenever I think of Las Vegas, the Bellagio Hotel comes to mind. With it's grand fountain in front to the conservatory full of flowers inside to the large rooms and great restaurants. The casino and hotel are grand and decorated with every last ounce of grandiour. Sadly, with competition so stiff amongst the hotels... some of the newer hotels with all their bells and whistles are capturing our attention away from all that is the Bellagio. Time to lower the rates to compete!

The casino is beautiful, though the room we got was mediocre. Soap scum on the shower head, and bath tub faucet, cigarette burn on the bed sheets, and a suspicious stain was found on the bench at the end of the bed (gross). I stay at a lot of hotel chains for my job, and I would say I have stayed at nicer rooms through Best Western. This was my first trip to Vegas, and I would have never imagined that somewhere as prestigious as the Bellagio would have had this many problems. 

The manager was very agreeable however, and waived some of the charges, and also offered to set us up with something 'nicer' the next time we come. I give 3 stars for how well the manager handled my complaint, though I doubt that we will be coming back anytime soon.

Pros
-Good location in the heart of downtown Vegas. Walking distance to most popular sites. 
-The Fountains. My favorite! Beautiful & free!
-Chocolate Fountains- Very cool!
-HUGE
-Disney World for Adults
-Famous Buffet (the most elaborate buffet you've ever seen)
-When in the lobby, look up! Incredible glass flowers cover the ceiling. Stunning!
-The Crepe Bakery
-Beautiful pools

Cons
-HUGE -takes 20 minutes to walk to your room
-Oppressive security
-Smoky casino and worn
-Too many people. Lines EVERYWHERE!
-Had to stand in line for 2 hours for the famous buffet (had to call the front desk to ask for a late check-out due to the long wait)
-Cost of Buffet (like most things in Vegas, over-priced)
-The famous garden was very artificial and mobbed by people

It was an experience, but I'll never go back. I'm just not a Vegas person. Too many people, too many lines, too much glut, too much smoke, sad watching seniors citizens on oxygen and in their electric wheelchairs spending their savings on slots.

If Vegas is your thing, you'll probably love The Bellagio.
Make sure to check the seasonal display just beyond the lobby. They always have different decorations made with flowers that are worth a walk through.

Just checked in here. Not impressed, really wanted to stay here because we try out different hotel rooms each year, and I don't think we would stay here again. Bed is horribly uncomfortable. One robe. Outdated feeling. Tub is small. Everything feels scratchy and sort of horrible. A big ol' "meh" for the hotel itself. So far, one of my least favorite Vegas stays. Going with air b'n'b again next time. Regret that we booked this two nights and I'm only on night one.

Hosted a vow renewal weekend this past weekend.  Everything was on par and beyond expectations.  Utilized the cabanas (Charles was amazing), salon service (nails, makeup, hair)...overpriced for nails, the chairmans club, and hosted private dinner at sensi (Rebecca and April were fabulous).  Bellagio never disappoints but this time exceeded expectations!

First of all save your money and head over to the Venetian. A way more family friendly environment. The bellagios customer service sucked! No bell hop to offer help with our luggage. Checking in took forever. We requested a king size bed but got left with two queen size beds instead. They were supposed to update us the following day on information on relocating to a room with a king but never heard anything from them the rest of the trip. And it also took way too long to get out of the hotel just to get to the parking garage. You literally have to walk through the entire hotel just to get outside. Definitely will be staying somewhere else next time that's actually WORTH the amount we paid.

Had a great time and great stay at the Bellagio.  Although it was a little crowded at check in it was worth the wait.  Room was great with a great view of the strip.  I used the gym for two days and they had enough weight and cardio equipment to make it a good workout.  Casino was clean and friendly too.

The Bellagio hotel is breathtaking!  As you enter the Bellagio your eyes are drawn to ceiling to the 2,000 hand blown glass blossoms that make up the magnificent a Fiori di Como  by glass sculptor Dale Chihuly. As you check in it is easy for your eyes to roams over the shoulder of the friendly staff who are checking you in as they are drawn to the amazing floral display.  But this is just a prelude to the spectacular Conservatory & Botanical Gardens which is like walking through a imaginary wonderland of exquisite flower displays, dazzling water features and unique rare butterfly atriums.  What could ever top all of this you might ask?  The amazing Bellagio fountain show!  It never gets old!  Every time I experience the music, combined with the beautiful water display my heart swells! There is something so emotional about the experience!  I recommend trying to get a reservation at one of the many Bellagio restaurants that have outdoor patios overlooking the fountain.

During our visit we stayed in room 28072 which overlooks the fountains!  The room is in a quiet part of the hotel away from elevators, service closets, etc. The room had a modern blue and white decor which was extremely calming!  The room and bathroom are spacious.  There is a large window to view the fountains and it adds a certain open feeling to the room.

The Bellagio pools and courtyard is very beautiful!  It is composed of 6-7 different pools surrounded by tons of trees and lined with private cabanas!   They have a large drink list and a reasonable menu however I recommend having a nice relaxing lunch at the pool cafe!

Did I miss anything?  Yes!  The amazing restaurants, clubs and poker room!  The spa is beautiful!  

Other note worthy items:
Gym fee is already included in room\/hotel fee
Hotel does NOT smell like smoke! 
Staff is really friendly
Room 28068 which my mother in law stayed in is right across from servers closet which can be very noisy

I stayed in the hotel while my new apartment was getting ready for our move in and well I was very impressed that the rooms are huge the staff are sweet kind and nice. It feels like home not a hotel. And to top it all its very pretty. It's a lot of hotels in Vegas each is different but I enjoyed my stay and will return as often as I can. Its lots to see and buy I give it five stars total. The stay the Shop its worth it please believe.

I stayed here for the third time over the weekend before New Year's Eve, and as always, it was an excessively wonderful experience.  

Despite the proximity to a major holiday, we got a fantastic room rate.  The particular room my friends and I stayed in was in the Main Tower, and let me begin by saying, the room is HUGE.  Maybe I've just been in New York too long, but by Manhattan standards, I am lucky to have a really big room -- but this was probably bigger than my room and my roommate's room put together.  Actually, I am fairly sure it was bigger than my entire apartment.  Maybe that's not saying much, but still.

The room had two queen beds, a desk, two plush sofa chairs, an enormous floor-to-ceiling walnut entertainment center, and a marble bathroom, with a luxuriously large bathtub and a sexy, all-glass shower.  

I rarely stay on the Strip when I am in Las Vegas, but when I do -- it's Bellagio or bust.

This was my second time staying here and it was cold so I didn't get to use the best thing about this hotel... the pools!  It's a beautiful hotel but lacks some things I consider necessary to get a 5 star:  slippers in the room, a fridge, and some way to make hot water at night for tea.  Did I mention the pools are beautiful!  Also the room service is really nice and the food is great.

Make sure you head over to the Bellagio to check out the beautiful botanical gardens.  When I was here, the Icelandic poppies were in bloom and it filled most of the lobby with a great flowery smell that cancelled out the smoke from the casino.  The butterfly garden and fountains also provided awesome tourist attractions and picture taking spots.  Make sure you bring plenty of patience along with you because there are always massive crowds in the Bellagio.

The Bellagio has classy architecture, beautiful fountains and a unique botanical garden that all can enjoy but at times the Bellagio seemed more like Disneyland than a posh Vegas hotel\/casino.  It is clearly stated on the Bellagio website that unattended children and strollers are absolutely not allowed in the Bellagio.  However, when I was at the Bellagio there were strollers galore and marauding children all over the place.  The Bellagio could do much better in living up to their five star reputation and create a more adult friendly atmosphere by adhering to their own self stated policy involving children.

A beautiful hotel, but the guest rooms are quite average considering you can find nicer rooms at other Las Vegas hotels for a much cheaper price. 

That being said, you shouldn't stay here because you want to stay in a nice hotel. The price you're paying is for the location and the view of the fountain from your room. The hotel is in a great location in the center of the strip. You'll have access to everything you want to do\/see in Las Vegas. This means more money. Everyone loves watching the fountain show in front of the Bellagio. Why not watch the show out your window, naked in the comfort of your own room? Try doing that outside. Now compare the cost of your stay at the Bellagio to the the amount of money it will take you to bail you out of jail for indecent exposure. Not too bad right? Man, that was a horrible night....er I mean, that's what I heard happened to a friend of mine.

I give this a thumbs up I have been here since 17 yrs ago when I got married here in Vegas the buffet has change a lot after 17 yrs ago lots and lots  and lots  of food to choose I love the decor in here and when you walk into the Bellaigo hotel everything has been updated and upgraded  a lot thanks for a memorable visit after 17 yrs I especially love the garden it is so breath taking and beautiful to see the flowers there

The attentive service and authentic interactions of Bellagio staff with guests makes for a memorable experience.  What makes Bellagio outstanding are how many people stop and take the time to say hello and also attend to handicapped guests.  KUDOS Bellagio for providing a complimentary wheelchair and finding so many ways  to assist guests with disabilities.  You make Vegas distances doable.

I stayed here, so none of that 'posing' where I rate this place cause I was gambling or something.

Check-in was a breeze.

They have these glass things bolted to the roof. Each could easily be like 20-50 lbs a piece.

They have security at the elevators 24\/7 which leaves creepy wanderers out which is nice. Some peeps I knew were in the other tower and even though I flashed my card, they never let me go up by myself, which kinda sucks.

The atrium\/garden is definitely worth checking out. They always change the place according to the seasons and is a nice reminder that Vegas is NOT just about sex, drugs, and alcohol.

The chocolate fountain is so amazing and draws a crowd, you just wanna end up taking a chocolate bath or something.

Their pool area is pretty chill and laid back. Definitely a family\/adult feel to it. It was Memorial Day weekend and there weren't any pool parties, just folks lounging around.

It's really well maintained and there's always staff cleaning various areas.

The fountain outside also makes it feel cool to stay here, knowing that people are gathering outside just to check out a water explosion. :P

Oh, and free Wi-Fi? Hells to the yeah!!!

This place is defiantly upscale!! The hotel is amazing!! Clean, attractive, lots to see and do within. This is my 3rd visit to Vegas and staying at the Bellagio was on my bucket list. However, I would never stay here again. The staff is rude (extremely) rude. You pay a 25$ per day resort fee which is to cover the cost of free wi-fi, pool usage, and the use of the fitness center.  Well only thing I used was the internet and that was maybe for an hour or less, the only reason I used it was because I felt like I would get some use of my money. I have HotSpot on my cell so there was no need for me to really connect to their "free" wi-fi".  In my opinion for the price paid to stay here per night those amenities should automatically be included.  If you have lots of money and it shows then stay here. If you're middle class and just want to come to Vegas and have a great time without the rude staff, extra charges and tight machines then pick another hotel. I've stayed at Planet Hollywood and MGM here in Vegas and I have not one complaint.

The Bellagio is located in the heart of the strip.  The staff here are friendly and extremely accommodating.  The hotel is gorgeous with a sizable pool area..  The 2 bedded room was a little disappointing as the design seemed outdated and bland.  As with most hotels,  you can expect to be surprised with resort fees which are substantial and yet there are no perks offered which separate its guests from those visiting off of the street.  On site restaurants are excellent but should offer discounts to hotel guests since prices are very high. A 38 dollar buffet is aggressive since the average person can walk up the street and have a 10 dollar breakfast.  In conclusion,  the hotel is properly run and well staffed but lacks in offering the little things which give customers a desire to return and since competition is more than fierce along the strip, it's almost essential that they do.
Arrived 2pm Sunday. Asked if a complimentary upgrade was available. Did the "$20 sandwich".  No dice.  Waiting for room. Will edit review when I see the room.

I stayed at the Bellagio for a work event. I was throughly surprised by the Beauty of the hotel in person. When I walked through the front door I was immediately greeted with warm welcomes and big smiles (it was a dental event so smiles are always encouraged lol). Our check in process was very easy, considering how many people were in line, we didn't wait very long. Jean (or Jeannie from San Diego, CA) was greeting people in line and helping them make sure they were in the right line and just making conversation while we waited. She gave us some good tips on sight seeing and things to check out for our first time in Vegas. Aaron from Honolulu, HI checked us in and he was very nice, great customer service skills and very fast without feeling rushed. He gave us tips about the room and what not to touch so we don't get charged extra.
The room was beautiful and so was the view. Everything in the room was well decorated and very clean. The drapes were automatic which made waking up nice. They also provide robes to help make you feel really comfortable. The beds are memory foam and very comfortable (I slept like a baby).
The amenities are amazing! The pool was gorgeous! I have never gambled before and the selection was good. I personally loved the wheel of fortune because I liked spinning the wheel  I would highly recommend this hotel for corporate events, or just getting away!

Thanks to a friend, we literally received the VIP treatment during our weekend celebrating another friend's 40th Birthday. What a beautiful hotel with great service. The suite was super clean, super comfy, super classy and just super awesome. 
The location was great and we were walking distance to where we needed to go during our stay and we just loved taking advantage of the snacks available at the VIP lounge.

This place was classy, probably the classiest place to put yourself in complete and utter financial ruin. My friends and I? Not so classy. After driving from New York to Vegas in a 1995 Ford Taurus with no air conditioning and no showers, we were bound to be a bit...sketchy.

And smelly.

We looked like vagabond derelicts who did not belong in the Bellagio. But I insisted. After seeing Ocean's 11, how could one NOT gamble a bit here? Due to our appearance, we were treated quite poorly by the staff. Waitresses would ignore us as we gambled at the slots or even at the tables. My friend lost all the money he brought on the trip and I ended ahead at the end of the night. But sober. Quite disappointing. Perhaps I'm a bit too into the run down for the Bellagio to ever give me the time of day, but one day...when I own a decent pair of shoes and a nice shirt, MAYBE ON THAT DAY, I will be able to get a drink from a wandering waitress.
Awesome hotel\/casino. We had a great view of the water show in the front, which is a must see. There are several different bars, clubs, restaurant as well as a buffet.

Bellagio has seriously gone down hill. I can't believe this is a 5 star hotel. It took over 10 minutes just to check it with only one person in front of me. I thought there was a hold up only on my line but it was that slow every single line. When you are finally in, there are series of weirdos Bellagio staffs standing in front of the elevators checking for people's room key before they can enter the elevator. TALK ABOUT LOW CLASS ! They could have hired private security and camera to watch for shady people, but to check us like we were criminals were extremely insensitive and stressful. This has never happened at any 3-4 stars hotel. They checked us not only once but twice. They didn't check everyone, just who ever they thought were suspicious??? But come on, how can you still be suspicious after checking on the same guy just ten minute ago? Are the employees really this unintelligent? The music played over the loud speaker was Boy George's Culture Club "Chameleon" . IT's like this placed was still trapped in the 80's. Their pools were advertised as "heated in the winter" and we called ahead to confirm. The pool was freezing cold when we arrived. No wonder no one was swimming. WAIT it wasn't even winter. IT was during November. All the other 3 stars hotels were generous enough to heat up their pools warm enough about 80+ degrees for swimming guests. This is ridiculous. Very disappointing experience. The hotels is beautiful but so are many other in Vegas. Service was shocking. I can't believe they were so cheap to not even turn on the water heater warm enough for people to swim as advertised on their website. I booked their hotels simply for the heated pool and end up "Frozen".

The Bellagio has so much to offer.  Was recently there and saw the conservatory beautifully decorated in the Chinese New Year\/Year of the Horse theme.  The theme changes often, so always worth a gander.  Of course, the fountains outside are one of, if not the, best free sight in Vegas.  The lobby with the Dale Chihuly ceiling glass sculptures are breathtaking and something you'd usually have to pay an art museum admission price to see (in many cities in the U.S., London, or worldwide). We were really looking forward to our (mid-Jan. 2014) visit to the Bellagio art gallery, but were disappointed to find it is currently temporarily closed.  This is one of the nicest hotels in Vegas...if you can't stay here, at least come and soak up the ambience.

Rude staff, tries to charge you and sell you upgrades to everything. Hotel is not all it is cracked up to be. I would stay at 15 other hotels before this one again. Way over priced, too. Also in the room if you touch or even bump over the food or beverages in the frig or counter, you pay for them. Rediculius! Every food & everage is marked up very high, too. Smokey casino, average decor and theme but not impressive.

Great location, if not the best, on the strip; Expensive; Classy; Memorable!  The water fountains are a huge attraction and being centrally located and so luxurious, it attracts people from all the other hotels ..... which means...it's always busy in the casino floor.  This is the place to be to get some eye exercise....if you know what I mean!

over rated.  totally.  the hotel's unique floral arrangement area and water show are cool, but that's about it.  the rooms are up to par compared to other "name brand" hotels on the las vegas strip.  the gym is really nice, but $25?  come on.  unnecessary.  it should be included considering the $399\/night room charge

summary: nice to walk by and see the interior, but stay somewhere else...like the palazzo or wynn :)

Stayed June of 2014. The Bellagio is a beautiful hotel. We had an upper floor Tower room which was more than a five minute walk to the casino floor (only downside to staying on that end of hotel). That being said, we enjoyed every minute of our stay and we even won enough to enjoy the perks of having a dedicated casino host for future visits which is always nice!  Do not hesitate to stay here and make sure to get the M Life card... Maybe you will get lucky like we did! Good Luck!!

I just returned from Vegas for a trade show, my coworkers stayed at the Cosmopolitan and I thought I'd spoil myself by staying at the Bellagio.  Last year I stayed at the Pallazo which i loved and figured the Bellagio would be even better.  

What a disappointment, when checking in they informed me my room reserved was only available in a smoking room which they said would definitely smell like smoke.  They were then nice enough to downgrade me to another room, I had no choice in the matter.  Since I booked it through SW airlines and not directly through their front desk I basically get what I get. As expected the room was a Motel 6 quality with a nice bathroom.

I make good money and can afford to stay in nice places, the Bellagio room wasn't even as nice as my bedroom at home.  Their casino is also as others have written, outdated.  

My second night i actually checked in the Cosmopolitan to be closer to the trade show and nothing special about the Bellagio.

Next time to Vegas I will stay at the Pellazo
Absolutely beautiful during the holiday season. We always have a wonderful time here.

Came here for family vacation, not my first time in Vegas.  First try at checking in they told me I can't check in since the room was in my dad's name.  I said my name was on it too, but was refused service.  I told her I had two confirmation numbers, one for my dad's room and one for mine and the one for me had my name, but she refused to look at my paper because she said "I could have printed it out anyhwere"  I got back in line and talked to someone else, and surprise they said I could check in, so the first woman was not only rude, but wrong.  

Before leaving after our stay, they had some construction up, and hotel "security" workers trying to manage people for safety reasons. Hotel worker "Michael" calls my family "You people", singles us out to block our movement while other people are allowed to pass, then when my dad tries to move he shoves him in the chest.  We complain to the head of security at the Bellagio, and get a pretty shitty apology, and told there isn't much that can be done other than an internal review.  I don't think any hotel workers should be able to put hands on a customer and shove them.  

Pretty much a terrible experience from start to finish.  Would not stay here again.

Oh Bellagio, How do I love thee? Let me count the ways! 

So for our second (family) trip to Vegas we decided to stay in the Bellagio- the main reason? It was one of the cheapest options for the quality offered (we booked with expedia), and it worked out a fair bit cheaper than the lower rated hotels. Also, having been before to Vegas, Bellagio (without a shadow of a doubt) is one of the most spectacular hotels on the strip - no naff gondolas or pirates, just pure opulence (and a fountain or two!)

Firstly, our room was just a standard room (personally, we spend little time in our room on holiday as we prefer hitting the streets and seeing the sights!) with two double beds. This humble abode was perfectly suited though, and served it's purpose of being a pitstop before going back into that lovely Nevada heat. Furnishings were all fine and didn't seem to be too worn, the big TV and safe worked perfectly. The bathrobes were nice and waffely (snuggle snuggle) and the bathroom was clean, with lots of marble but it was standard. The shower, nice as it was big, wasn't the best, but I'm just being pinnickity now. We stayed in the Venetian last time, and although the room there was a lot more grand and had more in-room facilities, we never used any of them, and a lot of space was never used.

Secondly, what makes the Bellagio a five star hotel for me? Location. Having this hotel slap bang in the centre of the strip is perfect , and personally I think that location is key when choosing a hotel in LV. Hotels like the Venetian, Mandalay( as beautiful as they are) are just a bit too far out (location wise!) for me. Furthermore, unlike the Venetian (where it took 20 minutes to walk to our room - no freaking joke!), it literally took 5 minutes from entering the hotel to get to our room-perfect when your feet were as blistery as mine - yum! 
also... ALL HAIL THE TRAM! ALL HAIL THE TRAM! (sorry..gotta get that out there!) Seriously, Tram = EPIC WIN. It's free (free in Las Vegas you say?!? unlike the bally's one..grr) and takes you to City Center, Aria and Monte Carlo, saving your feet the (longish) walk. Also the Tram is all purple and tinted, and hardly busy and gives you some nice views of the new mahoosaf and shiny City Center Complex. 

Another great thing about the Bellagio? The great choice of food,shops etc. The shops are amazing (Chanel, Gucci, Tiffany, Giorgio Armani...*sigh*) and although we never ate at the Olives restaurant , it looked super good (and always busy- proof in the pudding!) We did dine in the Café Bellagio (for breakfast) and my mother and I had the brioche raspberry french toast (soo soo good..even the thought leaves me salivating) and my brother had the omelette which was a bit dry and not the nicest(but it came with some nice toast and hash brown\/rosti stuff which was scrummy),- price wise, not the cheapest, but worth it (for the french toast anyway). Hotel lobby with  the handpainted glass flowers? Beeeauutifulll, absolutely beautiful. The Conservatory? AH-DORABLE! Lots of cute snails and bees made out of flowers, cool water installations and they even make the huge-ass ant models look cute- aww!
 And the fountains, oh the fountains! Frank sinatra + swaying fountains = happy me! Also a few resident ducks swim in the water (frequently watching the show..see if you can spot them!)

Finally, a big reason I love the Bellagio? The super smiley staff! All the cleaners were happy and chatty, which was greatly appreciated, and any other hosts\/conciergey people always did their best to make sure any questions\/qualms you had were sorted - first class service for a first class hotel.

To conclude, Mr Bellagio Hotel, you are wonderful. Apart from looking spectacular on the outside, you have a heart of shiny shiny gold with your wonderful amenities and super staff and cute fountains. When I return to Vegas, I know where I will be booking in to (if you haven't got the subdude hints here -it'll be the bellagio :) ).
The Bellagio is a beautiful Casino\/Hotel.  Their fountain water display in front is unbelievable.

Checked in after New Years. Didn't enjoy out time at Rio, really regret it. 

Moved from a Deluxed Room at Rio to a Penthouse Suite at the Bellagio is so wonderful. 
Bellagio staff was so nice to search for the next available Penthouse giving it to us first. We ever we're in Vegas we always stayed here everything here is just about as good as it gets. Love the garden, buffet, restaurants, and how great the rooms look. Plus it's in the heart of the strip, right in the middle. Just love it

I've been through here many times and have eaten at several of the restaurants, but was finally able to spend a staycation here. Who doesn't love a getaway that is only a 20 minute drive from home?

There are a lot of good things to say about the room at The Bellagio. The room was well decorated and has a luxurious feel. I also found it to be clean with comfortable bedding. The toiletries included more than the usual so no fear if you forget something at home. 

One of my favorite things was the distance from parking garage to check-in to room. We like to do staycations in our town and find Vegas to be notorious for lengthy walks. I don't mind walking, but not with suitcases. Not at The Bellagio! Here the garage is next to the check-in area and was less than a five minute walk. All Vegas hotels will require you to walk through the casino to get to the room, but this was the shortest walk of any I've stayed at so far. 

The check-in line was long, but I expected this. The line is always long here. Fortunately, we made it to the front in about 15-20 minutes. 

The property has one of the largest selections of restaurants, especially fine dining. Many of the restaurants are strategically placed to have fountain side views. There is also a lot of higher end shopping on property. The Bellagio Fountains and Conservatory are beautiful. They even have one of the Cirque shows available on site for entertainment.

The only negative I found with the room was lack of coffee maker. I get that they want to force you to buy coffee through room service or one of the restaurants\/shops, but it's terribly inconvenient. Just put a Keurig in the room and charge for pods like the mini bar. You'll still make your beloved coffee dollars and increase guest satisfaction.

One thing that did leave a bad taste in my mouth was the resort fee. This has sadly become so standard here and is nothing more than deceptive pricing. When we checked in we were informed that the fee was $35 ($32 fee + $3 tax). I nicely explained that we were locals and would not be using Internet, gym, pool, and anything else the fee is supposedly for. I asked if we could waive this fee since we wouldn't be using any of these things. The clerk called his manager and was told that it's a mandatory fee so he couldn't waive it. Isn't this like charging parking for someone without a car? If it's for the amenities they say it is and I'm not using them then it should be waived. Again, most of the resorts in town are doing this so Bellagio isn't inventing the wheel here, but I'd like to see someone break the cycle.
This is my favorite hotel in the world. It has a good feeling like home and the fountains are amazing. It is very clean and very comfortable.

I've yet to stay here, since I'm allergic to spending shitloads of money on hotel rooms, and additionally, because I'm reeeeeaally cheap, but I'll review the hotel for its decor throughout it's gloriously well-appointed, beautiful golden casino.

The last two times I was in Vegas, we went to Bellagio for the buffet breakfast.  Three years ago, it was hangover food.  Did the trick!  This last time, in January, no hangover, which allowed me to appreciate the interior decor more than the previous visit.

In general, I am not a fan of Chihuly glass.  It's just a little too grotesque for me.  Writhing, snaking organic shapes rendered in psychedelically colored glass is just not that appealing to me.  I acknowledge that Chihuly is a living master, and who the hell am I to critique the greatest glass artist alive, but TFB.  Maybe because I grew up in California, where glass worth as much as a house could break at the slightest little temblor, or maybe because it's just so absurdly priced that I can't imagine justifying its value in the millions for some pieces.  BUT....the chandelier (what an inadequate word) in the lobby of Bellagio, a Chihuly original, is stunning.  I mean really, it takes your breath away and leaves you speechlessly stricken with glee.  And considering how lovely the entire lobby and casino are, that's saying something.

Quality materials are used throughout the hotel.  It's just plain beautiful.  It's loveliness utterly defies description, so I really don't think I should even try.

The conservatory is completely redone depending upon the season, and no expense is spared in changing the artwork and foliage out.  Since both of my last two visits fell around Chinese New Year, it was decorated for the occasion.  Absolute gorgeousness!

My review, however, lacks the fifth star, because I'll be damned if I'll pay $20.00 to get into their gallery to see the pieces they have on display.  Bitches, please.  That's EXACTLY where I draw the line.

PROS:
1. The room and bathroom are nice and big.

2. The shower has amazing water pressure. This is important to Southern California folks because of the drought. 

3. Hotel staff was nice and professional. 

4. The lobby and restaurants are beautiful and amazing. The food is delicious, but, OVERPRICED. 

5. The SPA is good. But, OVERPRICED for what you get. 

6. They have about six pools with towel service. But, the pool closed at 8pm. Why? It would've been nice to have dinner by the pool. 


CONS: 
1. The casino was very SMOKY. Walking through the casino, you were assaulted with the stink of smoke. This was a horrible experience for people who don't smoke. They need to designate a smoking section for the smokers. Or do a better job of removing the smoke out of the casino. 

2. The lady who checked me in did not give me the room I had paid\/asked for. After complaining to management I got a room with pool view... It was a hassle because I was very tired after my flight, getting to the hotel, standing in line, walking passed the crowd to get to the room, which felt like a mile away. 

3. I stayed about five days. The room and bathroom were very clean at first. Subsequently, there was only surface cleaning. The bathroom was not completely cleaned the rest of the week. I found hair on the floors. 

4. Lines for everything: to check-in, to get food, at the concierge desk...

5. Last, but not least, the hostess at Olive, an upscale restaurant at the hotel, was rude. We had reservations and had specifically asked for a table by the window to see the water show. She told us that we couldn't have the table because another party, who had been waiting for over an hour, was getting the table. I told her that we had reserved the table earlier that day (at least 2.5 hours prior) and specifically asked to sit by the window. She said that we had to wait at least another 30 minutes and after then, they'll see. After our reservation and waiting for at least 30 minutes, if a table by the window became available, we could have it.

Bellagio is a wonderful hotel\/casino\/buffet. I have never stayed in the Bellagio but their garden and buffet are the bomb. They have a wide variety of food\/desserts. Bellagio is the perfect place to go when you are very hungry. Their prices are kind of pricey  but you get a lot out of what you pay for. I recommend going here.

I love Bellagio for all its opulence and exquisite everything. Went here with my boyfriend for our anniversary and didn't want to leave. They probably have the best spa ever. It was so beautiful and even though my treatments were just ok, it was just worth the money to relax in the facility. Wonderful pool area and kick-ass buffet!

I know this is a beautiful hotel, but I can't give more than a three even though we scored a great deal for our room.  

Why?  Amenities!  Last year we stayed at the Excalibur and the room at Bellagio was definitely nicer (the bathroom was amazing) with a gorgeous view of the fountains (we upgraded), but at the Excalibur you have free access to the gym (and it was a nice gym at that).  Not so at the Bellagio.  Instead you have to pay for gym and spa access.  Mind you,  the spa access does not include any treatments either.  Just access to their sauna etc.  Considering that most major hotels across the country allow free gym access, I find this to be a major issue.  

Now the other major issue is shared by all hotels on the Strip.  I don't know what it is about Las Vegas, but why isn't internet access free?  It is at most any other nice hotel in the country.  

Other issues: 

The Bellagio does not hand out any freebies at all, unlike some of the other hotels on the strip.  

Unfortunately, during our stay there was a fair amount of construction noise going on from the Cosmopolitan next door.  We've run into this issue before while in Vegas.  I don't know why they have to start noisy construction machinery at 5AM in the morning.  It may have even been earlier than that.  Very annoying.  

Despite all that, we did have a nice stay.  Especially since we were able to watch constant fountain shows from our room all night.  The fountain shows at Bellagio are the nicest on the strip.

My wife and I stayed there this past summer. WOW just wow. We loved the bellagio. It is right in the center of things, and the garden is beautiful. And the fountains are something to druel about. They are so beautiful at night as well. Don't bother staying anywhere else.

The best location on the strip. I had a wonderful stay at this hotel for 4 days with an amazing view of the fountains. The room was old, but it was spacious and the bed was new. They have a new tower on the side, but the view from the new tower can never match the view from the original tower.
Book a room above the 20th floor and make sure you ask for the fountain view, it will be the most memorable stay in Vegas.

I love coming to the Bellagio. The huge glasswork on the ceiling where you check into the hotel is beautiful. Plus their botanical garden that they happen to change up from season to season is always amazing. Waterfalls and beautiful flowers everywhere. As you walk around the corner to then see the chocolate shop with the chocolate waterfall. This place is amazing. Just the architecture is beautiful.

Of the limited number of casinos I was able to visit along Las Vegas Blvd., Bellagio was probably my favorite, primarily for its elegance. It gave me the most relaxed, comfortable feel as I toured the tables, restaurants, and scenery. It did not feel to me as if it has as much manufactured pretense as some of the others. As I expected, you have to be prepared to pay a bit more for a room here, or do some good hunting to get a good rate at a slower time of the year, but I would be prepared to do that homework. I probably should have been more impressed with the fountain, but I'm just not a fan of the song "Viva Las Vegas" regardless of just how great Elvis was or how appropriate the song is. I am, however, a fan of Bellagio.

Excellent experience! The staff is very helpful and friendly, the rooms are very nice, the hotel scenery is great. Plenty of shops inside. The water show is a must see. Conference rooms very nice, only small pick is they are far from the rooms. Would definitely stay here again.

Everything in its right place, pools are majorly used in the summer but somehow magically kept very clean--love that they're all different temperatures, including a cold one wtih a fountain you can swim around, drinks are good, service is great, restaurants in the casino are good but not a good value. Great gelato made in-house and just as affordable as any Berkeley institiution, nice generously sized rooms.

I thought my stay at the Bellagio would be great; great service, great food, great rooms, etc. Unfortunately, it was anything but. 

We were first being informed our room was not ready (THREE TIMES and after the check in time), I found the room to be small and without the modernity other resorts offer on The Strip. When my husband and I went to breakfast, we were ignored by the staff. They talked at their station for ten minutes before even coming to the table. Then my coffee cup and plate were dirty, covered in messy syrup. 

While the concierge tried to make the experience better, by offering us a room upgrade, it did NOT make up for their lack of service. They even had the audacity to say that the dirty dishes were not their responsibility because they do not run the restaurant. The last time I checked, the resort runs everything and they are all owned by the same company. 

The only thing that was great at the Bellagio was Pam in the Salon. She did my hair for my elopement and I couldn't have asked for anything better. She understood my style. Pam was a blast to talk to and work with and even though I won't be staying at the Bellagio next time, I will definitely stop in to see Pam!

Although some of the staff was fantastic, the overall experience we had was awful.  The room upgrade was nice, but not enough for all of the horrible service throughout the resort.
Quick tip. If you are driving, use the side entrance off of Flamingo. The entrance on the strip is always packed and the line getting in is crazy.

Gorgeous garden with tons of natural light and fresh air! Spectacular water\/fountain show, that everyone should visit in Vegas! Apart from these two highlights though, Bellagio is well worth a stroll through, especially since it is so conveniently located in the middle of the Strip. Do note that hotel is pretty crowded - garden, walkways, everywhere. So it's a bit of a pain of walk through and navigate all the crowds, but their general ambiance there is really nice and well worth a visit! Their prices are a bit more expensive than other hotels you might find on the Strip though - rooms and food there.

The sportsbook is not that great and the beers are $10, which is more expensive than the pool at Mandalay!  Better to get your beer while gambling at the cheap slots and then come here to watch the game.

Spent a very nice weekend here with my wife. Checked in on Friday night and stayed in a Deluxe Fountain View Room (or so we thought). The Bellagio is a very nice hotel that caters to an "older" crowd than most hotels on the Strip. Since we're not "kids" any more we appreciated not being around that age group. Staff was very friendly and seemed genuinely interested in ensuring we had a great time.  Dealers and Bar Tenders were mostly very friendly too. Room Service was outstanding (see photos) and very affordable.

I deducted one star because I found out today that we weren't in the room we paid for. We were on the 8th floor but the Deluxe View Rooms start on floor 9. We'll see what Bellagio has to say about that.

I stayed here in April. Check in and check out were both very easy. I like that they have a person directing traffic at check in. It makes it less chaotic. You do have to hope that the person in front of you isn't making a million requests. My husband and I came to see an ACDC concert and we only stayed one night. We checked in an hour and a half before we had to leave. We called room service and ordered their three course dinner special. We got a chopped salad, steak and a chocolate dessert. We heard a knock on our door 25 minutes later. I have never had room service come up that quickly. It's beyond me how they were able to prepare all of our food and deliver it in under 30 minutes. The food was delicious and prepared to our specifications. We got shuttled for free from the Bellagio to the MGM arena where the concert was at. We called over the phone to check out the next day. They had made a mistake with our bill and fixed it right away. If I hadn't reviewed the bill on the tv I may have missed it. I would stay here again. Their customer service is excellent. I wasn't disappointed with anything.

This is the worst Check in experience!
Ok stay.
In room dining kept messing up on orders
Room clean and updated.

Pros:
-Clean, modern rooms
-Comfortable bed\/bedding (I had the most restful night since I can remember)
-bathroom was spacious and luxurious even in a basic room
-superior customer service 


Cons:
-as previously stated by other guests, the ventilation is a bit lacking, walking through the casino on a Sunday night, you'll get a healthy dose of smoke
-our entire floor had a faint odor of vomit the entire stay
-upon check in we were quoted one price, I believe around 180+\/-(plus fees), looking at the card statement, it was rung up for $211, then immediately returned, then$247 and immediately returned...never mentioned any of this to us... All we were told at check out was  "your card isn't accepting this charge." 

Well duh, you kept charging and refunding, something probably alerted security...

Gave them a second card... Accepted. No receipt...ok. Check the statement...
$377. 

Now, I was already a little peeved that we were paying a $36 resort fee, on top of 12% tax... But we were never told we would have a $130 hold put on the card for any potential amenities...until we spoke to guest services.


I get it.. You're the Bellagio. You're paying for the name and experience. But please be more up front with your pricing. 

*also!* make sure you don't mess with the mini bar. They only say this in very fine print, but if you take anything out for more than a few seconds, a sensor is set off and your room gets charged for it, whether or not you put it back!!


Final note, I'm still giving this place 4 stars... I'm not an a-hole. Employees in the casino were exceedingly helpful when I misplaced my jacket. They were so courteous and friendly, and retrieved it from the vault within minutes. 

Just please be more transparent in your pricing to avoid potential headaches :)

My favorite place to stay in Vegas hands down.  I've been to Vegas only  about 10 times, and the last three times, I've stayed at the Bellagio. 

Can you say remote control mini-blinds?  HUGE Godzilla like Jet tub in the bathroom?  (ooohh my girlfriends and I loved this HUGE tub feature and I WISHED I was not single all three times I stayed here.)
Each year, me and the girls would take a few  three day tours trip.  Not 'The Hangover' style, kind of trip, but just to go and work. 
(We did promotions for Weight training protein shakes and went during the bodybuilding expos- no naughty ideas here kids- sheeeeesh)
Anyhow, we always tried to room at the Bellagio and always got the room for 99.00 per night for all three of us.  That's right. 99.00 per night. 
To be fair, this was in May\/June.  
Plus, we were treated like royalty because of the company we were with, and who we represented and worked for.
