We booked a Premier Lakefront Room as we love watching the fountains from our room.  Every time I have previously stayed, the fountain music plays in the room and the show is spectacular. We paid top dollar for the room at the rate of $400 a night only to get to our room and be told that the music was not available as they were switching cable providers.  When I called the manager to complain we were told the problem had just been fixed but it was not.  I feel we were duped. The fountain show (the entire reason to pay for the lakefront room) is nowhere near as nice without the music. I feel that Bellagio should have informed us at check in that there was a problem and offered us the option of a different room, especially as we paid a premium for the show.  Instead we were offered a refund of the resort fee.  Nice, but not nearly enough in my opinion. Not good enough Bellagio, charging full price for a premium room with half a show.

At first you're going to be put off by the high prices...but the food is actually very good for poolside eats and portions are very robust.

I have to give this place kudos b\/c our food took almost an hour to come out (all we did was order omelets) and we were royally annoyed b\/c we were missing peak sun time and our stuff was at risk of getting removed b\/c our belongings were saving seats by the pool for almost an hour.

Our waitress was very sympathetic and apologetic...so much so, that she expressed the unpleasantry to the manager, and he waived our bill!  I was shocked - it was a $50 breakfast!  I thought they would just send some fruit out to say sorry, but they comp'd us the breakfast instead.  What great service!  It turned our frowns upside down.

Ah, the Bellagio.  So heavenly.  A gift because God knows I couldn't afford it, but hands down the loveliest hotel on the Strip.  We could see the cheesy but amazing water fountain show from our window, and the casino was a pretty classy operation.   Bed = super comfy.  Drapes moved by buttons (okay, I wasted at least an hour of our stay opening and closing the drapes.  Never got old.) But the real mystique of the Bellagio is in the service.  Sample room service conversation:

Me:  Hi, I'd like a skinny double cappuccino.
Them:  Of course,  Miss _____.   We'll send a double cappuccino to you in room 642 in exactly 13 minutes.  Would you like a complimentary newspaper, two delicious rock sugar stirring sticks and a whole lot of smiling and bowing when your room service waiter arrives?
Me:  Yes, thank you.  That would be very nice.  Also -
Them:  Yes, yes, please tell us if there is anything on the earth we can find you\/do for you\/ make your stay more pleasant here by bestowing -
Me:  Could you make it extra hot?
Them:  It will be hotter than the flames of hell, Miss ______.  And if it isn't, you can take me out to the back of the kitchens and fling saucepans near my head while I apologize profusely.  
Me:  Sounds good. 

Yeah.  The good life. :)

The real truth about "hotel upgrades". I booked a 4 night stay at the Bellagio for myself and my husband from Nov 23-27 for a little R&R as he had surgery coming up. We have been to Vegas several times, but not that hotel. What a disappointment. I booked and paid for a "Premier Fountain view" room and put a deposit on it. We arrived around 9 pm after our flight and I went to check in.  I was looking forward to this.  Our desk clerk looked up the reservation and said " We have to move you to a different room".  This room is not available. I told her I reserved it online, and put a deposit on it.  She said if I read the fine print on the web site, it is NOT guaranteed.  WHAT??? In a nutshell what this and I am sure other hotels do is advertise a special and when you book it, and arrive late ( her words) they gave the room to someone that would pay the full rate!! I was so bloody pissed off. She said it was because I asked for 2 queen beds.  I told her I would take the King bed as originally booked, and she looked at me and said" no, we don't have it" They told us they were "upgrading the room" to a Junior Suite, but at the far end of the hotel, and with a partial fountain view. This was NOT an upgrade!!  This is what they tell everyone who's room they give to someone else. I just read a review on Trip Advisor where the customer "tipped" the hotel clerk $100 and not only got a suite, but free buffet and other tickets. If I had known that I would have done the same, however I thought bribery was not legal????? The best the hotel did for us, was reimburse the ridiculous $28 a day "resort fee".
So folks the next time the hotel tells you they are "upgrading you", I would say in most cases unless you slip them a huge "tip" they probably gave your room away to someone who would pay a higher price. 
I had friends that stayed in the Paris across the road that had a better view for 1\/2 the price.  I will NOT be going back to this hotel, or ANY hotel MGM operates.

The hotel and rooms are very nice. This is my first stay at the Bellagio, and the experience was not good. I haven't checked out yet, so maybe it might change at a later time.

I arrived early afternoon, all the non smoking rooms were booked, so they offered to call\/text as soon as my room was ready. 8pm comes around and not one peep. I came back and they tell me it's ready without an apology for the long wait nor for not notifying me. 

I come to my room and the first thing I see is the rubber piece of the door frame hanging down from the top. As I put my jacket away, missing robe and slippers. Walking to the restroom I heard water running from the toilet and noticed the lid from the tank slightly lifted, not able to close all the way down because it was somehow broken. I decided to flush prior to using it, and of course water did not flush. Engineers arrived quickly and said I needed a new tank, they replaced the tank within minutes, but by this time it was 10:20pm. The smell it left when they changed the tank was not pleasant. 

Forgot to mention, my colleagues room...when we opened up the blinds, we found a pair of used stockings...

I understand it's a very busy time with the conventions, but I would say it's unacceptable. Housekeeping should be doing better to ensure these items are made aware to fix. 

The employees were nice, but I don't think I would recommend this hotel...maybe it's just bad luck.

Also, my colleague is in a wheelchair and wanted to hop off and into a lounge chair at the bar. We grabbed the seat next to us and the hostess came over and basically trying to boot him off because it was apparently just reserved. (We were already sitting and buying drinks for approx. 1.5 hrs) Offered him a stool instead. Are you kidding me? He's paralyzed how would you think he'd sit on a stool? After a few minutes going back and forth with her she finally brought out a chair for the other table. Not very hospitable...

Had a WONDERFUL stay here. 

Parking: Valet. It's $18 over nigh but if you have a M Life card, it might be cheaper.

Rooms: Crispy clean and very up to date. The lights are controlled mostly in one area and the bathrooms are gorgeous- probably my favorite part of the room.

Room Service\/ House Keeping: Responds to requests in a timely manner

Hotel entertainment\/ shopping: Very elite with wonderful (costly) shopping options

Hotel Decor: One of the best hotel decors I've seen. The colorful lily pads and flower walk-ways are filled with people having their own mini photoshoot.

Upon arrival we were greeted by many people as there was quite a long line to check in. During check in we were treated well until we got to our room and our key didn't work. We found out the clerk wrote down the wrong room number. We had requested non smoking Fountain view (beautiful) but it stunk like cigarettes. 
The worst part about fountain view room is the terrible loud noises we heard from the clubs directly below \/across. Thankfully the yelling stopped at 4 a.m.

Don't know that I ever want to stay anywhere else. Slots aren't very loose and the tables are quite expensive. But the botanical gardens are beautiful, the decor is classy and the entire property is spotless. Food was always good but on the pricey side. The service is unparalleled. I felt spoiled the entire stay! Get a penthouse suite if you can. It's totally worth it! I splurged for a cabana for a day and that was worth it as well.

Loved my stay at the Bellagio. We stayed in one of the penthouse suites and it was really very lovely. We got a mountain view room (which I highly recommend) and the view was beautiful. Better than a paying extra for a fountain view room. The bed was very comfortable and I loved their bathrobes (it was huge on me maybe get smaller ones for your shorter guests). I also loved the luxurious bathrooms in our suite. It had a big bath tub which was nice after a long day out in Vegas. The penthouse suite was truly a great experience. I loved all their amenities. The pool was also nice and relaxing. Whenever I go back to Vegas I always find myself wishing I had stayed at the Bellagio again.

This hotel has really gone down hill since my last visit.  The room we were initially given had several broken items, including the drapery, 3 lightbulbs were out in the room and bathroom.  The kicker, and the reason I will NEVER stay here again;  MOLD!!!  So gross and awful, the bathroom had mold growing in the shower from the base to 3' up the wall.  I can live with some mold in a corner here or there, but this was just the worst I have ever seen in any hotel.

We asked to change rooms and that took 4 hours for a room to become available, all while we needed to shower.  We were as nice and as understanding as could be and were surprised at what was offered for compensation for the inconvenience; A $50 credit!  Really?  I did get a letter in the mail from Bellagio offering a free room upgrade to lake view on my NEXT visit... They should have tried this on my last visit and I may have considered a return visit.

I must say, I write this with much sadness as I have gotten to know many of the staff members in the restaurants there and have enjoyed them tremendously over the years and they are the reason that I even give Bellagio 2 stars.  There are just too many great places to stay in Vegas now.  Next, we will give The Wynn a try...

This luxury hotel gets a solid 3 stars.   I recently stayed there for 3 nights.  
PLUSES:    very clean and well-appointed furnishing in rooms,    elegant decor throughout the premises,   beautiful fountains,  fast and efficient valet service,  friendly and helpful employees.
MINUSES:   1.  "fountain view" rooms do not really have a fountain view as there is a lot of separation between the hotel and the fountains. The hotel is not directly on the water.     Do not book a "fountain view" room  and expect to even see the fountains unless you are on one of the higher floors, at least above the 10th floor. 
2.   No coffee maker in the rooms.  None.  Nada.  Not even if you call and ask for one.   This alone is worth a 2-star deduction.  Even Motel 6 has coffee in their rooms.  
3.  The lotion, shampoo, and soaps provided in the bathrooms have an unpleasant scent.  Not sure how to describe them.  They just don't smell good. 
4.  The WiFi  is slow and unreliable
5.  The pools are not for swimming.  They are wading pools about 3 feet deep.  Better pools are visible from the "fountain view" room  window but are not accessible you rent one of the "villas", which, we were told  "start at $5,000 per night". Uhmm. Ok.
Couteous staff, clean spacious rooms, and a great location in the middle of the strip. Stayed at Venetian previously and I thought Bellagio was a much better experience. Will happily return.

The hotel is vety well located! It has the signature fountains that are very pretty!! Our room has a view to the fountains and even though I would have made the windows bigger, you can still look out the window and see the show... Beware, the water does sound a little inside the room... Not the music, but the water when it falls...
As per cleanliness, there was a dead cockroach at the front entrance of the hotel... Well this is completely unacceptable at an estanlishment like Bellagio!! Our room is clean, the bed was better years ago... Mu sheets were a tad harsh and the mattress also a notch too hard!
There are plenty of places where to charge your electronics including the bed lamp... 
The bathroom has a separate shower and is ample... 
You do have to come through the Casino to come to your room as most hotels on the strip... 
Rooms need a little make up... They do seem dated at this point... 
The hotel is very nice, they can solve these simple things quite fast...
Enjoy

The room was nice. That's about the only thing that we enjoyed about our stay at the Bellagio this past weekend. I'm feeling generous today, so I gave them a 2, because the room was nice and the manager, William, was nice (he was the only one).

We received the most horrible customer service from the hotel staff (from the front desk staff all the way up to management). Day 1, the woman who checked us in dropped our credit card down the hole behind the computer. It took 1.5 hours for maintenance to fish it out. The manager who came over during this ordeal blamed us for the incident and told us to just be patient, we'd get the card back eventually. At one point we were told to go to get lunch (difficult without a credit card) and when we asked if lunch would be comped due to the issue at check in, we were initially told NO because it was our fault that the check in lady dropped our credit card. We then declined to get lunch, and said we'd prefer to wait at the desk to get our credit card back. It was clear they wanted us to leave the check in desk (there was a line of people waiting), because they then did offer to comp our lunch. Regardless, we needed our credit card and were afraid that once we were no longer in their sight, they'd get busy and never get the credit card back to us. So we stayed put, and continued to wait as patiently as possible for them to get us our card back.

Day 2, my mom slipped at the pool and hurt herself. When I went to get some ice for her, the life guard was amazingly nice. He was the only one. The manager he called over blamed us, AGAIN. He said that we should know that the pool deck was slippery from sunscreen being dripped on it. This happened at 9am, when it was cloudy out. I guess the other 4 people at the pool that morning had slathered on their sunscreen and dripped it everywhere? Did they not wash the deck the night before? And, really, if it's that big of a problem, they should have put a sign out "Slippery when wet". For the remainder of our vacation, my mom walked with a limp and couldn't navigate stairs-which for anyone who's been to Vegas before, knows is an essential skill to have if you ever want to cross the street! It was Day 4 before we received any follow up from Risk Management about this. While Risk Management was nice to us, the woman we spoke with the first person the entire vacation that was.

Not once did we receive an apology from the staff for any of this. Not once did someone say, "I'm so sorry that your vacation didn't turn out to be awesome." We weren't looking for monetary compensation (though we did get some). We stayed here because it's a beautiful hotel, and I'd read reviews about how nice everything was, but we received the worst service imaginable. The attitude of the managers and other staff, blaming us for everything, really put a bad taste in our mouths. A smile, an apology, and a kind word would have gone a long way.

We had a hotel staff member steal over $600 from multiple wallets from inside the room. When we brought it up to security and management, and they told us we had to fill out a form rather than checking the tape to see who stole from us. They showed no sign of urgency to help us find our stolen money. I will never stay in a hotel that allows employees to steal for us and not even offer us any compensation for us and left us to our room. We did not feel safe in the room but they had us in the room still. Never again

Do not play blackjack with the crook dealers. I go with a friend and buy in for 500. My friend is a first timer and i play a lot. I was betting 50 a hand and she was betting 10. She had a 16 against a 10, i told her to hit and she wanted to stay. She ends up staying and bank makes 21. The dealer had the nerves to say "you know what you just did, everyone lost because of you." Its her money man, don't tell her how to play and what to play. You do what you want with your money. You just deal, its your job.

Luckily i was running good, i never tipped him a dollar. He was getting angry at my hot streak. When it was time for a shuffle, it was the slowest shuffle i have ever seen in my life. As time approach i get a 21 and he underpays me. I confront him and of course he says he made a mistake. He was looking at his watch for a solid 3 minutes and i asked him if he had anywhere to go. He said he was waiting for a push. 

Make sure you get paid the amount your suppose to. 
Do not go to the buffet, the line is about 2 hours. Go to aria, its only 40 a person and they have the best crab legs and prime rib. 
Amazing!!
The Bellagio is always a must when in LV. Each time I go they have a new theme in their botanical gardens!! Stop by and get in the holiday spirit.

I was in Vegas this past weekend, and like Angela M., I really appreciated their autumn makeover for their gardens.  Different colored apples formed a river as they flowed from a huge bucket held in the air.  Mossy nooks were reminiscent of Halloweens in New England, punctuated by gourds and marigolds everywhere.  So cute.

My husband and I walked around the entire way, and found ourselves away from everyone else, walking down a giant corridor that led to various ballrooms.  We also saw their main LCD screen for all the weddings they hosted that day.  It was beautiful.  I felt like someone at court in a historical fiction novel.

Ugh, what a disappointment.
The hotel is not old enough to be as outdated as it is.  I'd rather stay at the Wynn or Encore any day.  We went there this weekend, and here's the breakdown.

PROS:
The fountains - probably one of the most beautiful things I've ever seen in my life.
The beds were nice and soft.
That's it.

CONS:
Rooms: The a\/c is loud.  too loud.  And I can hear people, the walls are too thing.
Forget it, I changed my mind, I'm not gonna make a list.  Who says I have to?  Just because I'm yelp elite? Oh Contraaree, I can do what I want because I'm yelp elite.  Here it goes. If I'm gonna pay a lot of money to stay at a luxury hotel room in Vegas, I expect for it to have better amenities than what I have in my apartment back home.  The bathtub was this ghetto looking small stupid thing.  The shower gel, shampoo, soap and lotion were stupid.  They smelled like olive oil and had no lather whatsoever.  We sat at the casino for a few hours, asked for a server about... um... 7 times... and nobody came.  Good thing my husband's a professional complainer so he let em have it for that one.  (lol he asked the supervisor, "hey, how's your coffee?  You enjoying it?  I'm still waiting for one... yours looks great".  "I haven't had service since 10pm last night").
ok im going back to making a list.

service:  Hi, can I request a late checkout?  We were up till 4am gambling money at your casino.  "We can extend your checkout to 11:30". ... uh, what's the regular checkout?  "11".  Really?  half an hour huh?  Or else they charge you for half a day.  That's not cool.

The Buffet:  Sucks, I'd rather eat at hometown buffet.  It's old and the food's mediocre.  I can't complain about the food too much, but there was nothing amazing either.  Which is why it shouldn't cost $500 for a party of 8.

This was our second time staying at the Bellagio. We booked our room through a flight\/hotel deal site and arrived on a Saturday to a pretty full lobby area. We were able to get checked in quickly and headed up to our room. We were a bit surprised at the floor we were given (5th) as we were pretty sure we'd ordered something a bit more upscale, which would mean a higher floor, right?

Sure enough, we get to the room and discover two double sized beds instead of the one king. Something definitely isn't write. My partner called the front desk and we headed back down. He went straight to one of the CS reps and politely let them know that the room was incorrect. A bit of computer searching and double checking and we had new keys to a different tower on a much higher floor. We got to our room and it was more in line with what we were expecting! 

Overall our stay at the Bellagio was great and the customer service was exceptional. We had our room fixed up quick and a charge from the previous tenants was taken off our bill after it had mistakenly been applied (the minibar had some items missing when we got into the room and apparently this was charged to us by mistake as a result). 

The Bellagio is a great looking hotel, the service is amazing, and it's in a great location if you want to be near a lot of the casinos, malls, and shops.

Stayed here 2 weekend ago during a spontaneous Vegas trip after failing to go Coachella. My boyfriend, our friend and I wanted to stay in a better hotel and out of the Wynn, Encore, Venetian and Bellagio, this one of the only hotels that offered 2 queen beds in the suite rooms. The rooms were nice but I had higher expectation. Plus I had room service bring up a water boiler to the room which cost me 35 dollars. A little over excessive I'd say. Other than that, it was pleasant but Bellagio probably would not be first choice next time I come to Vegas.

Only got to gamble inside the Bellagio but I did take sometime to walk around the hotel. The hotel itself is really nice, it almost feels like your more at some sort of resort or mall than a hotel. The outdoor pool was stunning, alongside all the decor. It seems to attract a lot of international travelers as most of the people I crossed paths with were either from Russia, London, etc. The outdoor fountain show is really cool too, it plays alongside different songs to asl well.

Didn't try any of the restaurants or food courts inside the Bellagio but it was a great place to gamble. Had a lot better experience with the dealers here. The run I had were very lively and seemed excited to be there. It's definitely an older much "boogier" crowd but that's alright, they all know how to have fun in the same way.

Overall I had a great impression here and would love to stay and eat here. Definitely one of the nicer hotels here at Vegas!

I was there 3 weeks ago for a 3 night stay and this place is just beautiful. I had a magnificent stay, the rooms are spacious and clean, their bedding is definitely heaven that I didn't even want to leave my room in the morning. The daily housekeeping is wonderful and they really put my stuff away very nicely as I had clothes all over the place. Their workout room is magnificent as it overlooks the pool. Bellagio really gives Wynn a run for their money. I will be going back in February which I've already booked and I'm confident that  my stay there will be just as wonderful. Thank you Bellagio and can't wait to see you February!

A manager from the hotel attempted to contact me regarding the below post a month ago. I immediately replied back letting her know that I was already working with a manager at Bellagio that has failed to assist with rectifying my horrible experience there sufficiently. She never replied back to me. It has been one month since I sent her a message. This is a prime example of how Bellagio has no consideration for its customers.  DO NOT STAY HERE OR BOOK AN IMPORTANT EVENT HERE!

my original post on 11\/11:
Do not have your wedding or any important event here! We had ours there a month ago and had so many issues with their customer services throughout our stay, even though I had been in contact on a bi-weekly basis with two individuals there planning our wedding for 11 months. You would think a years' worth of planning to get it right would be enough time for them to do so, especially since we paid for the majority of our ceremony, wedding dinner, and stay upfront. Some of the issues we experienced included:
-them not disclosing per room reservation fees until we checked in
-them not having on file that we were having a wedding in the hotel upon check-in so that they would know to not be rude to us. we had numerous issues with rude staff
-them booking our rooms incorrectly. two rooms were booked incorrectly in regards to number of beds needed
-they were aware, 11 months prior, that there would be an infant in one of the rooms and that a fridge needed to be there (set up for us) to store formula in-there wasn't. we ended up waiting 2 hours for it.
-our wedding dinner was one of the biggest issues. Their restaurant, The Fix, had half our money for our almost $4000 dinner paid for upfront which made them think they could set up our seating incorrectly. Us and our guests ended up waiting an extra hour for them to reset everything. A waitress was also rude to one of my guests during ordering. On top of it all, the manager on staff that night was rude to us and made no effort to resolve the issues with comping anything off the bill that night though he was made aware of how unhappy we were.
-we also ended up calling maintenance twice for service on broken audio in our penthouse suite that night. the first time, five hours went by, and nobody came.
These are only a few issues we experienced. We stayed at another hotel, while in Vegas, which was just as nice and had way better service. In addition to all of this, I contacted customer service about how unhappy we were once we got home and they have yet to resolve the issue almost a month later.

Stayed for a week,
Great time. The best bloody steak and eggs in the world. I think I am going to have to come back just for that !! Staff treated me like a rock star Fabulous....

Beautiful hotel. Very happy I stayed here when I recently visited Las Vegas. Staff was great and very friendly and helpful. Perfect location to everything and being able to gamble until all hours of the morning and then crawl upstairs was great. Will definitely stay here when I return to Las Vegas.

Fantastic time at my recent stay here! Great staff, great rooms and excellent location as far as being center strip.
They have a great variety of places to eat and drink, the fitness center is awesome! Nothing like a typical hotel like fitness center. The men's spa-locker room is super clean, great staff and good amenities. 
Will be back for sure

Enjoyed the water show in front of the Bellagio last night. This is one of the best things to do in Vegas. It's free, outside and set to music. There was an exceptional employee of the Bellagio....Teresa Clay. She helped us find the best vantage point and suggested we see it from both the front and backside which was awesome...she was great. Friendly, funny, helpful and genuine.
I loved staying here. Super nice rooms, amazing service, great pool. It's definitely an older crowd, but still really nice. I love gambling here, too. It's just so pretty. Steve Wynn is a mastermind.

I wasn't impressed with our room wasn't big enough, also we asked for a lake view  but didn't get one as we schd 2 months ahead of time.. 
The service was great our cleaning lady was awesome. Have no complains about our neighbors didn't  hear a pep!. 
For the price we paid (600 something for 2 nights\/3 days*) wasn't worth it. I sleep in so the room has to be important. Prob wouldn't go back try something better but it was a nice experience..

My favorite place to throw money away. They often have $5 blackjack and, most importantly, they bring the drinks more frequently than any other casino on the strip. The craps tables are very lively and the place is very classy. If I wanted some place where "the locals gamble" where it smells like that casino smell, I would go to some random river boat casino. The Bellagio is why it's worth the trip to Las Vegas.

Unbelievable!! Who would believe the fabled Bellagio in Las Vegas was such a terrible experience!!! Our two queens bedroom (confirmed) was not!!! We found out when we got there, because my wife and I are not a party of three!! WTF !!! Right out of a Seinfeld episode!!! The mattress was so worn (as in a rut) that I had them change it the next day (which they did). Such a disappointment! Never again. The best thing they did was to not ask us if everything was alright when we checked out. (,last stayed there 15 years ago and it was great. Only good thing still the same are the fountains. Next time I'll take them in from the street.

We really enjoyed our room here. It was just spacious enough even for Las Vegas standards, the hotel itself has a great staff and they are very helpful, you have to love the shops attached to the hotel, the gardens inside and the famous fountains which provides an amazing view from your hotel room at night.

Did I mention that Tiffany & Co. is located here? (insert smile)

The club Hyde in the Bellagio is so much fun!  We were able to receive and free table and bottle service which made our Vegas trip very memorable.  The servers here were sweet and very accommodating.  Also, the atmosphere and music played was awesome.

As many times as I have been to Vegas this is my first time staying at Bellagio and I can't believe I waited so long! 

Checking in was a breeze, they do hold a $150\/night deposit and $38 resort fee per day but it's totally worth it. 

We had a fountain view room, which you can turn on the tv and play the music playing outside and watch the show from the window. Our view was on point, centered with the fountain (15-024 was the room number) and it was awesome to watch from the window while getting ready to go out. The bathroom had a stand up shower and separate tub, which was nice sized.

The room has a fully stocked mini bar, including a phone charger set which was only $25. Of course the food and drinks were pricey, but that's expected.

Their customer service was amazing, and for $40 we got to check out at 3pm instead of 11am. We even got to check in at 11am for no additional charge.

Only 2 down sides were the issues with the keys to the room and garage not working (not their fault) and the cleaning lady coming in the room with the do not disturb sign on the door while we were resting.

My "Go to" spot in LV! Check in to Check out I feel safe, well taken care of and a sort of "visiting family" type of treatment(without the family arguments ). The Hotel is in the MLife group which I appreciate. From the front desk to Housekeeping the best service!

Bellagio is a really nice, quiet and calmed hotel. the dancing fountain is phenomenal. I think is very expensive to stay here but it is in the middle of the strip. This hotel is more older people so its more quiet and calm.If you like a little more hype Planet Hollywood is the hotel.

It wasn't what I expected coming from the Bellagio, the location on the strip was nice but whatever you do, do not get placed in the spa tower. This is for more business travelers and even though that is why we were there. The Spa tower does not have a view and is far away from all amenities besides wi-fi
Marvelous hotel, full of luxury and crowded of people. Excellent experience especially with Circe de solei.

I only stay here when I go to vegas as my friend loves the poker room...so do I. the rooms are nice and all but I stayed at the venetian before and I think their rooms are better.  Lots of nice things to see here if you don't want to gamble, the garden and art fixtures alone are super.

Expensive but it was well worth the $$ and the stay. My team and I stayed here for some R&R but like wow! I love this place! Good service and the spa tower is the bomb!!! ^.^ If I were rich, I would spend 2 weeks here! hah! Kept me amused for a long time. =]
I stayed st the Bellagio and Its the nicest hotel I have ever stayed in. Very professional staff. Nice rooms. The only thing I didnt like was the twice a day maid service lol....just kidding.

It's very unfortunate that this beautiful resort has such horrible service! From its initial opening under the management of Steve Wynn, the service, the cleanliness, the general atmosphere was extraordinary  and wonderfully enjoyable. Now, I can honestly say that all customer service from the front desk to the buffet has sunk to such a low level that it is simply not a good choice of hotels when there are so many other properties that make it obvious they value your patronage more than Bellagio does. I could list many items that have left us disappointed and the worst part is that they don't seem to be concerned when you do bring it to their attention.
Yes, they are trying to find as many hidden ways to charge their guests for any and all fees that they can get away with. I might guess that this is the corporate bean-counter way of conducting business as opposed to putting the satisfaction of their guests first.

What am I gonna say..... IT'S THE BELLAGIO MAN!!!

This place is swank, glitz, glamour, amazement up the wazoo!!!  If you've never been here, obvious recommendations are to watch the Fountain Show (every 15 min in the evening, every 30 min during the day), check out the garden near the lobby check-in (changes seasonally, so if you go on a slow time of the year, chances are they're changing it then), and the poker room.  

Bellagio has NICE rooms.  Very plush, yet firm beds.  Pool is "simple" for Vegas standards.  There are several.  Nothing overly unique.

I recommend checking out the poker room (lots of the high limit pro's you see on TV play here), the sports book is pretty awesome, and watch "O" if it's available and not sold out.  Weekend seafood buffet is good, but pricey (like $38\/person)

So close to 5 stars...but, overall, I am more partial to the Wynn\/Encore with that rank as they maintain the title as my favorite gaming property & resort in Vegas.

Speaking of gaming, I really am a fan of this casino. I've won here almost more than anywhere and I like the general layout. They could definitely use some better ventilation, though; every resort should take a lesson from the Wynn\/Encore in this area. 
The Bellagio can also be a tourist trap due to the glass flowers in the lobby and, of course, the ever-changing botanical gardens. Jean Philippe Patisserie is also frequently busy but a definite asset to the hotel-- I love it there!! 

I've stayed at the Bellagio twice this year, and each time has been close to an impeccable experience. Classy rooms, super comfortable beds, tidy&daily maid service, and friendly staff. 

TIP: Try to request the Bellagio (main) Tower instead of the Spa tower. The Bellagio tower is newly renovated and WAAAY closer than the Spa Tower. The Spa Tower, while still nice, seems to be a little dated. The walk is also inconvenient-- especially after a cocktail or two....or 12. 

Perhaps one of the biggest pros of this resort is its central location-- with CityCenter to its south and Caesar's immediately to the north, everything is right there. 
I love the Bellagio!

I love this place - I really do. Every time I come to Vegas, I have to make a stop at the Bellagio. Whether eating at Noodles, or the Buffet, or just walking around the grounds - it's always a great time!

And of course, the fountain show never gets old!

Came heare for breakfast buffet. Omg Worht the price to eat there breakfast! there eggs benedic are amazingly good. they dont keep there food out no more than 30 min if its under a heat lamp. they will replace it. fresh various food, from pizza to a omlet stand, to prime rib. it was about 30$ per person (with alcohol)

AMAZING!!! I love our stay! We were there for almost two weeks. The room was amazing and so was the staff. We stayed on the spa side and once in our room it was like Vegas disappeared for the night ( it was a nice needed break at the end of the day). I hope to go back to  Vegas soon and stay here! Casino was great and so were the restaurants!

Famous hotel of course, was a great stay, service was excellent and central on the strip.

Pool was great, it's not the pool party type but more mature crowd so if you're looking to "people" watch you may be disappointed. 

Concierge was nice enough to give us a connecting room as we had booked 2 rooms, this made things a lot easier for co-ordinating and making sure everyone was whole, as people went missing along the way. 

Super tip: If you let the Bellagio Buffet know you are staying at the Bellagio and you're frequent visitor, etc, then they can either expedite your wait or schedule you to come back a little later. This however takes some guts as you must walk past all the people giving you dirty looks through the VIP line and speak to whoever is in charge and ask for the manager so you can plead your case. In my case I had 10 guys, and they were able to accommodate to come back in 1 hr and they will have our table waiting for us, no problem for us since we had rooms in the Bellagio and we gambled a bit. They get 5 stars for this service, probably saved me hours of wait. 

Taxi lineups are crazy though, also when you book online or whatever, you will be charged an extra 'hotel' surcharge for internet etc which is mandatory.

In future however I will be trying out Aria, I believe they have specials going on now so it's quite cheap and the rooms are very modern, as opposed to Bellagio, they are the classic feel and somewhat dated.
Best hotel in Las Vegas! The suites are beautiful! There is a reason why they shoot movies there. Friendly service. Just perfect.

The glorious thing about Bellagios is that as time continues, the style and decor will continue to remain classic and appreciated. 

I stayed here for a week two times and had a great experience each time. The pool is lovely and we had an amazing view of the fountains. The restaurants to choose from have always been satisfying. I love that you're just footsteps away from some great food like Cafe Bellagio and Yellowtail. The clubs are fun and you get treated like VIP if you're a guest here. Albeit we had VIP access when we were here which included access to a secret lounge through this cool secret door you would easily pass each time without noticing. We also had open bar privileges here as well as a private elevator. 

Bellagios is the place to go to be treated like royalty!

unlike the lobby which is so nicely decorated, the room is blah ugly...poorly designed and a total rip off.  poor customer service at check-in.  unfriendly.  the lady gave me the worst room.  this was valentine's day!

i ate at their bellagio cafe.  that too is overpriced! they charge 8 dollars for french fries (saw on the menu).  a sandwich is like 20 dollars.  omelet is the same price.  we ate here because it was late and did not want to drive out.  the food is good though.  the wait time to get a table is long, even though it was not busy.  waiter gave excellent service, while he was serving us the food.

parking is limited, to add.  there is a long wait to get parking.

i fall in love seeing their over-the-top flower display.  it always feels like you are in "wizard of oz" (that munchkin land) but sadly, when you get to the room that's when your fantasy dies out.
Stunningly beautiful, you have to check out the Chiluly ceiling!

What can I say, I love the water show. It never gets old. It's nice from a hotel room or on a balcony lake front.

Also, the choices of dining is great, the high-end shopping is unbeatable, and it's centrally located on the strip.

Came here for vacation\/special occasion, was disappointed, especially since Bellagio is held to high standards. Staff wasn't friendly but wasn't rude, just okay. Hotel room was nice and clean but didn't have that luxurious feeling. Granted, we chose the cheapest choice but we also chose the cheapest at Wynn, but Wynn turned out to be 100x better. 

A LOT of people come to this hotel, A LOT, so you can run into more rude tourists. Not hotel's fault on that part but just a warning. However, since this hotel gets a lot of people, they have fees for EVERYTHING. Want a higher room? $50 more\/night. Room with just A LITTLE nicer view? Another $50. Want a king bed instead of 2 queens? $25 more. And calling spa for appt took forever... had to call twice and was waiting for 20 min before someone picked up.

One Yelp star for good food (FIX, the buffet, and cafe), another for being right in the middle of the strip, and third for having very comfortable mattress. Will not be coming back here, Wynn is so much better, even if it's a little farther.

I stayed at the Bellagio for my birthday and I loved it! 
All of the staff was so nice I was truly treated like an important person. My check in was very quick and I loved the fact that I could waive the hold on my card if I'm not charging anything to the room. I believe this is only if you're staying in a regular suite. My room wasn't ready yet but I was able to check in my bags and go straight to the pool so I didn't feel like my time was being wasted waiting for my room. I was able to get rid of those heavy bags and enjoy my vacation right away. Someone from the front desk called me as soon as my room was ready. I was able to leave the pool go straight up to my room and have my bags brought to me. I felt great! The pool is beautiful!

I really just wanted to rest and relax this trip so I made reservations to get a massage at the spa. You receive slippers and a fluffy robe...I really wanted to keep the robe! They serve snacks, fruit and tea. The massage was so relaxing I'm pretty sure I fell asleep! Don't plan anything else for the day because you won't want to leave. 

My room was beautiful and I had a great fountain view! You can turn to the Bellagio fountain channel on the T.V. and listen to the music clearly while watching the fountains from your room. I loved every minute of it! I will definitely stay again.

wow this place is pricey but fun. well we at here for dinner and saw Mike Tyson just know when he comes in  everyone was like WOW mike tyson is here, but you know what  - he is a man just like any other man. he is just a famous boxer. but, he would like to  eat  in a public place and he want  to just eat.

Don't leave any valuables in your room! The Bellagio doesn't feel responsible that my wedding ring disappeared after a delivery was made to our room, by their employee. #bellagio  #sadweddingday #terribleriskmanagement #bigdisappointment

So, we stayed here in 2008. The hubby was asked to go for a work convention and I was fortunate enough to be able to go as well. I never thought I would be able to or have the opportunity to stay here again. Last time it was terrific. From top to bottom, the staff is amazing. You feel like a star no matter what room you stay in. This trip I went in having no idea where we were staying. I wanted that portion of this big birthday trip to be a surprise. We landed and got to the baggage carousel. The hubby was anxious because we were late getting in and unbeknownst to me, he had things planned. I turned around while waiting for the luggage and there appeared a girl holding a sign with his name, surprise, it said Bellagio on it. Wow! She escorted us out to a waiting limo. Holy crap!!! We were driven to the Bellagio by Steve who was an awesome driver and nice guy. We got to the hotel and were immediately greeted by a bell hop who got our luggage and escorted us into the chairman's lounge for a private check in. Wow! My hubby, he went all out and boy it was just amazing. We were escorted to our room by Frank, the bell hop. Our room, in the spa tower, a suite. I almost fell over when they opened the door. I started to cry. My hubby is good to me, great to me actually. I am a very lucky girl! He even had flowers waiting for me. The room, strip view, corner, amazing. Clean. Huge. This is how the other half lives and however brief it was, it was amazing and I will never forget it. So, in short, amazing staff. Clean, clean rooms. Quiet. And the views are out of this world.
Real classy casino and hotel but I doubt that I'd stay & play. The buffet and restaurants are great and the shops are cool.

Back to great experience since last trip. Staff very good, front desk very helpful, rooms very clean and nice, security excellent at keeping low life's and hookers out compared to last stay, Lago excellent, crepes place excellent, cafe good not great and fountain show still awesome. 
Buffet not a top 5 anymore but I guess you can't have everything.

Ever since The Bellagio Hotel and Casino opened for business they have had one of the best valet parking teams in the Business... And, like most resort hotels the Valet Parking was complimentary, which meant "Tip Accordingly". Starting a few months ago, Bellagio now charges $18 a day for valet parking.  When I pulled up and saw the signs prominently displayed, I was very disappointed.  The Valets are demoralized and are now making less than 20% of what they were making with the service was complimentary. So, Bellagio's new policy has alienated their guests and demoralized their Valet ranks... the policy change absolutely sucks and will hurt the hotel's business and reputation.,

One of the best hotels on the strip. The fountains are spectacular. Currently there is the boston art museum's impressionist painting collection on display here. The little cafe on the first floor has the best gelato. Bellagio has Lovely shops, wonderful decor...good restaurants.

Got married in '07 and stayed here.  Giving 5 stars because of the view of the Fountain Show.  Remember to turn up the volume of your TV when the show starts. IT IS AWESOME.  Then saw Celine Dion next door at Caesar's Palace so the proximity was great - just walked right over [Paris Hotel is next door too].  The Bellagio has staff that asks for your card at the elevators so security is in place.  The pool is awesome and IIRC, the towels are provided as a courtesy.
Has always been my favorite place to stay

Dear Lori,

I am a paying guest at your property, why didn't you make me aware of a change in policy on your web site? When I called to make my reservation? When we checked in? No way to treat guest Lori and your response was pathetic!

This review is actually only for the fountains - I can't help myself!

The tourist in me just loved watching those hundreds of jets of water spraying in unison to catchy tunes. It's the equivalent of a fireworks show ... er, sorta.

So after being ripped off by the LasVegasTickets.com salesguy it sure did feel better to sit by the fountains with some gelato in hand and hear "Time to Say Goodbye" for the last show of the night.

Gratifying, to say the least. Good times.

I like the Bellagio but at the same time there are things that I don't like about it.
Of course, everyone knows about the Fountains. They are fun to watch and always a big draw. 
Once inside, the lobby is beautiful and the aroma of fresh flowers and other scents pumped in can be overwhelming.
The lobby is always crowded, especially around 3 PM, when you can get access to your room. Save time by downloading the MGM app for a mobile check in. However, be sure you have your confirmation number handy or you can't use the app.
The rooms are large and comfortable. The bathrooms are bright and big and include both a stand alone shower and a tub.
My biggest knock is as beautiful as the hotel is, it is not functional. Everything is expensive. I like a big fancy dinner and don't mind paying for it. However, for breakfast & lunch, I don't need a $25 & $40 dollar bill.

It is just amazing that this hotel can continue to get worse. In addition to other umbrages, I have mentioned are the following.  Overall attitude of employees is unacceptable. The place is woefully understaffed. To Wit:1- Cafe Bellagio requires about a 15 minute wait for service to appear after seating. No wonder the outside lines are so long. Management here is non-existent and attitude totally indifferent.-2-Most valet people are very indifferent. Neglect to tell, you there is a charge nor ask if you have a card giving free parking. I called down for a car about an hour before I needed it and it was not ready..  Very inefficient  and indifferent. Asked for number of my gold card 4 or 5 times in 4 days. 3-some of the poker room help has reverted to their obnoxious ways of old-4-telephone waits are totally unacceptable. 20 minutes to reach the front desk.-5-Check in with untrained help results in inconvenience. Ask for a room close to an elevator. They say OK but do whatever they wish, Need to get the definition of close..--6-The chain, like Vegas is run by petty clip counters. Service is a word with no meaning here. 

I'm working on getting rid of my poker addiction so I can give up on this really terrible town.

The only reason you want to stay in this hotel is to enjoy the Fountain Show from you room. Other then that, this is just an average hotel. I didn't find any difference between this hotel and any Marriott\/Hilton chains. Rooms are old, dark, and average. But the fountain show from the room is priceless :-)

The Bellagio is a perfect place to stay.  It's right in the middle of the strip, which makes everything else very walkable.  

The gardens off of the spectacular lobby are always beautiful and the themes are stunning and delightful for every age.  It's also the best place to take pictures.  Truly a wow!

Our room was very clean and large and comfortable.  We had a jacuzzi bathtub which is great at the end of the day.  We were overlooking the highway and the city, but I figure EVERYONE asks for the fountain view, so the beds are probably more worn down in those rooms.  Besides, you should go outside for the fountain show...to hear the music.

The staff was very accommodating and friendly.

Two complaints:  They used to have a really good and healthy little snack bar, with fresh soups and salads.  They still have a place called "Snack" but it must be new ownership.  We got a slice of pizza that was like cardboard.   And, my friend's burger seemed like it had been frozen about 5 minutes before.  Also, they used to have a french patisserie with little tables and chairs and great pastries and atmosphere.  It's gone, or blended into the gelato shop and has no seating and florescent lighting.  No fun. (Noodles was good, though!)  And, the buffet in the morning is really good.  

2nd downside:  I used to love that the Bellagio had such excellent smoke-eaters.  Even when the casino was full, you didn't feel like the place smelled of smoke.  That wasn't true this time.  I couldn't stay in the casino very long because my eyes would start burning.  Since Vegas is the LAST of the smoker's havens, there are probably more of them now....but....Cough, Cough.  Step it up.

I have only been to the Bellagio to see shows, visit the Conservatory, or eat at one of the restaurants.  This year, I decided to spend a night and enjoy the property.  I got a king, lakeview room when they had a room sale.  There were two small glitches--mobile check in needs work--I waited over an hour while others checked in waiting for an email I had been instructed.  After the wait, I went to the desk and asked if I should have received an email by now.  The person answered with a yes and she checked.  My room was indeed ready.  I never did get an email.  

The other minor problem was the TV.  The desk clerk had told me that the fountain music was on Channel 22.  When I turned the TV on, I got a message that there was nothing connected.  I managed to stop a bellman in the hall and he tried to see what was wrong without success.  He suggested I call and get someone from maintenance to the room.  I waited for about 1\/2 hour an no one showed.  I left and went for dinner at Paris because I had a show there that evening.  When I came back at about 9, the TV was working and it was left on.

Wifi is available and is included in the resort fee that's added to your room cost.  Parking is free for guests.  She told me to hold onto my room key to be able to exit the garage without paying.

The room was very comfortable, the view of the fountains was excellent, and I enjoyed the overnight trip playing tourist in my hometown.

I'll give it an extra star for the awesome deal they had online.  The room was priced better than my other Vegas favorites, and had a $100 food credit.  Yup, that works.

Check in on a Friday is a bit of a hot mess.  They have a ton of windows open, but there is no real organization, and although the lines for each window look short, you can still wait for well over 20-30 minutes.  When we finally got to our representative, he did little to personalize the check in process and was very robotic.  

They've done a good job with keeping the rooms modern after all these years.  We did have a leaky shower upon check in, but maintenance was quick to send someone and had it fixed in under an hour.  At the Cosmopolitan, maintenance service can take all night.  
We were placed in the tower far from the lobby, located well past the observatory.  The walk seemed like an eternity in 3 inch heels, so plan accordingly.  If you want to be close to the action, make sure you ask for the main tower off the casino.

The rooms were a bit larger than expected for a standard room, and that's always a plus.  The beds were comfy and the bathroom had all the usual perks.  Nothing far superior for Vegas, but still a decent room for the price.  

There are plenty of specialized restaurants, a 24 hr cafe with decent food, the Bellagio Buffet is amazing, and a few quick bite eateries that I didn't see or visit.  It's definitely not a hotel for kids, so try another hotel if you're planning on bringing the littles.

Booked a future booking at the Bellagio. Looked very forward staying here as my first time. My first call to a reservations agent was 25 min. Going over rates. When i received an email of my confirmation she processed my dates wrong, but was courteous in honoring online ratea as they differ from phone call reservations. So i made a call back, other sales agent would not honor the rate so reservation was cancelled. I booked online and all was well, until I check my bank statement and find four additional
Charges from Bellagio reservations (keeping in mind i have not stayed there yet). Called again for the 3rd time i could barely get a sorry for the inconvenience comment from the manager. No sincerity for an additional $1,300 charge. Not sure if this is the place or the service I would like when traveling.

I had a luxurious stay at Bellagio and am in awe of the decor throughout the hotel.  The views from my room were stunning.  It was just a bonus to have watched 'O', being the best Cirque show I've seen, and eaten at the Buffet, which also is the best one I've visited in Vegas.  I'm still shocked at how amazing the pasta was.  The pool cafe was a wonderful place to relax.  

One downside is the looooong hallways, making for a time intensive walk to get anywhere near the action if you're staying in a corner suite (which I did).  Another downside is the expense of most things related to this hotel.  I'm not a high roller, so staying here and purchasing anything is a rare treat.  I wish it were more affordable.

Yea, so, I got married here so I sorta have to give it five stars, right? Everyone who attended my wedding is always like "your wedding was awesome" even at other people's weddings. I'm a little competitive so that makes me extremely happy = )

Actually, it proves that the point of a wedding is not only to commemorate your day, but to make your guests have a good time. I mean, shouldn't everyone remember your wedding as a joyous day with a really great party? 

The wedding planning services here are amazing. I was in grad school at the time (*ahem, still am*) and while I had some planning, they do a lot in house so I didn't have to worry about food or the florist. Plus, I got married in the chapel so no transportation to\/from ceremony (plus my relatives are Irish, if you know what I mean, so I didn't have to worry about them). It was so worth every penny. 

My wedding pictures have the Bellagio fountain and the fake Eiffel Tower  in the background-- top that!

Awesome price, came here for our anniversary, got a discount, great room, always clean, inside the hotel is he most amazing bakery and garden.. MUST SEE. Close to everything, watch fountains outside your window. Free parking and great scurity. LOVED IT!!!

I was contacted by the hotel apologizing for the minimal plumbing issue (which by no means ruined our stay). I love when buisnesses take customer service seriously. This is the kind of service we got in the hotel which is great.

The Bellagio is a luxury hotel on the Strip, certainly among the finest, most comfortable places to stay and enjoy in Vegas. It does have just a few issues, however; more about them in a moment. Like its competitors, the Bellagio is large. Unlike most of them, it is loaded with upper-end stores and restaurants: Chanel, Harry Winston, Gucci, Rolex, etc. The restaurants feature the dishes of some of the world's top chefs like Julian Serrano, Jean-Georges, Todd English, etc. When you are tired of that and need to get to your room, you'll find lots of space, very nice furnishings and a quiet stay. Downstairs is the casino, big (of course) and packed with every game of your choice, and it is especially well stocked for high-rollers. The lobby is lovely, the conservatory makes for spectacular viewing, and those fountains in front light and dance every day, and you don't have to stay at the Bellagio to enjoy them free. The hotel also has a lovely, neatly landscaped outdoor pool and cabana area. You'll pay handsomely for all that, but discounts can be found, and remember you're staying at one of the four finest hotels in Las Vegas in our view.

So why not five stars? We don't like that smoking is allowed in the main casino areas; no matter the air movement, the smell is there, and you have to walk through the casinos to get most places. Why not have special smoking areas for patrons, we wonder? It could be worse if there were more smokers, but happily fewer people smoke now than ever. Still.....  The restaurant prices are quite on the high side even for Vegas, and there is no section in the hotel where budget-minded eaters can find choices (as, for instance, can be found in another high-end rival, the Venetian). The buffet is pricey and often has line that stretch for more than one hour. At times the hotel is so full of visitors and guests it's like try8ing to move in a cattle car. And there's this: a bottle of water costs $5. Finally, there's a daily resort fee ($32) but it does include free, fast wi-fi. 

That's enough. You've probably made up your mind before reading this, but we hope our opinions prove a bit helpful at least.

Horrible horrible front desk service and Manager.  Azi was curt, rude and completely devoid of understanding  of the fact that I was given very bad checkin information on the phone by their staff.  I will never choose to book a room here again and the only reason I'm staying here tonight is because my husband is attending a conference.
Didn't get any sleep in their rooms!!  Uncomfortable bed! Worst pillows ever and room was unbearably HOT!! Even had maintenance come up to fix ac and still hot room!!  Won't ever go back!!

If I could afford it, I would buy a penthouse here and be totally happy! It's so beautiful and even the floors in the gardens are exquisite. Parking was easy to find and it's free. Check in looked a bit crazy but it was UFC weekend, it was being held at Mandalay Bay,

Yum! After a couple of hours in the sun by the pool, I seriously needed something else besides my Strawberry Daiquiri to keep my tummy from rumbling. Luckily, Bellagio Pool Cafe was there! I scarfed down the enormous Turkey Avocado Burger and polished off all the fries as well. Delicious and filling! 

They don't deliver to your pool chair, but they are very speedy and the staff is very friendly. I'd order it again, even though it was a bit pricey.

Service was good when we checked in & we upgraded our two rooms into a penthouse on the 34th floor. We also got a line pass for the buffet whenever we wanted. While not in our conference we played craps and walked around.

The two stars are for the front desk staff when we checked in and to the casino hosts.

The zero other stars are for Jason who claims he is the "general manager" & for the concierge who kept transferring us back and forth from the front desk to get a late check out. Hello, if we are paying this kind of money we might as well go stay at the Four Seasons because they understand customer experience. We requested a late check out because our flight doesn't leave until 8. They said 12 PM. Okay, so we got a penthouse and paid all this money and you couldn't accommodate us? Then they offered us to pay $230 for the room until 6 PM... You're joking right? My dad just had a hip replacement and we now will have to lug our luggage around and have him be uncomfortable until then.

Room 34011 - if you're reading this then you know what to do.

We booked the Bellagio because we had been impressed with the garden area and general grounds on previous trips to Vegas.  Unfortunately, the room was not near the same level as the public areas. 

We stayed in room 25099, which has several issues:  the air conditioner does not work effectively, even when set at 60 degrees; there are two chips on the toilet seat; the caulking in the shower on the inset shelf was peeling off; the housekeeping did not come even though we did not have the privacy sign on our door; the furniture in general showed signs of wear; and the linens were low quality.  Also, I had noted on the reservation that it was my husband's birthday, and they didn't do anything special at all.  

The pool was nothing special, which was surprising to me given the higher-end image Bellagio portrays.  

The check-out process was lengthy, and I was unable to express checkout due to a linked reservation.  They should probably have more staff at peak checkout times, as there were a lot of people in very slow lines.  

On the plus side, I forgot my razor, and the concierge sent us some disposables for me.  

We will definitely not return to the Bellagio, as there are many other options on the strip.

For the price you pay, you're better off at cheaper hotels instead. This place is overrated by far. I spent one night at their Deluxe room back in 2006 and it felt like a $99 Marriott. It's basically your typical hotel called Bellagio. 

Seriously though, nothing unusual. Same customer service like every other hotels except here, the bathroom is a bit larger in comparison with other hotels.

Stayed here in May 2016. Room was dark and smaller. Pretty clean though. Complained that TV was making a funny noise and it was remedied. 

The dealers were cranky and mean. Never win here. Ever. It's very odd. Don't mind losing. Wish it weren't to cranky dealers though. A sullen bunch.  

The place mobbed.  It's like the common areas are too small for the foot traffic they see. You really can't enjoy much of the scenery. People are darting everywhere. 

The chocolate fountain is nice. The displays are lovely and save the rating. Including the water display out front in that. The buffet was good too.  Avoid the cafe--overpriced and not too good. Pool area mobbed too--assume your position in their rows of lawn chairs. No character to that pool area. I prefer when there are more nooks for a little privacy around a pool. No. Your elbow to elbow with strangers. Lovely. Oh well. Just skipped the pool.

I've stayed at some of the newer hotels like Wynn, Palazzo, Aria and Bellagio is a nice Vegas classic that is maintained perfectly and still beautiful. I like the location because it's right across from ph (Earls sandwiches) and close to city center.  The bars, lounge, shops, casino are all part of the perks of staying there. Check out the conservatory even if your not staying here because it is gorgeous!

Fortunately the Bellagio hotel wasn't the most expensive place I've been.  The hotel was OK - at best.  The entire facility has grown tired.  Perhaps this is because the lobby and casino are are basically the walkway for ALL visitors walking up and down the strip.  

A few years ago, I proposed to my wife near the famous fountains.  We were not staying at the hotel that visit, so on our recent stay for our anniversary, we booked a fountain view room.  The shows were good, and the room was OK.  The food and amenities were higher priced than elsewhere.  We did enjoy the coffee shop.

After so many trips to Vegas, everything just starts to mash together and I forget where I stayed and what I did exactly.  All I remember is the great memories.  I wasn't even sure if I'd stayed at Bellagio.  I had to ask my husband.  He said "Yeah, don't you remember?  With the really nice view of the fountains and the strip and so-and-so passed out on our floor."  Oh yeah, now I kind of remember.  So what do I remember about Bellagio exactly?  It's a really nice, posh hotel.  It has a beautiful casino and everyone knows about the famous fountains.  It really is a breathtaking show but maybe I just feel that way because I love Pavarotti.  There's the absolutely gorgeous glass flowers in the lobby overhead.  They also have a conservatory where the display is changed out often (monthly, maybe).  Every time I've been to Bellagio, there's a different display and they are each stunning.  The rooms were spacious with all the high end amenities you'd expect.  They're not as big as Palazzo or Venetian rooms with the sunken-in living rooms though.  We had a view of the strip in our room and had the pleasure of seeing and hearing the water show from our window every time it was on.  The nightclub, The Bank, is also located inside Bellagio (see my review).  And there is high-end shopping as well.  I have dined at the cafe in the lobby but I'll have a separate review for that...if I can remember the name of it and what I ate.  And I've been to the famous buffet too.  Unfortunately, I was too hungover to enjoy any of the food.  Overall, great hotel and definitely worth the bucks.
Service outstanding, Hotel&Resort very clean,had dinner at prime last night,food was great,be prepared to spend $$$$on the very high side, but great meal

Most of my visits to Sin City bring me here for my stay. The Bellagio Fountain show outside of my window, the soft, comfortable bed, the many award winning restaurants which include Michael Mina, the art exhibits which beg a second glance, the secluded cabanas surrounding the pool. The spa, the concierge and the customer service are all top notch. They do all they can to make certain you choose your next visit here as well. 
While they may not be the trendiest, hippest or most modern hotel here, they have an elegance and class that keep bringing you back. Many restaurants, lounges and a club are a few more places to enjoy. The shopping boutiques such as Chanel and LV offer some truly one of a kind pieces as well, so if you win some $$ you don't have very far to go to indulge! And how I can forget? There's gambling, offering high limit and low minimum tables.

We are staying at the Bellagio March 19, 2017 in a fountain view Penthouse Suite! My husband and I were so excited. Although we were told that we would be treated as VIP guests, Allie a VIP couldn't check us into our room. Kinda put a damper on the excitement we were feeling. "Checking in"took over 25 mins although there was no one in line but us. For whatever reason, our room still wasn't "ready at 4:30pm" even though our check in time is 3pm. It didn't seem too professional. We were told we would be placed in a temporary room. When we first called and set up the room reservation we weren't told that the previous people would have a late check out. At 8! Definitely lacks customer service. And our temporary room smells weed really bad! However, John a bellman was amazing and super sweet! We stayed at the Delano the two previous nights and it was a completely different feel. 
Would not stay here again.

I have stayed at many hotels in LV and all have been quite good.  I was looking forward to my stay at the Bellagio as I had heard good things.  My problems started with check-in.  They do not reserve the rooms that are booked.  I needed two rooms with two beds each.  I received one room with two beds.  The other room had a king and I received a roll away bed - real luxury!    

Check-in took three hours!  3:00 PM - 6:00 PM as my room was not ready yet.  

If you are driving, self parking at Bellagio is a nightmare.  Getting into the structure off LV Blvd is nuts and will cost a lot of time!  

For the money, there are better accommodations on LV Blvd that are much more enjoyable.
Enjoyed that it was in the center of the strip allowing me to walk to other restaurants because the restaurants in the Bellagio are lacking.

I stayed here during EDC week in Vegas & I really enjoyed my stay. Customer service is outstanding. I don't think I've ever been more comfortable at any other hotel than I was at The Bellagio. Also, the clerks at check in are so kind they gave me & my friends a very generous discount on our room. I will definitely consider staying here again next time I'm in Vegas.

The lobby is amazing. The atrium is always spectacular. This time it was the Chinese New Year. The rooms are better than most, but not as nice as the Wynn. One tip is to always stay in a room at least on the 8th floor or higher. Otherwise you're looking at lights and or a wall out your window. The service has always been great. Everyone is super friendly and helpful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone that is looking for a nice place in the $150 to $250 per night range. If you can spend more, go to the Wynn.  If you want to spend less, good luck!

Stumbling piss drunk down the strip at 1a.m. with five of my best friends we all of a sudden came upon this magnificent structure known as the Bellagio. A beautiful fountain show is always flowing outside, and even the entrance to this place seems lavish, and tends to make you feel a bit more formal. When we entered, I immediately headed for the nearest bar and very slurridly said, "Barkeep, get me a Grey Goose Martini, dirty as shit, please!" he did not hesitate to start mixing me a cocktail. After receiving my drink I managed to spill the whole thing on the ground. The bartender saw this happen, and just poured me a new one at no charge. What a nice guy! Gambling here was a good time, and I couldn't believe that amongst all these high rollers and upscale\/snobby millionaire types, they let my friends and I basically do whatever we wanted. My friend Heather saw the rapper Chingy hanging out in the lounge and went over to talk to him, to my surprise, this Chingy guy invited as all over to party with him. It was a really fun night, but I hope you have a serious bank roll if you want to play blackjack here. Table minimums are pretty steep!
Really the best brunch in town. Hotel guests get a line pass to avoid the hour plus wait.

The Bellagio is past its prime. I stayed here with my boyfriend Halloween weekend of 2009 and had a horrible experience. 

The room was old, the TV was Tube, the curtains were manual. The rooms seriuosly need improvement. For the price we paid, we would've been much better off at one of the REAL 5 star hotels (Wynn, Venetian, Encore, Palazzo, or Trump).

The Bank. We were offered complementary entry to The Bank's Halloween party so I called the Concierge at 7 pm to tell them that I will be late to pick up the tickets, the concierge told me that the tickets will be help at the reception except when I went to the reception desk they said the concierge did not have any tickets. They probably gave my tickets away. So after talking to the management, they told us that the Bank does not belong to the Bellagio and there is nothing they can do but give us free admission (but we would still have to wait in line). Nonetheless, we headed over to the Bank only there wasn't a line. There was about 100 people bunched up in the middle of the casino trying to cram through one door. This club sucks. 

Given my horrible experience with room and entertainment, we did not bother to have any fine dining. We did, however, go to the sportsbar and was surrounded by a old couple who chained smoked cigars.

My boyfriend had late night dinig at the cafe by the garden (can't remember name) two nights in a row. The food was mediocre, but the prices are pretty reasonable.

You know, this breaks my heart to give Bellagio 3 stars.  Its the BELLAGIO for crying out loud.
Beautiful hotel, really great rooms, centrally located.  
There are some things that are not so good ....
The lobby is chaos.  The have a terrible mess with incoming traffic and the check in desk.  The desk is in a terrible place.  No flow.
Secondly, we didnt know that this hotel had a tram access from city center.  This creates a HUGE amount of foot traffic everywhere.  
Next time we visit, we will be staying in a hotel that does NOT have a monorail access.  Its just too busy.

Stayed here for 4 nights over New Years.  Room was nice with a large soaking tub and separate shower and remote curtains which opened up to a nice view of "lake Bellagio" out front.  We really had a chance to test the quiet factor of the room, seeing as how the streets were literally packed to capacity with people on New Years Eve and we found that no matter how many people were outside screaming, the room was very quiet.  Room service was slow, even in the middle of the night but in the B's defense the entire Vegas strip is an over crowded madhouse this time of year.  My only complaint was a situation with a rude room service attendant, which was promptly resolved upon notifying a manager.  Other than the rude employee, this place offers excellent rooms (and views if your are lucky enough to get a strip facing room) which are a nice quiet escape from the madness of the surrounding Las Vegas strip.  One last observation, we noticed every time we visited another casino (Mandalay, Venetian, Pallazo) the valet was always full and we had to self-park.  This was never the case with the Bellagio, and it seemed just as packed as any other casino on the strip.  I would also say the Bellagio has one of the nicest lobbies challenged only by maybe the Wynn or the Venetian.  Granted the Bellagion isnt the cheapest place to stay, it is certainly one of the nicer places to stay.

was wanting to book a room. the website sucks. very unglamorous. i didn't even put dates in and it said 'that room is unavailable'. 
site not at all what i expected. i clicked 2 or 3 different places to try to find a room.. 
shouldn't be that hard.. 

you may want to revamp it

Gambling completely stinks here.  Just like throwing money away.  Hotel bed is very comfortable, rooms are updated and comfortable and the view of the fountain fis nice.  The fast food restaurant Snacks has REALLY GREAT burgers and chicken sandwiches.  And I mean really good.  The lobby is always a zoo regardless of the time of day which is a little annoying.  Have stayed here multiple times and overall the hotel experience is pleasant but the gambling is really bad - the slots are SUPER tight and a complete waste of money.  Not even a little play.

Such a disappointment. Reception was horrible. The lady from the front desk was very impatient. I was also double charged. Sent an email to customer service. Got an auto reply claiming emails received and would reply in 24-48hrs. And, of course, nothing happened.. The two stars are for the pianist in the lobby and the show room on the first floor. The fountain is absolutely stunning. But you can see those without staying in the hotel. My family will never stay here again.

Bellagio has a classy and elegant appeal. The decor throughout the whole entire hotel is absolutely gorgeous and intriguing.  From the minute you arrive, your jaws would drop. That is if you have never been to Vegas and this is your first time seeing this place. It is definitely one amazing hotel in terms of decor, but it does not deserve a five star rating because  the service was not up to par and our rooms were just not worth what we paid for.

I came here recently with a group of girls for one of my friend's birthday celebration. We decided to splurge and made reservations for two nights here. We even caught a limo from the airport to Bellagio.  We arrived on a Friday night around 8:30pm and we were in absolute hurry to check- in to our room. The bell man was getting ready to help us with our luggage until we decided to ask him how long it will take before we get our luggage if he were to help us with them. He said the soonest would be an hour. That was way too long for us giving we were eager to check- in and begin our night in Vegas. We decided to pass and helped ourselves with our luggage. 

From the beginning we were disappointed because it took about half hour before we got keys to our rooms. To make matters worse, they made a mistake with one of our reservations and no longer had rooms available with two queen size bed, which was what we had asked for. We didn't feel like fussing over it, so we settled for whatever they had, a king size bed. They offered to bring in a folded twin size bed for us, however and told us our room will be upgraded.

When we got to our room, we were quite disappointed. The room was small and the decor wasn't anything special whatsoever. It had a bit of an old fashion design to it and the bathroom was nothing to rave about. If our room was an upgrade, why on earth did we not even get a Jacuzzi? We had an average size tub, his and her sinks and a shower stall. There was one rob hanging in the closet and not enough towels for us to use in the bathroom. We just weren't satisfied with what we had received at all. We simply felt ripped- off. The cost per night at Bellagio is not cheap. The best part about our stay here was the gorgeous view our room offered.

Despite our discontent over our stay, Bellagio is a great place to explore while visiting Vegas because inside and out, it truly is absolutely beautiful. They have great shops for those who like to shop and are into designer brands, a casino for people who like to gamble, bars and lounge areas, a nightclub for some late night dancing and other amenities we all would love to enjoy. I personally would visit Bellagio again to enjoy the amenities this place offers (they also have an all you can eat buffet I have yet to try), but I wouldn't want to stay here again. Their prices are high (which is fine if they offered outstanding service), service is average, and it's simply way too busy and crowded for me to enjoy staying overnight.

4 of us stayed at the Bellagio for part of this Memorial Day weekend (Fri and Sat night).  The hotel and it's property is HUMONGOUS and though the front desk is a bit of a mess (you are just supposed to pick a line and hope it moves swiftly) there is plenty to look at while you are waiting.  

I am a bit of a high-end person so I had rented a one bedroom suite with a double queen attached; we ended up in the Spa Tower on the 28th floor facing the fountains.
