There were 6 couples and a total of 12 of us for our yearly mini vacation that stayed here last week. Been to Vegas many times, but have not stayed at the Bellagio before. Our friends are M Life members and usually stay here, so we decided to become members last year and stay here with them this year. After my experience last week, I won't ever stay at another hotel again. 

I'll start our experience from the beginning. Now we are far from "gold" or "platinum," but since we became M Life members, we got a pretty sweet deal on our room. And it never felt like we were the simpleton "pearl" members the entire time we were there. We downloaded the mobile app and got notification that our room was ready before we got out of the airport. We skipped the line and got in the mobile app line and got swiftly checked in. 

Got up to our room and wow! Just wow! Beautiful, clean, spacious. We didn't get the water view, but got the pool view, which was still gorgeous. It was quiet and most importantly, did not smell like smoke. 

The room service gal may have been the most polite and customer service oriented person we've ever spoken to. The food was prompt and delicious. 

The casino, including the sports book is great. I love that it is spread out and you don't feel crunched together. All of the dealers were helpful and patient assisting some of the more inexperienced people. Never had an issue with a cocktail waitress disappearing or anyone being rude. Even though people are smoking, it's fresh and doesn't reek of smoke.

Well, I did enjoy my stay at the Bellagio.  The room was nice, and there were many really good restaurants to eat at.  I enjoyed the water show from both the hotel side and the street side.  We had arrived the day that there was a shooting on the strip between a Maserati and a Range Rover, which ended in the Maserati running into a cab and killing the driver and the passengers, plus the driver of the Maserati.  This tragedy shut down the strip, so when we arrived we ended up getting dropped off at a corner and luging our luggage down the strip ourselves.  A small inconvenience given the tragedy.  So, this perspective also reminded me that I won't sweat the small stuff.  We had a mountain view and it was a little noisy, due to traffic noise from the freeway.  But my overarching feeling, is that  the Bellagio was a great place to stay.

There aren't enough words to say about how great our stay was. My wife is pretty picky and she is still raving. The service, attention to detail, the food, being made to feel special made for a great 4 night stay. 
We will be back.

I came here many times but the last time was with my parents on memorial day weekend where the weekend buffet price was ~45.

- Love the crab legs. I get my money's worth here. lol
- Sushi variety is average. Machine made, but sashimi is worth getting. 
- mac n cheese is very cheesy. although its a side, i love it!
- desserts are yummy. yet wicked spoon is better. 
- Meats are very fancy and tasty. a bit too rare for my liking but good.
- Chicken noodle soup is pleasant. I was a bit sick and it hit the spot.
- Pizza is great! exotic.
- Service is a bit rude, but fast. Can I get a Dr. Pepper? No....15s of silence..lol

^___^

Stayed here for 2 nights, and not just any room - a lakeview room baby.
Not worth it, ooh I am sorry so sorry maybe I just have been to Vegas too many times but I was not impressed - at all. The room is clean and pretty and all but I really had a whole different thing going on in my head.
TV is sooo dated, the window to see the fountain show is poorly located and small, room service is ridiculously expensive, bathroom os so not "wow", very blah.
Because the Bellagio is THE place to be for 95% of people who visit Vegas you always have a problem with parking, especially if returning to your room in the evening.
Would I stay there again? Comped yes.
Would I visit again? Absolutaly! I ADORE the B, the vibe, the casino, restaurants, etc. Just not the rooms.
If you have $ to spend in a room and expect the best go with Wynn, I know I will.

i've stayed here before, but it seems to be going on a slide downwards. the room was not particularly clean - toothpaste from a prior guest along the rim of the sink stayed there for the two days of our visit (sure, we could have cleaned it, but i wanted to see if the staff would eventually get to it; they did not). worst part: upon check out, my fiancé was charged $27 for minibar (which we did not touch) and two phantom $25 charges listed as resort fees. the minibar charge was taken off, but we were explained that the resort fee (about which we were never informed) was for internet, gym, and boarding pass print-out. we did not use the gym; we drove from los angeles (thus, no need for boarding pass print out); and the internet connection was not great. what's more, shouldn't all these things be complementary or at least à la carte?

The Bellagio charges an additional $30 fee to guarantee a non-smoking room. This means you have to pay an extra fee to make sure you get a clean room. 

So if you want to save money at the Bellagio - take up smoking, great way to help make the hotel dirtier at no extra cost!

The cutbacks are obvious and annoying.  We are (were) BELLAGIO regulars and noticed some cheap cutbacks on this most recent visit.  
One small bar of soap to be shared between the double sinks, bathtub, and shower?  Really?  
New shampoo and conditioner products that were very generic-looking. 
No more body wash?
No more shower cap? (Used to cover the icky TV remote of course). 
One slightly tattered robe that smelt of B.O.?
Housekeeping finally came at 5:30pm...really?  She was chatting on her cell phone via her earpiece the whole time...no wonder it took forever. 
The paid parking system is SO annoying. 
That's it!
Old money vegas feel.  very upscale and clean. didnt stay but am sure it would be nice.

My wife and I stayed at the Bellagio this past week (4\/22-4\/26\/12) for our wedding\/honeymoon week. Waiting to check-in was a little slow - I'm not sure if that was the staff or the guests in front of us being slow - when it got to our turn, it took about 4 minutes total to check in. The room was quite large and very comfortable. The shower in the bathroom had very high water pressure and plenty of warm water. Pretty much my only complaint about the Bellagio was that the fridge is ONLY a mini-bar; meaning you can't bring home leftovers from one of the delicious restaurants in Vegas and put them in the fridge. There is only room for the alcohol, mixers and candy\/granola bars. But other than that, I really can't complain about anything at Bellagio - the staff was friendly and attentive; you can get just about anything you need at anytime within the hotel. And no, I won't be one of those people who complain about the prices in Vegas - it's VEGAS (and it's the Bellagio); what do you expect? If you don't want to spend a ton of money, go over to the Imperial Palace, Bill's Gambling Hall and Saloon or O'Shea's.

Stayed two nights in February '17.  The casino floor itself is great - the entrance and gardens are great.  Our room was pretty basic and dated IMHO - not that clean...the first room we walked into had the bed literally up against the wall and the chairs turned upside down.  I called the front desk and they immediately gave my keycard access to the same room downstairs which thankfully was ready.  They gave us $60 food credit for the inconvenience, but as you can imagine the food was overpriced to begin with.    After paying the high hotel cost, they then bump another $34.99\/day  "resort fee" which is a joke.  They also charged me $10 each day for parking even though I was a hotel guest and playing $100\/hand baccarat.  Unfortunately, the nickel & dime tactic is a big turnoff.

The Bellagio is a great luxurious hotel with great location and great dining and great service. The display and glass flowers in the lobby are breathtaking and very unique to the Bellagio. Very luxurious and pristine. 

Warning to those who want a good pool experience, this hotel has some cold pools that are well styled but not as good as some other Vegas swimming areas.

MMmm gelato for breakfast lunch and dinner anyone?? Just knowing that it was right around the corner ever sooo conveniently next to the elevators was awesome!! The rooms were nice and the restroom was spacious enough. Elevators open right when you press the button so no need to wait 5-10 minutes. 

Cafe Bellagio was always opened and pretty quick with bringing out the food. Pools were clean and spacious. The type of people that stayed there weren't obnoxious either. Great place to stay.

We stopped in here to play a little and it is beautiful.  They really pay attention to details - to a tee!  Even the ashtrays were stenciled with their signature "B" - every one of them.

We mainly wanted to come by to watch the water show outside, at night.  We saw 2 of them.  And they were spectacular!
Very quiet, great facilities, huge fan of the buffet. Had some issues checking in due to a glitch in the system but it was resolved quickly.

For my first visit to Vegas, I chose the Bellagio because it was located right near the finish line of the Vegas half marathon that I was in town running. I got a pretty good deal by booking ahead of time. Kudos to the service staff - I had to upgrade my room for an additional guest, and they were very accommodating when I called a few days in advance.

The hotel itself is huge and beautiful. They have the botanical garden, fountains, and some really beautiful views! There's also the buffet, which was very basic to me.

Overall, I had a really comfortable stay. I ordered room service on my third day there, and it was super tasty, just really REALLY expensive. However, if I were to come back to Vegas, I don't think I would stay here again. It was really expensive, and it seemed like it was pricey for nothing. My mom stayed at the Flamingo for half the price, and her room looked to be about as comfortable as mine was.

I was very let down by my recent stay here.  It started with check in.  I was running late so I postponed my stay a day.  The man on the phone was very nice and accommodating.  They checked me in a day early and told me to get a key the next morning when I arrived.  After waiting in line 20 minutes to check in I explained my scenario.  The whole time she was making faces as if I was stupid and telling me they don't do that.  I convinced her to talk to her manager.  5 minutes later she came back and handed me my keys.  No apology but did at least give me directions.

The room itself was nice, what I expected.  My fiancé and I went to dinner that night.  When we got back we had to go to bed since we both had to be up early.  We usually do room service for breakfast.  They have a list of breakfast items that states it would be delivered to your room within 30 minutes.  When we woke up, she called and tried to order one of those items only to be told it would be an hour!  Not the level of service I expected from this property.

This hotel is old and outdated. The staff is really rude and when we complained about the room they upgraded us to a "suite" which was literally the same exact thing with different wall paper. This place was on my bucket list and I can't believe how disappointing it was. The Mandalay Bay was half the price a million times nicer.

I'm adding a star because they had some nice things when we came back to our room like chocolates. The shampoo and conditioner were pretty good. It was nice that there was a razor, toothbrush and makeup remover packets in the bathroom. The room isn't fancy but the bed is comfortable.
Very nice place. When inside have a chocolate fountain really nice. Also they have a area just full of flowers really nice looking place.

Worth booking the strip view room, absolutely gorgeous at night and you get a great view of the fountains. 
First time in Vegas, and after roaming around a few other resorts, this one still came out on top, while I enjoyed the restaurants at Caesar's better, I'd totally stay at Bellagio again.
Bellagio is classy, still right in the center of the strip, a little quieter, less smoky, and just really beautiful. Plus, with 5 pools to chill by to get relief from that desert heat. 
Don't laugh, but I am not a partier nor am I a gambler, so those other more resort like qualities appeal to me more. I went to see the sights, enjoy the food, shop, and relax. There was also no one trying to sell me a time share in Bellagio, whereas as soon as you walk into some of the other resorts you get completely bombarded, I felt like I was playing a real life game of frogger while walking through some of the shopping areas outside our resort trying to avoid sales people on the prowl. 
The room we stayed in was perfect. Not a suite, but a very roomy and comfortable strip view room. Loved that there was a large shower separate from a soaking tub, and a vanity with two sinks. Also probably got some of the best sleep of my life in that bed. 
If you are low key like me, this will be perfect for you. Enjoy!

An iconic place to stay at, very centrally located on the strip and all the comfort you could expect from such an establishment! I visited in mid-December and loved that I could do laps outside in their huge heated pool, not crowded at all. One thing: I would have liked some tea and coffee in the room and found that the toiletry provided felt very cheap but other than that I would come again because it sure is an amazing experience!!!

It's the Bellagio, what do you want from me! Expensive, but you pay for the name. The room was nice, the staff was friendly, and the eye-candy was totally worth it.

I think next time I'll go in the warm season so I can get a glimpse of the pool, I've heard great things!

My partner and I stayed here for the first time recently on a three night free room offer.  We had a very nice room with a view of the strip but could not really see the fountains as we were on the sixth floor (all you can see is the roof and yard of the private quarters that line the lake).  It doesn't get much more luxurious than this.  The pool area is gorgeous too and you can relax and enjoy yourself without being bothered by lots of kids.  Really enjoyed soaking in the oversized tub late at night.  No complaints about the staff, they were all top drawer.

Excellent location, perfect room- a little bit of a wait during check-in but that doesn't stop me from giving 5 stars. It feels like a city of its own.
Customer service was awesome too, this is by far the best place I have ever stayed at. It is expensive, but worth every penny if you are wanting to splurge. I can't wait to be back.

( I will write a seperate review for their buffet, which was definitely not 5 stars)

I do not usually give out five stars very easily but I must say if you want to experience true luxury beauty and relaxation along with a reasonable price for the stay the Bellagio is the place to be.  Some of the reviews speak of the rooms being outdated and I did see some minor hints of that but I do not really need to dwell on that because the only way I found this evidence was if I really really looked hard for those blemishes.  Once you walk into the hotel you are just amazed by its beauty and the flower sculptures are really amazing.  The customer service is great the staff is always ready to help you and are kind hearted.  The rooms are very very very clean.  The cleaning staff is great and left our rooms looking great every day.  The restaurants are stellar yes they are pricey but the food is good and of course the water show that is free outside the casino is amazing along with the show O by cirque de solei is really nice.  The casino is not to friendly to me lol but I can't do anything about that.  I really wish I could get some comps at this hotel to come back again for my birthday because I really do want to keep coming back here.  The rates are really reasonable also if you book in advance.  If you want to stay in Vegas and feel like you are a cut above the rest of the visitors you should come to the Bellagio Venetian or the Wynne in my opinion these are the best places.  I do not like the knuckle head crowd and I appreciated that I never saw any idiots in this casino and hotel.  Vegas has changed a lot in the past couple of years most hotels are really trying to push to get the younger crowd who really just want Electronica music accompanied with their alcohol and drug induced high.  I am not part of that crowd and do not wish to be a part of it.  If you value class and elegance above all the Bellagio is the place to stay.  Only bad things is the 35 dollars day resort fee that didn't work well.  Also they started charging 12 if you have a car not cool

I usually wouldn't do this, but the bellagio has plenty of reviews to offset this 1 star.  Hopefully it will still be considered with the utmost importance though!!  

Dear Bellagio:  Fix your ventilation system.  I should not throw up because the smoke in the casino is that unbearable.  If every other casino on the strip can successfully remove the smoke, so can you!!

This is a VERY nice hotel.  Right in the center of the action on the strip.  It is about 15 years old now but incredibly well kept.  The pool area is much more subdued than some of the other Vegas pools.  Super affordable and great service.  They DO allow smoking in the casino tho :(.

Overall good time, but not enough of a value to give 4 or 5 stars.  We stayed in the tower that is further in the back, not the main building closer to the strip.  The room was well apportioned with king bed and large, fairly luxurious bathroom.  Surprisingly, the TV was not HD.  The view was the backside of hotels and the freeway.  The hotel lobby\/shopping areas\/casino were gorgeous, with lots of amenities (Chihully glass sculpture in the lobby, bakery\/creperie, butterfly house, etc.), but overly crowded and noisy, long lines for check-in and crepes, and pretty impersonal.  I also certainly resented the nightly $20 mandatory WiFi fee.  OTOH, parking was free, which surprised me, but I guess all the casinos have free parking to lure the gaming clientele.

One nice find:  From the back tower, we had good access to the free tram that goes to CityCenter (Monte Carlo, Aria, and Crystals).  Those hotels all seemed upscale but dead--if you want quiet, those may be better alternatives.

The Bellagio is top notch! This is the only place we stay when in Vegas. Comfortable, elegant, and a great location on the strip. The pool cafe has great food for lunch. Bellagio is definitely the place to stay when visiting Vegas. You can't go wrong with this choice!

very nice hotel. very high price tag. i was totally satisfied with everything. extremely friendly and helpful staff...  clean, modern rooms..... the ultimate in luxury in vegas. however, i thought the images on the website were waaaaaaay nicer than the actual room. i thought ours was a little smaller and had less...... ambiance then the ones on the site did. also, it seemed like every single lampshade in our room was crooked. i mean, i straightened them out but... i thought staying here was so expensive because of the ever present attention to detail.. right? that said, i was still pleased with the whole stay. the room service was great, the spa was amazing and the casino is luxe!!

oh, but i saw an employee being very rude to a guest. the guest asked an employee where something was (the pool or the restaurant or something) and the employee was like "uhh, theres a sign right there sir. you need to keep your eyes open or youll always be asking people where you are all the time" or something. rude!!!

This is more of a PSA. 
Unlike most casinos, at the digital games at the bars, max bet means all your $$.  No first strike.  Bet it, lose it. No cap..Just be aware.   A very sneaky yet acknowledged practice....their bartenders will quietly concur. Fail. Fail.  And a note of advice to Bellagio management.. The hookers are way out of control. Seriously.
This placed is designed for the people that demand perfection.  I have stayed here once before but I myself am a little too dirty to enjoy the high class atmosphere this establishment provides.

I I could give 10 stars I would because here is my story.....

so my sister, mother and grandmother plan a girl trip to Vegas in mid June (btw best time to go cause of the prices)

we decide to book our whole package through expedia.com and choose a regular lake view room

well our flight out was canceled and we were put on the later 10:20PM flight. I called Bellagio letting them know that we would arrive after midnight and they were absolutely gracious

so we get there and we check in and the clerk says you can use the elevator behind the velvet curtain over there

okay

I look at the room number and its above floor 20 so I'm thinking great we will have a great view of the fountain i hope.

we get to our floor and the room door are very very far apart so we make our way down to our room and I'm thinking is this the right floor

we open the door and OMG they put us in the two bedroom penthouse suite!!!!!!!!!!!!!! we had 7 TVs 5 bathrooms a living room, dining room, two hot tubs and the list goes on and on.....I immediately put on the robe and slippers and do a dance.

my mom asks......"how much WAS this?!?" I said it was what i said but i think they made a mistake.......my mom said don't you Dare say anything i love this!!!!!
I swear it was bigger than my house!
floor to ceiling windows what a wonderful experience!

the beds were so confortable and guess what if you really like anything in the room you can buy it

thank you expedia and thank you Bellagio!!!!!!!

Stayed two nights in the Deluxe room.  Check-In was fast, smooth and super courteous.  Had to pick up a package at Concierge and they couldn't have been nicer!  The room was specatacular. Super deep bathtub which I took advantage of with my BF and filled it with bubble bath and soaked together after a long LONG day of walking the strip.  The bathroom was really huge and clean and beautiful.  Really high end bath essentials, which of course I brought home with me.  I never usually take that stuff but this brand was awesome. Even included hairspray and sewing kit.  Ate at the Buffet after snagging a Line Pass from Concierge.  Didn't have to beg for it, just plain asked for one. Of course you will still have to pay the steep 29.95 for Sunday brunch but you won't have to stand in an hourlong line.  We did not pay to have Champagne but our waitress was so kind and sweet and really pleasant, she kept pouring me champagne into my orange juice without paying for it!  She was a doll and she definitely got tipped very nicely!  We walked out of the buffet and promptly sold the Line Pass to someone about half-way down the LONG line, for 20. bucks.  I know this is bad but it was good for the WHOLE day and we weren't going to eat there again that day. I could have easily sold it for 30. bucks but hey, I DO have a conscience.  I actually told the guy, "Ten bucks for two people" and he gave me twenty.  I LOVE LOVE LOVE this resort.  The Bellagio fountains are spectacular and everyone at the hotel was really friendly. Ordered room service and it arrived super fast, and hot and it was wonderful. Went to see "O" and it was so beautiful and truly the best show in Vegas.  The hotel is huge and their is a lot of walking to get around, but plenty of bars and music and the tables were a lot of fun.

Literally all we've done so far is check in and check out the buffet. Got this trip as a surprise birthday present for my girlfriend and I'm already impressed. Patricia, at check in, is an absolute sweetheart. Almost got us an upgrade but the nightly hold got us. Still balling on a little bit of a budget. Beautiful room though none the less.

You know on Top Chef S06 when Robin was like "ooh I'm so inspired by all this beautiful Chihuly glasswork I just want to cook something way beyond the scope of my capabilities but still incredibly banal" and you were like "ugh why is Robin still on this show - go home!"? 

That reminded me that the Chihuly glasswork in the Bellagio is an irritating example of the dangers inherent in mixing bad taste and extravagance. It's less a knock on Chihuly than Wynn, who commissioned the work, and have you seen the Wynn? It's batshit insane.  Much like a bottle of Beringer white zin for $32.

Anyway, never been a fan of fiori di como, but you know, de gustibus non est disputandum. That's my thing.

Just got an apology, but after reading other reviews, the apology doesn't mean anything because this tends to be a trend at this hotel for sometime and nothing has been done, stay at your own risk. 


I made this reservation thinking I was going to show my future husband how great Las Vegas is.  What a mistake.  I called to see how I could have our wedding cake delivered to our room while we were out as a surprise to my fiancé and I was hung up on.  I tried calling back 3 times and never got a live person.  

When we checked in my fiancé was just telling the cashier how we had just gotten married and his attitude was like "so".  Not even a congratulations.  I was not looking for attention but dang.  

We were asked if we wanted an upgrade, so we paid the extra fee, I asked the cashier if it was a jetted tub as that was what I had originally reserved, he said yes.  Well surprise!  it wasn't. 

The bathrobes that they advertise on their website look comfortable, but in reality, they are scratchy and look like they have been worn a million times and are grey and dingy.  

We were charged for food we never touched or removed!  18 dollars worth!  The toothpaste for half a tube downstairs is 14.99!  Really???  I ended up going across the street to CVS Pharmacy!  Yes I have the money to pay 14.99 but will I?  No!  

The valet was rude, the door man was rude, the front check in was rude, the place reeks of cigarettes and homeless people hanging around outside vomiting on the skywalk.  

I will never stay on the main strip again either,  there is damage to the walls outside the Mirage that was never fixed and has been there since last October the last time I was there, Harrah's has broken glass that they have silver duck tape on it!  Classy!

The Las Vegas I have come to love has gone down hill and I am not sure if I will go back anytime soon, even my favorite places have closed down and no longer there.  

Next time I will either rent a car and go to Laughlin NV or stay on the old strip at the Golden Nugget where the customer service is excellent.

The hotel rooms and bathrooms really needs refurbishing.  My shower had mold and the shower head had green stuff all over it.  The bathroom was missing bath gel, shampoo,  shower caps....I felt that being a guest at their hotel was not important to them.

I don't see what's not to like.  The public rooms are a cut above the other hotels. The chandeliers are made of beautiful Murano glass from Venice.  The marble is Italian and top quality.  All the public areas are spectacular and interesting while the bedrooms are tasteful, lovely and with subdued colors.  Our stunning suite had a beautiful mini kitchen with lovely marble and 5 star appliances.  We had 4 separate bathrooms with a powder room.  Again the beautiful colors of brown, tan, vanilla and caramel were so beautiful and soothing.  The beds were perfect with comfy down pillows and opulent bedding.

Even the shampoos and soaps had a glorious scent and were classy.  The art and furnishings were lovely and didn't seem manufactured.  I have zero complaints.  Of course it is a mammoth hotel with throngs of people everywhere.  If that bothers you, then you'll need to find a nice hotel off the strip.

This place is exceptionally well-managed.  For such a large hotel, when you ask for your car to arrive, the valet has it there within a couple of minutes.  Kudos to management and staff here.

My only recommendation to the manager is to have a coffee maker in the kitchen.
Great place if you can find a deal on rooms. It's cenrally located and has every amitinty you can ask for, not to meantion it's beautiful.

Steve Wynn definitely has great taste in decor. It's a shame that he is slowing getting blind. This masterpiece hotel is a sight to see from the fountains to the flowers on the ceiling, expect to be captivated the first time you see these classics.

The casino is huge and still smells fresh, not like other hotels on the strip. 

Being owned by MGM now, it's been renovated and its beauty and charm still shine through. 

Getting to the hotel and casino is difficult as people are always crossing on the crosswalk at a busy intersection but you'll get passed it.

The rooms are comfy and spacious.

Be sure to book a suite overlooking the fountains! You'll be entertained for hours when the show runs. 

Lots of whales come and go and you'll run elbows with them on Baccarat or Pai Gow. Just don't mess up their okay! Lol 

Can't wait to get back and enjoy their dim sum or club at the bank!

The FABULOUS Bellagio.  

Yes, it is that sumptuous. This past week, I had the remarkable opportunity due to a client visit and conference to stay at the property, attend a conference and dine several times. I could write reviews of all of the components individually, but that would take up far too much time.  Instead, I will write in aggregate about many of the features.

1.  Hotel rooms - four stars.  They have delightful rooms with vast glass showers, soothing bed sheets, beautiful views, a simple but elegant turn down service and all that you should need in the room.  They don't get five stars because I had to pay for wireless access - seriously?  $15 a day simply for access seems silly.  Also, don't bother with the minibar or snack selections - they are a fortune.  The room sizes are really ample. I live in 550 sq. ft and I think the room (including bathroom) was bigger than my condo.

2.  Convention services - three stars.  Because of the size of the facility, it takes forever to walk to your venue.  There were multiple AV issues for both presenters and the audience and networking connectivity varied over time.  On the plus side, the food was remarkable at lunch and in the cocktail hour one evening, kind of meh at breakfast.  Not much to enjoy if you don't do carbs.

3. The Bellagio Buffet - four stars. They don't get five because the wait to get in can be as long as an hour, the place is usually packed to the gills and the service can be hit or miss on the drinks.  In terms of the food, it is unbelievable, particularly in terms of both depth and breadth of choice.  You don't want to go on the weekend if you can avoid it as the buffet becomes "deluxe" which jacks the price up $7 (29.95 to 36.95) and the "normal" buffet still is amazing.  Make sure you go after the high protein items.  My friend Aron and I grubbed deeply on crab legs, shrimp, prime rib, NY strip, lamb, Chateaubriand, etc...that was the value.  The Friday night "deluxe" buffet did include quite a few exotics - quail, ostrich, carved duck breast, etc...Oh, and to the four service people who ignored my friend Aron's request for Thousand Island dressing refill - BAD CALL \/ EPIC FAIL. How hard is it to refill the dressing container?  It cost part of the tip and prevented me from giving it five stars for the entire review.

4. The Bellagio Fountains - five stars. Watch from the elevated veranda roundelay in front of the hotel so as not to be overwhelmed by all the plebes not staying at the FABULOUS Bellagio. (That was for you Aron!)  The best part - it is FREE!

5. The FIX restaurant - two stars. Overpriced, loud and without alcohol, two people was over $160.  I know I am an epicurean, but I expect all components of dining, including environment to be amazing and in this case, deeply disappointing.

5.  The Fitness Center and Spa - FIVE stars.  Originally off put by the $25 a day (which runs from 6 am to 8 pm), we decided to go down on Friday morning early 6:30 am to get our workout on before the conference.  What a GREAT decision! As a long term weightlifter who has now looked to CrossFit and HIIT, they had ample equipment and machinery for everyone.  Loved their cardio equipment and because there was so much of it, I never had to wait a second.  The crowing glory however was the spa.  Three jacuzzi spas (102, 104, 106 F, respectively), a cool (room temp) plunge, eucalyptus steam room, dry sauna, complementary beverages, ice towels, fluffy & silky robes, luxurious large, enclosed rain showers (with primo soap, shampoo & conditioner), full on grooming with razors, qtips, etc... and shorts you can borrow, it was THE best part of the trip.  After doing a 45 minute workout, having a steam and sauna, not to mention the luxurious shower, I was fully focused and centered for a day of sitting and doing the mental work the convention required.  It was such a delight, since our day pass was still good, at 6 pm, where were we for another hour and a half? Yep, the spa!  Totally worth it.

Overall, if I was going to hit Vegas again for vacation or a business trip, I would definitely go back to this property.  Some minor lessons learned, but mostly remarkable.  No kidding about the Spa. I would go back just for that!

Nice looking BUT... Service is nothing to write home about (especially when considering overall cost).  The check in line was excessively long when we checked in and numerous times throughout our stay...they need roving check in...and for the prices, I should be handed a drink while waiting for the 30 minute check in.  Don't bother calling the front desk from your room unless you have 10 minutes to kill waiting on hold. I feel like I was nickled and dimed to death.  The cocktail service in the casino is so bad that they should simply eliminate it.  Not that you are coming to Vegas for sleep but good luck - very noisy rooms.  
So why two stars instead of one - the rooms are nice, the hotel and casino are clean, the location is center court, and the fountain show is great.

Bellagio is a classic now, hidden amongst all the bigger and better or just Newer casinos. I always liked Bellagio, it's timeless, kinda like Gucci. It's ceiling boasts the well known blown glass flowers above the lobby and the ever-changing garden tucked away behind it. 
It was "Spring is in the air" themed when we were there. I was there on official Toyota business, ahem, so we had dinner the first night in a banquet room, that I would give a solid 3 stars too, maybe the fact there was an open bar there solidified the stars but the meal was pretty good considering our flight was delayed and we were late as hell. 
OK so we then went to XS and after a few cocktail came 'Home" an ordered room service!! MMM Brioche french toast @ 3am, thankyouverymuch! Don't forget the side of burnt bacon!! Ooh that was good! I like the casino there, the grounds pool and cabanas are nice but so it the 24 hour room service. God, I LOVE VEGAS!! I have to say it even tasted good cold when I broke off a piece the next morning. So I applaud them for staying true to the game, as one of many Vegas "classic" hotels amongst the slew of trendiness that is spreading like wildfire across LV.

dont be fooled by this hotel ,i stayed here and i did not like it ,this place should be 3 and half stars only ..unless you stay in there suites if not its just another 3 and half star hotel .(there  suites start from $499 and up)

My sister-in-law and I come to Vegas every two years and always stay at Bellagio.  We call it the Disneyland for adults!  There's always a fresh new themed exhibit of flowers in the conservatory.  The resort is clean and well maintained.  Staff is courteous.  The rooms are well appointed.  The beds are comfy and the draperies open by a remote control on the wall.  The bathrooms are roomy with a large tub and a separate shower.

We love the spa and we always reserve a lounge chair at the Cypress pool.  
We also enjoy sitting at the poker bar savoring tasty cocktails while we play.
There's a variety of restaurants and shops and the lay out of the resort although expansive is easy to navigate.  The fountains are always a pleasure to watch.

Only down-side is there can be long lines to check in or out.  Seems like it takes a long time for the process.  The Patisserie always has a long line too.

We really do enjoy staying here and always look forward to our stay.

I've been coming to las vegas for the past 10 years (business and pleasure) and I never get sick on coming thru this Hotel and the sceneric view.

Love the decor, and rooms are clean and big.
Middle of the strip and convenient.
Shopping mall inside the hotel and across the street, restaurants.
at night I can never stop watching the water fountain.

Service is always a PLUS, they never fail me.

Cirque du Soleil "O" was SPECTACULAR! (one of my best shows i've EVER seen!)

Always keeps me busy and Makes me look like a MILLION dollar LADY!, SOO CLASSY AND LUV IT!

SEE YOU NEXT YEAR AGAIN BELLAGIO

My usual spot in vegas, they know how to treat there guest plus the location is right in the middle of the strip ****BONUS**** lolz I never have a problem checking in plus i think there spa for men is one of the best

Great experience at the O Cirque Du Soleil show .... a must see show! The cast of characters are from all over the world and you can tell they are athletes since their feats are amazing ... especially the swimmers and high flying trapeze acts! 

The fountain show run once a hour (to music) and is also amazing! Get there early so you can be right up against the cement rail.

I have stayed at almost all of the major hotels on the strip and this was my first experience at the Bellagio. I was completely impressed. Wonderful from check in to check out. all of the employees were very friendly without being snotty, the room was really comfortable and pretty and it really is just a wonderful place to stay. i can't say enough great things about the Bellagio.

We stayed in the Spa Tower and it is a skip.  The Spa Tower is to the left (if you are looking at the fountains and it is behind the main tower.  You can still see the fountains but it is not impressive, it is much more impressive to pay the 19 dollars\/person and go up in the Eiffel Tower.  The Spa Tower is also a hike through the hotel.   I would suggest if you want to stay at the Bellagio and are willing to pay a premium make sure you stay in the main tower and skip the Spa Tower.

Nothing about this place is less than amazing. Both restaurants we ate at were great and the best service ever, love the gelato and the fountains outside are so beautiful. Everyone's seen it on tv I know, but it's still impressive to see in real life. So neat. Great stay!

If you want a smoky stinky casino this is the place for you. We requested a suite with a firm bed. I slept on the floor!  The broken marshmallow was torturous. The staff could care less.  I asked if we could get to the buffet without smoke immersion. No way!  Did not give a crap and was reminded I was staying in a hotel\/casino.  Never again.

This was our first stay at this resort and we will return! Absolutely deserves a 5 star rating in our opinion. During your stay here it is a must to check out the secret garden, the beautiful glass in the lobby and my goodness the pools are fabulous. We went to the Cypress area for the day and yes we did pay for our seats but so worth it and the service was beyond spot on. The old saying goes "you get what you pay for" rings very true here. Pictures can not do these fabulous grounds justice. Go see for yourself.

Ever since watching the first Ocean's 11, I've wanted to stay at the Bellagio.  The opulence! The glamour! Did we get that during our 3 nights? Yes...but we couldn't help but think the B is a bit...outdated. 

Don't get my wrong. From the stunning seasonal displays in the lobby, to the impeccable room service orders, and the famous fountains...the B knows now to treat guests. 

However, after spending time in the newer Aria and Cosmopolitan properties, we couldn't help but feel like the Bellagio needed to update itself. 

The standard king rooms, still featured tube TV sets. Our shower door was squeaky, and the shower head was caked in green sludge and mineral deposits. The toiletries were in nice bottles but smelled like shampoo ad conditioner from the Double Tree. I for some reason expected Bvlgari or like the W hotels, Bliss products. 

Again, don't get me wrong. I appreciate the spacious room, and the marble and granite...and the location can't be beat, smack dab in the middle of the strip. But for the money, I'd rather have something more contemporary, with more "wow" factor.

I had an amazing stay at Bellagio.  Initially I booked the Bellagio suite,  but upon arrival I was up graded to a penthouse suite.  Wow my room was beautiful.  Three bathrooms,  the shower was also a seam room and the tub had wonderful jets for your sore body after a long walk in heels.  Spacious and comfortable.  
  I also received coupons that let you pass the buffet line.  They were a life saver.  Hungry and hungover my boyfriend and me went to try the buffet at around 11:00am to find a line of about 50 people waiting.  We went in to the guest line and had a table within 10 minutes.  
  The pools at the Bellagio are also fantastic.  Nice place to have a drink and relax.  Also if you want to go to the Bank (club located in Bellagio)  the pool is where we meet the the promoter.  He put us on the guest list for the whole weekend and gave us his number if we had any problems.  Once again we were able to skip the line,  while other had to wait.
  Loved the Bellagio and will defiantly want to stay there again.

I HATE THIS HOTEL. There are so many bad things I can say about this place. First, their rooms are boring and I expected more. It was so cramped and the window was small. The room looked old and wasn't decorated nicely. The bathrooms aren't great either, we stayed in 3 rooms there. Each shower had something wrong with it, either it was the faucet or the door. There was only 1 sink and the bathtubs were small and there wasn't a jacuzzi. Second, all their employees suck and so does their customer service. We had to move out of our first room into another room which was supposed to be connected to another room that we were also supposed to have. Turns out we had 2 rooms that weren't even together. We had to move rooms again and when we were moving our things into the room the door suddenly wouldn't open. We were locked out with all our things inside and we had to go through so much trouble to get another set of cards for the room. When we tried the new cards, the door still didn't open. So we got another set of cards, AND IT STILL WOULDN'T OPEN. They told us the door was the problem and that they would fix it right away. We had to wait over an hour for them to finally come and fix it. We ended up wasting around 3 hours over that stupid door. Their room cleaning service is even worse. We came into our room expecting it to look clean and new. Instead, the maids only did our bed and left everything else untouched. They didn't even bother to clean or replace our dirty cups and old drinks. Same with our hotel robes. The bathroom was still messy and again all they did was make the beds. We also came back into the room with the snack bar messy and touched. We got charged just for "touching" them when it was the maids. Besides that, we were missing our chargers and beats earphones. AND, everything is over priced. We ordered room service and ate at the Bellagio Cafe. The food was bland and tasteless but so expensive. An egg, bacon, and hash browns equaled to 18 dollars like really? Wasted money. Last, their pools may look appealing but they aren't that great. Only 2 pools allow children, which is whatever. The pool water is nasty and uncleaned. The water is either warm and smells like pee, or cold and very salty smelling. Not to to mention that all the pools are only 3 feet or under. Overall, I had a terrible experience and won't be coming back.
Bellagio is beautiful to visit.  Great lobby -  especially the Chihuly ceiling!  Those fountains are amazing.  But does get a bid crowded at times.

4.5 stars

We stayed at the Bellagio over the 2010 winter holiday. We were fortunate enough to stay in a 2 bedroom suite on the 34th floor. The room was as beautiful as the view -- and you have to love a suite that has 2x the number of bathrooms as bedrooms. Everything was really nice -- beyond luxurious, but also understated. The service was excellent and I was really impressed with how friendly everyone was. Really one of the nicest experiences I have had at a hotel of this size -- very impressive.

Will return.

Bellagio was one of the best hotels in Vegas up until MGM bought Mirage Resorts.  Now, you get the same level of service and value as you would with any other MGM property.  Which is just fair.

Unfrotunately, the price has not changed from 5 years ago....

buffet, buffet, buffet!
man....

LOVE IT LOVE IT LOVE IT!  This is one of my top 2 high class fav casinos in Vegas!  It's beautiful, classical and the fountains are amazing!!  It truly is a joy to walk through!  The gaming floor is great, the waitresses quick and plenty and honestly I've never had a bad experience here that I can think of!  I love the glass sculptures and there are plenty of shops to check out!  This casino is a grand centerpiece to the Vegas strip in my mind!

I really liked this hotel.  We came here to gamble and to eat dessert.  The Bellagio is definitely one of the better Casinos.  I was especially impressed with their garden area that was beautifully decorated to commemorate the Chinese New Year.  The Casino area was nice and clean and the layout made it flow perfectly.  It was never overly crowded or rowdy.   They offer a lot of amenities that guests can enjoy and look forward to being a hotel guest.

So far the Bellagio seems to be the worst 5 star hotel I have ever visited. I am a seasoned Vegas goer and can only speak the best of other strip hotels like the Sand Co (Palazzo, Venetian) or Caesar's palace and similar. But when you arrive a hotel complete the check-in process at 12:30 and are being told the room is not ready (which is ok) but with no forecast of how long it will take and then get a text at 3:40pm that your room is ready, it simply sucks!!!

Even worse, you ask then to talk to a manager and a smiling Lady tells you well this is normal and there are worse cases than this with people not getting a room till 5pm you wonder in what highway motel you landed ... 

Defenitely not a 5 star hotel and I have been in any corner of Europe, the US and Africa and have not yet encoutered such a bad service.

AVOID THE BELLAGIO, you are better off with any other Hotel on the Strip!

I used to love the Bellagio. I was there the week it opened. If I ever got married again I wanted it to be there. From the water show to the sports book to the gaming tables, everything was so elegant and classy. The dealers are all pros and the waitresses are all models. Just an amazing place. 
Well. I went tonight and it soured me forever. I always gamble there, even when I'm not flush with cash. Sat down to play some 21 tonight, $15 minimum bet, pricey but not outrageous. Noticed blackjack only pays 6-5 instead of 3-2. I play a lot of Blackjack. I know how to play perfectly and don't mind losing according to the odds favoring the house. On multiple deck games, the average house advantage is around 0.5%. Lowering the blackjack payout to 6-5 raises the house advantage to almost 2%. Whether you realize it or not, that's a HUGE deal. Millions of $$ per year. For decades, Vegas has done just fine on a 0.5% advantage. I asked and was told that the $50 tables still pay 3-2. You know what?  Fuck you, you greedy pricks. If you want to raise the table limits to make more $$, have at it. But you want to skew the percentages?  Go fuck yourself. I made a few hundred there tonight in spite of your shitty table odds. Won't be back. Assholes.

Outstanding!!!! The Casino is absolutely beautiful the flowers are gorgeous, The service is phenomenal!!! The food really good any restaurant you choose to eat at their all good the shopping is very good...
I really enjoyed my stay!!!

We (two girlfriends and I) stayed at the Bellagio for three nights (Dec 9, 2010) to celebrate a friend's birthday.  It's a very nice hotel but I don't think I'll be back. Just not my thing. 

The positives:
* It was decorated beautifully for Christmas
* The staff was super friendly and helpful
* The taxis come one after another so there was never a wait
* The fountains are just fun
* The bathroom was HUGE!
* Room was pretty clean
* The location is awesome

The negatives:
* It is pricey.  From the $6 water to the $8 pastries, there isn't anything to eat that is both quick and not too expensive
* The table limits stay quite high throughout the weekend (even at off hours) so low-rollers like me have to find lower limit tables elsewhere
* Other than the HUGE bathroom, the room is pretty typical. Nothing special here.
* The walls are thin. I could hear the neighbor's alarm go off at 5am.  We had an amazing view of the fountains but they are quite loud and were also heard from inside the room throughout the day and night (I swear I heard a random fountain at 4am).
* Did I mention everything is very pricey?
TIP- Do not book tours with the tour desk. You can save hundreds (literally) by booking at the tour desk in the souvenir shops on the strip.

My rating is based on the features of the hotel like the lobby,casino,fountain and botanical garden.

All were enjoyable, especially the fountains at night with a great show for free. I prefer to stay at MGM or Venetian, but it definitely looks like an amazing place.

This was my second time staying here.  At times, I was overwhelmed with the "traffic" in the hotel compared to other hotels (Cosmopolitan, Caesars).  The only real problem I had was with the check in desk.  The woman was rude and really looked like she had no desire to be at work.  However, we had a problem with the key reader on the door which was promptly fixed.  The staff (front desk included) was very friendly and professional and made up for our check in experience.  If you are easily overwhelmed with crowds and lines, give yourself some time for the check in process.  The time was short for us, but at times (Thursday and Friday evenings) the line was exceptionally long.

I loved staying at the Bellagio.    The registration area is spacious with beautiful "flowers" (glass) in the ceiling area.  Take a walk down towards the botanical garden area and you'll see creative and beautiful displays of flowers and plants.   The displays change, it seems, with the season \/ flowers.  During holidays, there are themes (i.e. July 4th, Christmas).   Wonderful to stroll through.

The rooms are well appointed.  If possible, get rooms which face the fountain so you can view the water show.  If you do get one, you can turn on the tv to a set station to listen to the music that plays along for the water show.  Magnificent sight to see at night time.   Also, I appreciate that there is a security guy who checks for room keys at the elevators.  

The Bellagio is at the center of the Strip - pretty convenient.    The buffet is one of the better ones around although it can get pretty crowded.   Good restaurants and shows.  We tried Le Cirque which I'll have to review separately.    Definitely see "O" if you can - I believe that if you stay at the Bellagio, you will have an easier time getting tickets.

You cannot go wrong with staying at the Bellagio!   All around wonderful!

I love the Bellagio! I stay here every year for a week-long work conference, and look forward to it all year. When I come out on vacation and stay with friends, I always end up here for a drink, or to play a little Blackjack.. or even walk through the flower display.

The Bellagio hotel has more people staying the night every night than the total population of the town I grew up in. Seriously. It's a great place to sit and people watch (I recommend one of the comfy chairs by Jean Philippe's Patisserie.) The fountains are a must see.. with shows running on a regular schedule to a changing music selection.

Bellagio.. it's the definition of Vegas!

This is a beautiful hotel and one I recommend everyone visits.  While I haven't stayed here yet, I always enjoy my visit to eat, shop, and gamble.  At Christmas time the decorations are over the top.  Especially when many hotels no longer decorate for Christmas.

Stop in and view the hotel.  DON'T FORGET the fountains show!

I absolutely adore this beautiful hotel. We stay here almost every time we go and I hate leaving. The penthouse suites are UNREAL. There are TWO massive bathrooms for each master bedroom in the suite, ours had 5 bathrooms and 2 bedrooms..I could live in those showers.....They had a steam room and a sauna inside and also a jacuzzi with light up jets. The vacation is in the room.

I can't help visiting the Bellagio each time I am in Vegas.  The lobby ceiling and the atrium are enough to warrant the trip. There is a small french cafe just off the lobby to catch a cappuccino if the check in lines are long.  Also, it is always fun to check out Hermes and wonder how to rationalize a $400 scarf.

This hotel is absolutely breathtaking. I love their decor, and for some reason the casino part of the hotel seems very spacious and not crowded like many others. Every time we come to Vegas we like to gamble here, we enjoy their buffet, and next time we come hopefully we can stay here if the price is right, lol.

I really enjoyed walking around this hotel. They have so much to look at and lots of shopping. The Dale Chihuly glass ceiling piece was really nice. The botanical garden is colorful and so pretty. They also have an art gallery with artworks from some of the most amazing artists and at another art gallery, they were exhibiting Picasso's. If you're in Vegas for the fist time, I highly recommend checking out this hotel.
A beautiful place to stay. Quality in everything they have and do. The water fountains show is breathtaking. Words can't describe, it's an amazing place to stay

Upon hearing that my sister-in-law got us comp rooms at the Bellagio, i had certain expectations.  Snooty upper class guests and gamblers, high-priced food, scantily clad cocktail waitresses, and dealers who had no clue about "aloha" spirit -- I expected all of these things of the Bellagio, and I was right.  What I did not expect -- mold-stained sheets.  Yep.  You got it.  What could be expected out of a flea-ridden, no-star motel, I found at a so-called 5-star hotel.  What made it even worse however is the staff's reaction.  Granted, our group did not make this discovery until the wee hours of the morning (3 am to be exact), but this IS the city where you can get just about anything 24 hours a day.  Apparently you can also get lectured by the housekeeping staff on how it is impossible to get clean sheets when the hotel doesn't launder their own linens. This woman ranted and raved for nearly an hour about how most of the sheets are stained and that the staff is supposed to check them before putting them on the bed.  She even advised us that we should leave a note, in big letters, stating that we wanted CLEAN sheets!!!  Um, isn't that sort of a given???  She even had to go through 6 sets of sheets to find one set of clean ones!  She then had the audacity to grumble to us that she wasn't told there were four beds to be changed.  Um, well, there shouldn't BE four beds with dirty sheets in the first place, right???  And through all this ranting and raving, not even a single apology.

Yes, the Bellagio has a spectacular water show and beautiful gardens.  So go for those things, but definitely do not stay there.  Or if you do, bring your own sheets.

On a more serious note, I wonder if the management there is aware of the serious health risk mold poses?  I mean, there is a good reason the Hilton Hawaiian Village spent millions to rid their Kalia Tower of mold.  In these trying economic times, I think the Bellagio would do themselves a huge favor to make sure their hotel is mold-free.

LOVED it here. Having full view of the fountain and the water show made my stay in Vegas 1000x's better.   They have a special TV station so that you can blast the fountain music in your room.

Why it's awesome: 
-THE VIEW - make sure you ask for the lagoon\/fountain side of the hotel 
- Service was fantastic 
- Love the turn down service with the chocolate squares that they leave for you 
- Nice comfy beds with fantastic sheets 
- Huge bathroom 
- You can room charge at any other MGM property 
- They have an awesome floral display with ants, butterflies, snails .. it's friggin amazing in there and smells fantastic 
- Concierge - they were able to get us fantastic seats for "O" last minute 

Why it's not so awesome, but I'm willing to turn a blind eye: 
- No exhausts in the washroom - if you like super hot showers like me, then you have to keep the bathroom door open to let the steam out 
- You have to pay $25 bucks to workout.. BUT it's worth it though, but just a bummer that you have to pay extra. If you get any spa services, that fee is waived 
- Room service is super expensive - it's better to get your lazy butt up and out of bed to make it to their Buffet. $8.00 for orange juice? seriously?? 

I honestly can't imagine coming back to Vegas and staying anywhere else .. the view alone is what single handedly made the trip amazing.

Every time there is a special occasion or I want to pamper myself, I tried to stay in the strip for a night or two to relax. one of the best places, ive stayed at is the Bellagio. Bellagio seems to have the best of everything. the location is perfect. its at the heart of the strip. its more expensive compared to the other hotels in the strip, so if u want to save money, u probably would want to stay away from this hotel. but u can always get discounts, ive seen 200$ a night on orbitz one time, and for Bellagio on a weekend, that's a bargain. the room is clean, posh, and has a comfortable bed. if u have enough to spare, get a room with a fountain view.

the Bellagio also boasts a watershow in front of the hotel and I think it runs every 15 mins at night during weekends. its always packed, so its always best to come right at the end of show for the next show. inside, they have the beautiful garden that is always changing every season

First time here.. def won't be my last.

Trip started out with a hiccup with no limo service when I landed.  But from there, this place is def the best place to stay.  I had a Bellagio suite in the spa tower.. amazing views of the fountains and the strip!  

Also from the lobby to the spa tower, jean phillippe bakery.. almond croissants are amazing.  Better than bakery nouveau in west Seattle.

The room had his and her bathrooms.. huge spa tub and steam room\/shower.  Room was cozy and probably the most comfortable I've ever been in a Vegas hotel room. 

I can't wait for my next trip at the end of summer!

The fountain. The shops. The utter beauty of everything. This place is amazing, and one day I hope to stay at the hotel. Just passing through and doing some window shopping, this place seems like one of the most elegant hotels in Vegas.

One of the biggest casino floors on the strip. Very nice, but also very busy. Always a good crowd going. Can't speak to the hotel, but there's good action to be had here if you want to gamble. And who doesn't love the fountain show?

The Bellagio, like Caesars or the Venetian are the elite on the strip.
They are always my highlight and the light and watershow at the fountains never gets old.
You can see it for free out front every half hour on the half or full hour.
It gets full but you still have a great view and nice photo ops.
Inside it is always very well kept, great restaurants, shops and bars, a must see!

Wonderful experience and what a lovely place to stay! This was my 7th trip to Vegas and my boyfriend's 1st. It was also his birthday. I had been in the lobby and casino of the Bellagio many times but had never stayed there. Decided since it was my boyfriend's first time in Vegas to make it a special trip so booked here. We ended up paying to upgrade our room when we checked in to a fountain view room and am glad we did. The view was AMAZING. Check in was pretty quick as we got there around 3 pm on a Monday. 

Our room was lovely. Large, clean and that amazing view! Whoever was our housekeeper on the 25th floor gets five stars for being awesome. Turn down service, chocolates next to the bed, ongoing towel replacement.... sigh. I wish I had service like that at home. The hotel even sent a box of chocolate truffles to the room for my boyfriend's birthday. There are multiple elevators at the hotel that only go to certain floors. This is nice as it cuts down wait time to get an elevator. I also like that there is someone that stands by the elevator bank to make sure you are actually staying in the hotel before they let you on the elevators.

The pool area was so pretty. We didn't ever lay out or use the pool but did sit out at the bar at the pool for a drink. The casino itself is great and while I am not a big gambler, I did win 180$ on a slot machine so was happy with that. My boyfriend played craps for the first time. The lobby at this hotel is a MUST see. It is beautiful.

I would pick this hotel as my first choice of a place to stay for future visits. Had a wonderful time in Vegas.

The rooms are nice, a little dull but nice. The big bathroom even in entry level rooms are a massive plus and if you like to soak in a deep tub you will be very happy. The rest of the Casino is nice enough but I think next time I will head back to my usual hangout which is the Mirage.
The hotel is absolutely clean and beautiful. The customer service are outstanding. Everyone here is super friendly and helpful. Totally satisfied with everything here. Highly highly recommend.

I had a great stay at Bellagio - I was here for a convention and so my perspective is of a business traveler vs someone looking to party. 

Room: A
I was in the spa tower, so totally non smoking (hooray). My room was large, spotless and nicely decorated. I didn't have a view but I didn't pay for one either. The bed was comfortable, and I was a big fan of the bathroom with soaking tub. I brought bath salts from home and had my own mini spa break - highly recommend. No coffee makers or fridges in the rooms FYI. Also, if you want privacy, use the sign - I swear to god they were trying to clean my room\/turndown\/etc like 10x per day. I had no issues with hearing people in the halls or other rooms but I think they don't put the party crowd where I was. 

Food: B
Standard casino mix of mostly expensive "celebrity" (I.e. Was on Top Chef that one time) places, an Asian place, a buffet, etc. Not many reasonably priced places but there's a ton within walking distance. I ate a lot of conference catering and rate it above average. 

Amenities: A
Small but beautiful pool area, large clean casino with a good ventilation system, absolutely stunning conservatory (done up Japanese cherry blossom style) and overall beautiful grounds - plus the iconic fountains. 

Staff: A
Great in general - helpful, friendly, always willing to help with directions or whatever. 

Overall: A
My kind of Vegas hotel - clean, not too many loud drunk idiots (ymmv on weekends) and generally pleasant to spend time in. Also, I had an early flight out so got to walk through the casino at 3:30am - highly recommend for amazing people watching.
A perfect place to visit with a loved one. You don't have to be a gambler to enjoy the hotel. Just hang outside and enjoy the view.

Enjoyed my stay here.

Definitely appeals to a different group of people.

If you are going to stay there, make sure to have a room (somewhere in the middle) w\/ a view of the water show. It's nice to watch watch the show from your room and take pictures.

Can get expensive staying there, even more so if you like to shop in their mall.

Good location as you can walk to Caesar's, Paris, Planet Hollywood, etc. to check  out some of the other hotels and\/or shopping areas.

I love visiting this hotel, and I try to do so every time I'm in Vegas.  I have yet to actually stay here, but maybe one day my dreams will come true.  I would love a room with a view of the water.  Awwww........

I love the front desk, the flower exhibits, hotel lobby, casino, and of course the water shows.  I could just stand there all day and watch them.

At the shopping area with my family, great music, the decorations are great. Nice dinner at olives, just very disappointed with security letting 2 men half dress like Santa showing off???? Really? Is this appropriate specially with lots of families?? Come on security, don't let this happen in your property

Bellagio we called you our home for a few days last week, we gave you some of our money in hopes of taking some of yours in exchange for the right bet.

The hotel itself was a nice experience after our first night here for some reason the maids decided to be like super hostile and really wanted to clean our room they woke us up at around 7:30am and then called us again about 2hrs later I'm not sure why this was even though we had the do not disturb sign on our door it definitely annoyed me as I had been up most of the night and needed to sleep in.

Our room was conjoined with our friends room and they also had the same unpleasant wake up experience but a bit worse seeing they had a little one with them who was very cranky early in the am.

The rest of our stay here was way more enjoyable as we didn't endure anymore conflicts with the staff and were able to rest peacefully.

The hotel was definitely better than some of the other places I've stayed on the strip but it really didn't extend into the five star quality I expected and have seen in the past.

We would consider staying here again but only if the price is right as we kinda felt like this was a very unfamily friendly environment by the way the staff treated our friends little ones.
in my opinion best place in the las vegas to play and to stay and to eat and party

Bellagio still remains to be one of the premier hotels on the Las Vegas strip.  

While Encore, Wynn, City Center, & Cosmopolitan are the new kids on the luxury hotels on the strip, there is still a undeniable class that can not be ignored at the Bellagio. 

Home of the Bellagio fountains,  the Bellagio Conservatory, Chihuly glass blown art in the lobby, beautiful private pool and gardens.  The restaurants here are some of the best of the strip, Prime Steakhouse, Noodles (one of my faves), the Seafood Buffet (one of the best on the strip). 

Bellagio is for your refined guest, who don't like to be seen, but have.  It's not your bikini clad day time pool party, it's your home away from home.  

Be sure to get a room with a view of the Bellagio fountain show.  It thunders like champagne with views of the Eiffel Tower at the Paris.  

  I like the suites here over the standard rooms, so upgrade if you can.  Enjoy your stay and have a glass of champagne and watch the show from your room.  Truly spectacular!

This hotel is wonderful! hands down, beautiful architecture, and a great water show! Everything is extremely clean, the location is amazing, as it is literally located near the center of the strip. At night time, they play the water show in front of the fountain. Although there is a set schedule for the showing, its never really gone off on time... Also, if youre exiting the hotel, dont bother to sit at the ramps and make sure you arnt leaning towards the guardrails!! There have been huge trails of ants which is insane (hopefully they fixed this issue). The staff overall was very professional, which is nothing less expected from a Five Star Five Diamond Resort.

This review is for the Casino only.  

Five stars for the two hidden $5 Black Jack tables and all the complimentary Peroni beers one can drink.  Even though I lost I totally won!  

Travelers Tip:  Look for the $5 dollar Black Jack tables.  There are only two and they are wheelchair accessible so they sit lower than the other gaming tables (which made me wonder, does the Bellagio assume people in wheelchairs have less money?  Oh well it's fine by me!).  

The first table is located in the front of the Casino, in the first set of table games right behind the very first roulette wheel in the second row away from the main aisle.  The second table  is located in roughly the same area only  in the second table gaming area. Just look for the first roulette wheel in each section and you'll find it.  It took me a while to find them.  I even asked a bartender where they were only to be informed with a laugh, "there are no $5 dollar Black Jack tables at the Bellagio, you're in the wrong place"...he was wrong.  :)  Must be a pretty well kept secret.

Good luck!

I'm definitely torn between a Fan rating and a rating of as good as it gets...and here's a few reasons why

First and for most, the hotel is HUGE.  I mean huge as in to get from the Front\/Check-In Desk to the room elevators (don't forget to show your room key to the attendant, else you can't get through), to my room....what an immense walk.  And that is not even going from one side of the hotel to another.

The rooms were pretty standard to the caliber of Las Vegas hotels...roomy, clean, and I was definitely thankful for a great view of the pool.  I fell in luv with the electronic curtains, but felt annoyed that the light switches were all over the room.  Can I just get one central light switch to turn things on and off?  I liked the bathroom with it's roominess and separated bath tub and shower.  And one thing I REALLY liked....the toiletries.  Being in the dessert, Bellagio was very smart to provide it's hotel guests with toiletries using Olive Oil.  Definitely saved my skin while out there for the week.

The service from the Front Desk, Room Service, Housekeeping were all very friendly.  And the only inconsistency were the room elevator guards.  I mean, smile..will ya.

Was a definite fan of the 30-40 minute room service delivery, but for being the Bellagio, the TV in the room was quite questionable.  We're talking about probably a 28 inch Panasonic tube TV.  I think the electronic curtains were more advance in technology than the TV was.  I mean, not even HD compatible.

A few touristy notes about the Bellagio.....it has a stop on the City Center (free) tram that will take you to the City Center and all the way to the Monte Carlo and back.  You just have to make your way to the Tram stop.

The Bellagio is severely lacking in simple eateries.  Aside from 2 small cafes, there really was nothing else aside from their buffet (known to be one of Vegas' best) and their somewhat pricey restaurants such as Le Cirque.

The water show runs every 30 minutes, but I believe looks best at night.  And if you can't catch the music while the the Water show is going, one of the TV channels plays the music for you in your room.

The Garden of the Bellagio apparently gets changed per season or occasion, and we were lucky enough to be there when they completed one of these changes.  Really fantastic place to capture a moment and a picture.  You'll also see some flashes in the lobby as people take pictures of that horse and the ceiling.

One KEY note I did NOT realize until it happened....the housekeeping staff has every authority to check you out of your hotel room.  How you may wonder...

Well, if you are noted to have left your room (no bags, no toiletries, no personal items left), the housekeeping staff can deem that you have in fact left the hotel...thus having you checked out of the hotel registration system.  Yeah, definitely surprise to me.

But the check-out staff easily cleared up that snaff-u.

I had always wanted to stay at the Bellagio and finally got to. I'm glad I did. This is a great hotel. It's right in the middle of the strip. You can easily walk to almost anywhere on the strip from the hotel. 

I had a room with a strip view in the Spa Tower. The downside is that it's a bit of a walk from where you check in. I'm used to the elevators being near the check in desk. The view is also a bit to the right of the fountain. It's still a very nice view. 

The nice thing about the Spa Tower is it's easy to get to the pool from there. The pool is very nice. It's pretty quiet and relaxing. 

The staff at the hotel was very nice. I liked that there was security where the elevators are. The hotel and casino were both very clean and I felt safe. The bathroom is large. I expected the room itself to be bigger, but that was OK. 

I would've liked at least one more choice for casual dining and a Starbucks. 

Overall I was very happy with my stay there and would consider staying there again.

Horrible- it is the correct word for this hotel.
1. When checked in we asked for a room with a view- we were asked to pay $25 extra per day, we agreed. When got to the room we noticed that the only good view we have is a view of a drive up to the tower. Not only that but also, the room is filthy- there was a pill of some sort laying next to the phone, ripped wallpaper in the bathroom and molded shower door. So, I called to front desk and was told that for a better view we need to pay additional $15 per day - I said no problem and we had to move again. (It would be easier and better if we were given different options to begin with)
2. We get to the 2nd room and notice that the room has 1 bed instead of 2 queens that were requested, and I call to front desk again. And we had to move to room 3.
3. We get to the room #3, unpack and almost ready to leave just to find out that safe is not working.
4. When we checked in- we were told to use room key for entry and exit to the parking structure, well just to find out that the parking package was never added.

Management of this hotel should really get their act together. Disappointed to say the list!!!

2014 YELP 100 CHALLENGE - 36\/100

Beautiful hotel! Probably the nicest one I had visited this weekend, other than THEhotel at Mandalay Bay. It was a vintage, regal and expensive look to it. I have not stayed here, but I was really impressed by my visit this past weekend and would love to return.

LOCATION:
Excellent. Right in the middle of the strip for easy access all over

EXTERIOR:
Beautiful. Especially the beautiful lake in the front which gives it a little bit of distance from the actual street

INTERIOR:
Like I said earlier - regal, fancy, stunning
Entryway has beautiful glass flowers all over the ceiling

SHOPS:
Not too many. Most were very high end stores such as Prada, Gucci, Fendi, Louis Vuitton, etc. More eye candy, but they definitely match the expensiveness of this hotel!

WHAT TO SEE:
Flowers in the entryway
Window shop in the expensive designer stores
Conservatory & botanical gardens (decorated every season!)
Jean Philippe patisserie - home to the "world's largest chocolate fountain"
The famous water fountains out front! Shows either every 15 or 30 min. depending on day\/time

I would love to stay at the Bellagio if I could afford it. I think I was expecting the Paris hotel to look more along the lines of Bellagio. Kinda disappointed over there...BUT Bellagio was simply beautiful!

It's my first time staying here. Then again, I am not a staycation kind of person. I am here only bc of company meetings. If they are going to pay anyway I might as well stay here since the classes run early in the morning.

I read another Yelpers review and I wonder where they stuffed her, the maintenance room for the fountains since she complained about raggedy towels and green tiled bathrooms? I agree that I wasn't wowed by this place but things are not bad. Towels look relatively decent. I can't tell if they are new or old. There's no frayed edges and it's pretty fluffy. Everything is clean. No green moss or water scum in the bathroom. Everything is neatly in its place. The wallpaper looks sufficiently classy. It looks like attention was paid to the room. Granted, the Venetian looks better but this grand dame started the mega resort and was the first 5 star casino. I don't know what it looked like when it was new but there's a certain classiness to it. Wynn was always one notch above MGM so maybe it did go down hill a bit. It's no longer the crown jewel.

I didn't valet my car like the working American whose rental was snubbed by Valet guys who are accustomed to parking exotic cars like Maserati. I parked my humble 4Runner in the garage and walked my plebeian feet to the elevator. I just heard a gurgling noise coming from the sink after using it. Probably a little pressure issue. It has been a few years since I inspected this place along with City Center. Everything was running pretty tiptop and they were going for efficiency. Aria was LEED certified. Which I was told was the first casino to be LEED certified. Bellagio, although older was running at top efficiency.

Back to the hotel, the beds are comfy enough. The AC vent comes from the wall and looks like it's a shutter. It's pretty quiet. The window has a vent that allows outside air to come in. The wind was howling tonight so I closed it. But it's nice in the daytime when you want fresh air. Good little trick. The lights do have plugs built into them for you to plugin your AC for your phone or laptop. The clock has a smartphone dock, not for iPhone though :(

The wifi is free and anyone can login but it is kind of slow and cuts you off after 30 min it seems. It also cuts in and out at times as well. It's pretty bad wifi for a good hotel. Again, this place was conceived before the iPhone came out even so it wasn't a foresight back then. But at least they are generous with free wifi unlike some hotels that charge you.

I checked into Bellagio Towers in the fifth floor, which is around the corner from the Buffet. So far, I don't hear my neighbors unless I try really hard and maybe hear a drawer or something. Next to the bed are controls for all the lights and for controlling the drapes. These controls are next to the table\/hallway as well. You can control the lights every which way.

I am not sure what attention to detail this place lacks, other than one of the ceiling\/reading bulbs being out on one side of the bed. These things do happen so I am not going to gripe about it.

Tomorrow I shall check out the pool. Oh, they will charge you $50\/day if you mess their minibar and store stuff in there. That's just MGM's management style of penny pinching. I am not a fan of MGM but I hardly call this place second rate. Try a hotel in Reno and you will see what 3rd and 4th rate is. Dusty furniture, velour drapery and seating. Ooh, I can hear the Addams Family theme song just thinking of hotels there I stayed at.

Downstairs it's pretty busy. Asians are snapping pictures of the scenery and pictures. I guess they are the only ones that care to notice the little flowery things or decorations. I think they should make little areas for Asians to stand and take their pictures without impeding traffic. They can even set up little tea stands there and a little Segway Fun Tours bus can pick them up and guide them thru the casino floors, stopping at each Baccarat table of course.
