Asians do like to gamble. I joke, half heartedly. They don't make $15 billion in Macau by playing penny slots. Funny thing is I rarely take pictures of scenery or myself. I don't take selfies of myself or otherfies of other people.

What I did notice is that everyone in the hotel greets you whenever you go by, the housekeeping to the gym.

So I am having a real problem with this review... Why? Because I don't go to Vegas to gamble, or for the shows, or to play. I go to Vegas for conferences and seminars... because they happen to be in Vegas, not because they are in Vegas.

The conference venue was the Bellagio. It is a stunning property, meticulously maintained, huge - there are towns in the United States and other places smaller than this one hotel - and busy. Most airports aren't as busy as the lobby of the Bellagio when I entered it. There was a *very* long line to check in.

In fairness, the staff was incredible getting people checked in. I probably waited no longer than five or ten minutes to get my turn and the clerk was friendly and efficient. 

I was assigned a room on the 22nd floor of the Bellagio Tower and given instructions how to get there. This is when you really notice how big this place is... after a long trek through the casino main floor, dragging my luggage while fighting crowds of people, I arrived at an elevator lobby with express elevators dedicated to specific floor ranges, found the right elevator and made it to the 22nd floor - quickly. Up on the floor my room was another trek away from the elevators.

Upon entering my very standard two queen room I found myself in a place that Caesar myself would have found adequate - luxurious, large, very well laid out, a stunning view, and .... quiet. What a wonderful surprise. Probably the nicest hotel room I have been in, and I have stayed at five star properties in the US and Europe.

Back to the public spaces, the Bellagio has shopping of all types, restaurants, coffee shops, art galleries, pools, spas - it really is a luxury city. The personnel is just incredible... all of them courteous and friendly. The food served was outstanding.

Pros: 
* Great room 
* incredibly courteous and friendly people 
* great venue, you never have to leave the place for anything

Cons: 
* Way to large, too much walking to get from one place to another
        o  I got my workout without working out
* In room WiFi - if you bring a pc be prepared to have to reboot several times before you can get on (that is with help from the front desk) - once you are on you have all the bandwidth and reliability you can ask for - but it is a real pain
* Calling the front desk: You'll get a recording to hold, every time. It's like calling a call center

In closing, know why you are going and what you want to do. If Vegas is your thing I can't imagine a better place than the Bellagio. For me it's a love-hate thing.
The hotel lobby is beautiful. The staff was nice and gave me an upgraded room. It's nice but I guess I expected a little nicer. Beds are comfy and the rooms are quiet and well insulated.

We loved this hotel.  Excellent service and accommodations.  The dealers could benefit from a customer service course (some were great, some grumpy), but that is my only complaint.  The rest of the staff members were wonderful which is a huge accomplishment as 10K people are employed by the property.  Well worth the price to have the fountain view.

We had a wonderful stay...loved Cirque de Soleil's O...loved the decorations, the staff, the fountains of course are spectacular. Had an issue with the "honor bar" that we got charged $106 for items in the refrigerator we did not use...just got off the phone with front desk (they rescinded all charges-Thank you!)...apparently even taking an item out of the refrigerator (to see what brand the $55\/small bottle of champagne is :), there is a motion detector. If you stay at Bellagio, especially with family that doesn't understand this, request a lock on the honor bar.

Again, we had a great time...p.s. the buffet was amazing, never had so many different good foods in one meal.

p.s. The tallest ferris wheel in the world (550'), the High Roller was spectacular.

Horrible service in the B & S bar. Smoke was off the charts and the wait staff didn't care one bit that we paid for the reserve seating. Nachos came out cold and when I complained, didn't even get a response from the waitress. Do not waste your time.

I and my girlfriend stayed at the Bellagio hotel during December 25th, so this may have been a factor to consider when reading this review. We booked a room through Expedia. I will start with the good things: The room was very comfortable. That means the bed was very comfortable, the shower (we didn't have a bath) was nice, and the minibar was well equipped.  Also, HD TV with convenient inputs if you want to bring your own equipment like Ipad (just bring a connector). The view from the window was not impressive (i.e. not the water show direction). The bad: it took us 30 minutes to find parking. I should note that parking is free and probably other hotels in the stip face the same problems during peak hours because many people (not hotel guests) use the parking for visiting the casino. Also, you can always use valet parking if you wish.  The way from the parking to the hotel was tedious. Generally it feels like walking in a busy shopping mall with your suitcases. Not a feel of a luxury hotel. There are many pedestrians tourists coming in to the Bellagio to see the water show and inside to walk around. This is part of the experience of the strip, I guess. However, this makes the place be less elegant and more like a zoo. The front desk is located within this chaos and the clerk at the desk was pretty cold to us. But I could understand that she was very tired herself from all the noise around. At the check in we were also informed that we will pay another $28 dollar per day for a "resort fee". I think Expedia should inform clients about this fee when booking because it is a serious addition to the price. I also know Priceline does not inform about this fee. This is common to other hotels and you will not know the fee until you know the hotel. During my time of visit there was not much a "resort" feeling because the only free thing we used was the internet (which btw worked great). However, It was too cold to use the outdoor pool (we didn't see anyone using it and it may have been closed- not sure). The water show which I heard so much about before I came was also not such a big attraction in my opinion. Yes, if you pass by you should stop by and watch but don't book a room at the Bellagio for this reason. Just stop by like most others.  Generally, some people may be impressed from the indoor decorations. If you come from Europe you will probably not be impressed at all.  The Bellagio is more a pretentious hotel, not schick.  This is my opinion- many people will probably disagree with me. Many others will say this is Las Vegas. But I have seen much classier lobbies and casinos in Las Vegas during my visit. From my walking around I prefer the Aria or Encore lobby, for example.

I had the pleasure of working with Amy and Laura from the Concierge.  They are both morr than helpful and made my trip one of the best ever.  Bellagio is one of the best resorts ive ever had the chance to stay at.

Stayed at the Bellagio for Halloween weekend and it was great! My friends had already checked in by the time my boyfriend and I arrived, but they did say the process was quick. The room was clean upon arrival and was a decent size. We paid for a fountain view room and were in the Spa Tower. Unfortunately, the view of the fountain was not the best (we had to go to the right side of the window to see it). I would hope next time that booking this selection would render a better view.

There are a few dining options inside-- we got a crepe on Sunday from the crepe place. It was super good and a decent price compared to most food in Vegas (~$13). My boyfriend and I split it and couldn't even finish the meal. Service was a bit slow, though.

The lobby is beautifully decorated and there were fall-themed decorations in the atrium area. It was SUPER GORGEOUS and my favorite "autumn" decor I saw all weekend. The only place that has a nicer lobby\/hangout area is the Cosmo.

I didn't hit the casino here at all, but my boyfriend did. He was a bit upset that, though he was playing for nearly 20 minutes, not one person came by to take a drink order. NO BUENO! The tables are upwards of $15 minimum bets, so we didn't play anything. 

My friends got room service one night and it was rather quick and the food decent. It ran them about $60. We got drinks at the pool bar and one of the bars in the casino... They were good, but very pricey (it is the Bellagio though!). 

The pool was nice. We tried to sit in the "nicer" pool area with comfy chairs and were told. we would have to pay $100 per chair for the day... Um, no thanks.

The location is perfect and close to everything on the Strip. We went to shows at the Brooklyn Bowl Friday and Saturday night and it only took us about 15 minutes to get there.

Just a quick update from my previous 1 star review...

I finally got a email about a month ago from Paige Hundley. I had a 2 night free stay at a mlife property and i was staying there for 3 nights. So I had to pay for the new years eve\/new years day night. Which was perfectly ok.

After reading the email, they comped me the first night stay there. So my whole 3 night stay was free. I really do appreciate it. 
So I am raising my 1 star to a 3 star. Only 3 stars you say?...Mainly for the inconvenience of the whole no water and moving to another room at 3 in the morning.

This is our favorite hotel! We normally stay 4-7 days in June.  The casino floor is nice with a lot of different slots to choose from. Drinks are really good. Pool is relaxing lots of lounge chairs and different sections of the pool to choose from. Our favorite cafe is located right by the pool door all sorts of French pastries, the quiche is one of our favorites and the coffee is always good. :) lots of different places to eat inside the Bellagio. At night we enjoy watching the fountain from our room or even off the street. The lounges are also fun for grabbing a drink before heading off to club.

So, My boyfriend and I stayed there in a penthouse on the 28th floor...we also brought our beloved pooch (which we paid $125 extra...per night) We got the room for the night, with thoughts of extending our stay if we liked it...I mean its a beautiful place...who wouldn't want to stay there as long as they could? lol... Us! We would not want to stay there as long as we could... First of all, We spent the entire time looking for a place for our beloved pooch to go potty...apparently, only the rich and famous get to use the pet area..it was locked while we were there..and NOBODY that works there, could tell us where there was a place to take her.. Someone told us theres a park about a mile down the road...Really?? Why do you take pets, offer no place for a pet to potty and charge $125 a night...not to mention, they charge if your pet has an accident.. I bet alot of pets have accidents...It comes from not having anyplace for them to relieve themselves! Also, they want you to keep your pet kenneled when you leave the room...which I'm fine with..except for the fact that they have you sign a paper that if your pup barks, they will come to your room, take your pet, and board it til you leave..you have no say, and can't get your baby til you leave...and they charge you for that! My baby is a rescue and special needs...shes on meds for life, and screams when shes scared due to all the abuse shes been thru before we got her..  Anyways, the only person who made our stay worthwhile, the only person who made that one night worth it, was the room service man...he was so nice.. Very friendly.. And he was the ONLY staff that was friendly and welcoming!  We left here and went to the LaQuinta...which IS pet friendly...and Motel 6...which is also truely pet friendly...they don't charge for your baby to stay with you...and they have actual areas for your baby to relieve him\/herself.. I suggest one of them ..especially if you are taking your baby..

I stayed here while
Visiting my brother and thought it was really nice. The food and the service was very friendly. I liked the whole ambience here and there is much to see here inside the hotel.

No need to gamble here to be happy.  I would leave happy if I just wasted my whole trip at the pool.  Rows and Rows of chairs, with lush white towels.  Even better, splurge on a  cabana lounge.  Need a drink?  Raise up the flag on your lounge chaise and *poof* a pool boy\/girl comes to take your order.  The grounds are amazing to look out on.

For breakfast I was happy going downstairs to the cafe located near the pool for a croissant and a mocha java.  when one is in Las Vegas, you never spend much time in the room, but it was a welcomed retreat after a late night of dancing and drinking.  The view of the strip and the fountains were fantastic.  The marble soaking tub is big enough for two.

Light and Fix within the Bellagio are sensational to boot.  A girl could sit at the bar drinking cocktails and drooling over the bartender all night.  Boys if you wan to get into the club, make sure you have a pretty girl with you. Otherwise you'll be in line for awhile.

I luckily caught the water show on my way to meet up with my friend.  I videotaped it using my phone along with others next to me.  Remarkably everyone was quiet, taking it all in.  A must see when you're here.  

Inside, the lobby had this cool hand-blown glass canopy with multiple colors covering the ceiling. What a sight. And of course there's the courtyard filled with flowers and other plants. They decorate it differently form time to time in honor of various holidays.

I grabbed drinks at Yellow Tail...the mixologist knew what he was doing!  Never had a vodka-cranberry taste so good!

Las Vegas is known for its Hotels along the strip...and they do it so well!

We have wanted to stay at Bellagio for years and finally had the opportunity on X-Mas. Unfortunately, the hotel did not live up to our expectations. The room had very recently been remodeled and reeked of new carpet. 

The smell was so bad it made our eyes water. When we requested a different room we were rudely told the only thing available was a smaller room with double beds on a smoking floor. 

Since that wasn't an option for us we simply chose to live with it. Looking around the hotel it became quite clear that the property was showing it's age - faded awnings in the casino and ripped carpet in places. Given that Bellagio is charging a $20 resort fee that several other hotels are not, we expected more.

It is an ok place to visit but may be not to stay unless you are alright with smelling cigarettes all over the place. It was really annoying in that sense. Thankfully, my room did not have that smell but, the bathroom definitely needs some remodeling. It had some archaic shower head I didnt find the most comfortable. So, a little disappointed, especially for the money you shell out, its not too much to expect I guess.

What can you say... Bellagio is a timeless classic on the Las Vegas strip.  With so many dining and entertainment options, Bellagio continues to attract herds of people each day.

I personally love the scent the conservatory gives off with the fresh flower displays which are changed 5 times a year.  Even as a local watching the fountain show never gets old and they have recently added a couple of new songs to keep things fresh.

The pool area smells of lilac and has perfectly manicured shrubs along the walkways.  There are several pools and I had not too much of a problem finding chairs on a Sunday afternoon.   

While this isn't a party property, you'll definitely have a fun, high-class time here!

Obviously the Bellagio is a beautiful hotel. However, I found that the rooms weren't much different than any mid range hotel on the strip. I assumed that due to the higher price range, the Bellagio rooms would be so much nicer. Nope, not really. So what are you paying for? The lobby, the conservatory, the pools, the grounds, etc. Which are all gorgeous of course! 
I liked that there were a lot of great restaurants and cafes to choose from, and all the staff were really friendly and helpful. Overall we had a nice stay.

I am staying here in a spa tower fountain view room. The room smells smoke. This one star is for the front check in desk staff Jem. She is very passive, unfriendly . She probably had a bad day , but she brought her bad mood towards customers. To be honest, I will not return for such an unprofessional attitude.

Great hotel. Prettier lobby. Love the chocolate fountain. 
Rooms were beautiful, clean and spacious.the girls loved it and had a blast. 
Top notch service

I would say, this has probably been the nicest hotel I've been to in vegas (wynn, mBay, and TI). Even with the crappiest view of the pool, I still had to admit that interior-wise it was the nicest I have stayed at. I was able to stay in one of the new renovated resort rooms and it was pretty damn awesome. For the lazy, grumpy sleepers they have curtain buttons right next to the bed. They have copious amounts of pillows and chairs in the room and the beds were moderately comfortable. The staff is pretty nice also although the 20 dollar trick got me much more at ti (better view and champagne). At the bellagio, I was given no upgrade but only a checkin time at 11. I wouldn't say that is worth a 20 dollar bill but its vegas and a gamble is a gamble

I dunno... saw one of the best shows of my life there.  It is big.  It has trees inside.  It has Chihuly... minus two.  

I don't know, though.  I just don't like it.  The floor is a wreck of different ideas running into each other like trains.  I am sure it serves its purpose.

As a guest, you can hardly move through the lobby... the place is treated like Disneyland, and the lobby and casino and floors are filled by gawkers without any semblance of predictability as to their exhausted stupour filled stagger.

But "O"!

"O"!

Wow.

Absolutely breathtaking.  I'm not one for upgrades, tend to do things as cost effectively as possible, but if you can, spend the extra money to get a fountain view room.  The fountain is spectacular from all angles. While it must be seen up close and personal, outside, the best views of it are from the rooms, where your perspective allows you to see the entire lake.  I cannot even begin to articulate how stunning it is.

When One thinks of Las Vegas, classiness is probably the last thing that comes to mind. However, Bellagio is very classy. Probably one of the most beautiful casinos that I have ever been in. It is an extremely well done hotel in every sense. Despite the massive size of the hotel, the service is on par with much smaller luxury hotels. Still my favorite hotel in Las Vegas.

This review is for the champagne brunch.

What could be better than winning $140 on the nickel slots while your friends wait in line? Using that money for the $29 per person champagne brunch and treating your friends! Yay!

So once we got in, we were seated in Vicky's section. She was great. It was like eating in Chinese restaurant except it wasn't our water glass that was never empty, it was the Champagne glass!

Lot's of options, great sweet potato mash, salad wing... you name it. Definitely worth hitting it up! The only thing that was missing were some corn dogs or something.. but I forgot... I wasn't at the Gold Coast.

So for this trip to Vegas, we stay at Bellagio.
Of course we all know this to be the home of the awesome fountains in the front, or maybe even their buffet...or the neat little garden area they have...but unless you stay here, you don't see how it's ran (obviously lol).
Upon check in-it was insane, granted we were here for a conference, so everyone else arrived around the same time. The line was outrageous, took about 15 mins to get to the front. 
Of course the staff was courteous-but the front desk guy tried to up sell us a little too hard. We knew we would hardly be in the room, no need for a suite.
The rooms were clean and stocked with everything needed. Housekeeping was attentive. No complaints here.
We did use the concierge, which the gentleman was nice but we never did get a call back regarding the club in Bellagio, as he said we would. Not cool.
The hotel\/casino is huge. I've been in it several times before but never knew the extent of it u too I stayed there and attended a conference there.
The casino is chilly, I'd say even more chilly than others. Not a bad thing except to those like me who get cold easily.
Security at the elevators could use some ramping up. I've stayed in other hotels that had tighter security than Bellagio....like Venetian. Hell, even Sunset Station in Henderson has tighter security.
For clothes laundering, they could use a little bit more organization in taking the orders.
Overall, it was a great experience. Great place to stay with clean rooms. I'd definitely stay here again.

I loved loved loved the suite I stayed in at the Bellagio. The hotel itself was very chaotic especially at night. It was packed and very loud. Typical for a casino I guess but this hotel and casino seemed overly rowdy even for Vegas.

OK, so i'm walking down the strip wondering..."where are all the *cool* people?"  My friends and clients tell me that they go to Vegas, but right now--i'm just not seeing it..... OK so now i'm crusing the pool at Bellagio--Check out the private cabanas...*now* we're talking... some interesting and attractive people hanging out...OK Bellagio that's where it's First Class...was getting a little worried there for a while.

Air cond. in rooms is weak.   Housekeeping needs improvement on bathroom cleaning, glasses in room were dirty and you could see rag marks around the rim glasses.  Shower floor very slippery!  Front desk clerk was not happy to be there.  Buffet line one hour wait and not worth it.  Hotel in major need of housekeeping, dust on ceilings in bathroom in lobby area.   Good points:  beds are comfy, room decor updated, fountain show superior!

Five stars for the service and very helpful staff, but three stars for the room, which was quite spacious, but the bathroom definitely needs some refreshing. It had lots of hard water stains and wear and tear. Extra credit for all the outlets, prompt housekeeping, and handsome room service waiter.

*woof*

LOVE Bellagio....now and forever. You're in Vegas....it screams it...pretty people....high end tables...$25 cocktail----put money on a table or in a slot, kids! Beautiful rooms....and smells.....clean....unlike some other casinos on the strip that pump Apple or some musk that reminds me of old man meat through their vents....

One complaint....the Conservatory this trip around was hands down weak....It was a Chinese New Years theme and it was plain slapped together like my tacky neighbors Christmas display. I can't wait for their next scene....maybe a wonderland theme like the year's past? If you have never been to the Conservatory, it's always fresh and WORTH the walk and changes every season.

We have stayed at the Bellagio a number of times in the last 5 years.  It has been a 5 star venue for us because of their excellent customer service, luxurious appointments, great location and amenities, etc.

But things seem to be going downhill.  I blame it on wear and tear, not just of their rooms and facilities, but in the casino, and most regrettably with customer service.

Bellagio remains a high-end hotel.  Shops are expensive as are the eateries.  I am not a whale, my wife and I are not extravagant in our dress (she does like her shoes and purses, though), but we have usually been treated with respect and there has always been that extra effort to accommodate our needs.

During our last two stays?  Not so much.  It's intangible..... a look you get, hesitation before a response, a smile that doesn't seem right......I don't think it's my imagination, or is it....no.....maybe......

Last year, someone got into our room.  We didn't have anything taken, but a box of candy was half eaten and a bottle of water was gone.  We reported it and were not charged, but hmmm.....who has access to our room (I know I locked up), an employee?

When I play the slots, I'm always collecting change as I cash out my tickets.  We were killing time before we were to leave for the airport and I had acquired a pocketful of change. I went to the cashier cage and asked if she could take my change because I had a plane to catch.  She practically laughed in my face.  I was tempted to do something rash, but we needed to get out of Dodge and I let it slide.  If I had reviewed the place then, it would have gotten one reluctant star from me..

This last time, we were comped 3 nights and we gave the Bellagio one more try.  It was a much better stay.  Check-in wasn't so stressful.  Maid service was good, and they now have a change counting machine in the casino.

The Bellagio is still a great hotel, but iit's lost some if its sheen.  Definitely not what it was 5 years ago.  T

The stay at this hotel was absolutely amazing!  You can tell right away why Bellagio is a 5-star hotel.  Out of all the hotels I've stayed at The Strip in Las Vegas, I can say that this is by far my most favorite one.  The Garden Conservatory itself by the lobby is a great free attraction which is wonderful to look at.  Check in line is quick and efficient especially around the time before lunch if you opt to do the early check in time at 10AM which we did for an additional $40 and late check out is at 3PM for the same price.  One of the main reasons why I chose to stay at Bellagio, besides the fact that it's in walking proximity of everything, was because of the Dancing Fountains.  I could never get tired of watching the Fountains of Bellagio.  The view from the Deluxe Fountain View Room was perfect.  I liked how the room was clean and amenities were complete even if we checked in early and checked out late.  The bed was just so soft and firm at the same time that I slept really good.  Everything from the bathroom, the view outside, to the bed was great and accommodating.  Check out was very easy to do since they give you different options to skip the line when checking out like via the TV in the room or by email the then you just have to drop the keycard in one of the boxes by the exit after the elevators.  I believe the price we got for 2 nights was reasonable especially since I've signed up at M Life Rewards Program before booking which I recommend that everyone do prior to booking.  Overall, I loved the stay here at Bellagio and would definitely go stay here when we decide to go to Las Vegas again.

8\/1- My home away from home when I visit Vegas. But I think the smoke in the casino got worse over the years. Check in was quick although there was a long line which was a nice surprise. Got coffee and gelato from Jean Philippe - both very yummy.

I lost a lot of money playing 3 hand poker and casino war. Never play 3 hand poker and casino war you will only lose money. Money that could be used to feed your child instead of paying for their gorgeous installations in the lobby. Dam that stuff is beautiful. I want to hate it but I just can't.

After all is said and done, I usually eat my sorrows away at the delicious buffet. Then I reflect on what just happened at the beautiful fountain show. As the water shoots in the air I imagine what it may feel like being hit by one of those and I think to myself, "Everything is going to be okay...

Best, yes, the absolute best BEDS in town!  Their mattresses are super comfy and we even, yes- we did, tried to find the label to so we could purchase a similar mattress for home!  The rooms are quite and super dark when the drapes are drawn, clean and smell good.  

Although nice spots at the pool are hard to come by, I was a die hard and woke up at 7am, yes that's early for Vegas, and trekked it to the pool to get a nice spot in the sun.  

I love everything about this place.  The decor, the rooms, the pool, the craps table (where I learned to play craps) and the buffet.  Yum!

The Bellagio is a gorgeous hotel with an amazing lobby. The only trouble is there are tons of tourists walking around looking for fun which is great and all but it can really take a long time to get around the place. Just plan extra time to get anywhere and plan to walk slow. The spa is nice and they have a great salon where you can get your hair and make-up done. I go there on most trips and I always leave feeling fabulous. There are several great restaurants there like Prime and Picasso's that I recommend. Also, the piano bar in the front is a great place to people watch and they serve caviar. I only gave 4 stars though bc while it's a beautiful place it could use some updating as it's been there quite a while and it's starting to show its age. And it has a rep for having some of the tightest slots in town so you may want to stick to the card tables here. The Bank is the nightclub here and I really like it. They usually have a good dj remixing top 40. It may not be the most flashy club out there but they treat you really well, especially the ladies and it's a lot of fun. Also, O is the cirque show here. It is outstanding and I highly recommend seeing it. I've been twice and I never see shows twice! Oh and let's not forget the fountains out front. If you get a res far enough in advance at Prime, request a table next to the window so you can watch them from dinner.

This was my first time staying at the Bellagio.  I likely won't be back.  The hotel is beautiful, no doubt.  The lobby and most of the main floor was fully decorated for the holidays.  The Bellagio brought holiday decoration to a whole new level, and none of the other hotels I wandered into during my long weekend in town brought it like the Bellagio did.

It is pretty clear that the changing economy has greatly altered the landscape that is gambling in Vegas.  There were far more $10 tables than I've ever seen here before.  Even at the Bellagio, there were penny and quarter slot machines.  None of which took actual coins, mind you (so glad I brought my quart-sized baggie of quarters from home, which the Bellagio was unable to change for me because apparently they no longer have a CoinStar machine in their cashiers booth).  It never occurred to me that Vegas wouldn't willingly take my cash, even if it was a 12-lb baggie of quarters.

The Bellagio's casino felt cramped.  Not the large walkways between gambling locations, but the machines and tables all felt completely crammed in on top of each other.  And the Bellagio is one of the worst locations on the strip for smoke-to-oxygen exchange.  Caesar's next door does a much, much better job of making you feel like the air you're breathing is only mildly toxic.  We did most of our gambling next door for exactly that reason.

The room I reserved wasn't quite what I was expecting, but apparently the fantastic rate I managed to secure a few months back was far too low to obtain a full fountain view corner room, even though that's what I thought I was reserving.  Love the blanket disclaimer on the web site that lets you know that they reserve the right to screw you long and hard and give you any room they feel like upon arrival.  Cue the passive aggressive counter staff.

Truthfully, my overall stay was perfectly fine.  I even figured out that if I pressed my forehead up against the window of our room, I could kind of see a water cannon or two in the fountain up front, so maybe the hotel felt they fulfilled any obligation to me they may have had.

Been there, done that.  Next time, I'm staying at Caesar's.

What can I say that a AAA Five Diamond Award did not.

Simply a beautiful place, from the entry to the gardens and the room and of course the casino.

All the rooms that were comped were very nice. Nice view of the fountains. Very comfortable bed. Nice pool area.

The casino is very comfortable. The best seat on the strip, soft leather. 

I have the best luck here.

For some reason I was in front of the Belagio or across the street or in the vicinity view everytime the fountains went off so I got to see the "water show" about 5-8 times day and evening. It actually is different sometimes and always very pretty. The inside is gorgeous, the people watching is gorgeous and I love that bar with the subtle piano player playing...he plays very softly but the music and tune is fabulous, its always very beautiful songs and its just assists the whole gorgeous atmosphere. The 3 tier chocolate fountain in the back bakery is awesome, its like a sculpture of white chocolate, dark and milk chocolate woven and spilling harmoniously together and they offer beautiful pasteries and coffee and hot choco back there too for when its brrrr brrr outside watching those fountains

Great location, and best staff\/service I had, ever.  Some of the facilities are a bit outdated, but they look very pleasing, clean, and overall, comfortable.  Their staffs are always available despite how crazy busy they are.  Restaurants provide superb quality foods.

The only complaint I have is, the breakfast lounges have ridiculously long line.  I just could not find a place where I can seat and order food without waiting for 20~30 minutes.

When I come back to LV, I would certainly stay here again.

Stayed at the Bellagio Halloween weekend and just getting around to writing this.

We rented a penthouse suite and it was amazing, the room was huge and laid out very well.  Normally I don't feel comfortable in hotel suites, but this was the exception.

The automatic blinds and other features add that extra touch, as does the steamer and the two master bathrooms.

The only issue, I think I will be the upgrades that my wife wants to make to our house now...so thanks for that! :)

Looking forward to staying the Bellagio again soon.

Nice scene but bad customer service . It took me a couple hrs to check in. I worked with a teller who was still training and didn't really know what she was doing. She ran my card several times so I was charged 900 + dollars for a night stay. The rooms are so far from the elevator and the staff are not very helpful. The man at the valet said they will bring my bad up but when I called they told me to go down and get them. You'd think since this is suppose to be a high class establishment that people would act as such ... Smh

Came here the tail end of Labor Day weekend.  As the flight arrived into LAS, we were picked up by a Bellagio limo. WE got the Salome corner suite.  WOW! what views! Service is always amazing and room always lives up to the expectations that matches their amazing service!
I really can watch the fountain shows ALL day\/night.  My favorite is the Tiesto and "con te partiro" water show.  
Bellagio holds a dear place in my heart.  
The suite includes you to enter the "Chairman's Lounge" which is an elite lounge that you can relax and chill out with endless water, wine, tea, coffee and pastries.  The staff in there are always so patient and kind.  Also, includes a limo ride back to the airport also.  Which I think should be the standard if you are staying in a baller suite.  
Thank you for making my last stay in Las Vegas for the year, such a memorable one! 

https:\/\/www.bellagio.com\/en\/hotel\/salone-suite.html

Disclaimer I did not stay here but my experience is convincing me to switch from PH to The Bellagio. 

Came to Las Vegas for my significant other's birthday with a lot planned, and I walked out of the house without tickets I paid for to see a show. 

PH (the hotel I usually stay at) charges $7.50 for 15 minutes of internet use with $1.50 for each print. 
A bit ridiculous, the resort fee is should cover internet use just as it does with wifi. 

Anyway, my significant other gambles at the Bellagio so I thought I would ask them for help. The Bellagio instead charges per the minute for the amount used, rather than a set charge. 

Andrew at the concierge desk went above and beyond to help us. Rather than pointing us to the direction of the business center which was our initial question, he helped us print out our tickets right there at the desk. 
It may have been a simple gesture, but he took a lot of stress and worry from me. Makes me consider my hotel choices as we stay visit Vegas frequently. 

Thank you Andrew for you're simple but exceptional customer service. It is really appreciated.

There are not adequate words to express my disappointment with my very recent stay at the Bellagio (2 Bedroom Penthouse Suite).  Shortly after check in, I had a very heavy face plate fall off of the bathroom vanity onto my foot.  While filing a report with security, I was told that this was the 3rd report of this type of incident in the past few weeks.  Not one call to see if I was ok nor to offer a simple apology for the negligent maintenance.  My family was there for a surprise vow renewal ceremony.  After keeping the secret for months, the surprise was ruined by a call to the room to confirm my bridal makeup appt.  My appointment was booked by the very helpful (wonderful experience with the wedding chapel staff) wedding consultant so there should not have been a need to verify the appointment.  Again, not one call from Client Services to apologize for the mistake.  It absolutely amazes me that such little regard was shown to my family for the injury and for the ruined wedding experience.  We sacrificed to save for this special trip and that obviously means nothing to MGM nor to the Bellagio Mgt.

It doesn't get much better than the Bellagio in Vegas.  I go here every time I visit just to walk around inside.  It is beautiful and the glass artwork is worth the view alone.  They have their seasonal indoor garden which is stunning.  The fountain show in the front lake is a must-see for anyone new to Vegas.  I REALLY love this place.  "O" is here and it is one of the best shows on the strip.  I am pretty sure it is gone now but there was a priceless artwork collection there a while back that was worth the price of entry just to see some originals from famous artists.

Had such a great stay here! All of the front desk staff was knowledgeable and helpful. It's was packed but the line moved pretty quickly. We did stay memorial weekend. We got the JR. Suite King and it was perfect. Great view and a good location for the nice casinos. Slots are tight, but you shouldn't gamble where you sleep right? Lol

You know that scene in The Christmas Story when Raphie is unbelievably excited to get his Red Ryder BB gun, only to shoot his eyes out minutes later? Well, I sort of felt that way after my first stay at the Bellagio.

As a kid, a road trip Vegas was like a yearly ritual. For my parents, it was the ultimate family vacation because it was affordable and relatively close in distance. Being exposed to second hand smoke, addictive gambling, hooker billboards, and porn slappers on the street? It was a small price to pay for $29 a night at the Circus Circus, pigging out on buffets, and winning an arm full of stuffed animals at the carnival. 

Fast forward to adulthood, and things aren't that much different. I rarely turn down a good deal, and I typically stay at some of the better value hotels on the strip like Bally's or Paris. But this time around, Bellagio lured us with a book 2 nights, get 1 night free deal. Overall it still wasn't that inexpensive, but I was excited and had high expectations. I wanted to bathe in luxury. But all we got was a puddle. 

It's safe to say that in order to enjoy everything that Bellagio has to offer, you have to ante up. Want a lake view room? Extra $20 a night. Want access to the gym? $25 per day. Going to the buffet on a Friday or Saturday? Extra bucks for the "gourmet" dinners because lamb and beef wellington are on the menu. It's only the beginning.

Alas, our "deluxe" (aka standard) hotel room had to be luxurious, right? Well, not exactly. While it was spacious and had all the usual amenities, the room lacked any sort of character or ambiance. The window view was the roof and some construction cranes. Service throughout was indifferent. The dealers were grouchy. But we get it. A fat wallet speaks volumes and undoubtedly enhances the experience. But the highlight of my stay at the Bellagio? Those automatic curtains that open and close at the push of a button. Now that's why I pay the big bucks.

I have always loved the Bellagio and was fortunate enough to stay here April 2-5 2013. Indeed my entire stay did not disappoint. In fact I love it even more.  My experiences there confirms, this place knows all about excellence. From my first encounter with valet, to the bell hop, front desk, operators, even the floral staff..everyone showed concern, help and was fast and efficient.  No doubt the garden is gorgeous, as well as the rooms and the details such as the bouquets which are real flowers! All of the bouquets. I will definitely stay again at Bellagio. I felt like royalty.

This review is for the buffet at the Bellagio. I went there during Mother's Day weekend and brunch was $28.99 per person. I thought the food was going to be really good, but it turned out to be the opposite. I tried alot of what they had including lamb (omg I felt like I was eating road kill-it was that bad) and all I ended up enjoying was their mashed potatoes. They didn't have that much variety esp. dessert. I was totally disappointed!
I had some problems while staying at the Bellagio but since that the the hotel has reached out to me.   Hope to visit again soon and have a better experience

Terrible experience! We booked a two queen beds room with fountain view. The front desk was rude and definitely has the "we are the best so we don't care" attitude. But the worst part was that after we checked in the room, we found out that they gave us a one king bed room! So I called the front desk and the lady at the front desk insisted that we booked the king bed room only. She couldn't switch us because there were no two queen beds room available with the fountain view now! It wasn't true that we booked one bed as my kids are traveling with us so I double checked it was two beds when I made the reservation. However, she was very certain and I didn't want to ruin my vacation because of this so I agreed to switch to a no-view room with double beds. She said she will credit us back $30 for the no view.  So we switched the room, it was a crappy room facing the street, then my husband reminded me that we paid $50 for the view, so I called her again and told her that she needed to credit us $50 instead of $30, she was reluctant to do it, then she realized I was ready to ream her out so she agreed to credit another $20 back! What a rip off, they play tricks their customers!!! Will never come back again.

I love the hotel, but my favorite place for a quick bite is at the Jean Phillipe Patisserie. Every bite their is heaven. I started with a roast beef sandwich that had a horseradish sauce. It was wonderful. I ordered a Cherry Tart that was so good, I went back later for another one. It was the perfect dessert. I'm sad that I had to head back to Minneapolis.

We did a lot of walking in Vegas and by far the Bellagio was The best. The hotel is gorgeous and so clean. By far the best casino with the best ventilation system for those sensitive noses. The customer service was on point we even got a free room upgrade with a few of the fountains. Our room was gorgeous. I only wished there was at least free coffee in the room. The bellagio is in the center of the strip so it's perfect for site seeing. This hotel felt so classy I LOVED it!

Place is beautiful, the buffet is spectacular, the sportsbook phenomenal, O is great with a beautiful theater, and you'll go broke if you stay here, even without gambling.

It's palatial and gorgeous with the gardens and lobby, with some fine restaurants.  But when a double beam & diet is $20, oofda!

We stayed here for the VCS conference. The hotel is beautiful from the outside and inside. I've always thought of the Bellagio as a higher quality hotel on the Las Vegas strip however this last visit showed me differently. As open disclosure I'm not too picky with beds or pillows I mean I could even sleep on the floor. However the pillows in the room were terrible! You know the way a pillow gets bally when it's old and should have been in the garbage months ago. (All 4 pillows were that way). We called the front desk for better pillows and they brought us nice fluffy ones. The restroom did not have cotton balls or q-tips so bring your own.  Lastly I left my lulu lemon pants on the desk and when I called to see if they could ship them to me they said they weren't left in the room. Goodbye to my yoga pants. Overall I recommend the hotel upgrade there pillows maybe even some mattresses. Also don't assume people are incorrect when they say they have left something... look further into it because things do not just disappear.

One of my fave hotels!  It's been around a lil longer than some of the best on the strip, but it's the classiest.  Love love love the ambiance & relaxing feel of the hotel.

The rooms are awesome!  Pretty big rooms, and the bathrooms are humongous!!  Ther only thing that is weird about the bathroom is, the standing shower is directly in front of the mirror, so you get to watch yourself shower.. a lil weird..

Each time I'm in Vegas, I try visiting the Gardens, it's always beautiful & changes with the seasons.

Jean Phillipe Patisserie with the largest chocolate fountain always pulls me too!  Mmmmmm.

Anyways, still one of my faves!

My husbands cousin has their wedding vow renewal in Vegas church and they had their reception in their suite afterwards.

In order for us to use the elevator to go up to their suite, his cousin had to use their key card in order for the elevator to reach the designated level. The hallway was super modern in décor and was so long it looked like a cruise ship hallway.

The suite was gorgeous and the view of the pool was very, very nice.

My husband took me to Vegas to celebrate my 40th birthday.  We LOVED the Bellagio! The hotel was stunning.  The staff was extremely friendly and helpful from the time we checked in until we checked out.  We had a suite on the 26th floor with a view of the fountains.  It was absolute perfection!!  And the Conservatory was beautiful beyond belief.  
I noticed a couple of comments about the valet price.  We thought the price was extremely fair, especially given the fact that the daily rate not only covered the Bellagio but all of the MGM hotels on the strip.  Considering that we paid $50\/day in Washington and that was to park the car ourselves, we felt like $25\/day was a deal! 
I highly recommend the Bellagio for anyone visiting Vegas!!  We saw a show at the Luxor, the MGM Grand and the Mandalay Bay and none of them compare.  I promise this is the best of the best!

Hi,

I have enjoyed the Bellagio in the past but I had a bad experience during my recent stay. I would be unlikely to stay at the Bellagio in the future or recommend it to anyone.
 
Here is what happened: Once I checked into my room I noticed that my toilet wouldn't stop running. I called engineering to inform them and to see if they could fix it. I left my room for dinner and when I returned to my room at around 9:45 pm. The toilet appeared to be fixed but I noticed a large towel on the carpet by the bed. I lifted the towel and the carpet was soaking wet. I then called the front desk and informed them that the carpet was soaking wet and that there was a bad smell as well. I asked to be moved to a different room. I was told that the hotel was completely sold out and that I would have to stay in that room until later in the week. I was told I would be contacted in the morning about a room change. They sent someone to spray and shampoo the carpet at 10:30 pm at night. It was still wet and they laid towels back on the wet carpet. The smell was still there too. As a result I didn't sleep well and didn't feel good about my stay. The next day I was in meetings all day and when I got back to my room at lunch time I hadn't been contacted about possibly changing rooms. The smell was still in the room and the carpet was still wet. I wasn't contacted yet and it was about 12:15 pm. I called the front desk and they said they could move me to another room but I would have to wait until after 3 pm. They told me they would contact me when the room was ready. I got back to my room at 5:00 pm and I still hadn't heard from the front desk that my new room was available. So, I called the front desk and they told me they finally had a room for me. I got the new room number and moved to my new room around 5:30 pm. 

I didn't feel like I was a priority to the Bellagio and the customer service was poor. I will stay at other properties in the future as result of my recent stay and will not recommend to the hotel to anyone.

Notre virée à Las Vegas nous a conduit au Bellagio, et le moins que je puisse dire, c'est que j'ai aimé ! Malgré tout, dirais-je !

Je vous arrête tout de suite : bien sûr que c'est kitsch à souhait ! 

Mais c'était le but totalement assumé de ce petit trip au Nevada. Nous avions réservé une graaaande chambre, une fois à l'accueil, on nous propose de nous upgrader gratuitement dans une suite dans les étages supérieurs de l'hôtel. Mais bien sûr, avec plaisir ! 

Chambre immense, salon, salle d'eau (avec douche-hammam), salle de bain (avec bain à remouds), trois toilettes (3 ?!), trois (ou 4 ?) télés, 10 coussins et de petits chocolats sur le lit, surabondance de produits de beauté... ? N'en jetez plus ! Le Bellagio, c'est ultra bling-bling. C'est un peu n'importe quoi, mais une fois de temps en temps, qu'est ce que ça fait du bien. Retrouver son lit fait en rentrant du restaurant, voir le soleil se coucher sur les montagnes, dormir au 30ème étage, commander un petit-déjeuner gargantuesque au room service... Je ne fais ça qu'une fois de temps à autres, et quand je le fais, je veux que ce soit parfait ! Et rien à redire, ici, ça l'était. 

Et que dire de l'hôtel en lui même... Bien sûr, là aussi, c'est du grand n'importe quoi. Entre les fontaines (des fontaines lumineuses qui jouent les Beatles ou Sinatra, quoi !), les boutiques, les restaurants, la chapelle, le casino, le Cirque du Soleil, il y a ici une ville (bien kitsch) regroupée dans un hôtel. Au début, ça fait très peur. On a rigolé, on s'est dit que ce n'était "tellement pas nous", et puis zut, on ne vit qu'une fois, alors on a joué nos 6 dollars chacun au casino, pour rigoler, on en a regagné dix, on a pris des photos débiles dans notre suite, on a dévoré notre petit dej, on a fait semblant d'être des riches américains, ou des nouveaux riches bling-bling. Et puis on est reparti, avec plein de souvenirs et plein de fous rires ! Et si c'était à refaire, on referait tout pareil !

No one was in valet area multiples times to check our car. Called the front desk to find out why our mini bar never got stocked, was told it was probably because we had a do not disturb sign up... which we didn't. No apology. Tv was small and the movies didn't even play on the whole screen. Tv in bathroom didn't work. Poor customer service all around. Disappointed in general with the stay here. Back to the Wynn we go.

I'm not ashamed to admit that yes, I did in fact sneak into the Bellagio on New Year's Eve Day 2009. Because of the holiday and the huge crowds, there were signs posted all over that only guests could enter & keys needed to be shown. Well, one of my girlfriends & I just walked right in and had a blast! 

Since we were there during the holidays, after watching the fountain show, I was able to see the beautiful flower display, complete with toy trains with live cameras! The blown glass ceiling decoration was so fabulous I spent a good 20 minutes taking photos. The salon looked wonderful, although obviously on such short notice we didn't attempt to make an appointment. The pool was gorgeous as well. We were staying at the Luxor, so I wasn't able to see any of the rooms, but absolutely everything else at the Bellagio floored me. On my next trip to Vegas this is right at the top of my list for places to stay.

Loved it. Was tired when we arrived so we relaxed in our room & ordered room service - which was delicious.  After resting we got out and explored, no complaints at all everything was beautiful, service was superb, all in hotel restaurants were fantastic. Prime Steakhouse, was great views from outside were perfect, best servers in the world, with melt in your mouth steak. Yellowtail, a cool hip vibe- try the popping crab roll for fun & poprocks. Buffet for breakfast was a dream come true, avoid long line and walk to the right ask to be sat in the bar. Our room overlooking the fountains, wonderful 26th floor offers excellent views. Will go again and stay here, can't imagine staying anywhere else! If price is no object consider a private Villa with your own pool.

Nice hotel but outdated rooms and bathrooms.  The toilets are old and noisy, and the window is super small.  The room is much smaller than Encore and Cosmo, but service here is nice and the food is amazing.

Sorry. Yes I know it's a great hotel. Beautiful, well-decorated, large, everything you would expect from a Vegas Strip center piece.

Do I like it? Sure. Is it a preference? No, not really.

Rooms are nice. Plush, ornate, luxurious, great views. I don't have much to say about this hotel except that it is exactly what you would expect. It's an amazing hotel and resort, but I was left a bit unsatisfied.

Restaurants in the Bellagio are under par in my opinion. 

I make it a point to come here only because this is the only place on the strip that has single deck blackjack at $100 a hand. Normally for single deck, you're either off the strip or you're putting down way more per deal.

Count cards and come here.

Stay and you'll enjoy it. Stay somewhere else and I'm sure you'll enjoy it too. 

Vegas is all about luxury.

We stop by each time we visit to look at the garden inside and to watch the fountains.  This year my mother in law was having difficulty walking.  The folks at the front desk let us borrow a wheelchair for free for an hour or so.  This is much more than we were allowed at some of the other big hotels.  Seeing their displays was much nicer when we didn't have to worry about a family member being run into by other tourists.

my first trip to vegas was for a conference being held at the bellagio.  so we got discounted conference rates, and i was pretty happy.  

the hotel room was nice enough.  i have to say i found the shower pretty nice.  how do they get such good water pressure to a friggggggin' huge hotel in the middle of the desert? i did think the room was a little dark.  how about some over-head lights, guys?

also, why is the fitness center extra? i had assumed that'd be thrown in.  but the pool was of course available, and man was it nice.  i rather enjoyed laying out in the 100 degrees by the water for a while.  and it wasn't crowded at all.  

all in all, this is exactly what i think of when i think of vegas.  tacky, loud, busy, lavish.  thanks, bellagio.  you had it all.

Bellagio always has and probably always be my fav strip casino to hang out, but unfortunately not to stay at. It is a b*itch to get to on a weekend since its possibly the only casino with just one way in off LV blvd. Pedestrians never pay attn to the light and there's always some @sshole who blocks traffic by stopping to watch the fountains. But once you get past that, the self park usually has open spaces and its a quick walk to reach the casino. 

The moment you enter, you're hit by the strong scent of the thousands of flowers filling the conservatory. I love that it's your first impression of bellagio. The conservatory is a must see, but I recommend going after midnight, and not on the weekend. Otherwise you'll have to fight your way thru Asian and European tour groups and every step ruins someone's picture. It'll be a much more mellow experience going at a slow time so you can really enjoy it and take your own pretty pics. 

The conservatory is changed for several seasons - chinese new year, spring (w live butterfly garden), summer\/4th of July (very patriotic, my least fav), autumn, winter\/Xmas. You can tell they've cut their horticulture budget a little, but its still a magical place. 

The water show is another great free attraction and is best seen from the dead center. Don't bother fighting the crowds near the main valet. Its less of a clusterf*ck if you walk thru the casino and shopping esplanade, and go down the escalator to the blvd. Show is every 15 min at night, I think it's every 30 in the day. Go at night if you can - makes for better pics and its just not the same without the lighting. They don't have the show on windy days, and you can ask the concierge desk for the show schedule if you're there for a specific song. The Sinatra ones are fun, but I'm partial to the slow songs like Titanic theme and the Andrea Bocelli song. 

Bring a couple cocktails or even brown bag it if you're feeling ghetto. Just kickback and watch the show for an hour - a great cheap date. 

Now the negatives, which are the rooms. The previously mentioned traffic is a problem if you're staying there and have to deal with it throughout your stay. Valet has been extremely slow in my experience (30 min on sat nite). And if you're older, its kind of a far walk down somewhat slippery tile to get to the valet pick up area. The registration desk is conveniently located, but then its a pretty far walk thru the casino to get to the rooms. 

I was really disappointed in the rooms. I had always wanted to stay at bellagio, so I had high expectations. The rooms seemed dated, and they weren't well maintained. Working at a hotel myself, I do look at things with a more critical eye, but I called engineering to replace a couple light bulbs and fix the bathroom door which wouldn't stay shut. There were also streaks of something on the ceiling above the bed. And this has to be one of the few hotels in Vegas that hasn't upgraded to plasma\/LCD TVs. I was pretty shocked that they still had big old TVs with a really grainy picture. Hotel prices have come down in general, but bellagio still isn't what I'd call cheap. 

So hang out at bellagio - check out the free attractions, have some cocktails at the baccarat bar and a great dinner. Just don't stay there, you can do a lot better for the money.

I will put a disclaimer on my review that this was the first time I've stayed in Las Vegas, so I have nothing else on The Strip to compare it to.

That being said, I can compare it to other hotels I've stayed at outside of Vegas at a similar price-point and star-rating.

The good:
-room service was fantastic, even making up a special gluten-free box lunch for my partner for a trip out to Death Valley.
-rooms were comfortable, a good size and well appointed.
-the fountains were fun to watch and the pool was beautiful, even though it was too cold to swim in late March.

The bad:
-customer service, apart from room service, was non-existent. I realize it's a casino, and there are a lot of non-hotel guests milling about, but it felt like I was putting someone out to even ask directions.
-the restaurant choices weren't spectacular, but *were* spectacularly priced.

The ugly:
- everything smelled like cigarette smoke, which made me ill. It's ridiculous that you have to walk though the stink just to get to your room. And even though we were on a non-smoking floor, our last night there someone was smoking in the hallway or something because smoke infiltrated our room. Seriously disgusting! I spent virtually zero time in the casino, but my clothes and hair still smelled like smoke each night. 

I gave it 3 stars only based on the speculation that it might not be the best, but maybe it's better than other places on the strip? At least the rooms and hallways were clean. But, that's a sad way to judge a 5-star, 5-diamond hotel.
the fountain at night is a must see!!!my mank (aka my girl) really  enjoyed it.

OVER-RATED!

I came here for my first time in Vegas, which was about a year and half ago. Since then I've been 6 times, and have had no desire to come back to the Bellagio. Why you ask?

-check in is ridiculously long
-sub-par service
-stupid employees at the crepe counter
-too crowded with gawkers in the lobby
-you really just don't get what you pay for

2 stars only for the pedicure at the salon

Now if you want service, go to the Wynn where EVERYTHING is better

If you do not plan on spending a lot of time in the room save yourself some money and stay at a cheaper hotel. The hotel is "nice", but so is the Marriott. (Depending on the city) As a guest, there was nothing special about my stay. Certain sections of the casino had a foul odor. The casino floor appear rather darker than many of the other hotels, but that could be due to the old drapery changing colors. The flower exhibit is beautiful however anyone from other hotels can view it as well. Maybe it was my expectations that were too high but I felt as if I was being charged for everything. Expensive does not always mean good. The hotel charges for everything and please do not touch (seriously it's on a sensors and you will be charged like me) the refrigerator. There were robes in my room but I was too afraid of a fee, I did not touch them nor did I ask. House keeping did their job however we would always return to the room with my mother's purse  unzipped. This happened 3 out of our 4 day stay. Nothing was stolen, however we put anything of value in the safe or we kept it on us. This was not reported to staff due to there being no real crime however it was very weird. I can say the staff is really nice, and any issue that arose was handled swiftly. The beds must be mixed with  an angel cloud because I slept like a baby.  If you just want to brag and say you stayed "at the Bellagio" go ahead, however if you are trying to spend more money at the slots im sure there is another hotel for you.

Bellagio is well rounded!

Lots of great restaurants, beautiful fountain show outside, shops, shows, etc.  It definitely should be on every tourist's checklist.

We came here for Jean Philippe desserts and the Fine Art Gallery.  The desserts were great, and prices were reasonable!  The gallery is a bit small, but I think if the right artist is showing, it will be worth the entry fee.

Even if it is just the walk through for the scenery, it is worth the stop!

I'm currently a guest at the Bellagio. I brought two friends from out of the country who'd never been to Las Vegas and since I'd stay at the Bellagio once with my husband I thought there was NO better place to showcase the town. BIG MISTAKE! This hotel is a different place from the hotel it was when I stayed here and it was owned by STEVE WYNN. For starters we left our car in valet where we found out it was $19 a day, of course I expect to pay for valet, I figured I transfer my car to self-parking the next day, that's when I found out that SELF-PARKING WAS $10 ADAY. EXACTLY WHERE DO THEY EXPECT GUESTS TO PARK? Then I had to stand in line TO CHECK IN FOR 45'MINUTES. I felt like I was in a ride at Disneyland! When we got to our room, it was dark and it had a feel of being in a hole. We asked for another room and we got one, same view but at least higher up. The next day we're getting ready to go to the pool, we're trying to find out how many pools and where they are and so on and we come across an important bit of information, besides the charges for the cabanas there are also charges for LOUNGE CHAIRS!?!? Now that I've never seen, they're charging people to sit? So I call the concierge and yes! They're charging for LOUNGE CHAIRS, to the tune of $75 to $100 a chair! They also have the other ones they don't charge for, but it's FIRST COME, FIRST SERVE, and a word of warning....come EARLY and DON'T LEAVE YOUR TOWEL UNATTENDED FOR MORE THAN AN HOUR BECAUSE YOU'LL LOSE YOUR CHAIR. It happened to us! When you add that to their thrifty use of TOILETRIES and TOWELS(one bottle of shampoo, conditioner, body lotion and two sets of towels for a room that sleeps four) it gets a LITTLE FRUSTRATING. So far I've been here twenty hours and I'm ticked off enough to sit and write this review, I don't if we'll stay the rest of our booking, we'll see....

The only way to make any sense of the fantastic service one gets as a guest at the Bellagio is to presume that they are all doped up on something. 
Seriously. 
It is not normal for people to be this nice!
I could give many examples.. like the time I called concierge at 5:30 am asking them to see if I had, by any chance, possibly left my glasses in the room we had been in previously: "I'm not sure I left them there, but maybe I did.. could you go checkl?" 
Sober me hates drunk me.
But Bellagio's staff were more than glad to help drunk me find my glasses. At 5:30 am. And then, when they brought them over to me, the nice man even told me where I had left them, with a big smile on his face, as if it wasn't the middle of the night, as if I hadn't totally sounded like a stupid drunk idiot asking hotel staff to go looking for a pair of glasses I might or might have not left behind.. 
Goodness are they nice over there.
And then, of course, there is the time my girlfriends and I ran a hot bath so we could soak our feet in it. .And called concierge for some bubbles- Bubbles you ask? Oh no. They sent up two baggies filled with goodies like bath salts! All that was missing was a rubber duckie. But I'm not going to hold that against them. 
Besides the wonderful service, of course, you get all the other wonderful things with staying at such a star-rated hotel- beautiful installations, comfortable rooms (we even had  a beautiful view of the pools from ours), and delicious restaurants! (Oh, Bellagio Cafe, you converted me, for a brief 3 nights, into a pancake-obsessed maniac- my tummy thanks you. My waistline maybe not so much..)

If I can help it, I'm never staying at another Vegas hotel ever again.

Hotel was gorgeous and clean and decorated beautifully! Everyone was very friendly. The show with the fountains out front at night is gorgeous and worth 10 minutes of your time. Poker room is newer and open and beautiful!

BEAUTIFUL! CLASSY! CLEAN! It is definitely worth seeing once every season because they change the theme. You almost feel like your walking into a theme park...its so beautiful. Regardless of if you are staying there or not, I suggest everyone to at least check out the lobby :) Gorgeous. Very Artsy! Fabulous!

I think I was a little disappointed in this hotel. I thought it was just gonna be a little nicer. We had a fountain room which had a side view of the fountain. We looked out he window and we could just see the parking lot below. The room really needed to be upgraded. The yellow light covers were gross. The sheets were comfy but the bed sunk in too much. Probably time for you a new mattress. The customer service here was good. Housekeeping made sure we had what we needed.
The Buffett here was not great either. It was all being remodeled so it didn't look great and a lot of the areas were closed off. The best thing about this hotel was the pastry shop inside. They had some pretty good mint chocolate gelato. 
Another thing about this hotel that I noticed was different from some of the others. The smoke smell was bad walking through the casino. I really wish we would have stayed next store at Cesar's palace. I don't know I would give this place another chance. I thought Bellagio was suppose to be one of the best?

**************************** REVIEW 878 ********************************

      I have been here zillion of times and Bellagio remains my favorite casino and hotel in Las Vegas. My parents celebrate their anniversary here every year for the last 10 years.

- The service here to M Life card is AMAZING. 

- I have the best host in the world, Mr. Steve Jackson VIP Casino host.

- The best wine selection in the whole US if not the world, managed by Wine Director Master Sommelier Jason Smith, 1 of the best in the world!!!

- Restaurants choice: hands down 1 of the best restaurants group in Vegas - Picasso ($100 millions worth of original 11 painting by Picasso, when can I get this close to the real thing?), Prime Steakhouse by Jean-Georges, Yellowtail sushi, Le Cirque, Circo, Sensi, Fix, and Michael Mina! 

- The water fountain, the best in the world!

- The service, the service, and the service - I always feel like a queen when I'm here!!!! 

         Now, before you LECTURE me about other hotels, read my reviews to see where I've stayed and dined at first OK... When I come to Vegas 6 times a year, I've stayed around every single new hotel there already! My heart will always be with Bellagio!

What's up with the overt effort to squeeze every last cent out of its guests? I mean seriously, charging for valet? And its not cheap either. And you are even charging for self parking? So in order to visit your resort, you are insisting payment be made. If someone wants to come gamble at your casino, they have to pay in essence a service charge?!?! I think its rather pathetic and ridiculous. And to the poor valet, it has to have hurt their tips. Who wants to give a sizable tip after having to pay such a high rate for the privilege. There's too many other choices in casinos, why go to one that charges to just park?
Don't leave anything in the hotel room, they'll just take it... The service is also rude.

It is difficult to rank a Hotel\/Casino like Bellagio, because there's so much that comes with it. It's not just the hotel or casino, but restaurants, attractions, service, and upkeep.

Rooms
The best hotel in Las Vegas to me is the Wynn. I've stayed at the larger suites in BOTH (Salon @ the Encore and Presidential @ Bellagio) and you can tell the difference by seeing the attention to the details. Little things such as TVs (huge flatscreens), bathrooms, layout, artwork, and decor are better at the Wynn. The biggest thing I notice is the upkeep. Bellagio rooms need a makeover to keep their elite status in my opinion. Carpet, fridge, TVs, and bathrooms were all underwhelming. When you go into a Bellagio class Suite, everything should be something you can't get at home. If your TV at home is bigger, then you're not going to be impressed. I think Bellagio is right there with hotels like The Cosmopolitan. This is just my opinion, but The Cosmo is only nice because it's new. Their rooms are very modern, but don't necessarily convey luxury in every aspect. I like it, but both seem a little less amazing than the Wynn -- close to great. Also this was for the larger suites. Some of the regular rooms have seen some modest upgrades.

Service
Both are quite top notch. I haven't had an issue with either.

Restaurants and Attractions
highly debatable. It really depends what you want. If you want to club, then Wynn has XS. Buffets are good at both. Wynn has some stuff Bellagio doesn't but Bellagio's is one of the most consistent and solid buffets in Vegas. The nicer restaurants. Honestly I haven't been to most of them. I do know that from the people I've talked to the overall impression and consensus seems to be that the Wynn has more wow factor. The food itself is good at both. Next time at the Wynn, I plan to hit up Sinatra.

Gambling
Both are catered more to higher end gamblers. I mainly play poker, so it depends what you're looking for. Both casinos are made to gamble and they are not like the Cosmopolitan where it is more of an afterthought. Bellagio has been stepping it up with more tournaments and high roller rooms and separate room for celebrity status players. I recently saw Doyle, Gus Hansen, and a bunch of others just chillin at the Bellagio. I prefer the Bellagio poker room, because it's more comfortable. The Wynn's buy-in is higher and the competition is more stuffy (which can be good or bad).

For me personally, Bellagio is old money. I recently got upgraded to the MLife Pearl status which apparently gets you to the front of the line at the Buffet. Saving at least an hour will definitely warrant a return. Also staying anywhere near City Center (Vdara, Aria, Mandarin, Cosmo), Bellagio is the best place to play so I see our relationship continuing to flourish. The Wynn's main issue is that it is further north, so can't really walk to and fro. Yes, I said to and fro. No, not talking about hair.

Tip: Water Fountain Show is still fun to watch as you pretend you're one of the Ocean's Eleven crew. Here are the show times:
Monday - Friday
3:00 p.m. - 7:00 p.m. show every 1\/2 hour
7:00 p.m. - 12:00 a.m. show every 15 minutes
Saturdays, Sundays* and Holidays
12:00 p.m. - 7:00 p.m.  show every 1\/2 hour
7:00 p.m. - 12:00 a.m. show every 15 minutes

This is one of those hotels that absolutely captivates you at the first moment you enter.  We stayed at the here for 7 days and 6 nights.  There were tons of shopping options (very high end) and restaurants with every taste in mind.  It is centrally located on the strip and we had easy access to the entire new part.  We had not been to Vegas in 20 years and everything has changed.  There are out door escalators everywhere and moving walking paths too.
The hotel staff were very nice, helpful, and ready to help with anything we needed.  They also have a very good fitness center not to mention the incredible pool area.  The room was nice, had plenty of room, and over looked the pools.
Overall, this was a great vacation and we would recommend the Bellagio to anyone.
As a side note, we were preferred\/invited guests and therefore we didn't have to wait in the very long check-in lines (and trust me, they were very long).  We suggest that you look into preferred\/invited guest options.

Everything is so wrong with this hotel. Expensive, old, outdated, rooms tiny, no personal fridge, paid parking, terrible mobile checkin..,etc.. And I had to wait an hour at the lobby just to check in... and loong walk from lobby to elevator and another loooong walk from elevator to room.. you need patience and meditation to get to the room.. my first time and definitely the last one..

i recently stayed here and we booked through the bellagio-mgm-mirage site. got an awesome lake view room and you can see paris right in front of you its beautiful. room service is awesome the 2.5 lb steamed lobster was so good. the omlette was disappointingly dry! the garden next to the lobby was beautiful as usual and the themes always change so theres always something new to gasp your eyes upon each trip there.

My husband and I stayed here this past weekend, we just checked out on Monday. The hotel is beyond beautiful and the restaurants are delicious. The reason why I gave it a one star is because several employees treated us very rudely. It feels as if some employees feel more entitled than the guests. There was a lady in the front on friday offering water bottles to the guest who kept rolling her eyes at us for no reason. The young man at the shop by the guest elevators was always looking at us like we were going to steal, very unprofessional. The security that stand by the guest elevators in the spa tower some would rudely ask us for our room key. They would only ask "certain" guests not all for the room key. I witnessed this one incident where 2 employees were laughing at a guests face and making rude comments to him. I felt so bad for that guest, the employees handled the situation very unprofessional. Monday morning came to check out and we were a little confused an employee suggested we take an uber to the airport and said we would have to go downstairs to take it. We went downstairs and asked an older man(employee wearing a white shirt and black pants) what the name of the airport was and he started giving us attitude telling us what are we trying to do. I told him we were sent down here to take an uber and he just starts yelling at us that we are wrong and shouldn't be down there ubers are taken up stairs on the side. I told him we were directed this way and a sign was posted to take ubers downstairs. He got mad and started yelling at me telling me that hes been working there for years and that I'm nobody to tell him how to do his job. He mumbled other things and walked off, his argument made no sense as all we wanted is to know the name of the airport. Another employee overheard and shook his head in disbelief, then greeted us and said to us it's better to take a taxi. We got in line for a taxi and the employee that helped us out was so nice we thanked him and tipped him. Not all employees were this bad, the front desk  was awesome and the housekeepers are so nice and greeted us every time we walked by. Forgot to mention several things in our room didn't work like the light up mirror or the outlets in the bathroom. We also asked for a fountain view room and they gave us the view of the parking lot, we were disappointed. There were 2 items missing from our fridge and snack bar so I'm pretty sure we will be charged for that, even though we didn't take it. The hotel is beautiful, but the lack of good service by their employees is what makes me never want to come back. I'm still in shock that were treated like that after all the money we paid to stay there. We could afford to stay anywhere we wanted in Las Vegas and we chose the Bellagio, that was a mistake as it ruined our mini vacation. We will be flying to vegas again next month and I'm planning to book at the Venetian instead.

Drunk in public. Not one f^&* was given. Love the Bellagio. They have a cool chocolate fountain in their sweet shop which is to the right of the main entrance. I think it's in the Guiness book of records for some reason. Largest? Tallest? It's neat. They also have a seasonal exhibit that's free to walk through to the right of the main entrance. When I was there most recently, it was a fall scene. Water wheel, talking trees, Chihuly leaves. Neat!

Enjoy the huge lobster sandwich topped with creamy mozzarella and a slice of beef tomato and avocados, in a herb focaccia bread.  Then, wash it down with a cold, thick Mango-Passion Bellini.  Anyway, don't be fooled with the  "bellini", this is more of a smoothie spiked with champagne.
This is a great place for people watching, without actually getting in the pool.  So, sit back and relax, while you stare fixedly at the hot bods behind your big, Hollywood-style sunglasses. I did.

I booked two connecting queen rooms for nine people about a week ahead of time. When we got there, the lady at check in told us she only had one queen room available for us. How are we supposed to fit nine people in one room? It was absolutely terrible and some of us ended up sleeping on the floor. 

The buffet on the other hand was great. Food came out regularly and the waiters always came and refilled our drinks. I suggest going around 11-12 because it isn't as crowded. 

The pool area was another great experience. Although I recommend going in the morning when it isn't crowded but still sunny enough to tan. The only thing that kind of confused me was that all the pools were 3 1\/2 feet?
