There is no none-slip mat in the show either, very dangerous. Will not stay here again. Not much of amenities in the room, except a well stuffed pricy minibar.

My husband and I went for a mini vacation hoping that it would be nice to stay in a better rating hotel. It was nice the fist night. When I went to take a bath I found pubic hairs in there. Gross unsure if they clean out the bath but that was nasty. Both nights we started hearing the drain in the bathroom making loud noises, I mean loud enough that my husband had to get up and close the bathroom door. We got the king suit fountain view, uh not the greatest view. All you see is the tip of the fountain and the rest is a crappy flat roof of the Bellagio. Would I stay here again probably not. If you want great views of the fountain I recommend the Cosmo or Paris. Beds here are meh, and services where good.

What a wonderful hotel! My boyfriend and I stayed here while in Vegas and had a gorgeous fountain view room on the 28th floor. The nighttime view of the fountain show was spectacular. Our room was one of the newly renovated ones and it was very modern, which didn't really fit with the traditional feel of  the hotel but it was still very nice. 

With the exception of an incredibly rude check-in lady, the staff were all very nice and helpful. The casino is big and lots of fun and the spa in the hotel is absolutely gorgeous and relaxing. We ate at the cafe, Olives, and the buffet within the hotel and they were all fabulous. 

I highly recommend staying here. You can't really ask for a more luxurious experience.

Ever stumbled to the fridge in the middle of the night in a thirst-crazed stupor, and taken a giant swig out of the pitcher *you thought* contained deliciously wet water, only to be shocked into a horrifyingly awake state by a disgusting slurp of the world's oldest orange juice? That was our experience last weekend at Bellagio. (Insert Debbie Downer "waa waa" sound here.) 

First, a little context for this review: I am thankful to have had the opportunity to visit Sin City over a dozen times. And since it opened in 1998, I have been dreaming of the day I would get to stay at the sparkly crown jewel of the strip that is Bellagio. 

Second, please know I did not expect canopied beds made of fluffy pink cotton candy, or prancing ponies lining the walls, but I did expect a clean, well-maintained property. And while I anticipated the gaming floor to be smoky, I was not prepared for air so filthy, that it left me with bleedingly bloodshot eyes the next day, squinting at the sun from behind my sunglasses like a newborn mole rat. Ugh. 

While the service and grounds were lovely, our room, the hallway leading up to it, and the air quality on the entire first floor sucked **big time.** 

Here are some of the specific issues dear hubby and I encountered: 
* Ratty towels in the bathroom 
* Leaky faucet
* Shower fixture falling off the wall 
* Several sets of used room-service drinking glasses left on the floor in the hallway for two days (however, after we called the front desk, they were promptly removed)
* Paper-thin walls -- in addition to banging doors at the crack of dawn, while getting ready at the vanity in the bathroom at night, I kept running out in my robe to answer **what I thought** was our room's phone ringing -- and it was actually the phone next door
* Cracks in the crown molding 
* Old tube TV
* Lame amenities -- no shower gel or bath soap? Really?
* Dark, poorly planned lighting -- since we didn't have Garanimals, we had to open the light-up armoire when getting dressed to ensure our clothes matched properly

I **really, really, really** wanted to love Bellagio. So I am hoping we just ended up with a crummy room, instead of experiencing what our cab driver referred to as "property neglect" due to Bellagio's involvement in the new City Center project.

me & my gurls stayed here for 2 nights..service and location was great! our room was very dark for sum reason...even wit all da lights on. there seem to be mostly older people staying der..elevator was fast...i wouldn't mind staying here again.
One of the best hotels and casinos in Las Vegas but the Ceasar Palace is hard to beat!!
It's an amazing experience to stay here. I would highly recommend to get breakfast at cafe Bellagio
The Best Ever.................  I love this Hotel............. Bellagio is the best Hotel in Las Vegas.........
This is still my favorite hotel in Las Vegas--really beautiful.
The Inside Atrium is my favorite and always a destination when I come to Vegas.

Definitely one of the best hotels in vegas.  The rooms, restaurants and fountain are all amazing. The conservatory that changes with the season is the best part.  Don't forget to visit the chocolate fountain near the conservatory.

I've been here for the past four days for an annual convention I attend here.  The convention facilities are first rate, the casino staff are fun to interact with and most of them appear to have worked here since the place opened almost 20 years ago.  The rooms, however, are starting to appear dated in comparison to other places I have stayed on the Strip - such as the Wynn and Venetian - and are in need of an update for the price you pay.  The majority of the restaurants are great, and they do a great job overall to make sure you have a great experience.

Each time I visit LV, I realize that I love, love, love Lake Bellagio and the dancing fountain show! The Fontana provided a very good vantage point.  In addition, the hotel lobby, the restaurants, the Conservatory and garden with the Lunar New Year decorations, are beautiful. I especially love Sensi, the restaurant. I truly love the Bellagio!

First, I want to explain my rating. I give the Bellagio two stars for the room only. The room looked magnificent, and I would have given it five stars if the service matched.

This birthday celebration was not the experience I was looking for when booking a room at the Bellagio Hotel. Not just any room, The Penthouse Suite Fountain View room. We thought this would be the best choice OUT OF ALL the hotels in Vegas to celebrate my 50th Birthday. It is a milestone birthday, so we expected a great experience. Unfortunately, we received the opposite. 

Ok, here is the real deal for a $1713.56 two night stay at the hotel and two tickets to KA, purchased through the Chairman's Concierge.  

For securing the Penthouse Suite, we had the opportunity of using the "Chairman's Lounge" to check in\/out and have a concierge to help us with our needs. The Chairman's Lounge ( I guess) is supposed to give us more of a VIP "FEEL" because you don't have to deal with the front desk where everyone checks-in. Oh, they do offer a place to relax and free water, coffee and wine. These things I can buy myself and come out a hell of a lot cheaper.  First off, there is no signage to let you know where the lounge is. Second, the lounge is usually grossly understaffed, so you still have to wait in line for everything. Third, every time I tried to call the concierge, no one answered. Not until I was checking out, did I realize there was a second private area. When I asked the lady behind the counter if it was the Chairmans Lounge and could I check out here, her reply was, "Did you check-in here?" WTF! That was rude and made me feel like I did not belong there. I would not be asking if it were the Chairman's Lounge so I could check out if I didn't belong there. There are a lot of different ways she could have handled that. This woman didn't even ask me how my stay was. She just took my credit card, charged it and said, "Have a nice a day."

Now let's not forget that this was a milestone celebration for me. Once again, I am spending $1713.56 for "TWO" nights and a show, and they did nothing for me for my birthday. Keep in mind that I told them it was my birthday celebration when I booked it, checked in and throughout our my entire visit because the staff continuously asked me if we were there for a special occasion. We have been to extremely less expensive hotels, and they have offered complimentary bottles of wine, cakes or coupons for smaller celebrations. Needless to say, I was disappointed that they didn't even place a cheap bottle of wine or champagne in our room since I chose to spend my birthday at their hotel. I would have been happy with a cupcake. It's the thought that counts.

Let's talk about the room a little more. Even though it was a great looking room (36006), The HVAC made a loud and disturbing sound everytime the heat turned on or off. In the bedroom, it seemed like someone was trying to kick the door open as hard as they could. This loud thump happened every 15-20 minutes. So, for the two nights I was there, I did not sleep at all because the sound kept waking me up. Luckily, my wife sleeps with earplugs, so she didn't hear it.  That is the most important thing that pissed me off about this whole trip.

There is one more thing, beware of the concierge in the Chairman's Lounge. There is a markup when you allow them to help you. I understand that you pay for convenience, but I thought I was already paying for it. I figured it came with the room price of $711.31 per night. We wanted tickets to KA. The Chairman's Lounge concierge was the most expensive for the same seats that I priced with the regular Bellagio concierge that everyone uses and Half Price Tickets on the street.  The only reason why we ordered through the Chairmans Lounge is that we waited until the last minute. Plus, my wife talked me into it. We PAID (again) for the convenience.

Now, I understand that $1713.56 is not a big deal for a show and a two-night stay at a hotel for some people, and in particular for the Bellagio. But, for us, it was a lot of money, and I just wanted to best possible time for my wife and I. Sadly, I got the opposite.

My wife and I have been to Vegas a combined eight times and have never experienced this type of treatment before.

I guess I am writing this to say; you don't always get what you pay for.

I have stayed at most of the Vegas strip hotels and here are my thoughts.

I have stayed here a handful of times.  By far, they have the best customer service!  I had a bad customer service experience while checking in and they upgraded me to a 1 bedroom suite with 3 bathrooms.  They even sent up a fruit basket for my troubles.

The bedrooms are very nice and a step up from some of the other hotels on the strip, but not a HUGE night and day difference.  Just being in the hotel and in the room makes you feel like you are Donald Trump.

You must check out their season botany garden display which changes every month.

The pools are nice, but a bit weird since they have about 7 different pools which are a bit on the chilly side and attracts an older crowd.

TIP: Although their buffet has received high reviews, your best bet it to go to the Wynn Hotel's buffet where is a bit cheaper and WAY better!  Also, there is a free tram that you can take from the Bellagio to Monte Carlo that you can take.

One of the best places to stay in Vegas!!! Love the location, the decor, the fountain with the synchronicity of the music that you can hear from the room. The shops are great and the shows that they offer and to me the casino is the best compare to the others. The pool area is huge with different areas and cabanas are great and spacious. Great restaurants and among all of the hotels that I have been I think it is family oriented without kids bothering .... strange but true!!! Love the hotel!!!

Every bit a 5 star resort. Gorgeous property. Layout was somewhat chaotic but I guess that's what casinos do?  Great gaming experience.  The garden square is also fun to visit, but we gave the art gallery a miss because we were too cheap to pay $15 to get in!
Awesome casino and hotel.  We enjoyed this casino a lot how can you not like the Water Fountain.  Not many cocktail waitresses around which was not cool.

I come here everytime i visit Vegas this is one of my strip stops. Love this hotel nice and the atmosphere here is great lots to see here and the water show is awesome and also l love the deco and the themed  area by the registration area which changes every season.

Have always wanted to stay at Bellagio, but wanted to save it for a special occasion. When my husband I were married last Sept, we decided to stay at the Bellagio on the wedding night.

Booked a decent deal (three nights for the price of two) and made sure we had a nice view of the fountains. This was a must, for us there was no point in staying at this hotel unless we could enjoy the fountains.

The guest room was adequate, but not overly nice. I was actually kind of disappointed. Before staying here, I thought the Bellagio was supposed to be one of the snazziest hotels on the strip. As a passerby I was always impressed by the casino and lobby, so I assumed the hotel rooms would also be incredible. So the room was just ok. No fancy tv, relatively small room, and decently appointed bathroom. The fountain show was amazing though. I've never had a room with such a beautiful view. In the evening the show would come on every 15 minutes (until midnight) and you could turn the tv to a certain channel, which would play the coordinating music. Nice touch.

For the money, I feel like I could find nicer hotels in Vegas. Bellagio has been a staple on the Strip for a long time, but I think other hotels are competing in the luxury four\/five star resort status. I would stay at the Bellagio again, but I would probably splurge for a suite...which would definitely have to face the fountains.

My poor wife got scammed today at the Bellagio by one of their boutiques. It was at a store called Bella Donna, the product was some skin care. She was totally rolled by the high pressure sales guy and now that I've read the reviews of the product company- Predire, I understand these tactics are endemic. You expect the Bellagio would vet their shops, you don't expect to get played when you patronize them. Right now we are trying to reach out to both the Bellagio and the boutique with zero luck. Maybe they have someone tracking the Yelp posts and will reach out to me but I'm not holding my breath.

I stayed at the Mirage since it opened decades ago and thought to switch it up and try the Bellagio since I heard rave reviews. Well, checkin is a nightmare if you show up when the entire checkin staff changes shifts! Insanity they move so slow when there is a line even at the Gold member special line. Then request to have adjoining rooms with a door in between was supposedly honored and I was happy until I found that no shared door - just rooms next to each other - what a fibber at checkin !! Crying baby (for hours \/ poor kid!) down the hall and they sent security when I called but of course crying stopped yet started up 20 minutes later. They could move me but can't guarantee room next to my friend who will also not enjoy the crying baby - why move 2 rooms instead of moving the baby's room? I typically don't complain but we are not at a no tell motel here for 19.99 a night or 4 hour nap. Insane for Gold membership and paying over 2k per room for 6 days. I asked at least for a discount - nope. They could move me but not what I wanted so forget about it. Not sure if I will return. Cobb salad room service was listed around $18 but add a Diet Coke and extra dressing and the bill was $34 without tip - how did that happen ...really?  Nickel and dime yes \/ we shall see how a $200 cabana measures up tomorrow for 8 hours. Mirage was better and I may just return there next year - but will give Bellagio a chance \/ rocky start .

My top 3 favorite hotels in Las Vegas. One of the main reasons has to be the fountains and the decor. They also have some great black jack tables that I've always enjoyed playing, especially at 3:00am. The first time I stayed here, the front desk allowed me to upgrade to a fountain view. I was blown away at the view, the most beautiful thing! It's 5-star service, all around at this hotel.
Heaven.  One of the best hotels in the states I have ever been to.

Bellagio is a great clean place and EXCELLENT LOCATION! Enjoyed my stay here. The staff was very friendly to us all the time, had a fountain view room which was nice, only thing I think is needed is for the rooms to be updated a bit, wasn't terribly outdated but definitely can use some refreshining. Other than that 4 stars!!

This place is incredible! IMHO, this is the classiest casino on the strip. The level of attention that they've paid to every detail is amazing. 
The table minimums were the highest I saw on the Strip, nothing less than $10, most $15+ on the table games. But the casino is spotlessly clean. The decor is classy. I've never really been able to figure out what the theme is to this casino. French Renaissance? I don't know. 
I really love the ceiling of the lobby, glass done by the famous artist Dale Chihuly. It's an amazing display that makes glass look like a wonderful garden of flowers. 
The botanical gardens are also nice, with a lot of different plants and flowers to check out. 
I also enjoyed the art museum here. When I went, it was a display of Andy Warhol prints, which was a really cool display that any world-class museum would be proud to show off! 
I really enjoy this place to hang out at, but generally stay away from the Casino. The shops here are pretty amazing, with all of the high-end shops you could ever want to burn your cash at! 
Of course, the highlight of the hotel is the fountains out front!

I've stayed at many hotels and the Bellagio service is simply unparalelled. On my last stay here I got in around 10AM on a Friday and had no problem getting fast, early check in with a gleaming smile. The casino is the cleanest in town and the dealers are fabulous, even to a low end gambler like me. The restaurants, with the exception of Circo anymore, are wonderful. I will not stay anywhere else in Vegas.
Beautiful hotel. The dancing waters....enough said. Breathtaking

After all these years, this place is still one of the best hotels in Vegas.  We love to check out the Conservatory & Botanical Garden during the holidays.  Keep up the good work Bellagio!  

Return Factor - 100%

Stayed here over the weekend for a vacation and I loved it! The hotel is beautiful and we had a beautiful room overlooking the fountains and the strip. 

If money isn't much of an issue, order breakfast room service! I must say, I did not know that eggs could taste that good. Everyone we encountered was very nice. The only rude employees I encountered was the ladies at the window where you sign up for the Player's Club Card. They were extremely rude and unattentive and did not seem like they wanted to help me.

I can't say anymore than what has already been written.  My wife and I have stayed here on two separate occasions, and it will be very difficult to stay elsewhere the next time.  Bellagio is 5 stars all the way through.  Only thing I would change about the Bellagio is an update to the rooms.  Everything here is expensive though, so be prepared to spend some $$$.  Highly recommend.  Will probably try out one of the city center hotels, or Wynn or Venetian next go 'round.

For my first stay in Vegas, I couldn't imagine staying any where other than the Bellagio. The lobby is clean, stunning and welcoming. The staff were knowledgeable, and genuine in welcoming\/answering any questions. There seemed to be a variety of restaurants on the property (although reservations were difficult to get at times, so book ahead!). 

The casino was more spacious than others on the strip which helps if you are trying to avoid the smoke. I enjoyed the dealers, but found the tables a bit expensive for being an inexperienced gambler. 

Overall, you can't miss the fountains and scenery. It's worth the extra money to stay at this hotel (beautiful rooms--best hotel bathroom for this price!) At least it'll make you feel a little fancy...

I hate Vegas, but do enjoy spending time at the Bellagio one time a year.  The service is great at all levels, be it at the pool (LOVE IT), any of the plentiful bars, restaurants, room service, banquet service, etc. etc.  The employees just can't do enough for you, and I like it that way!

My room was plush and the bed was oh so comfy.  The bathroom is supplied with tons of little goodies and the softest of robes.  My one quibble with the bathroom is that the sink is kind of high.  Since I am kind of short, I am on tiptoes trying to wash my face or brush my teeth.  A small price to pay!

Kick back, open the drapes and enjoy the corny - yet pretty - water fountain show.

I enjoyed the Bellagio.  Service is good.  Rooms are nice.  Casino is nice.  Location is good.  There is really nothing bad to say except that for my money, there are better alternatives.  I do find the decor to be a little outdated but it is the Bellagio.

Bellagio is famous for being luxurious, and it is indeed nice, but IMO they are coasting on their reputation in order to milk the maximum profit.  The furnishings and fixtures look worn. No in-room coffee generates more profit for their F&B operation, which charges above $5 per cup.  The check-in agent warned me not to use the in-room refrigerator for anything except buying their products, because sensors under each item will charge me automatically, even if I don't consume the item. A $32 daily resort fee, on top of whatever room fee you pay, comes as a surprise at checkout.  Lines for check-in are frequently long.  One of the servers at their buffet restaurant shared that the company is cutting the positions that clear plates, shifting this task to the servers.  A driver shared that the company is on the verge of charging for parking.  

Next time I stay in Vegas, regardless of whether I'm looking for a good deal on a clean and convenient location, or the nicest luxury experience, I think I can do better elsewhere.
Freaking amazing.... gorgeous hotel. Went to Hyde and danced all night long.. ate late night at the cafe. We felt like tourists. ..best night out in a very long time!!!

Sigh. I just love the Bellagio. I had the opportunity to stay here with my husband thanks to some great internet rates. It absolutely lived up to my high expectations. Everything about the Bellagio was a cut above other hotels in Vegas. And the only one that can hold a candle to the decor and service is the Venetian. I knew I had arrived when I walked into my hotel room and my curtains had wall switches. Huge glass-enclosed shower and separate huge tub - and that's the low-end room! Service was superb.  Very classy, Bellagio offered nice little touches everywhere from a live piano player, to fresh flowers. Being from the east it reminded me of the Plaza in NY. Just love it. Hope to get back again soon!

Impeccable service, housekeeping and convention staff in particular. Efficient, unobtrusive, helpful and total professionals. 

Room amenities were great but as another reviewer pointed out, bring your own toiletries.  Super comfy beds and nicely decorated. Wifi in room is excellent but spotty outside the room. 

Everything here is expensive, from bottled water to room service to restaurants to snacks. 

Tables weren't that lucky but all price points accommodated. 

Too hot in June to bake in the pool and didn't get a chance to try the spa. 

Overall, I'd stay here again as an treat but bring a thick wallet.

One of the most beautiful hotels ever, this place is a must stop just to see their beautiful fountain show and the indoor structure and attractions.  i love this place, super gorgeous! The botanical garden was well maintained, had the most beautiful flowers and just everything about it total jaw dropper. A must see that's all I have to say!
Service and treatment so far have been amazing. The staff here really goes above and beyond to make sure you're a satisfied guest. Gonna enjoy my few days here for sure.

We stayed at Bellagio for 4 nights in March 2010.  The location was convenient, the fountain shows were spectacular, and the O by Cirque du Soleil was breath-taking.  

Now taking about the actual stay: For a 5-star hotel, the lobby is a mess-- very noisy and chaotic.  The room was spacious, and the bathroom was nice; we liked the individual vanity and the separate shower.    However, when we realized that there was no coffee-maker (I brought my own tea for daily consumption, so all I need is hot water), we called the housekeeper, and was transferred to in-room dining.  They didn't have coffee-makers but could deliver an electric kettle for $25 plus $4 delivery charge.  And then there was $15 daily charge for the Internet access, $7 for printing the boarding passes at the business center ($5 for minimum Internet access and $1 per page for printing.)  The concierge would do it for you during their office hour but just like everywhere at this hotel, there were always long lines.

I understand that Bellagio is a popular hotel with high demand, so it may not be as important for them to provide the best service.  However, it is still annoying for a hotel at this caliber to be nickel and dime.  We probably will look for a different hotel next time, just to avoid the hassle.
The rooms are dated.  Nice public spaces.  I would not stay here if I had to pay for the room.  Better choices on the strip.

My husband and I enjoy the Bellagio hotel. It is beautiful inside with the blown glass flower ceiling, marble floors and helpful people. Drinks are free when you gamble. Be prepared for long lines at check-in, and a smoke filled casino which I wasn't expecting. Apparently all the casinos allow smoking. The sports book in all casinos is the only non smoking environment. I didn't win much at this casino but scored at the D downtown and the Luxor. Also, room service takes a LONG time! Just a heads up on that. I would say the beds are too soft for me but I still slept pretty well. The negatives are just so you are aware. This is a nice\/classy hotel and I enjoyed the experience and would return.

We stayed in Bellagio for 2 nights (02\/10 and 02\/11) to celebrate our anniversary!

It was my first time there and my husband's fourth time. I was a little weary to choose this hotel based on some reviews and wasn't sure if it will be the right choice for us. I am glad I choose this hotel!

Checking in was very pleasant. I loved the person who helped us! Her name was Naya I believe. She upgraded us to a suite for additional fee and requested housekeeping to send us chocolates every day, which was such a nice gesture. We were checking in early around 11 and we were able to access our suite right away since we upgraded, regular check in is at 3pm. We got lucky! They also, let us check out late at 12pm. Big Plus!!

The Suite was breathtaking! We had the spectacular views of the Fountain and a view of the pool on the other side. The bed was absolutely comfortable and the bathroom was beautiful! We were on the 18th floor.

Housekeeping did an amazing job. They cleaned our room in the morning when we left for breakfast and then we went out to dinner and came back to made up beds again. How awesome is that? Keep up the great work guys!

We had a beautiful stay and I will be back. It was a lovely, well maintained, classy hotel with great hospitality. Will definitely return again.

Wonderful time in Vegas for girls weekend. Had a 3 night stay with a room with a view of the pool! Too bad it wasn't summer time.  The decor is always very classy here. I feel like there is a higher quality of people that either stay and or hang around in this hotel. Definitely recommend. The restaurants were ok in the hotel. Some better than others.  I have had better food around Vegas.  The shopping is nice, wish they had a few reasonable stores.  We did the $40 day pass at the spa... highly recommend. Worth every penny.  Was going to have a massage, but the prices in Vegas are astronomical.  Did not see O, still want too... heard it's great.  We saw Britney and Celine instead for our nights out. Overall, great time. Would stay there again.

Since early childhood, I always considered the city of Las Vegas to be synonymous with a reckless activity that I never truly cared for... Gambling. For me, the idea of putting hard earned money into a machine, only to watch my funds disappear with a resounding cacophony of bells, whistles, and flashing lights has always seemed less than gratifying. However, my linear misconceptions were refurbished in February of 2015, when a co worker and I decided to fly into the neon desert for lunch at the Bellagio Hotel. 

The architectural decadence of Vegas' post Howard Hughes renaissance undoubtedly extended it's influence into to every detail of the Bellagio. Decked out in floral regalia to commemorate Chinese New Year, the first breathtaking attraction to pose for my cell phone's aperture was the ornate conservatory. As we made our way beyond the majestic waterfalls donning taxidermied goats, I remained captivated by the red and gold lanterns, matching miniature pagodas, and life size figurines made entirely of flower arrangements. 

Nestled away in an inconspicuous corner of the conservatory was the entrance to Cafe Bellagio. In spite of a long line, my co worker and I were seated within a timely manner. After reviewing the reasonably sized menu, I settled on the portabello, Swiss, spinach, and mushroom sandwich, with Parmesan french fries and a mocha frappuccino. Both feeling thoroughly satisfied, my co worker and I departed from the cafe and spent the remainder of our time at the hotel exploring the gift shop, enjoying the live pianist, and of course venturing into the casino. Although gambling isn't my cup of tea, I must admit that it was enjoyable to see the different celebrity themes of each slot machine. 

When I have a chance to remain in Vegas overnight, I'll be interested in renting a suite and experiencing every ounce of luxury that the Bellagio has to offer.

This place is tight! Stayed here for 2 days for a friends wedding and damn it was really nice. All the stuff in our room was controlled by one remote control, the window blinds, the lights, the TV and the DVD player all in one remote, that in itself was heavenly LOL

We ordered room service and got a rib eye steak cooked to medium rare, mashed potatoes and a spring salad. I've never had room service turnout so well and the steak come as ordered. Usually it comes a over done and the other items luke warm or soggy. That wasn't the case here, the meat was cooked as ordered, the potatoes were hot and the croutons in the salad were still crunchy! 

The next morning after the wedding rehearsal we were treated to lunch at the Bellagios buffet and oh damn...that was the best buffet I've ever eaten at. Pizza, prime rib, turkey, butternut squash ravioli with sage, prime rib, sushi, Alaskan crab legs and did i mention prime rib? GOOOD STUFF!

The thing about the Bellagio though is, NONE of it is cheap. Even the roulette wheels are at a $20 minimum inside and out, I won though so no complaints. The room service we got was about $120, the buffet was free but I've eaten there again and it was $29 and the room...hell I ain't getting into that LOL but it costs you...a lot.

If your looking for a good time in Vegas and are willing to spend the cash this is the place for you!

Much overdue review. My husband & I stayed here in March 2013 and we loved it. You do pay more to stay here but its totally worth the money. We had a pool view room on the 11th floor I think. We stayed 3 nights. The room was clean and very nicely decorated,  the bed was very comfy. Bathroom was huge and nice tub & shower. If I came to Vegas again I would most definitely stay at this hotel.

My friends stayed at other "cheaper" hotels like Flamingo & Baileys and they are nothing compared to the high quality hotels, you truly get what you pay for, and for me I rather stay somewhere I feel comfortable and have an awesome experience, like you do here at the Bellagio :)

Veggie D Lit e. and I stayed here and I would DEFINITELY stay again! I have stayed @ The more 'tacky' hotels (not the really bad ones!) Like New York New York, The Paris, and Caesars and I think this and the Venetian and the Wynn are my favorites to stay in because they dont over do it! I know vegas is about being gawdy and loud and thats all well and good I enjoy that too but when your getting home after a long day and night of gambling,dancing and drinking and you have no idea what time it is I need beauty and simplicity and Bellagio offers just that. It's a classy hotel. Chihuly adorned cieling in the main lobby, a beautiful indoor garden, and they are highly accomodating. We got an upgrade to see the fountains and had a pretty nice room! Jean-Phillipe Patisserie is utterly scrumptious. It's nice to wake up in the morning and go down stairs and get a crepe or pastry of some sort with such caliber! And the pools OH MY GOSH SO AWESOME! Definitely check it out!

The Worst.  Bellagio... you might be pretty, but remember, looks aren't everything! 

We had such high hopes for Bellagio but they couldn't do a single thing right. 

To sum it up... here was our 3 day\/2 night stay... of nothing but WAITING: 

Day 1: 
Arrived at Bellagio... waited an hour in line for check in... arrived at check in and there were no more rooms with double queens, so they said they would have a roll-away bed delivered... 4 hours later, go to the room and no roll-away bed so we call to ask for it... 1 hour later, still no roll-away bed so we call again (2 am in the morning).... another 45 mins, still no roll-away so we call again... another 30 mins, still no bed, so I call to speak to a manager, 5 mins later, the roll-away bed arrives. 

Day 2: 
We call to get switched to a room with 2 queen beds and they tell us our new room number and tell us our keys have been electronically updated to the new room... we walk to the other room and our keys don't work... call the front desk, spend 20 mins on hold and they tell me they will have security meet us to let us in... 40 mins later security comes and lets us in but he doesn't have new room keys for us... so we have togo to  "check in" again and wait another 30 mins to get new keys. 

Day 2 night: 
Come back to room around 12 am and there is a party in the suite beside us so we ask to change rooms... go back to check in and wait 20 mins to get new keys... talk to the manager about how frustrating our experience has been at bellagio and she upgrades us to a suite.... go to the suite and it's 1 king instead of 2 queens.... call the manager who apologies for her error and takes us to the correct room with the new keys... 1:30 am and hungry, so we go to the Bellagio Cafe (the only thing open)... place is empty but still a 45 min wait to eat... 

Day 3 - Can't wait to leave... but until we can leave... must wait 1 hour for our car at valet. 

Worst experience ever which consisted of non-stop waiting and waiting and waiting. One of the most frustrating experiences of my life.  Check-in is the most unorganized area where there are no line queue, so you just have to choose a line and hope for the best... it's crazy this place is a 5 star hotel since they clearly don't know how to manage guests and visitors. 

Never again... better off staying at Venetian, Mandalay or Wynn.

Our first trip to Vegas, but after walking up and down the strip, we were glad we picked the Bellagio.  We liked that's it's right in the middle of the strip.  We were on the 26th floor with a great view of the fountains and the Paris hotel. I would stay there again just for the awesome view.  The room was spacious and quiet.  There are numerous pools, so we always found an open spot.  Went to the breakfast buffet and it was awesome, anything you could possibly want.

I stayed in the Bellagio when it first opened, and it was grand - I would have probably given it 5 stars.  However, my most recent stay here last weekend wasn't as climatic. By all means, the hotel is a must-see, but staying here and paying an arm and a leg isn't worth it. 

The rooms are not as luxurious as the newer hotels - so minus 2 stars for that. Everything looked old - the walls, paint, bathroom decorations, the old-school TV, etc. I'm sure they are trying to go for the classic Italian feel, but they should invest some of their money to spruce things up. I also stayed at the Vdara that weekend, I have to admit that I wished I stayed both nights there instead of the Bellagio.

However, don't let this review stop you from visiting this hotel. The casino is top-class, the conservatory is breathtaking, and the fountain show is amazing. However, I was disappointed that the show I watched did not have any music playing.  

All in all, you're better off staying in the City Center, Venetian, or Wynn for a 5-star stay.

Stayed here in June of 2008.
I loved the dancing water , the design of the hotel and shops. It was pure coincidence that Marie Osmond was there promoting and autographing her dolls-so I was able to get my favorite Strawberry Shortcake doll autographed.

Vegas baby... wait what?

Bellagio is a staple of new Vegas. I booked a room there a few weeks back and can say the hotel itself is of course beautiful. The hotel incorporates an atrium area that was both beautiful and whimsical. Picture being in the middle of a Tim Burton film.

The room - Surprisingly basic except for the bed. Great bathroom with separate shower and tubs. The bed was incredibly soft. The walls however are shockingly thin and I could easily hear what sounded like a stripper party next door. (nothing wrong with that, it is Vegas) Because of that, I wouldn't suggest getting much sleep.

Parking - Free and lots of it. No complaints here.

Casino - Higher priced tables

If this hotel were in Dallas, no doubt it would get 5 stars. But due to the cost and the expectations associated with the Bellagio, I am forced to give it a 3. I believe if you want to shell out the bucks on a room, check into the Aria.

This really is a beautiful hotel.  The rooms are great, the staff is friendly.  The pool scene is pretty good.  The pool area is enormous.  Several different pools.  If you can get one of the well placed Bungalows, that is the way to go. They have misters spraying water to keep you cool.  Otherewise, you MUST get there early and it helps to tip a pool guy to get you a good spot.  Anything but right by the pool is lame.   Somewhat of a mixed crowd.  Young hipsters, families, blue hairs.  The music kind of sux.  It is a mix of eighties something or other.   But if your chairs are right by the pool, you won't be able to hear the music.

come on eh? it's the bellagio! nice hotel, better be for the price. iconic fountains right in front, our room had a view of the magnificent pool structure. employees seem to be worked like some hebrew slaves but that place is huge so kind of makes sense. bellhop was awesome, very accommodating. elevator is moving at least 90mph. good hotel, would recommend.

you breaka mi heart. waiting over 25min for my 1st cocktail at the craps table & never getting cocktail service for my 20min playing $5 slots was unacceptable for an establishment of this caliber. been here at least 5 times & never had this complaint.  i can only suspect that many servers called in sick on swing shift that night(night before st. pats) or bellagio chooses to function w\/bare minimum  staff.  i'm starting to believe neglectful cocktail servers are a jinx(they sure were that night). i can go to stratosphere or plaza or fitzgeralds or binions, where i've never had this service prob.
 don't get ghetto on me.  don't become blahgio.

Checked in on Wednesday for five days, it's the Fourth of July holiday weekend and we're still here, checking out tomorrow morning. The hotel is absolutely gorgeous, everyone is very friendly and the staff was very attentive. It is a little disappointing, not having a refrigerator in your room. Here is a little tip , we brought a huge cooler bag with us in our suitcase, filled it with ice and kept light snacks and water in there, and it worked out perfect. You can also put ice in the ice bucket and leave a few waters to chill for the day. Worked out perfect for us! There is a CVS directly across the street which sells liquor, light snacks, sunblock everything pretty much you would need. It is about two dollars more than our average local CVS, but so worth it. Especially for a case of 12 waters (Dasani) $6. And it's 24 hours. You do not want to buy any snacks out of your  room or anything out of the refrigerator as is an absolute ripoff. A huge bottle of Fiji water $18 a small bag of chips $8, a small little thing of cookies $7 so not worth it , The prices are on one of the channels on the TV. Stock up across the street. This location is prime right in the center of everything. The mile mall is across the street, make sure you go to the ABC store  and stock up on any novelty gifts you want to bring home, as they have the best prices that I have seen. Also, if you have a AAA card make sure you go to the customer service desk, they will give you a huge book with tons of discounts. A lot of buy an entrée get an entrée free, free trials of popcorn etc. Buy one show ticket get one free.
so worth taking a look at and it's free. We like having freshly squeezed veggies and fruit shakes in the morning for breakfast, there is a place called Jamba Juice in the mall excellent! So many different varieties and tasty shakes, a large runs about nine dollars, but in the coupon book there is buy one get one free.
We walk the strip every morning and every night, and tried different food and honestly Bellago by far , has  the best tasting food.I thought I can get a cheaper deal outside of Bellagio, but all the prices are pretty much the same $15 for a cocktail $17 for a sandwich and fries etc. even at the steakhouse, all the prices are pretty much the same. Yesterday we sat at the Cypress pool, being a holiday weekend, it was $125 for a chair, but with the reviews all being great, we figure we would at least try it once, and we are so glad we did! Get there early, because you get to pick your seats. We stayed from 11 AM till 5 PM and enjoyed every minute of it. The chairs are so comfortable, and the service they give you was impeccable. Not to mention the food was delicious, I believe it's from the restaurant Fix in the hotel. I got a turkey club sandwich, with Parmesan fries, my boyfriend got turkey sliders and we shared nachos with guacamole, everything with the tip came to $85. But was so delicious and so filling, and generous portions. All said and done between the chairs, the food and tipping everyone it was a$400 afternoon, something you definitely have to do at least once if you can. We were going to rent a cabana, but for both of us it really wasn't worth it, the  chairs were definitely a better deal.  My recommendations get the plastic large Bellaggio cups , $28 for your first drink, and  the refills are only $24 for a 32 ounce drink. I really thought I was going to drink a lot more, but with the heat, you really don't feel like drinking and it tires you out, combined with the sun. They to give you free water by the pool out of a water tower , so you can use the reusable cups, which come in handy. The other two days we came down around 3 o'clock, after walking the strip and we were able to find lounge chairs after looking for about 10 minutes. This morning, I woke up early and got here when they opened up at 8 o'clock which there was already a line of about 70 people in front of me, and about 50 people behind me when I got down at 7:45. But on a holiday weekend, if you want an umbrella , a table and two lounge chairs you need to get here early. I am sitting next to a pool that is directly across from the cypress pool, which is a great alternative if you don't want to spend the money on the cypress pool. The cypress pool is  an adult pool, but the one right next to it basically the same , they are both cooling fountains , the water is a lot colder, and not for swimming, so the kids don't come over here at all. They stay in the other two big pools, which the water is warmer.  The pool area is beautiful, and they played a good variety of music. You can also order food and drinks around any of the other pools as well.  Caesar's Palace is right next-door, which is also a nice place to visit with a lot of bars ,lounges and .All in all, we are having a great time and definitely recommend this hotel

More like a big fat ZERO!  So many things went wrong that they comped us free in room champagne and food credit.  That sounds reasonable for a subpar experience right, except when we called for our champagne, they had no record of us getting comp and after 30mins they actually get the approval.  When we checked out we noticed the food beverage credit never made it on to our bill, we called the front desk and they said they didn't have record of it but will talk to the manager.  So after several phone calls they manage to square it or that's what we thought.  So the next day we checked our credit card and the credit was never applied.  We called the Belagio but was directed to their billing department.  After a long phone call they said the credit was only $100 instead of the $150 they originally offered.  Seriously, a five star hotel can't even honor a $150 credit that they offered in the first place.  Dealing with management is shady, get your comps in writing and maybe you will get it with out the ordeal!

It's a fine hotel. The rooms are comfortable and I had a good night sleep. However, based on what friends have told me about Bellagio I was expecting to be clown away and I was not. Rooms are smaller and not as good in my opinion than the Mandalay Bay not to mention "TheHotel at Mandalay" which is my favourite hotel in Vegas so far. I also enjoyed Aria more. Also, it's quite expensive and I think you can get better for less elsewhere. Location is good if you like to be in the centre of the strip where there is much action... and you don't mind the constant traffic jams around there. Otherwise, a nice experience.

My fiance and I just came back from our first trip to Las Vegas and I can tell you right now that staying at Bellagio was one of the best decisions we've made.  The hotel amenities were wonderful!  The bed was amazingly comfortable for our aching bodies due to walking up and down the strip in 110 degree Vegas weather!  Housekeeping was very prompt! With a phone call away, the hotel staff were very attentive to our needs.  We didn't know where the ice was and where to get ice from so we called the In-room service staff and received it within minutes!!!!  

We had a fountain-view room and it was amazing! We could see the dancing water fountains throughout the day that it played.  I loved the fact that they had staff at every "guest elevator" to check to see if people had proper access (room key) to get onto the elevator!  Just that alone, I knew that the management was very keen in making the hotel safe for all the guests!

We didn't munch at many restaurants while we were in the Bellagio because we wanted to see the strip.  We ate at the infamous Bellagio Buffet which was one of the best buffets on the strip for the price that we payed ($35+ per person on weekend\/nights ).  We had the Dim Sum at the restaurant called "Noodles".  It's a very quaint restaurant.  The dim sum was okay, but of course because it's in a well-established hotel.. the prices were inflated ($3.50 for mini appetizers).... and the Chinese sausage and shrimp fried rice was not worth the $19 that we payed.  I could have made these food and it would have cost me less than $20 to make!! 

For a quick and reasonable bite, go to "Snacks".  They have some tasty snacks under $10!!!!! :)) 

Of all the sightseeing that we did this past week, Bellagio was by far the most elegant hotel with respectable and attentive guest services!! It is definitely worth the money to stay here!!
great hotel!! i love the rooms and the lobby is beautiful!!!

I admit i enjoy coming to Bellagio because of the wonderful decors that change from time to time. But playing here is kinda boring. Some dealers would deal for hours without uttering a word, sometimes not even look at you. If you guys are gonna take our money, at least make a decent conversation or show some personality. Some of the dealers try to chat and joke around with the players creating a fun and upbeat ambiance but some are just like zombies giving you cards. They gotta do something about this because there's a lot more casinos out there who got dealers with personalities.

Sightseeing location #2: Bellagio Hotel & Conservatory of Flowers

+: fancy flower arrangements upon entering; nice displays everywhere worthy of a second look; good layout so not easy to get lost; beautiful fountain shows every 15 minutes
-: some security guard who yelled at the pedestrians for unable to leave the hotel entrance during NYE b\/c the streets were packed with people. 

The whole experience at Bellagio was surreal b\/c the hotel was absolutely gorgeous! If not for the run-in with that rude man who was shoving everyone out, it would have been an amazing experience.

-definitely my favorite and my most stayed Vegas hotel
-one of the best Dim Sum buffet in the country
I loveee this hotel!!! It is absolutely amazing and always fun!!! The cafe bellagio is da bomb too!!  The spa is something else just an all around awesome hotel!

Our stay was horrible! Hair on the floor, shower water was so weak, room was facing parking garage, and not to mention unpleasant front desk people. All our card keys did not work and needed to be changed.Aggh! So disappointing! 
This was our first time to stay here since we normally stay on the Venetian or Wynn. We will never stay in this hotel!
Beautiful room, sparkling clean, fabulous view. Lots of bells and whistles. Staff were marvelous. Picasso restaurant vegetarian dinner was fantastic. Pricey.

previously, i have stayed at the venetian (still my favorite), planet hollywood (because it is spg), and hilton (i would not stay at the hilton because it is very far off the strip but it was a good deal at the time)

first of all, bellagio is beautiful and classic. it is centrally located. i will say that the clientele seems a bit older than other places. 

the spa is wonderful (only guests can use the spa so it is not as crowded as other hotel spas where anyone can get in, and easier to schedule appointments- i will write another separate review for spa)

the buffet is superb - pricier than other buffets - i think the market buffet (formerly aladdin hotel but now in planet hollywood) is still best bang for the buck but if you want better food and willing to pay extra, belliagio buffet is excellent - i used a tip from yelp to pay for brunch and get in a little before dinner starts (which costs a lot more) - genius!  

we stayed on the 26th floor in the spa tower. there was an annoying constant buzzing sound which we later learned was from a generator for the hotel (we didn't really notice it until we were getting ready for bed but we were able to fall asleep because we were soo tired each night). if you get a room on the 26th floor, make sure it is not one of the rooms with this sound - you could probably easily change the room unless the hotel was completely booked.

My boyfriend and I traveled to Las Vegas and stayed in the one bedroom penthouse suite at the Bellagio. The living room (including a large television, coffee table, arm chairs, sectional sofa, and desk) and the dining room (including a dining table, dining chairs, sideboard cabinet, and chandelier) were both convenient and comfortable. The small bar off of these spaces (including a sink, coffee maker, miniature fridges, and small drinks and snacks) was fully stocked. The bedroom (including a large television, chaise lounge, and king-sized bed) was warm and inviting. The his (including toilet, bidet, sink, steam shower, and closet) and hers (including toilet, bidet, large bathtub, sink, closet, and vanity) bathrooms as well as the bathroom just inside the main door to the room were clean and beautiful. The room was clean, very quiet, beautifully lit by both artificial and natural light, and serviced the perfection by housekeeping when we were not in the room. The service in the rest of the hotel was perfect too. The limo that took us to and from the hotel was prompt and smooth. The chairmans lounge was quiet and welcoming. The slots, tables, restaurants, and entertainment throughout the hotel were all classy and well done. The fitness center was clean and updated. The pool and poolside bar was beautiful and busy. Overall, I thoroughly enjoyed my time at the Bellagio and would be happy to return.

I love this hotel and all it's glory. Any place that is willing to spend about $33 billion on their free water found show out front is going to be my favorite place to stand at the top of the hour or every 15 minutes after 7pm. I could watch every single fountain show that is choreographed by computer with randomly picked songs and never get tired of it. I also love walking through the hotel lobby to enjoy the extravagant seasonal displays. If I were rich I would definitely like to stay here too.

flew in for one night last week, over all the stay was very good. service and friendliness inside the cafe by the flower garden could have been much better. if not for this it would have been 5 star review

I was really impressed by this hotel! I go to Vegas every year and have stayed at many many different hotels.. The Bellagio is definitely a cut above all the hotels I have frequented previously. The service level was exceptional from Ivan the Bell Man at the front door (he was so helpful and had the most positive energy\/attitude) to the woman who was at the front desk walking around with the IPAD trying to help people in the lineup check in\/out in a more timely manner (she helped us out a few times during our stay and everytime was soooo pleasant ) . I was impressed .. Customer Service is VERY important to me and I couldn't find anything to fault at this hotel... even the girl who worked only night shifts in the store selling souveniers (who had to deal with crazy drunk people every single shift) was always happy, smiling and helpful...Our room was very nice in teh spa tower (room 18605) ... we had wanted a king size bed but got two queens (honestly it ended up being a godsend having a second bed as my husband and I ended up spending a bit too much time in the sun and were burned to a crisp and were quite happy to be in different beds haha ) ... The one and only thing that I can say I wasnt too thrilled about was  the service at the pool. The server came around very infrequently and when she finally did show up after an hour, she took our order and then never showed up with our drinks..She seems to skip over sections of people and I heard a few people around us commenting that she wasnt paying attention to our area of the pool .When you are spending 20$ a drink , and tipping generously, you kindof expect SOME service. We ended up having to get hte majority of our drinks at the bar but.... is this really a big deal.??. no... it didnt affect how I feel about this hotel at all . The location of this hotel is perfect ... Great hotel! Try it, I can't imagine why you would be dissapointed..

I had the chance to stay in a fatty corner suite overlooking the fountains! This was legit a "baller" type of room! Luckily I didn't have to pay for it!

The decor is super modern and hip and I absolutely loved the color scheme! It was a lime green and turquoise and white and I was just enamored with it! The furniture in the suite was a nice sofa with chaise, a table and chairs, a little coffee table, and the huge bed. Everything here was insanely comfortable and the suite we were in was overlooking the fountains! It was awesome to be able to see the water show just by looking out the window! I have never actually watched it before, so this was a double awesome for me!

The lavatory area is awesome, the actual area to tinkle has a toilet and bidet inside of a room and the wash area has the tub and shower which were huge! Inside of the wash area is also a closet and vanity.

This is probably one of the pretties and most comfortable rooms I've been in! I would definitely reccommed this room (Corner suite 22nd floor) to those who can afford it!

Yay!

Not sure how to evaluate this hotel.  Was able to get a free room for the visit so price was this was a great value!

The rooms themselves at one point were top notch.  Time has gone by and while they are far from run down they definitely don't feel special anymore.  You can tell the difference in mattresses between the better hotels in Vegas and the lower end places.  The mattress was soft, with springs that still had life in them.  Was never a fan of the decor in the rooms and that hasn't changed.

This place does well with the free entertainment and fine dining restaurant options.  Bellagio is one of the first places I tell people to go if this is their first time in Vegas.  Between the fountain show, the lobby glass, and the seasonal atrium decorations you can kill a bunch of time without spending any money.

On the dining side have been to Le Cirque 4 or 5 times, Picasso 3 times, and Olives twice.  Never had a bad meal at any of those visits.

Their spa is one of the best I have been to.

Location is fantastic, basically the middle of the strip.  There is a tram that leaves from Bellagio and takes you to a spot in between Monte Carlo and Aria.  I think that feature is very underrated as that stretch is my least favorite on the strip to walk.  Nice to be able to avoid it.
 
Overall I like to stay here for everything but the room itself.

Didn't stay here but spent an evening gambling here. This place was great. The drink service was fast, even on the penny machines. I was surprised when I ordered a Pina colada and it came back looking all fancy! You don't normally get that with the free drinks in the casino. 
Will definitely be back here!

Overall decent experience. For a nice hotel, I do think it is lacking. The rooms are up to date but the bedding\/mattress are lacking. Paid for and enjoyed a great fountain view so that was a plus. Bathroom was nice, nothing special, but the vanity faucets leaked when in the on position. Not sure I would return to stay, more likely to return to a newer more modern hotel like cosmopolitan (good experience and great view as well last year). Check in was a little hectic with no apparent organization in the lobby. If you want a great view of Vegas (if you pay for the right room) and decent accommodations, then you may like Bellagio.

Bellagio is the epitome of luxury in Vegas, but they've been around since 1998, so when staying here, I wasn't sure if the room and amenities would be dated. It wasn't (yay!), but some of the furniture and fixtures in the room were showing signs of wear and tear. 

THOUGHTS ABOUT THE ROOM: the room itself was spacious. There are controls near the door for the ceiling-to-floor window curtains. The room does not have a wall-to-wall view like Wynn, but more like half a wall of a view. The TV stations offered are not as plentiful as I've seen in other hotels. Certain channels, like the Asian channels, were a bit wonky. There are a couple of channels for them and when you flip to it, it works for a few seconds and then appear to lose the signal. Happened for every Asian channel. I didn't see a problem for any of the others. The bathroom had both a soaking tub and separate glass enclosed shower. The room fridge is fully stocked as a minibar and not empty, so you'd have to order an empty one at an additional cost. 

The resort fee of $33 covers internet, fitness center access, local calls, and boarding pass printing. During my trip in April, there were no parking fees for now but I was told it will be coming later and it'll be a cost separate from the resort fee. As of this posting, they've started implementing parking fees at certain M Life properties like Bellagio. -_-

THOUGHTS ABOUT THE AMENITIES: The fitness center is far from the hotel rooms. It's near the conservatory, sharing the same entrance as the spa and salon. As you head to the fitness center, you are given a great view of the conservatory from the second floor. I think Bellagio has my favorite fitness center thus far. It's a large fitness center with high ceilings, bright lights (some of it natural light too), weights, machines and an area for balance exercises. Surprised to see a considerable amount of people working out on a Tuesday morning! I didn't have a chance to check out the pool during my time here, which I was sad about.

THOUGHTS ABOUT THE SERVICE: Jacqueline, the front desk personnel who checked us in, was so warm and welcoming. We had booked a resort king room, but was able to upgrade to a fountain view room for a reasonable fee per night. It was totally worth the upgrade fee. Jacqueline is amazing; she worked her magic to get us a room as close to the middle of the floor as possible, which meant a breathtaking view of the fountains and the strip skyline. We pretty much stayed in the room when the fountains' schedule started and tuned in to the TV channel that played the music to the show. The music came through clear and crisp. We took many a video that captured all of the fountains. It was clearer than filming it at street level.

Bellagio was definitely worth it for a special occasion. The view itself was worth it. However, due to the parking fees, I would be factoring that in when choosing the place for my next Vegas trip.

Service is wonderful, staff is friendly and extremely helpful, and the rooms are immaculate. We are having our wedding ceremony here. I haven't had to do a thing! The wedding planners are beyond amazing. From the flowers to the time of the ceremony, they have it all figured out. So happy with our choice

Good god, y'all!  Where do I even start with this place?  Probably the nicest hotel that has put me up so far.  

I knew I was in for a rich (as in, I would soon be poor) experience when I first walked in the door and used the ATM and it spit out only Benjamins.  But if you got to go down, do it in style.  Bellagio's got style in spades.  You know you're in a class joint when even the urinal dividers are solid marble.

Those beautiful people chatting in the hall that you can't understand? Yes, they're actually Italian.  And there are a lot of them.  I assume Bellagio doesn't just truck them in for verisimilitude.  They actually fly themselves over from Florence or wherever  to stay in this idealized version of Italy.  In a city, or at least a street, where everything is artifice this is as close to real fakery as you can find.  

The thing is, for all the show (my room had marble floors and from the bed I could open the curtains remotely, then stroll over and watch the fountain show) Bellagio doesn't miss the details.  The pretty Italian cafe near the elevators uses both Illy Caffe and Umbria coffee and has outstanding pastries and snacks.  The personnel are without exception professional friendly and helpful.

Also, for all this I didn't pay all that much.  True, I was on a conference rate but I heard one of my fellow conference-goers bested that with Expedia.  I just give thanks to all those folks on the gaming floor, subsidizing my stay. 

I could go on about the spectacular pools, the selection of restaurants and bars, the amazing people watching, but you'll just have to go check it out.  My friend gave me a useful piece of advice: if they offer you a special deal on upgrading, take it.  So do that, have a good time, and try not to lose too many of those Bens.

What a beautiful experience! We stayed here Monday, August 31st to Saturday, September 5th and it was the best vacation by far! We got a great deal on cheap tickets! I came here with my boyfriend for his 30th birthday! The room was beautiful, the service was amazing and the casino was lively! Would definitely stay here again! Definitely a 5 star hotel!

After about 10 visits, this hotel stays consistent and classy. I always make sure to enjoy a glass of wine or martini at the Petrossian bar near the front desk, a calm and civilized place to listen to talented pianists while doing some serious people watching!  

The recently refurbished guest room in the main tower was really tastefully done, it  gives a tired guest a soothing feel the moment the threshold is crossed.

This last trip I forgot to pack my "jammies," which were hanging on a hook behind the bathroom door.  I didn't notice until close to a week later, yet when I called, they were there and promptly returned via Fedex at their expense.  Nice!

I stayed at Bellagio for one night, and as they say "What's happens in Vegas, stays in Vegas". Maybe my company was the reason that I had one of my best hotel visits ever. I was stunning by the building. It was great, the room service as well. And we were so pleasured about the room, so much space. The shower was great! One thing that a blondie maybe will do is to jump in the beds. Don't do that. We had a very low roof in the room. But otherwise it was great! I would love to stay at the Bellagio Hotel again. Big casino, great Italian restaurant too! Beautiful fountain! Nearly to everything. I walked barefoot from the club to the hotel, it was about 5 minutes walk. Super!

The fountain to watch was neat how it went with the music, but I thought it would have been more like how you see it on tv or in movies, but we had also caught the last showing for it that night, but it is still worth going to check it out it's romantic and peaceful

This is a late review.   I stayed in the presidential at the end of February for 4 nights.  It was the best experience!  The Bellagio limo came to pick us up at the airport.  When we left, a bell hop place another couple into our limo when we were standing there for 15mins.  This was the one thing that ruin the perfect Vegas weekend
Other than that we had 24 hour butler service available and the perfect view of the the strip.  We stayed with my future in laws who were there for business meeting.  The butler service was the best part of the presidential suites perk.  All you have to do is pick put any phone in the room and let them know what you need.  Most of the time, we used it for room service.  We needed some clothes pressed for some couple of the fancy meeting we needed to attend.  All we needed to do was give it to whichever butler was working and they were by our front door the next morning. Our tub was next to the window of the view of the strip.  The radio in the bathroom was great too!  I loved the robes that were provided for us to use.  Wished I could of taken that home.  There were fresh flowers places around our suite and they even switched out the flowers after a day or two. Room service was amazing, the butlers has their own entrance to our suite and when they were done setting up our food in the dining room they would politely announced that they were ready for us.  
The only con from this experience besides the limo was that we were not allowed in one of the pool sections where you had to pay.  My father in law was in the presidential suite for a week.  For the amount of money that he spent that week for his work meeting, that paying pool section should be included with the presidential suite perk.  Our overall experience was fantastic!  We would love to be able to stay in the presidential suite again!

What can I say. Between the fountain shows, the gym, the food, the room, and the pools, I'm proud to say that we made the correct decision on where to stay on the Strip. The gym is fully stocked with great equipment. Smith machine, free weights, dumbbells, mats, weight machines (leg extensions, leg curls, chest press, etc.), cardio machines (treadmills, ellipticals, arc trainers, stairmasters, bikes), and cable machines. I've always felt so limited when it came to working out at a hotel gym, but not at the Bellagio. The spa was also beautiful. My mom and I had manicures, which were definitely over-priced, but what do you expect at a hotel. We were desperate lol. There are plenty of food choices. So many restaurants and all with different themes. Cafe Bellagio is good for breakfast, as well as the pool cafe. The gelato cafe is awesome too. Really yummy flavors, and the best espresso! The room was stocked with the necessities, and not over the top. Flat screen, very comfortable beds, and a separated shower\/tub. Just watch out if you open the mini fridge. If you stick a personal item in there and never took out anything that was already inside, they might charge you. It's an automatic charge if anything is moved. Caught 4 extra charges there. All in all, it's one of the best newer hotels on the strip and would definitely come back.

Keep a green tree alive in your heart and a songbird may come to sing there!

Christmas time in the Bellagio was breath taking.    Never before have I seen such a massive grand display in their center courtyard.   This reminded me of Christmas in the Park back home in San Jose.   Bellagio's Christmas displays are definitely on steroids!   I could spend hours here in the courtyard admiring the displays and the details spent on the icons that make this time of year joyful.      On this enchanting evening, our party ventured to Bellgaio's dinner buffet on a Sunday night and filled our bellies with delights of prime rib and kobe beef.   Yes, you read that right... KOBE BEEF!      I had to dive for seconds and thirds for the succulent Wagyu cattle from Japan.     I joined my beef dinner with their selection of Alaskan crab legs, fresh shrimp, sautéed and herbed mushrooms, and various fresh greens.    I'm taking one star for this visit because I expected the desserts to knock me off my seat.   Instead, it fell short of tantalizing my taste buds.     I love my desserts moist and full a natural sugars and creaminess.   In any event,  I've learned over the years that Bellagio has the best buffet food.    It's all about the quality of the food, not the quantity.     This is big recommend when searching for the best buffets in Vegas.

As for the accommodations, I suggest booking early as you can and getting on their mailing list for special deals.     This is my go to spot when in Vegas.     Perfect for romantic getaways for couples on a quick mini vacation.   Leave the kids at home.

Notes:
- Holiday Dinners on Sundays are $41.95 plus tax per person.
- Rooms priced $139.00 - $489.00 a night depending on how early you book.

The Bellagio is owned by MGM and MGM must stand for mobsters, gangsters and malevolence since we feel robbed...  Old times in Vegas still live on?

I never like to write 1 star reviews, and I always try to find something positive to say.
I am actually sad to admit I cannot be very positive in this review :(

Me and my wife found what seemed to be a nice online packaged deal and we stayed here for the 1st time ever thinking it was a going to be great and we were looking forward to the stay here very much!  

We upgraded our room and were told about service charges and resort fees and listened carefully about all these things the desk clerk mentioned..
After check out and we viewed our bill on the TV service they provide and we were ok with it. We get back home and find more charges were applied to our credit card!
We were charged for things we never used or even saw or told about!  
We do not drink, yet were changed for alcohol!
How is that legally possible?

Do yourself a favor.  
If you do not intend to use the snack bar in your room and tell them to remove it from your room before your go to your room unless you want to be charged for never using it.

I can't stress this enough to everyone, Get a copy of your bill on paper before you leave so if need be, you can dispute "unforeseen" charges!  
Yet even then they still may take you to the cleaners for no valid reason.

Also My wife was stopped by security a number of times trying to go to our room thinking she was not a guest by the same security guard even though she showed her room card!

If all of this sounds like a good time to you. Then by all means go to the Bellagio.
Maybe you have so much money that you don't care about getting ripped off and or you do not love your spouse enough and do not mind them being treated in a hostile fashion.   

Looking at and talking with other yelpers on this subject.   Lori P. of Bellagio Hotel always says sorry, but never makes any effort what so ever to compensate or right the wrongs that have been done to honest people.   In short, her apologies and words are like the service we paid for, worthless. 

We tried calling the Bellagio, but were just given the run around with numbers that go to recordings and no one to talk to.


So all in all...
Yes, I just like to give out our hard earned money to places like this so we can give bad reviews rather than a good one for no valid reason. Kinda like taking money for no valid reasons, right?

There a huge difference between splurging and telling a resort to just have their way with your credit card, thus robbery.

With business practices like these. Its no wonder why Vegas has been going downhill with the business model MGM and their resorts are projecting onto it's customers.

The rooms are quite nice and large.  We stayed in a 2 Queen Bedroom.  Wonderful bed with lovely Egyptian cotton - so comfortable!

Huge marble bathroom - tub, stand-up shower, 2 sinks - lovely soft towels, 2 bathrobes.

Freebies - body lotion - leaves your skin so smooth - it's actually sold in their store, mouthwash, shampoo, conditioner.  

There is also turn down service.  

The Conservatory - love how it changes with the season or celebration - I went during Chinese New Year.  It was transformed to a Chinese Garden with an Ox made out of a bush!  The God of Fortune was right in the middle and pandas on the side.  Lovely!

I've been to Vegas at least 20 times and have stayed in at least 15 different hotels. I've seen how bad things can get (Westward Ho) and I've seen the five star side of things (Venetian). During my visits I almost always visited the Bellagio to play poker or just hang out because I felt it was the classiest joint on the strip. I always dreamed of staying there, but the high price was hard to justify.

So this was my first stay at the Bellagio and I saw things that I had never seen before. Things such as $24.95 per day WiFi access, $6.00 handling fee per letter to receive mail at the hotel, $1.00 per minute computer usage, and a $10 per day fridge rental fee. I heard things that I had never heard before in a hotel, namely my neighbor urinating. The sound coming through crisp and loud through the vent above the camode. The constant sound of dripping water in the shower drain. And dealers informing me that I have to bet $25 per hand at blackjack to get MGM\/Mirage rewards.

In addition to surprises, there were things that I found simply disappointing. The pool closed at 6:00 PM. The CRT television had around 30 stations, and 10 of them were in Chinese. And most requests (hangers, pillows, towels) took an average of 45 minutes to arrive. Yes, I actually timed each request because I had read another review on Yelp about how fast they had things delivered, they said usually in less than 10 minutes.

Is this just a negative review? No, I hope not. There are some really nice things at the Bellagio:

* choice of down or foam pillows
* the fountain show and an amazing view of the strip
* fancy and expensive restaurants
* comfortable beds with good linens
* a fancy bathroom with a beautiful glass shower and large tub
* almost as much marble as the other nice hotels on the strip
* a very helpful conceirge desk, although sometimes understaffed
* lots of shaded parking close to the lobby (but not to our tower)
* good, invisible, and quiet ventilation in the bathroom
* reliable and quiet HVAC with 1\/2 degree increments
* electric curtains, although the switch wasn't near the window
* clock radio with iPod dock (although not for iTouch or iPhone)

When we checked out of the hotel, we had an overwhelming sense of being nickle and dimed, despite paying a premium to stay there. Perhaps after reading this review you won't suffer the same sticker shock and awe, and can enjoy your stay knowing how much you will be billed when you check out.

Will I go back and stay there again? Yes, I will. Not having a flat panel TV is not the most important thing about staying at a hotel. The most important thing is making my wife happy, and she absolutely loved the spa. As far as I know, only guests are able to use the spa on weekends so that will be the one reason we will return.

Location, location, location.

I've been to Vegas more times than I can count (and then I'd like to admit), and stayed at various hotels. I honestly believe that any of the mid-tier hotels are good enough (Paris, Monte Carlo, etc). but if you are looking to splurge, the Bellagio is worth every penny.  There's the Pool Cafe which I LOVE (see my review here: http:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz\/bellagio-pool-cafe-las-vegas#hrid:tj7FPE3ZFiI7pwAZrXDUaA) and amazing customer service. My friend lost his wallet in the middle of the night (or early hours of the morning, depending how you look at it...) and got a call the next day from security letting him know that they had found his wallet. And everything was still in it.  When we were checking out, I took my bags with me to grab my friend from the pool. I asked the guy at the top of the stairs leading to the pool if I could leave my bag for a few minutes while I grabbed my friend, and he was more than happy to do it, and even suggested I pull it around where he could see it better to keep an eye on it while I was gone.

And.. location.  You can't get much more central than this. In terms of the high end hotels (Venetian and Wynn are the other two I would note) the location of the Bellagio is by far the best. We could walk almost everywhere that we wanted to go (even in the 100 degree heat).

The rooms are large and roomy and nicely decorated, but that is to be expected.  What sets this hotel apart are the customer service and its location. I only wish I could rationalize the splurge and stay here more often...

I love the pool cafe at Bellagio,  the staff and food are wonderful!  It's been almost a year since I was there and I'm definitely looking forward to going back in a few weeks!  

I have to go with 4 stars,  because they weren't open during the regular hours that were posted.  I'm hoping whatever issues they had are resolved by the time we get back!

The hotel itself is gorgeous, I love the conservatory and water shows.

Unfortunately, it was really crowded when I got in, which makes things  annoying. A lot of people passing by while standing in line to check in. They were out of non-smoking rooms when I got there so I had to spend my first night in a smoking room, gross! Had to fight through crowds to get to my room.

Rooms are a decent size, and are quite comfortable. Only problems I had was that it was too dark and the smoking (which was fixed night 2) The chocolate is good. Bathroom is roomy, and had a separate bathtub\/shower.  Gym is nice.

Service is good, they know your name and room number as soon as you call in. Getting a non-smoking room night 2 was a synch, I didn't even need to go to the front desk in person!
