I wouldn't be opposed to staying here again, but it wouldn't be my top choice.

Everyone has seen Ocean's Eleven so it's  cool visiting the hotel in real life. The casino was one well organized, although I lost more than a small amount of money. The fountains were good to see, especially at night. I thought that they lasted for longer, I wasn't too bothered because we could see them from our room across at the Paris We also saw the Cirque du Soleil show O, an experience that I totally enjoyed

Best Hotel I've ever been to. This hotel is amazing, classy, has a fantastic casino, a full gym, and amazing staff. Everything I asked for they could provide at this hotel. It gives a Central location of the strip, I got a fountain view king room. The view, the hotel, the location, the gym, the casino; were all reasons to stay at this hotel! However, I did not eat here nor was there entertainment (shows, performers, clubs...). But in my opinion, it was nice to visit other hotels for these purposes, it gave me a chance to explore. Plus the bellagio is already packed, it's best not to add more stuff!

This was my first stay and I am hooked. I splurged for the Deluxe room with Lakeview since this was a milestone birthday celebration which did not disappoint. There were no lines in check-in, professional staff, exquisite room decor, fabulous pool, and the banks of elevators that take you directly to your floor without stopping at every level. 

If you can fit it in your budget, live like a Rockstar by reserving a poolside cabana that is yours for the day with your own personal Cabana Boy to pamper you. You will want to reserve it a couple of weeks prior to your stay to ensure your spot, they will call you the day of to confirm that you still want the reservation, no charge to reserve or decline. Just call, the staff is accommodating. 

I would have rated it 5 stars aside that there is no late night quick bite joint where you can grab something quick and get back to gambling or carrying on. All eateries are sit down, and at 3:30 am, who wants to play nice-nice with a waiter that doesn't want to be working at 3:30 am. 

The hotel is in the middle of all the action, across the street from the Hip Planet Hollywood, Paris, and Ceasars Palace! What more could you ask for?

OMG this hotel is just GORGEOUS!!! I feel like a Goddess...meow. I didnt get to stay here but we went to The Bank. The pools looked amazing from the inside. LOL  Definitely a place I would stay maybe next time! They have a really fun garden somewhere and lots of tourists were there taking lots of photos!

I don't understand how such a nice hotel can have a horrible check-in process.  It's extremely disorganized, you just look for the shortest line, and get in it, no matter it may suddenly slow down and people who got into other lines 20 minutes after you did are probably in their rooms by then.  Unfortunately, we picked a line like that the last time I stayed there.  I don't understand why they don't use the ropes, so the line is fair and orderly, instead it's crowded and there are people scattered everywhere.  It took probably 45 minutes to check in because the people who were at the front were from out of the country and had about 8 passports to check in, then they decided they wanted to change their type of room.  Now, this is not the hotel's fault, but if they had an orderly line, I could have gone to the next available person.  Instead, the employee directing people to lines tells us to stay where we are.  I did not even see the point of that person.  Seriously, a simple rope that probably doesn't cost much could make all the difference and keep guests tempers down.

They have recently renovated and the rooms were very nice and clean.  I liked the photographs they had throughout the halls and in the rooms.  Of course, the lobby is beautiful (but not beautiful enough to distract from the line!).  The housekeeping staff was extremely friendly and they are a definite positive about the Bellagio, unlike the cocktail servers.  Good luck finding one while you are gambling or if you do see one, getting them to stop and take your drink order.  I will probably stay there again, but I know I need to prepare myself for the cattle call check-in.

My favorite Vegas Mega Resort - located in the heart of the Vegas Strip. Built when themed Vegas hotels were still a thing (ahem - cold sterile City Center) this place packs a bunch of personality and spares no expense in doing so.

From the beautiful exterior to all the small details inside this place is nothing less than incredible. I've been so many times and no visit to Vegas is complete unless I drop by. From the moment you step foot onto this property you will notice that is different and better than all the rest.

Just enter the parking garage. Right before you get in you are greeted by security and asked to pop your trunk. This isn't just some free for all where you can just walk in like Walmart - rather this is like a Costco where your checked by the door for admittance. I like that and it adds to security. I noticed other properties do the same but only on New Years eve - Barbary Coast comes to mind where they inspect your car - even with mirrors to check the undercarriage. You can never be too safe these days.

I particularly enjoy one of the hostess at the  Buffet. She has been there since day one back in 1998 and it always puts a smile on my face to see her there. Looks like she never misses a day of work.

I don't like the addition of the new tower that was completed in 2005. Its an eyesore but I guess its set back far enough that it shouldn't be an issue. I would have preferred they name it a different name and painted it a different color. Such a shame the sweeping double staircase was sacrificed for this addition... but business is business.

Casino is beautiful. Ceilings and light fixtures... walkways - all just as beautiful as can be. Some casinos look like warehouses - no this one... rather a work of art. 

Standard rooms are small but of high quality. Power shades and lots and lots of comfort and pillows. Good thing they have turn down service - moving all those pillows and opening up the bed is hard work.

Other resorts might be newer but in my book none beat Bellagio and all the elegance and good vibes it has to offer.

We were excited to visit the Bellagio during this Las Vegas vacation.  Im sad to say it will be our last.  

Upon arrival, we were shocked  the checkin line was winding through 4 roped off lines all the way to the  lobby exit door.  It took an hour to check-in.  Why they weren't better staffed was puzzling.

The room was of decent size but was dusty in areas, shower had loose molding, wallpaper is pulling from the wall, there were spots on the bathroom floor and tub area that were never cleaned and the bedspread smelled of urine.  All items I would not expect from a "luxury" hotel.  I asked housekeeping to remove the bedspread and bring a new one, but it wasn't replaced  until the day before our departure.  The A\C rattled and we called engineering to repair.  A nice gentleman did come and repair it, but he stood there and talked (we had just arrived) until we tipped him and he left. 

We immediately took note of the expense of the In-room snacks and beverages in the refrigerator and decided to avoid that at all costs (pun intended).   There is also no coffee maker in the room.  So, we taxied to a market and purchased some milk, water, wine and snacks to enjoy in the room.  (A bag of chips in their ice and concession area is $5 and a beverage is $7).   We did not carefully read signage and removed a couple of sodas and beer from the refrigerator in our room to keep our items cool.  We had a knock on our door two days later from an employee who informed us we were being charged $50\/day to use their equipment.  I was shocked and said by all means I would remove my items so they could put the items we removed back back so we wouldn't be charged.  She put those EXACT items back in that we removed.  Worried about the charges, we called the manager who said we had actually been charged $50\/each day AND $468 for the contents of the entire fridge.  He said it was a health code violation to put items back.  I expressed outrage and said a) not everything was removed and B) the exact same items were put back in so how could we be charged for all of it?  He then he agreed to remove  the charges "as a courtesy".  Perhaps as a courtesy they should make things affordable, provide a coffee
maker  in the room and provide a refrigerator you can actually use?  The evening before check out we were settling our bill and noticed another $50 charge.  Called and at first we were told it was a "perishable" fee charge then by a different person a "restocking" fee.  The manager refused to honor what we were originally told that it be removed and would not credit it off.  

The entire experience we felt so nickel and dimed, disappointed by the lack of customer service and it just wasn't worth it for 4 nights.  There are too many other options on the strip to be treated this way.  We will not be returning.

Other than the fact that the line to get checked in seemed to take forever (which appears to be the norm for most Vegas hotels) everything was amazing. Great sports book and the Bellagio poker room is where all poker pros seemed to be 24-7 literally. Got some pics with poker greats like Gus Hansen, Scotty Nguyen and Mike Matusow. Also Prime steak house was great and so was the staff in that restaurant. 

Tip of the day, splurge a little and get a lake view room-that way you can watch the fountain show when you want right from your room and they have a channel on the tv which plays the music for the fountains. It's super romantic as well since it's like a private show in the comfort of your air conditioned room without the heat and crowds.

My wife and I had our wedding here in October, 2012 after deciding the traditional wedding wasn't the route we wanted to go. We ended up spending about $2500 on the smaller chapel at the hotel. We could not have asked for more. The complete process could not have been simpler. After providing the payment, asking for certain items to be added, they simply told us "be here at this time, on this date." That's exactly what we did and it was all taken care of. 

The hotel itself is wonderful. For this occasion we stayed in one of their suites with a living space, three bathrooms, and entry - not 100% sure what it's called. It was always clean and tidy. They left chocolates on our pillows (small touch-  but it's food!). 

Restaurants and gambling were top notch as well. 

We will be back.
Always so classy.  Always so romantic.  First hotel I stayed at when I visited Las Vegas the first time.  Loved it so much that I came back and got married here =)

For the price, this place didn't deliver enough imo. They said they'd have a room ready with a view of the strip if we waited until 3  to check in (we got there at 10). True, you could see paris... over the parking lot. The bathroom shower... AMAZING. hella comfy pillows, but very rough towels not what I expected. Coulda been better.

Stayed at the Bellagio this past weekend for our birthday weekend.  From the moment we arrived, we were pleasantly greeted at the mobile check-in desk, and thanked for being a MLife member.  Once we got up to our room in the Spa Tower, it was beautiful, luxurious, and spotless.  I must say, I only stay at MGM resorts in Vegas, and out of all of them, the Bellagio is probably my favorite.  
We had a great time throughout the resort, but spent a good amount of time in the casino.  During the daytime, the cocktail servers were frequenting our table to make sure our drinks were never empty.  At night though, I don't think I saw any servers at all.  It didn't matter though, it was pretty late (or early however you want to call it...lol!), and we were almost ready to head up to the room, so one more glass of champagne would have been a nice way to end our birthday weekend.  Since we didn't see a server, and we had just cashed out, we ended up going back to the room.  I guess that was my sign that I already had too much champagne...lol!  Nevertheless though, we had an AMAZING time!

This has to be my most favorite hotel in all of Las Vegas and not because of the casino but of the fantastic buffet they have. The food is high quality and their are so many choices that you can go crazy lol. There is nothing better than filling your tummy up with caviar and fresh sashimi and don't let me forget the dessert that they have.

Just checked into Bellagio in one of the new towers. We booked the deluxe luxury rooms. The rooms are new and we'll done but the hospitality leaves a lot to be desired. They sold us a parking lot view room in the name of fountain view room. Rooms were not ready for checkin even at 2 pm and they have removed even the electric tea cattle from the room. We called services to provide one and she said it would be additional $31 just for the hot water kettle!!! We tried to order in room food and she said the wait time was more than  1 hr in a tone that begged us to not place an order.... We have just arrived so I will update the thread over the next couple of days...

This would have been a 5 star rating as the experience was nice from the mobile check-in to the amenities of the room. It was dropped to 1 star after we found out that our souvenir gambling chips which my girlfriend and I had been stolen from our bedside night stands by the maids when they cleaned our room in the evening. They aren't redeemable anywhere if they had inspected them for 2 seconds.

If you don't want any spare chips or small bills that you don't want to vanish or they think it's tip then you better put it in the safe. Front Desk did offer to comp us some fees to settle us down but it's the principle of the manner on this. 

Looking up other Yelp 1-star reviews it turns out this is not uncommon on the maids stealing from the rooms with corporate turning a blind eye. Here is another heads-up that it keeps happening.

We'll definitely be staying at another hotel after this trip.

Funny ... most everyone knows you've got to know when to hold em, know when to fold em, know when to walk away, and know when to run.  Kenny knew a thing or two; about gambling and life. 

Bellagio still packs em in for their holiday displays and fountain shows. During that time, they also beckon you to gamble with the denizens of Vegas; smoke and chips, cocktail waitresses and conventioneers. 

We are up lifetime on visits to Lost Wages, and hope to keep it that way. Always walk away when you get ahead. That's the only way to stay a winner here.

Never actually stayed here, as the table limits are too high.  My wife likes the slots here and to browse around the shops.  They also serve fiji water on request vs reg bottled water.  The hotel and service from the staff are all five stars.

Shhh but the Flamingo side valet is our secret parking spot to go to Serendipity, which my wife has to visit on every trip.  It is also easy access and never busy as it is hidden and not much people know about it.

Our room was nice and clean, and the bed was comfortable.  However, the walls are pretty thin and the other guests near us were very rowdy and noisy.  We also could hear a lot of noise coming from the street.  So, sleeping was not all that easy.

The casino was fun, but we ended up losing more money than we won -- no surprise.

We drowned our sorrows in one of the bars inside the casino, and enjoyed people watching as we sipped our Old Fashinoned and beers.

REMEMBER: Don't gamble more than you can afford to lose, folks! :-)

Beautiful Winter Wonderland. The Bellagio never underwhelms with they're Christmas decorating. It's always a must see when visiting Las Vegas. Cute polar bears made of flowers with frolicking penguins in a cute snow scene. Gigantic tree twinkling lights, with a train circling around and bright colored ornaments hanging from the ceiling. Lots of photo opportunities here.  Very festive and cheery. A nice break from gambling and rambling. 

Nice to visit and admire all the lights and Christmas decorations throughout the hotel.

My flight was late for the Cirque de Solei Beatles show. Initially they said they would rebook me for another day. When I provided proof that I had purchased the tickets through a ticket broker and they had acquired the tickets through ticketmaster.t was my sons birthday and that ruined it since I cant always afford $700.00 for a special event.  Bill  I flew from San Diego to Las Vegas and unfortunatley the flight was cancelled by Spirit.  I really believed The Bellagio would have aided us.  I know you are supposed to lose in Vegas but not like this
The gold standard for casinos everywhere. Just bring a fat wallet, you won't find many $5 tables here.

One of the best hotels in Las Vegas. It's my favorite place to stay. The service is better then Wynn hotel and encore. If you sign up for their email they will send you great deals for your stay. I love Bellagio. The rooms recently have been renovated. They also have a great selection of fine dining.

LOVE the Bellagio! I've stayed at the Bellagio more than half a dozen times, and it remains my favorie hotel in LV!  Much better than The Wynn.  Perfect location mid-strip. I love the Spa Tower.  All of the rooms are renovated and beautiful.

I attended a 5-day converence at the Bellagio.

ROOM: My room was starting to look a little worn, but it was still nice. A\/C works well (can't get the room super cold, but gets it very cool). Either the walls are nice and thick, or my neighbors were boring.

AMENITIES: Restaurants on site aren't cheap. Even the place for late night meals can run you an easy $20, but everythign is quality and delicious. The pool is amazing. I brought my gym clothes, but never went. Whaddya expect? It's Vegas! Conference rooms were really nice.

SERVICE: The staff is ridiculously friendly and accommodating. Most everyone says hello when you walk by. Dealers are funny and interesting. None of that difficult small talk at the tables. My room was turned twice a day. Housekeeping impressed me.

I stayed here with 3 of my girlfriends back in November. The location is great because it's truly at the center of the strip plus it's close to some of the other great hotels (Caesar's, The Cosmopolitan, Planet Hollywood, etc). Our room was amazing. It was spacious and the bathroom was spectacular! However, the casino was very smoky. I understand though... but the smoking is such a turn off for any nice hotel! 

It was kind of annoying as we would go to the guest elevators, there would be an attendant checking for our room keys. At the time I didn't really understand why. Security reasons?

Maybe it's 4 stars if you get a room without a fountain view, but I wouldn't know! The Bellagio remains our hotel of choice on the strip -- it's 100% worth the extra price to get a lakeview room. 

Want a cheap night in Vegas? Pay the extra $50 for the lakeview room, sneak a few bottles of wine up to the room, and get drunk watching the watershow.
Beautiful hotel with a few high end boutiques, great restaurants and bars with a beautiful fountain show you can view along the Vegas strip.

The hotel is one of the best on the strip.
I ordered  an item, delivered by fedex. I had to pay

 15$to have someone bring it to my room. 10 if I were to pick it up myself. How warped is that?  
 

Ps.  Xmas week and I paid through the nose for my fountain view room.
The fountains, the gardens, the buffet, the gambling, what's there not to love about this amazing hotel?

Wow I remember when Vegas was cool and classy. This place has turned into a perverted freak show. I didn't even gamble much. Maybe $50.00 if that at some other hotels. The comfort and peace of mind  that comes with most guest experiences has gone down to filth and greed. 

Beside the food, which if you pick the correct restaurants is great. I'll be damn if I'm pumping another dollar in this sh*t hole.

this is a 3 star hotel not a 5 star. there is no such thing as customer service. most all hotel rooms in las vegas are the same. the way to separate themselves is to have better customer service. ceasars palace is a much better hotel.

I wouldnt call this a 5 star hotel, it is definitely nicer than the lower end hotels like the Linq.  But its a HUGE hotel, rather noisy because we can hear our neighbors phone conversation.  Its a standard nice, but nothing really wow'd me about the hotel itself.  I do like how it doesnt smell like cigarette smoke like other hotels.

When booking @Bellagio, i highly recommend getting a room with a fountain view! 

This is my second time staying here and probably my last until they upgrade.
@Bellagio, you will find exclusive shops, top restaurants, a casino + Botanical Conservatory all under one roof! 

x Gambling area is set up conveniently 
x Rooms were recently upgraded but need more work
x  Botanical Garden (a must see)
x exclusive shops such as Hermes, Chanel, Louis Vuitton, Dior, Gucci, Prada, Cartier + more
x glass artwork by Dale Chihuly in the lobby
x Restaurants- Olives, Michael Mina, Picasso, La Cirque, Prime Steakhouse, Harvest, Lago + more 
x "Fountain Show" 
x reasonable prices per night
x Jean Philippe Pastry 

Valet seemed like a hassle.. 
The wait for the car seemed forever. 

Another problem i had was the bathroom light not working on the 2nd night. (wth) 
-The ipod dock didn't work 
-The bathrooms are old
- Air conditioning was blowing heat instead of cooling down the room

 Im looking forward to a future remodel

Second time stayed here. I really like it. Love sitting right outside the pool and enjoying the sun. Also they have Jean Phileppe in the hotel, which I love! Plus, the internet is complimentary not like other hotels. :)

Came here to celebrate my gurl's batchlorette party.  Let me tell ya it was off da hook!

The food, the ambiance, the pool, the rooms (all suites), the service, the top shelf alcohol.  I could live like this forever!

oh and catch the water fountain show...it rocks!

Initial note: I've been here just a couple of days of my 6 day stay, so I will update my review (good or bad) at the end of the stay.

Review:

The Bellagio is a place I want so hard to like because it is absolutely gorgeous. I've been to Vegas a couple of times, but both times, I've stayed on Caesar's, which has been more than excellent. 

My issue with the Bellagio began with the bellman. I was asked three times when I was wheeling my luggage into the hotel (all one bag) if they could grab it. I politely told them 'No thank you.' They all responded by making a snide sound or rolling their eyes or throwing their hands in the air. Totally unprofessional. 

The next issue was the most major, because it reinforced the idea of the Bellagio that I got upon my arrival - that the employees are snobs. I played Craps countless times, and the dealers were just flat out rude, especially when I would have bets taken down and cashed out (I would imagine because I was up). This happened on three different occasions with 3-4 different employees. One was a higher up with a tie, overseeing a chip deposit to our table. 

My next issue was the room itself. The temperature would not adjust. The room is a smokehouse, and while the temperature reads 65, there is no way it is above 73.

Next was the food. Every place I ate at (that was a quick grab -  not a restaurant) was twenty minutes to fill an order. It shouldn't take that long to make a pastrami on rye sandwich! This occurs multiple times.

Having had very positive experience at Caesar's, I don't know if I'll ever return to the Bellagio, and that just isn't to stay, I will no longer gamble there either (for the rest of my trip, I'll be gambling at Caesar's or somewhere else). 

I hope that someone reads this because the Bellagio is such a beautiful hotel. Everything is set up to be perfect. Some of the employees aren't executing it like they should be and it's ruining the experience.

I just returned from another stay at the Bellagio.  I love the Bellagio and wish I could give them 5 stars, but they continue to have a few unresolved quirks that are consistently mentioned in reviews which keep them from being a world class hotel.  These Include:

Lack of Access to Coffee:
Even Motel Six  has in-room coffee makers, but not The Bellagio.   I tried the coffee options that include: 1.) Jean Philippe Coffee Shop-a 35 minute wait in line for one cup of black coffee.  2.) Room Service- very fast (8 minutes) but the coffee tasted bad and was expensive. 3.) A quarter mile walk to Starbucks at Planet Hollywood-best option.

Robot Thief of Mini Bar:
As true of all mini-bars, no one in their right mind would pay these inflated prices.  However, with this one, you are charged if you pick-up or touch an item.  You are also threatened with a $50 a day fine, if you store any personal item in it...just plain tacky.

Resort Fee:
This mandatory fee is charged daily and covers the following, regardless if you use them or not:

Wi-Fi--------------------I have LTE data and my phone is a hotspot.
Fitness Center---------Who wants to work out on vacation?
Print Boarding Pass---I save it as as a PDF on the phone and don't print.

Why not make these optional or just include them in the room price? Once again, tacky.

Other:

I even discovered a new one this visit.  There are no blender drinks at the pools.

The only reason I cannot think of that these things continue is the opposite of the Burger King slogan.  Management wants you to "have it their way." If you do not like these aspects of your stay, you can stay somewhere else.

Otherwise, this is a beautiful hotel with the best customer service on The Strip.

First time staying at the Bellagio.  Booked a standard room and threw $20 in for the girl at check out and got a fountain view room.  Overall the room was fantastic.  You cant beat the location either.  One thing though, $12.50 for a rum and coke???  It is vegas so i guess you can suck it up.......great experience.  The Bellagio is my go to hotel on the strip from here on out.
Beautiful decor but getting a little old by Vegas standards. The fountains are a big draw, the sports book has free drinks.

Very disappointed.  Got food poisoning twice.  Once from in-room service and second time from eating at Cafe Bellagio.  Which is a shame because spent more than $50 on each of those meals, to only spend all night in pain having diarrhea. 
The front-desk staff is incredibly rude.  I asked to speak to the manager to relay the sickness I experienced, and the guy told me he was the manager and was unbelievably rude and and condescending. 
The room attendants and the phone operators are really nice, but everyone else there seems like they have huge chips on their shoulders.  
I spent about $1000 at the blackjack tables, and can say that the dealers are ok... not really nice but not mean either... just "there".  The drink waitresses have SERIOUS attitudes, literally barking back "I'm only 'picking' up now!!" Meaning, no drink orders could be made at that moment.  That was another example of how "jaded" the staff here was.  
The rooms are comfortable enough, most notably the nice big bathroom... but one many occasions, you could hear the toilet gurgling all by itself and emitting a really foul odor.  Obviously there was something wrong with their plumbing.. but how gross is it to experience this at such a high-end place!!!
I spent six nights at this hotel.  I've stayed at many other nice casino hotels on the strip, but I really was looking forward to the Bellagio experience.
I will never stay here again.

Just returned from our 4th stay at the Bellagio.  I do love this hotel.  I do not know if its because of the economy or what but we got a terrific rate for our stay in October.  We always stay in one of the 1 bedroom President's Suite.  This stay, it was $399 a nite!!!  At over 1500 sf, this is a great room.  This room, this stay, was on the back side looking out at the Rio and The Palms hotel with the gorgeous mountains in the background.  I tend to keep all the draperies open so at night the lights illuminate the room and in the morning, the sun coming up on the mountains is great.  Although I complained to myself this time for not booking the room on the fountain side, I actually prefer this because the fountains are loud and can bother you after you see them the first few times.

The President's Suites are furnished in purple and gold tones.  When you walk in, you have a foyer with a 1\/2 bath on one side and entrance to the wet bar on the other side.  The front side of the wetbar has 4 barstools. It is a mini kitchen with cabinetry, refridgerators, sink, etc.  This overlooks the dining area (table for 4) as well as the living area which has a full size sofa and two chairs, huge flat screen TV.  The whole wall is windows.  In the bedroom is the most comfortable king bed.  The bedroom is on the end of the hotel so the windows wrap around the room.  There is a TV that comes out of the console at the foot of the bed.  Only a slight problem (which is insignificant to me), its hard to operate the remote while lying down.  There are his and her bathrooms and closets off the bedroom.  My bathroom had a huge jacuzzi tub that overlooked the mountains.  Flat screens in each bathroom.  My husband's bathroom had a huge steam shower.

New since about January 09 is that when you stay in the Suites, you have VIP access.  You have complimentary transportation to and from the airport via a stretch limo.  There is also a few food presentations in the VIP suites room (wine, cookies, choc covered straberries, etc).  We always forgot to take advantage of this - but it is a really nice amenity and its secluded.  The VIP concierge took care of all our reservations and we always went right to the front of the line in many of the food establishments at the Bellagio as well as ease for reservations for last minute dinner choices.  We are already planning next year's trip (my husband attends a yearly conference)....next year I plan on hosting a private party in our room for business associates which the Bellagio staff said will of course be , "no problem".  Oh, and the housekeeping is AWESOME. Very attentive!!!!

One last review of the pools.  They are my favorite.  There are a bunch of pools - finding an open chair is hard if arriving after noon or so.  I've found it best to find one of the pool attendants and giving him a tip to find the best location where he will bring the chair(s) over and set them up.  Its worth it as to not waste time walking from pool to pool to find one chair or two.  We usually get a cabana for one of our days there.  You have to book this before and its not guaranteed as the high rollers have first pick of them as they are comped.  However, we have always gotten one - you will know by 8:30 am the day of.  The cost is $400 for the day.  What is great is that when you check in between 9 and 10 at the cabana, if your cabana is in the shade, ask your cabana attendant to reserve some beach chairs in the sun - they will go and set them up and put reserved signs on them.  This was just terrific.  The cabanas have a flat screen TV as well as fruit and beverages in them.  It was great to take breaks in there when you had to get out of the sun or have lunch.  My husband watched football and enjoyed lunch at the table (seats 4) and there is also a sofa in there.  Outside the cabanas are usually 4 private chaise lounges.
The room and water closet were as clean as home. The ironing board could have higher quality.

The hotel looks so nice with lots of things to see, eat, and do. Some for free like the amazing botanical garden with aquarium designed by tv show Tanked. There is also a free exquisite art gallery. The minimum on the slots varies from a pennies to five dollars. Most of the tables minimum is $25 but you will find very few tables with $10-$15 minimum bets (the loud ones). I will give this hotel 5 stars but due to these cons I gave it 4 stars.  The room I had does not have a microwave (not sure if all rooms are like this) and the drink bar has a sensor under the items where if you bump or lift a drink it will automatically charge you $40 dollars for a small bottle of water (look but don't touch). However, I had a great time watching the fountains, the staff were nice, and I will definitely be back here again.

Booked a suite for my bachelorette weekend (now about 2 years ago) and the room was amazing, plus we were accommodated with roll in beds for my gals. However, the sound system would not work at all and none of the staff members seemed to care to fix it, but I'm going to assume that was on purpose. Anyways, for what you pay... everything should be in pristine condition.  
We attended Hyde which provided great service since we were there before 10 and were able to get free bottle service. The rest of the night gets pretty packed, but that's common with most of the clubs. 

Expect to pay out some nice change for even a bottle of water at the convenient store here. I took the tram to Monte Carlo for water that was way more affordable. And by the way, the tram is great! 

Gambling is fun at Bellagio... why because it's one of the few hotels in the strip that actually still carries the older slot machine games (along with the newer ones)! And they have European roulette, which is fun to watch when the minimum is $300. Crap dealers are always friendly, and I enjoy that they have lower minimum tables to play. 

I really wish that Bellagio was part of Total Rewards instead of Mlife... much better program with perks. I would gamble at Bellagio wayyyy more often. 
But if MLife stepped it up, you'd be back in the game! 

And as always, a beautiful job with the decor! The high end stores are always a treat to window browse. I get my rings cleaned at Tiffany, so that makes me feel like a baller. ;)

The standard rooms are fancy but I don't think it merits the 5 star price tag. However, the pool is extremely nice and I believe it's only open to guests of the hotel so that (and other amenities I haven't used) might make it worthy of the $$$$. The casino itself is pretty classy too! The decorations are nice and my family loves going to the botanical gardens, which change with the seasons.

AMAZING HOTEL! Clean, nice, and AMAZING! 

Rooms? Stayed in a luxury villa and it was HUGE! But seriously, how come there's almost double of the amount of bathrooms than bedrooms? Kinda pathetic. 

Spa? Got an in room massage for 90 minutes and it was worth every penny. Make sure you ask for Jennifer! 

Shows? O by Cirque du Soleil is where to go. Surrealism, jaw dropping, and just amazing! 

Dining? Picasso. Don't even waste your time at Michael Mina or Jasmine. Go to Picasso. 

Shops? Via Bellagio will fit everyone's needs from Chanel to Prada.

All in all, great hotel! I'll come here again.

Hm... $15 for glass of Champagne with is real cost $3! Are you crazy? We spend a lot of money in this hotel and I feel like  they cheating on me. After check out they told us we need pay some fee!!!! Fee for what????? They don't know, maybe for cleaning room or something else. Just make sure you will pay $30 this fee! Why I'm write this post , because when I spend money I want to have Quality!!

Once in a life time experience 
Just being able to stay there was amazing 

Clean nice hotel 
Perfection at all levels 
From the check in to the room maids 

The gorgeous views 
Omg if you want the best experience
Come to this hotel amazing

We recently returned here for a long weekend. We love this hotel. Great service and best location on the strip, for convenience as well as all around experience. I will only stay there when in Vegas. We also saw "O" again.. It was amazing!!!

The lobby is gorgeous, glass flowers on the ceiling. The botanical gardens get changed by the season and are great for photo ops. The restaurants are great. The shopping is pretty amazing too.

The monorail system is great so it's easy to get up and down part of the strip. 

The casino is pretty basic but being from Jersey, the dealers and staff on the casino floor are way more friendly than AC. I can't stress this enough. 

I have stayed at a few spots in Vegas but always go back here.

What can I say:) don't go there and don't waste your money. $17 for a very small amount of Glefiddich ($28 price for a bottle in any store). Somehow, price for a double shot goes up to $ 40:) and that double looked less then a single shot in any average bar. I was playing black jack, $100-$150  a hand and asked for pack of cigarettes. very self attracted floor lady with cute silicon lip said with a nice smile that i would have to pay $20 for those as she did not think I deserve a comp yet. so I guess 100 bucks a hand is not considered anything special in that place. Free drinks that they serve while you gamble are another story I would not drink that quality alcohol even under pressure from someone. They got absolutely worse selection, cheapest, bottles you usually see on the bottom shelf of liquor section in any supermarket. All table dealers are either not interested in their job, or looking at you like they are very annoyed by your presence. Gave guy $10 tip on one hand, he looked back like "really?thats all?"
I can continue and share my thoughts about $15 parking, rude poker receptionist who declined to spell out my name because its too hard and just called me Kevin, ATM fees, double charges on my credit card in the sports bar. 
so, just don't go there. Stay away from the Strip Casinos (especially Bellagio) and you will have more fun, respectful staff, you will not go bankrupt after few drinks, etc..

Over rated. Nice, clean, smells amazing. Rooms are no big deal. Average, actually. Although famous, the poker room sucks. Over packed, tables way too close together. Long line to get a seat. 

They do have a great signature drink called the Cable Car.

We are fans of Bellagio and we haven't stayed here once.  Every time we go to Vegas we check out the Water Show which is a family favorite and the conservatory.   Usually drop some money in the slots too.  Now the water show is a must see and usually quite crowded.  Music, lights and water shooting up into the air.  Whats not to like really?  The show is every 15 to 30 minutes depending on the time of day.  We always watch at night....it just seems much more dramatic.   And on warm nights its refreshing because you can feel the water spray and it makes you really cool off too.  Just a relaxing free thing to do in Vegas and who doesn't like that?  The conservatory is beautiful and depending on the season it is decorated appropriately and it is just a beautiful area to take pictures and wonder around in.   We got to enjoy Autumn harvest.  As you can imagine pumpkins, lots of fall colors, flowers and a grist mill and giant cornucopia.  Beautiful. Now because of fellow yelpers I must check out the John Philippe chocolate that until now I've know nothing about.   We are already planning  our next Vegas trip and are planning on staying here...so we can update soon.

I was there 7\/13\/16 to 7\/15\/16 Bellagio hotel left my prayer mat behind in the room 34030 upon checking out.I called to lost and found to let them know on Saturday 7\/16\/16 but they said nothing was there yet.they told me to call back the next day.they give me a reference # 16-35621.Monday 7\/19\/16 I called again I spoke with someone in lost and found dept,around 2.40 pm the person I spoke to was so rude, she was putting me hold without letting me know,I was still talking with her.
I really disappointed with the service. I don't ask for monetary compensation,  I just want the mat back because it was a gift from my passed mother.
That's the first time We stayed in Bellagio Hotel.

The hotel itself is excellent however the employee is way below the standard, no customer service skill whatsoever. The hotel management needs to address this problem or else the hotel will go down too

Fantastic esp. before sunning yourself while catching up on some greatly needed rest from a night of debauchery.   

Yummy order: huge plate of Panini turkey\/ham w\/mixed greens. My gf: coffee & TunaSalad Sandwich.

Major cool: patio dining near poolside & hot bods. Atmosphere kinda reminds me of outdoor cafes of St. Tropez, France, quite indulgent.

Just spent 5 days at the Bellagio and enjoyed every minute of it. The hotel lobby are is gorgeous with Chihuly glass decorating the ceiling. The conservatory is busy, but beautiful. There is a nice selection of high end shops and restaurants as well. I was there on vacation, so i spent a fair amount of time at the pools, which are terrific. The location on the strip is ideal, right in the middle of the action. Ceasers Palace is on one side and the Cosmopolitan on the other. Wifi in the rooms was strong and fast. The rooms are good size, nicely appointed and the bed and pillows were very comfortable. Overall, i had a really nice time and would happily stay there again.

quieter, alot quieter

more for the older generations
lower rates on rooms
a good place to visit

Two words: LAKEVIEW SUITE!!
It was AMAZING!!! Where else will you find two plasmas in your bathroom?? The suite was sooo spacious and beautifully decorated. The view is simply PRICELESS. We had a center view of the fountain show and the strip. 
Our TV played music that was synchronized with the fountain show and allowed us to watch the show minus the noise and crowds  =) It was fabulous!!
We were comp'd bellagio buffet passes and got to skip the line and walk right in!! Although after having tried it I think I would wait in that long line even if I wasn't given a vip pass. It's the best buffet on the strip! It even tops some of the "5 star" restaurants we visited. I couldn't stop eating the creme brulee!! It makes me want to fly back there just thinking about it. =) 
This is the perfect hotel for a couples retreat. (It made our "nice" suite at the Venetian look like a cheap motel room.)
Service was top notch here from the moment we checked in until the end of our stay. Our stay here was nothing short of PERFECT and I can't wait to go back again. =)

the bellagio has been known as being the first casino in Vegas with real marble, stone, real art, everything... and thus for the highest of the high rollers.  Even though the Wynn ushered in a whole era of the ultra-high end casino hotel, the Bellagio still has the most cache on the strip. 

So when i took my whole sales team to Vegas to celebrate the stellar year we had in 2010, i specified: "don't get your hopes up, we ain't gonna stay at the Bellagio, okay!" .... But of course that just made them want to stay there all the more.  And they insisted that i stay in the Penthouse so we'd have a place to go back and party. 

If you're gonna get a Penthouse, wow, you should really get one at the Bellagio.  for starters, they have a limo pick you up at the airport.  nice touch!  then they have their own Audio-guy just for your room!  as in: the sound system for your room is SO bumpin that they have a special guy that comes out and shows you how to use it and tests that it's bumpin loud enough.  he actually replaced one of the speakers for me because it didn't bump to his satisfaction. 

next, i had my own conference room (not reserved for my usage - no no), like a conference room IN my Penthouse, hello!  could seat 20 and had crazy audio visual capabilities in case you wanted a corporate feel.  i had my own bar - with 4 bar stools and 2 refrigerators and it's own TV (just for the bar area).  then i had my own steam room!  well, my big-ass shower doubled as it's own steam room.  nice!  

ask me how big my room was?  How big was it , you say?  it was sooo big that i had 2 bathrooms in my room.  the main bathroom and the guest bathroom for all the partiers.  we juiced up the sound system so much that security came to our room 2 times per night.  but relax though, they had this great system where basically you had at least 5 warnings before you got kicked out of the room.  so we're like: "why don't you tell the people complaining that they should get a Penthouse next time? or maybe that they shouldn't get a room next to a penthouse, hello?"

couple things i forgot: you don't check in with the masses when you have a penthouse. they take you to a private room to check in that has coffee, free drinks, chocolate covered strawberries, cookies... heck i was looking to see if we had our own 21 table and go-go dancers in there.  of course, you have your own concierge that can get you tables and entrance anywhere.  we partied in the penthouse till 3-4am each night then we decided it was time to hit the clubs downstairs.  we were never back in the rooms till 7am either night\/morning.  tragic.

I've stayed in many hotels in Vegas and Bellagio is right there with Luxor in terms of room quality. Checking in is also an absolute nightmare. It took us a very long time to get to the front counter.

The food is mediocre. Whatever you do, do not eat at Noodles unless you like paying $22 for cardboard pad thai.

Glad that I'm able to check Bellagio off of my bucket list but will definitely not be returning.

Just one of the great hotels that I visit\/stay.

Great selection of restaurants with awesome casino.

The staffs are friendly and knowledgable.
Great service.

Depending on the rooms you booked, the view is awesome.
I like staying here. 

Don't forget the free fountain show daily.

First day stay: check in was simple,line was short which made it a lot easier. My room was decent but I've seen better for the same price. Shops were the same high class shops that normal people like me don't shop at. My room had a refridge but was stuff with overpriced things like soda and such. If you ask them they will bring up a empty fridge for you.
Second day: I tried their tub. It was ok. Paris suite was much better you could fit someone else In the tub. Not as relaxing as Paris hotel. I probably had jets in em if I paid more for my room. Bellagio was a little too high class for my taste but it was an ok experience.

Is there really a point in writing a review for a place that already has 512 reviews? Oh well.
Had an amazing time here. We stayed in a fancy suite, so maybe that's the reason I didn't have the underwhelmed response some people did to the rooms. Our suite had 3 bathrooms- one presumably for guests if you were to have visitors in the living room area, and two off the bedroom. One had a large jetted tub and the other had a steam shower. Enjoyed having my own bathroom to get ready in! The bedroom, living room, and dressing area were large, the huge windows with automated curtains and amazing view of the fountains were incredible. Everything in the room was luxurious and well maintained. 
The room service was incredible! Definitely expensive, but so good that it's one of the things that would make me come back to this hotel. Fresh juices, delicious eggs benedict. 
The walk to our elevator from the lobby was a bit long, but the lobby and gardens were gorgeous, and the many places you pass on the way, like the candy shop with chocolate fountain, were fun to look at.
Didn't gamble here, but the casino looked serviceable. 
My recommendation- if you're going to splurge and stay here, go all the way and get a suite.

The thing I don't like about this hotel is that the customer service is not friendly. I called the hotel and ask how much deposit when I check in.  The employee picked up the phone and she didn't answer my question ....she silenced and her voice sound like ignore my question .... I repeated my question, " Excuse me, I don't have my credit card with me right now... I want to know how much deposit to check in " .... she waited less than one minutes and replied, " $200 per night ...total $600 cash for 3 nights"....

Gosh!!!! what took so long for 5 stars hotel employee to answer that simple question?  They hire unprofessional customer service.  

One lead to another, I logged on line and cancelled my reservation from the website that I booked a hotel.  They charged me over $200 fee for hotel cancellation...

Finally, I called Planet Hollywood Hotel.  Customer service in this hotel is very nice and friendly.  She answered all my questions very well.   Good speaking skill.  She is fair and unbiased at Planet Hollywood Hotel.

THE GOOD

Central to everything, the Bellagio hotel made arriving at every stop while in town a cinch. The cab stand outside ran quickly and efficiently. It seems they aren't very Uber-friendly given they make it a little tougher to order one without having to walk forever to find it. 

The water fountain show is grand and magical. 

The lobby and public areas were pretty spotless considering the amount of crazy foot traffic this hotel gets. You can always spot employees cleaning up at all hours of the day. The same goes for their lobby bathrooms. 

I stayed at one of the Spa Tower rooms and enjoyed the space, storage, shower, and outlet availability. Our room had a mountain and pool view; it was especially nice at sunset. The window treatments worked via wall switches. I never knew I needed that in my life. Ha! A nice added touch. Their AC power and water pressure were on point. I can't even begin to imagine what it takes to run that beast of a hotel. Impressive. Checking out online made the departure relatively painless.

Having easier access to favorites Le Cirque and O is a nice perk (reviewed separately). I didn't have enough time, but I would have loved to visit the Michael Mina restaurant too. Additionally, the Jean Philippe Patisserie has all sorts of sinful bites for breakfast or snack. I suggest going Sunday morning when all of Vegas is asleep from too much Saturday fun. ;) 

The hotel conveniently connects to Caesars Palace.

THE BAD 

Although technically speaking the Bellagio is not the largest hotel in Las Vegas, something about the layout makes it feel like it. I've stayed at the Venetian and walked through endless lobbies while there and have never felt this claustrophobic. To put it simply, it's a f'ing zoo within the already existing Vegas pandemonium. I know it shouldn't come as a surprise, but I still found it overwhelming. One second I'm walking out of my peaceful room and the next...boom! People everywhere: a complete cluster-f*ck. There was security by the elevators at least, but that also meant sometimes there was an additional wait just to get to the room. You know, after walking a mile from the lobby to that point. 

Checking in was a nightmare. I thought joining M Life Rewards would expedite the process, but it did not- despite even "checking in" online the night before. The front desk staff couldn't be bothered to step out of their script to personalize service. Just one more person to robotically check in. My questions were answered with the same rehearsed lines and a painted smirk\/smile. The lines are painfully long. Wear your patience hat. I forgot mine. 

The mattress in our room was quicksand. It swallowed us whole no matter how many times we rotated. The pillows were equally flimsy. I slept on two at once in a failed attempt to puff them up. 

BEWARE of the mini bar rules. Everything is displayed out in the open. Removing ANYTHING (meaning just lifting it off the shelf) adds the charge to the room. My husband took two bottles of Fiji water and put them on our nightstands. We left them untouched while we searched for the price list (which is ONLY available if you turn your TV on). When the bellhop came in with our bags, we asked him about it. I didn't know if to laugh or throw something when he said we were probably just charged $36 for the two bottles. That's $18 EACH. It's not even about the amount. On principle alone, I will NOT pay that for water! I called downstairs and had them credit it back. The same bottle poolside is $8, still a rip-off, but more in line with usual inflated hotel prices.  

Speaking of the pool, available umbrellas are hard to come by. Even if you do luck out and get one, know they are stationary. If you don't time the sun location just right (because everyone carries a chart that tells you just when and where to sit, right?), you will be left fully exposed despite being the proud owner of that nice umbrella. I'm not being petty. This is Las Vegas in June. and a big deal when you consider temperatures peaked at 113 the weekend I visited.

SUMMARY

Never again. Next!

WOW. Just when I think The Bellagio can't top themselves with their excellent customer service, they did. This shout-out is to Bellagio's Security Department.

I can't get into the details of what happened, because the service that was provided to me is NOT common practice at Bellagio or other hotels and I don't want any unfair expectations being put on them. What happened with me was a one-time occurrence and I was just very fortunate to deal with such wonderful people who took mercy on me. 

So....to KIM AND JESSE IN SECURITY.... thank you SO MUCH for helping me!! You guys saved me from extreme hardship and I can't be more grateful or thankful for you. Jesse, you are the best and I really appreciate what you did. Also, to Kim's and Jesse's bosses: THANK YOU!!!  Thank you for making a one time exception. Your compassion and understanding saved me so much.

Also, I'd like to add, that what they did for me happened AFTER I'd checked out of and left their hotel. This hotel is unbelievable in their Class, Customer Service and compassion. I've always chosen to stay at Bellagio when I go to Vegas, and they have gained my loyalty for life.

The Bellagio is leagues above the other hotels in Vegas. I've stayed there countless times and continue to be impressed by them: by their wonderful restaurants, beautiful rooms and amenities, and excellent Customer Service. But this time, they went way above and beyond the call of duty to help me out and I will always remember and be grateful.

If someone could fwd this to the Security Dept, I 'd really appreciate it. 

Don't stay anywhere else...Bellagio is a Five Star Hotel in every sense of the term. 

Nancy F. 
Los Angeles, CA

This review is for slot play only.

good amount of slots. has the gold fish slot machine (my fave)

didn't gain much here.

Stayed at the Bellagio hotel from March 11th to March 14th 2017. This hotel is huge and amazing! I checked in a little after 3pm. Check in was easy although very long lines. I didn't experience any snobby front desk agents like other reviewers. The lady who assisted me in check in was courteous, sweet and accommodating. 

FYI: You do pay the resort fee at check-in (which went up before my stay on march 11th). The resort fee as of that day was $39.00 plus taxes and fees which totaled $44.22 per day. In addition to this fee you must pay a deposit for incidental which they will refund at the end of your stay and that can be anywhere from $200 plus. This will appear on your credit card as a charge but again they do refund (in my case I got my funds back 48 hours after check-out.

I was placed on the 10th floor and my room was clean and spacious. This is a no view room. The bathroom was definitely my favorite. I love the glass stand up shower and the bathtub definitely came in handy on my trip. We had enough clean towels and was given new towels daily by housekeepers. 

Room-service was also pretty good. We had a lazy afternoon and didn't feel like doing much so the Bellagio in-room dining service came in handy. You have the option of having it charge to your room, paying directly with credit card or cash when the food arrived. I ordered the Bellagio prime burger with french fries and my sister ordered the Chicken Alfredo. The meal comes with a complimentary basket of bread and the sodas were $6.00 each, which was a rip off for the amount we got but the Bellagio is quite over-priced in certain things.

Overall, my stay here was phenomenal. The Bellagio fountains is a must see, the garden inside is beautiful, the casino was nice, the bank night club was good and popping and the staff was all courteous and showed great customer service. I would definitely stay here again when in Vegas!

Checked in 03\/06\/15- Checkout in 03\/09\/15 
(Currently staying) just like every Birthday Vegas is my destination, can't complain I just love the whole Vegas scene... This year I went for BELLAGIO LAS VEGAS, and I just cant describe how happy And pleased I'm with this hotel, I had hear some bad reviews about how customer service need to improve, but honestly I haven't experienced any bad service or anything but a good vibe, nice environment, since the booking process, checking into hotel all the way to even room service... I'm really enjoying my experience and would definitely recommend it to anyone!!!

Meh.  We go to Vegas about every 3-4 months.  We usually stay at the Palazzo or Encore.  I guess our expectations were too high because we were really disappointed with the Bellagio.  Everything is sooo old and dirty.  The rooms are small and smell like cigarettes even though we had a non-smoking room.  The amenities are old and unkempt. We had to pay for parking which was also annoying, as you don't have to at the other resorts.  In addition, the daily resort fee is quite high, especially when you are already paying $300 a night for a small subpar room.  It is just a poorly kept property.  The Bellagio has lost its glamour.  Keep your expectations low if you decide to stay here.

Bellagio remains our favorite place to stay in Las Vegas!
All aspects of customer service are stellar.  
 
Cafe Gelato serves up an astonishingly good breakfast panini. Take one out to the pool with a smoothie in the morning and you will cure all the wrong things you did the night before. Follow that with a couple frozen cocktails and the world will be right again. 
Extra Liz-Star (TM) for the poolside waitress who gently woke me up when she noticed I was getting a little too pink. 
 
I'm not going to take away a star because of the BJ dealer who WOULD NOT STOP talking about the color of my hair long enough to DEAL THE CARDS.  I should, but I won't.  That's how much I love Bellagio.  
 
VP 411 - couple banks of decent .25 progressive.  $1 at the bars.

Bah Humbug Bellagio.. 

Last night I saw Santa and Mrs Santa along with elves..they wanted pictures on the atrium.. But a lot of people were excited to see them..
( they wernt taking money, they were there spreading Christmas Joy.. KIDS WERE SO EXCITED..

And Bellagio Security escorted them off the property quite rudely..
Coal for the MGM, coal for the Bellagio. I watched,  as Santa and his entourage got in a Limo and left.. So they wernt street people ! 

Wow.. Bellagio definitely hates  the Christmas Spirit !

Thousands of blooms are worked into the displays here in the Bellagio Conservatory - they are marvellous to see. The figures and beautiful carpets of flowers are such wonderful colours and the scale is amazing, I really enjoyed seeing this.

Oh Bellagio!!!  This is one of the classier hotels on the Las Vegas strip and I enjoy going to their botanical garden inside.  It is very interesting, but it can get very packed, especially during the holiday season.  Please plan accordingly.  I've yet to stay here, but they have plenty of shops to keep you occupied and their lounges are also on the high end side.  I did a photo shoot last year and the location is just fabulous.  The background showed up magnificently in my photos so I was really happy about that.  Good place to take a date too.
My first time staying here n it wz just stunning! I loved it!. Nice, clean, good service everything wz just great! I'm definitely coming back..

I asked for the mini to be emptied because we needed to chill our sons food and they refused. The restaurant was unable to make a hamburger protein style. Staff did not have the no problem attitude at the front desk or restaurant. The view from our room was great. The concierge did a great job selecting seat locations for our shows.

I didn't stay at Bellagio which is why I cannot give a 5-star review (although, let's be serious .... it's the Bellagio, I'm sure the room is amazing).  We spent the majority of our time at the sports book, which let me tell you, if you're looking to have a few cocktails and bet on sports all day, GO TO THE BELLAGIO! They are the only sports book that will give you a drink for free and without spending like, over $100 on one bet.  We had gone to the Wynn on our last day and couldn't order a drink because we didn't have a drink coupon ... because we didn't place a large bet.  Definitely go to the Bellagio for sports betting.  Huge room, tons of seating and tons of TVs :)

I am in love with the Bellagio.  I just finished my first trip to Vegas and stayed here with my friends recommendation.  I had a fountain view room on the 25th floor of Spa Tower, and it was amazing.  The room was beautiful, the view was beautiful and I thoroughly enjoyed the stay.  Every single person who works there is so friendly, helpful and knowledgeable, and completely willing to stop what they're doing and answer your questions.  The Bellagio has spared no expense, every detail is the best it can possibly be, and every space is gorgeous and pristine.  The outdoor heated pool is spectacular!  If you go to the Spa make sure you talk to Kim, she's a sweetheart.  I could go on and on, but the bottom line is: stay here, you will not regret it!
I wish I never had to check out, but I will definitely be back as soon as possible!  Thanks Bellagio, for creating such a beautiful hotel with amazing staff!

The Bellagio hands-down remains my favorite hotel on the Las Vegas Strip. It has prime location, great restaurants, shows, nightlife, beauty and the best concierge in town. 

Bellagio is situated right in the middle of the strip, convenient to everything. Next door is the new Cosmopolitan Hotel, which ranks as runner up favorite hotel on the strip. Bellagio features Cirque du Soleil's: "O" in my opinion ranks as the best of the three Cirque shows I have seen. 

Las Vegas is known for its fine dining and Bellagio is no exception. Even the Buffet at the Bellagio outdoes the rest. The hotel features 5 Fine Dining Options (a great assortment of Seafood, French, Chinese, Spanish, and a Steakhouse) as well as 6 other midlevel restaurants, and even more casual dining options. There is truly something to satisfy even the pickiest of eaters at the Bellagio. Yelp rates both Picasso (French\/Spanish) and Le Cirque (French) as 4.5\/5 stars.

If you aren't a high roller or you are finished with playing the tables, there is lot's more to see still at the Bellagio. There are the unforgettable fountains, Botanical Gardens, Art Galleries and an enchanting blown glass ceiling by famous Artist, Dale Chihuly. Shopping consists of 7 high end shops and boutiques. And Bellagio's hot nightclub The Bank features 8,000 sq. feet and VIP rooms to accommodate up to 75 guests.

Can't afford to stay at Bellagio? Stay next door at Caesars or across the street at Bally's. Bally's connects with Paris, another great hotel to explore on the strip.


Read more Las Vegas and Los Angeles Reviews on my blog- http:\/\/rescuelashelters.wordpress.com\/2011\/07\/06\/the-best-of-the-las-vegas-strip\/

Bellagio started on the bandwagon of charging for valet parking.  $13 for 1-4 hours.  Vegas is not Vegas anymore.  It will be just a matter of time before all hotels are on this kick of generating additional revenues.  Sad.

There is no explaining why you go to the Bellagio.  It is absolutely beautiful.  The fountains are amazing.  Aside from that, the rooms are okay.  What is a complete deterrent from staying there is the amount of foot traffic there.  As a guest, I do not feel like I should have to fight for the comfort of the hotel I am paying for.  Nevertheless, I do not advocate the Bellagio to begin restricting its attractions to guest only.  That would truly be sad.  However, because of how crowded it is I will not choose this hotel again to stay at.  I will simply follow the crowd and enjoy its attractions and leave it at that.  It is certainly not worth the expense of a stay.

I have stayed at the Bellagio for the last time!!  When a pit boss says "let me talk to you like your white!!!!" I think that pretty much translates to "your not welcome colored folk!" So I will take my non-white self to the many other non MGM properties!

the age of this hotel really showed through its not-so-fancy dull-colored lights hanging in the main reception area. bedroom were so-so, but i'm comparing with other newer hotels on the strip i'd recently stayed though.

friend had a suit, which was really kinda like wynn's suite, except that Bellagio's had 2 bathrooms :D service was average too, although concierge were very responsive.

I just got back a couple days ago and I cannot wait to return to this beautiful hotel!

Let me me start by saying I've been to Vegas multiple times in the past and have always wanted to stay at the Bellagio! It just exudes class and is breathtakingly beautiful! I made my reservation about 3 weeks before our trip and just book a regular room. After contacting the guest concierge, we received a complimentary upgrade to a deluxe fountain view room since it was my birthday and my husband's first time in Vegas! I thought that was very sweet!

We arrived late in the evening and there was no line for check-in! I believe we waited less than 5 minutes...I did see how long the lines do get during the day so i guess we just got lucky! Our room wasn't very far from the main desk. After reading so many reviews, I was expecting to walk a mile to our room! It wasn't more than 5 min from the main desk. 

Our room was spectacular! Literally a million dollar view of Vegas! We were on the 28th floor of the main building and had a view of the fountains, all of the hotels and a view of the mountains in the back! We will never forget the view! Our room was spotless! Lots of (overpriced) goodies in the mini fridge and snacks right below the TV. The closet had a couple of robes! The bathroom was huge! Loved it! The bed was super soft and so comfortable! The windows even had a automatic open\/close feature which i thought was a nice touch! Our room was always cleaned promptly! On our second night, I received a complimentary chocolate truffle amenity which was such a wonderful surprise! We couldn't really hear any outside noise (not sure if people were staying the rooms beside us) but I thought that was nice! Although, we could hear people talking as they were walking by our door! 

This hotel is HUGE and it definitely lives up to its name! It has a lot of high end shops if you are interested in spending $$$ and is in the heart of the strip! There are also lots of restaurants and the conservatory is beautiful as well. Since this hotel is so iconic, it's quite busy and there is always lots of people walking around! The pool is beautiful and I wish I had enough time to spend there but there was just so much to do and see! I'm not a big coffee\/tea drinker so I didn't mind that there wasn't a coffee maker in the room. There are multiple cafes downstairs and I lost count of how many Starbucks I saw near this hotel.

This is definitely a romantic hotel and it's perfect for couples! A very special thank you to Michelle S. and Chaz P. for going above and beyond to make my birthday very special! The staff are extremely nice and very friendly! I wish I could give the hotel 10 stars! It lived up to every expectation I had, and then some! We were very spoiled while staying here and i cannot imagine staying anywhere else! My husband and I cannot wait to come back! 

Tips:
 - There is a standard $35\/day resort fee. 
 - On top of the resort fee, there was a $130\/DAY (yes, PER DAY) incidentals charge that they will put on your card until you check out. This wasn't a problem for us but might be for others if you are on a budget and wasn't expecting extra charges.
 - Security is very high here. You will need to present your key to security before entering the elevators to go to your room and also to the pool.. (I thought this was nice since I didn't see any other hotels do this)
 - They have a business center in between the check-in desk and guest concierge which is perfect to print your boarding passes or anything else you need!
 - The bell desk will store your luggage for you if you have a late flight later in the day (make sure to tip!!) 
 - Uber\/Lyft has its own designated section (to the right of the entrance) Very easy and nice if you choose to use this option. 
 - Definitely let them know if you are there to celebrate a special occasion! They will do their best to make it memorable.

I'm convinced that every other hotel in Vegas has "Bellagio Envy". I don't know if I'd ever consider staying anywhere else, OR not stopping through the Bellagio when I'm passing through Vegas. Such a great hub of activity, shopping, art, pastry, and relaxation.

My brother pre-paid for his stay at Bellagio on Expedia.  His flight was not going to be arriving in time for him to check in on Saturday, so he put the reservation in my name so that I could check in for him.  Once he arrived, me and my husband went back to our hotel.  We were tired and didn't think to put the reservation back in Lange's name.  A few hours after he arrived he apparently had too much to drink and instead of letting him go back to his room, the security people kicked him out for trespassing - when he had paid for March 25-29 at the Bellagio.  It was his room - not mine, and when the security people called me after detaining him, I explained that it was in fact his room, we just forgot to put the reservation back in his name.  They still would not let him in the room except to get his luggage and other personal items.  I'm sickened by what happened to him, and I will NEVER recommend Bellagio to anyone.  I will change my feedback on Yelp and on TripAdvisor if the Bellagio will refund my brother for the nights he was not there (March 26, 27, & 28).
Dining, decor, entertainment, ballroom, everything is great. I also think the fountain during "Time to Say Goodbye" with Andrea Bocelli and Sarah Brightman is one of the most romantic spots.

Here for a conference.  Like most LV hotels the Bellagio is huge so expect to walk a lot especially to the conference rooms near the back of the hotel. Some good lunch choices in the hotel and next door at the Cosmo.

Bellagio is for the sexy classy people!

Whenever I go to Vegas I stay at the Bellagio. The service and casino are top notch. The room service food, even at 3pm, rocks. 

The lobby is amazing with the venetian blown glass. The conservatory always has the most beautiful flowers. Sensi, Prive, and Prime rock!

Disappointed. That is the word that sums up my experience here at this supposedly five-star establishment.

I have been a dedicated customer and fan of the Bellagio for many years. I have always thought they showed  class, service, and value that many hotels on the strip did not provide. However, my most recent stay disappointed me for many reasons - i will mention them as i  write a detailed review of my entire stay below:

The service:
Highly disappointed - While many aspects of the staff and service of this hotel was great as usual, there were a number of events that stood out and really made my stay very unsatisfying:
1) upon check-out, i wanted to store my luggage with the bell desk b\/c my flight was not set to take off until 6pm. I did not have small bills to tip the bell boy and needed the bigger bills for the cab. I thought i could make it up by tipping them again when i picked up the luggage at the end of the day. The bell boy reiterated upon receiving my luggage that he would not be here later that day and that someone else will be serving me in an obvious tone that was implying i needed to tip him. He also stood there quietly, for several seconds waiting for me to tip him. I felt uncomfortable and awkward and was forced to use what little cash i had on hand for him. This should not be the mentality of an employee of a five-star hotel!
2) Update: I emailed the establishment of this complaint and all i got was an apology letter and that's it. No further follow-up, no nothing. 
3) The room: it was nice. The room is fairly large and the furniture and what not was well-kept and modern. The bathroom is large with two sinks, a separate shower, and a separate tub. I found all the amenities i needed in my bathroom. There was also a robe, iron, and safe. 

In all, Bellagio embodies the nature of today's Vegas: a high-class surface masking the old, crude, low-class mentality that has always existed.

Walking around the Bellagio instantly made my hotel (The Stratosphere) look decidedly normal, if not perhaps a bit crap.  The Bellagio is a classy place and well worth a walk around.

I'm almost tempted to knock a star of as the waitress we had at our Blackjack table was both incompetent and very rude.  Thankfully the waitress I had around the slots saved that star making me think we just got unlucky first time around.

The water show on Las Vegas Blvd also looked pretty impressive and would probably be worth scheduling into an evening if you're in the area.

This is a really pretty hotel. Lots of restaurants, decent size casino, great shops, pretty pool area, amazing decor that changes seasonally. Only thing is that I wish they had at least one restaurant that had cheaper choices. Even their cafe was really expensive, when you'd think a cafe would be on the cheaper side. The service was great, and the rooms are really nice and well equipped. My big complaint is that they didn't provide a fridge, only a mini bar fridge that has weight sensors so you can't move anything around because you'll get charged if you pick anything up. So if you want to store things that require refrigeration, you can have them put a mini fridge in your room for an extra $35 a day. No thank you!

On a happy note, we really enjoyed our stay at the Bellagio and I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Vegas. It's almost right in the middle of the strip which meant we could walk easily to all the different places knowing that our walk back to the hotel wouldn't be a stretch.

Beautiful hotel with a garden that changes seasonally. I love the water fountain show outside too. Lots of food options and very friendly staff. Ive never stayed here but frequently visit the hotel during my vegas trips.

Bellagio offers great room rates every now and then, so it is definitely worth while to get on their mailing list. Upgrade to a lakeview room is a must. Though the rooms are not that big (suites are really nice though) the view of the water show in the evenings is spectacular. The conservatory and botanical gardens next to the lobby is extremely beautiful, especially during Christmas time. You must dine at the buffet at least once during your visit. One time I was there with 3 girlfriends and we were at a blackjack table during the wee hours of the morning. The dealer's shift was over, so the pit boss asked us to move over to the next table which only had a single deck. For doing this, we were all given complementary brunch at Cafe Bellagio - a full 4 course meal for all of us!

Ok so experience in this hotel I will say exceeded expectation. I landed I'm Vegas early and I went to the check I'm desk expecting to drop off my bags because usually at 10am they are still prepping the room. But I got lucky because they had a room all ready and they accommodated when I asked high as possible and gave me the 26th floor. So I was already in a good mood. Bathroom was clean and room was spacious. So it was nice and in the evening my friends arrived and a parties like ore partied (no one called complaint on us unlike they do in encore). We were loud and blasting music and drinking heavily. No noise complaint.  It was also nice how  prompt they were when we asked for towels. Even calling in to make sure we got our towels. Now that's service. Then again bellagio in the MGM mirage family which is always a good group when staying in Vegas or anywhere that MGM mirage has hotels.

We didn't stay in one of their rooms but while walking around, we came across The Bellagio Hotel.

While here, The "O" by Cirque du Soleil and the Fountains of Bellagio (free) are must sees. There are lots of good eats at the Bellagio. I love the art work in this hotel. There is a spa in here as well. If you're visiting Vegas, this is a nice hotel to visit.

The Bellagio was nice. I stayed for a work conference that took place at another hotel. I would say the atmosphere of the casino and dining appeared to cater towards an older crowd as places like the Mirage and Aria have a much more modern feel to them. 

I learned very quickly that there is a fee with everything. $10 bottles of water with room service was not exactly what I wanted to do, but I've heard you are not supposed to drink the water in Vegas so....

This is an elegant property on The Strip featuring FREE parking (sometimes as locals, we take this for granted until we go out of town...). My two favorite things here are the free Fountains show choreographed to different types of music and themes- Pink Panther, Andrea Bocelli, Frank Sinatra (show times below) and the also free, Conservatory & Botanical Gardens- we came here to take pictures after our wedding (it's such a fun memory and we've got the pictures to prove it). It's an amazing display of the beauty of flowers, done in several scenes- there is an ample amount of photo spots here. The floral smells are amazing, as well. There is a small bridge with a water feature. It's crowded here, so be warned.   

SHOW TIMES:
Monday - Friday
3:00 p.m. - 7:00 p.m.
show every 1\/2 hour
7:00 p.m. - 12:00 a.m.
show every 15 minutes

Saturdays, Sundays* and Holidays
12:00 p.m. - 7:00 p.m.
show every 1\/2 hour
7:00 p.m. - 12:00 a.m.
show every 15 minutes

The decor is Italian\/European styling- the architectural details are all over. Also notable, is the Fiori Di Como, a glass sculpture on the ceiling, composed of 2000 hand-blown blooms in bright vibrant colors, blue, red, yellow, green, etc. There is always fresh flowers in the lobby. For hotel guests, the amenities include: spa\/salon, fitness room, pool. Shopping here are strictly high-end labels such as Bottega Venetta, Omega, Chanel, Dior, Fendi, Tiffany, Giorgio Armani, Gucci, Hermes, Louis Vuitton, and Prada. (Ok, not really practical for the average person on a budget.) The resident show is "O" by Cirque Du Soleil- ticket prices are $155\/$130\/$109\/$98.50 (limited views)- wednesdays through sundays, 7:30 pm and 10 pm. And finally, the Gallery of Fine Art, open from 10 am to 8 pm (last entry is at 7:30 pm), $15 for visitors, $12 for those with NV ID. Special Locals Promotion on wednesdays from 5 pm to 7:30 pm only: $8 entry with NV ID. (If you're entering from outside, not the parking lot, there is a small concession stand, if you're thirsty or if you want a light snack.)

I bet that if you are a local, you've been here at least once before, because there are free attractions (there are a few that are worth going to) here and your out-of-town family members wanted to come and see it. It's a pretty casino\/hotel on The Strip with free parking, so what have you got to lose?

Without a doubt, this is the center of Las Vegas. I didn't make it over to Steve Wynns so next time we shall see what is the difference.
