Walking in the enormous lobby there is a chandelier called Fiori di Como by glass sculptor Dale Chihuly, a ceiling of floral shaped colored glass designs, a stunning piece comprised of 2,000 hand-blown glass blossoms.

There are large vase flower arrangements throughout. Often you see men capturing the essence of their ladies next to them.

It is easy to admire the exceptionally gorgeous plants, flowers and trees thoughtfully arranged in the botanical gardens conservatory displays. 

The casino has a lucky feeling to it, everything is remarkable. 

Even luxuriously appointed rooms can be had for under 200.

If I could give this Casino a 0 I would. The corporate staff and security are very disrespectful.. There was an issue that happened at one of the nightclubs about two weeks ago, I am now 86ed from the property and was told by Security that I just have to contact Ray Brown to get the 86 lifted.. Prior to being 86th they lied to me to get me into the security office in order to 86 me.. I have now contacted Security and left 4 messages  four times saying I will get a call back and never have.. The lady that answered the phone who I've spoke to each time said her name was Kris but I do not know if that is even true.. She is very disrespectful, interrupts you, I caught her in a lie which is pretty funny, and also has hung up on me numerous times..

Our FAVORITE resort on the strip!

From the luxury meet-&-greet transportation, to the private VIP Lounge Check-In, the delicious complimentary morning and afternoon\/evening treats, to the private VIP elevators, to the beautiful penthouse suites (and above), to the OUTSTANDING personalized service, and, of course, the beautiful grounds and fountains, Bellagio is a wonderful stay!

Bellagio has always been very nicely decorated to the seasons. I was here just in time to see the Fall Seasons decorations. I've always enjoyed coming to Bellagio because of the elegance this place has. The best part would be water fountains shows. I have also tried their buffet which was pretty overwhelming with the selections but I'm not complaining. I usually come to Bellagio because Jean Philippe is located inside this casino and it is a must to go try their chocolate!
My all time go to hotel. Nothing compares to the location, atmosphere, and overall quality and friendliness of this hotel

Of course this place is known for the famous fountain show when you walk by on the strip but I always had a great time actually gambling here.  There were definitely hundreds of dollars that exchanged hands on my adventures here.  The conservatory Botanical Gardens is beautiful too, always fun to walk by and take pictures there on every single trip to the area. Alot of nice birds to look at in the environment as well. 
  I almost stayed here way back when the place opened or near when it did, but now I just love passing through.  Maybe I can plan to stay at this spot sometime in the future.  I do look forward to seeing the fountains again on a future visit to Sin City. Of course the tram actually starts here once you walk through all those shops that gets you to Monte Carlo.  I did not go to the Bank Nightclub, but I HEARD it was really great.

I recently stayed at the Bellagio with my boyfriend for 4 days and 3 nights. This was my first Vegas trip, his third. I do A LOT of research before I book trips anywhere. Some may say that where you stay in Vegas doesn't matter, because you likely won't end up being in your room a lot or at that hotel a lot. Well, in Vegas, the major hotels that you stay at are where you will in fact spend a lot of time. These hotels have many restaurant, large casinos, pools, bars, pool bars, shops, etc. So that's why when I looked into different hotels, I looked for a place with good reviews on all components of the hotel for a fair price. My boyfriend had also given me some insight since he had already stayed at the MGM and the Palms in rooms that were comped thanks to his dad, but said they weren't anything remarkable. Bellagio had the best reviews for my budget, and I couldn't agree more. I booked a fountain view room. I only found out about a month out from the trip that the standard king bed fountain view I picked was in a separate tower with actually only a partial view of the Bellagio fountains. I upgraded the room to a deluxe fountain view king room. Thank goodness because we ended up getting a room with a remarkable view. The room was perfect for a couple. For me, being able to go back to a luxurious room is quintessential to a vacation, so that's another reason why I picked the Bellagio and why I'm happy I did. The room and bathroom were large. The bed very comfy. The decor, lavish. Housekeeping kept it very clean as well. 
The hotel itself is perfectly located on the middle of the strip and right in front of the Bellagio fountains that have beautiful shows through the day and night. The lobby is magnificent. From the moment you step out of the cab, you're greeted and all staff is eager to help. The lobby is grand and decorated very uniquely. Our check in was technically at 3, but we were able to get a room at 10 am (partially due to the fact that we had come on a Tuesday). The casino is HUGE and very well lit. We walked to about 7 other casinos during our stay, and I was highly disappointed in how poorly lit they were on top of the dark materials used to make up the floors, walls and ceilings. The Bellagio is made up of lighter colors. It makes the place feel a lot more welcoming. Additionally, the lay out, although big, is very easy to navigate. 
The pool area is jaw dropping. 
The staff keeps pretty good security measures. For instance, before you enter the pool area or go to the elevators to get to your room, you have to show your room key. 
Room service, the concierge, etc all work fast and efficiently and are very pleasant. 
Although prices are a little high, I believe that is a vegas thing. So, just be prepared to spend money for things like room service. 
We spent a lot of time in the casino. The dealers are very friendly and fun, as well as the other vacationers that come to the Bellagio casino. We also spent a fair amount of time in the poker room. The poker room at the Bellagio is by far the nicest I saw. We also got to see some big name faces, such as Doyle Brunson. The wait can be long sometimes, especially at night time, and especially for standard buy in of 1-3 Texas Hold 'Em, but once you sit down, you're bound to have a good time! 
Over all, very VERY happy with the Bellagio. It's a BEAUTIFUL hotel and casino resort located on the middle of the strip right in front of its own lake with its own fountain shows. The place is so lavish it makes you forget you're actually in a hot and dry desert. 
Aside from room service, the deluxe fountain view room with a king bed, a large bathroom with a glass stand up shower and a separate  tub for four days and three nights (all room rates, resort fees, taxes included) cost me about $741---not a bad price whatsoever. 
So if you plan on staying in Vegas, and want a lot of bank for your buck, and want to stay in a lovely hotel And casino, definitely consider the Bellagio. I had zero complaints.
Beautiful Hotel, however they really rip you off with prices. If you have extra money to throw away, this is the place for you

Bellagio hey hey ;)

I had a nice time staying here with my boyfriend. We had a very nice room with a massive king bed and the room itself was clean and pristine. I didn't really like the sheets they used on the bed though because they were a bit scratchy for some reason. The big TV was legit and the bathroom was very pretty. However the toilet always flushed with such force that it scared me every time I flushed it lol The shower was a bit small and the shampoo smelled like citrus which wasn't my favorite but it did the job. 

Checking in was craziness since there were so many people at registration, but the employees working the desk were great and had us checked in in no time. The casino is very nice and I had a good time playing some blackjack for an hour or so (first time gambling!!) The pool was okay, I wish that they had a deeper pool because everything was 3.5 feet which made it feel like we were wading. The restaurants at the Bellagio were pretty legit though so that was fun, especially the Cafe in the Conservatory. 

Definitely a fun Vegas weekend!

We came into Town for SEMA... we upgraded to a Suite on the 11th floor and it was Beautiful. We each had our own Huge Bathroom! The View was amazing! We felt like we were on our Honeymoon. There was an issue with TV and they fixed it within minutes of call! All the Hotel Staff were accommodating. Had Blow Out in Spa by Roxanne and my hair looked AMAZING! Centrally located... our new FAVORITE

Overall, our stay at the Bellagio was very disappointing.

My partner and I booked many months in advance, as we were getting married and also honeymooning in Vegas. Our travel agent emailed the Bellagio to suggest a complimentary upgrade. When we arrived, not only were we not upgraded, but we were downgraded from our originally booked King Room, to a Double Queen, even though it was a Sunday evening. When we were informed of our downgrade, I suggested that we at least be moved to a fountain view room, but we were advised that that would be an extra cost.

Our Double Queen room was most outdated, and quite small. Although the bathroom was quite spacious and nice, the shower was also lovely and big. 
However, we were not happy with the sound of (what we assumed was) clanking pipes throughout our stay. It almost sounded as if we were staying underneath a gym and heavy weights were being dropped on the the ceiling above us.

On checkout we complained about the noisy room, and we were refunded one days breakfast at the buffet. The gesture was appreciated, but doesn't quite make up for our disappointing stay.

On a positive note, the foyer was nice, and the flowers were lovely of course. 
The Bellagio is nice to visit, but I would recommend travelers stay elsewhere.

I stayed at the Bellagio for 3 nights this month on my first trip to Vegas.

We paid a decent price for a great room via hotels.com. It was around $170 per night with a view of the Strip (rather than a view of the fountains, or no view at all). Still pricey, but you'd pay much more for something comparable in virtually any other city. 

Check-in was a little slow - it gets busy. There was also no sign of the mobile check-in that some of us had signed up to use. But once we got to the front of the line they were pretty quick. The room and charges were described but they didn't tell us how to get on the wifi. They also underplayed how far the walk would be to our room, so we kept wondering if we were headed in the right direction.

Our room was kind of out of the way in the spa tower, which was quite a long walk from the front entrance, past the parking and some of the restaurants and spa. Overall, though, that turned out to be a good thing because the elevators didn't lead directly into the casino. Some family stayed in the other tower with fountain view rooms and they all commented that their rooms were too warm.

Back over in the spa tower, the room was large and clean with a desk and two comfortable sitting chairs. The a\/c worked fine, and the electric drapes were a nice touch, and useful, especially for the location. The bathroom was palatial with his and hers sinks, a great, very deep bathtub, and large shower. The wifi is serviceable for email and light browsing but I ended up using my mobile data most of the time.

The cleaning staff were really efficient. A couple of times they managed to get in and out of our room even when we'd only left for an hour or so in the afternoon and everything was clean and tidy on our return.

My only complaints were the pillows - super flat, which always gives me a cricked neck - even after being plumped, and the in-room snacks. While we all expect these to be overpriced I find the lack of tea\/coffee service really irritating. All I need are a couple of mugs and the ability to boil water; instead, you have to walk half a mile to get some caffeine!

Im really dissapointed at this hotel after i left.  I accidentally left a nice pair of shoes in the room and once i realized, i wasn't too worried since the staff seemed trustworthy and nice.  I called the same day and they said they haven't labeled anything from that room yet.  Called lost and found again the next day and got hung up on 3 times after being on hold! Finally i was able to talk to someone and they said they did not find my shoes and nothing was even turned in from that room... 
Nice hotel but i do not trust their staff.  I know it was my fault for leaving them but i was really depending on their staff to do the right thing and turn them in.  i remember where i left them and the staff would've easily saw them so i know the next guest didn't take them.  Im just really frustrated and dissapointed. Not okay for how much money i spent there. I will never come back. There's obviously a problem going on here,  I've been reading other reviews and there's a pattern of items being stolen.  Not okay.  I have a lot of friends and family who stay here,  not anymore.  It just gives me an uneasy feeling.

I want to give five stars I really do but not until I stay here and relax. I got a great deal for my team to do an overnight stay here and well..it was really really nice there was a lot of good things and great amenities. The staff was always on top of their game and I wanted to relax but I didnt let my self do that except I did take 3 showers which was fabulous for me. I may go back for uncorked or some other event because it would be nice to enjoy a night ..ok 3 nights there and just relax.

Stayed at this beautiful hotel for spring break and it was absolutely gorgeous. The room was clean and serviced daily when we were out and we had an amazing view of the fountain. My toddler made it her home and enjoyed being in the room more than going out. Would definitely go back!

Room was HOT, king bed was old and had two massive sags in it from overuse. The resort, pools, casino, and fountain show were AMAZING and lived up to expectations. Will be staying somewhere else next time for a better place to sleep.

I've stayed at a few hotels in Vegas, and this one is by far the best I've ever experienced.  I realized it's a little pricey, but it's worth every cent in my humble opinion.  

Let's start with check-in.  They had everything absolutely perfect.  They knew I had paid for the room through Delta Vacations and had charged the upgrade directly from them.  Great start!

The room.  Oh, the room!  When I made the upgrade with Bellagio, they moved us up to  the 25th floor with a lake view.  The bathroom was exquisite with it's marble foyer and bath.  The bed was so comfortable!  My only recommendation is that they add a floor-length mirror in the foyer like at the Aria.  I know they have the mirrors in the armoir, but the doors don't open as far as I'd like to be able to see myself without holding the door--minor criticism to say the least.

The hotel staff were all wonderfully polite and accommodating.  Housekeeping comes by twice a day, and they greet you whenever they see you in the hallway.  Even the maintenance staff greeted us in the hallway!  The first morning we woke up late and saw that we had a message from housekeeping saying they weren't able to service our room because of our privacy hanger.  After we called them back, they said they'd be more than happy to service the room.  So nice!

The hotel has great restaurants, exquisite decorations, feng shui casino, and they have the Cirque du Soleil, "O" theatre!  The only thing lacking really are a couple cheap places where you can grab a quick bite.  We made up for that by taking the tram to City Center for that though.  

Another great example of how accommodating this place is my friend wanted to see a fountain show featuring Celine Dion.  He ended up calling the concierge who called someone to verify if and when the next Dion song would be.  Unfortunately she informed him that they would not be playing the song for the next two days, but to our surprise, the very next show was "My Heart will Go On". 

A second example is when we checked-out.  They said we had had some pretzels, but we didn't.  They immediately took care of the issue for us.  Furthermore, check out is at noon.  We didn't check out until 2pm, and they didn't bring it up as an issue.

If you're looking for a great hotel in Vegas on the Strip, you need to come to Bellagio.  I was extremely pleased with everything here, which was a surprise even to me.

Write down the top things you value in a good hotel\/casino on the strip.  I wrote down: centrally located, good food, excellent customer service, entertainment & shops, and filtered air (I cannot stand smokey casinos where the smoke permeates the walls and carpets-I feel like I smell like an ashtray afterwards).  When I entered the casino smells of flowers wafted through the air from their show stopping seasonal display.  They have at least ten lines to improve efficiency in check in\/check outs. I love all of the restaurants: Noodles- a quick stop for lunch, Fix-trendy dining, Sensi- fusion, Michael Mina & Picasso (both outstanding) and the buffet ain't bad either.  One of my non negotiables is stopping at the Jean Philippe Chocolate fountain. If you are lucky enough to get a fountain view room it is absolutely worth it! There is really nothing like it, it's beautiful by day and even more gorgeous at night- truly a Las Vegas landmark. Yes, I know it's an older casino and a little dated. It could use some updating however though all of the years it still hasn't quite lost it's charm and maintains it's classy appeal.

This place is so overrated and over priced. I was a little disappointed when I got here, and then it just went down hill from there. Service here is crap, so much for hospitality. Room service is terrible, restraint service is junk. After going to Aria I was immensely let down by Bellagio, which is crazy because they're both MGM properties. Next time I know better.

I'm here to clarify and follow-up on Michael H's review of our stay between 12\/31 and 1\/3. We are Vegas regulars, hardcore gamblers, and Platinum M-Club members. I can't believe I have to write a bad review about the Bellagio. I don't want to, but I'm shocked at the poor customer service we've experienced here. Lori, to clarify, please check your records but there was a scheduled water outage on 1\/3 between 2am-4am that we were not notified about. We were gambling all night, came back to the room, and there was NO running water. When Michael called to inform the front desk that we did not have running water, the staff member that helped him did NOT help him. She simply stated matter-of-factly, "yes, you will have water again after 4am." 

This is absolutely unacceptable. We asked for more details and were told our entire floor had no running water for 2 hours. I had to ask for a solution -- we were checking out the next morning and had flights to catch. We're not going to sleep dirty. We were offered (Option A) of peeing\/showering\/etc. in another room and staying in our own room or (B) packing up and moving altogether. Well, it's 3am at this point, we're tired, but we pack because it's ludicrous to expect a guest to jump between floors to use the restroom. 

Basic Customer Service 101, when a huge inconvenience happens, management usually tries to satisfy the customer. But since our room was comped for this particular night, we were told "nothing could be done." I mean, really? Our rooms are comped because we spend ridiculous amounts of money at your hotel and casino. The staff member could have followed up with management, or anything, to address the inconvenience. After expressing our frustrations, we were offered $50 in-room dining credit, even though we were leaving super early the next day.

Michael takes the time to write a Yelp review of his experience and Lori responds with information that is completely UNTRUE. Michael ALSO took time to write the hotel directly and DID NOT receive a response from the Bellagio.

I really, really cannot understand how this could happen -- and to say that I'm disappointed with this experience is an understatement. It's unfortunate that a hotel with such a great location AND reputation cannot address customer service issues directly. Here are the various time points in which we could have been treated better: (A) a notice that the outage was occurring ahead of time, (b) an apology for not notifying us that the outage had occurred, (c) spontaneously offering options for running water, without being asked for a solution by the customers, (d) spontaneously offering some sort of compensation or credit for the inconvenience (we did pay for part of our visit), (e) offering to follow-up with a supervisor about our concerns, and (f) following up with Michael's review with accurate facts about what had happened.

I hate to play the "well, we are Platinum status members" card because ALL customers should be treated as valuable, but the truth is, this is Vegas. If this is how you are treating your guests, well, we will be taking our business elsewhere.

The rooms aren't that great unless you pay the big bux or get comped for a suite.  The Venetian and Palazzo offer better standard rooms.  The main draw here is the Garden which changes with the seasons and the Dancing Fountains.  The staff isn't as welcoming as other "high end" hotels.  You need to gamble a LOT to get any sort of comps from this casino.  Too snooty for me here.  I'm gonna stick with The Venetian\/Palazzo.

Love the shopping here and the best part for us was the water show every 15 minutes at night and was a site to see. Always saw it TV and seeing it live was an experience. Not a gambler so can't comment on the casinos, but the shops and the views here were great.

Overall this is a pretty great casino and hotel.  The public areas are absolutely stunning and warrant a visit even if you aren't staying here.  Compared to some other hotels, Bellagio seems to attract a slightly classier, more elegant visitor (by Vegas standards).  The ventilation was pretty good as well, and even my smoke-hating grandmother wasn't bothered very much.  However, if you can't tolerate smoking, Vegas in general probably isn't the right place for you.

I was totally impressed at how warm and friendly every single person working there was.  From the maids to the security guards, everybody had a warm smile friendly demeanor.  The rooms were beautiful, though I was a bit surprised at the low quality of the toiletries.  Most of the restaurants and food outlets are very pricey (think $5 muffins and $7 gelato).  I do not consider myself to be a lucky person, but I won at the casino a few times, so that definitely made my stay all the better.

Pluses: 

- Service at the pool
- Friendliness of the bell guys
- Food and service at Olives restaurant
- Automatic curtains

Minuses: 

- Front desk lady acted offended when I told her we'd like an updated room at check in after friends said they had stayed in one that was not. "ALL of our rooms are updated!" Then (pretty sure same lady) told our other friends at check in she could upgrade them to a more updated room...
- Hairs (yes those kind) in the tub upon arrival to our room
- On that note, our bedroom was nice, but the bathroom was super ugly. LOTS of mismatched marble with super busy wall paper and the tub and toilet were a gross dark yellow color. Pretty sure that the bathrooms haven't been updated in quite some time. 
- Kleenex and toilet paper were incredibly cheap (rough - super thin), is this Walmart or what is supposed to be a nice hotel? 
- The cleaning ladies were so loud - yelling down the hall, that they woke me up and it kept going on long enough that I went out to ask them to please be quiet. She apologized but not in a sincere way and then it was just softer yelling
- We got a cabana at the pool and that thing was FILTHY!!!!! I mean really, really disgusting. Like years of dirt. We bought it for my friends who flew in for my bday and I was praying they wouldn't open any of the cupboards and be grossed out like I was.
- For the cabana, which was $500, not only did they charge us 20% tip for the food and beverage (which is understandable), they CHARGED GRATUITY ON THE $500 FOR THE CABANA!!!! WHAT?!?! If you want to charge $635 for the cabana, charge $635, don't be a**holes and try to slide $135 into the gratuity. 
- We told them at check-in we were there to celebrate my bday and had gotten 8 people to stay at The Bellagio to celebrate. I have to admit, I did expect a little box of chocolates or bottle of champagne, but nada. Even mid-range hotels do this consistently. 
- The gardens. I have walked through The Bellagio before and been really impressed. This time it was like the set from a bad horror movie. They were trying to do a Halloween\/Fall theme and clearly spent a lot of money on it but it was just so ostentatious. 
- I had an good bagel one morning from the Cafe by the pool downstairs, but the next morning at the same place the bagel was super small and cheap and burnt to a crisp. I can't believe someone working there thought it was ok to serve! Too bad it was served in a bag and I didn't want to deal with the line again so I didn't go back. 
- The hotel just feels outdated. I'm guessing their bookings are going down. Because of all this and the sense that whomever is running this place is like 90 years old and just isn't quite with it, I won't stay here again. My group of friends wasn't impressed either.

We checked in to the Bellagio on 6\/25\/14.
Were told that they had a small refrigerator for my husband's insulin that could be brought to our room free of charge!
Fantastic!
The next morning when he went to take it out IT WAS FROZEN SOLID!
Many hours later of forms; risk management people; promises that the over $530 in insulin would be refunded we are now OVER A MONTH LATER and it is still a run around!

    Stayed June 2014

Bellagio has slipped quite a bit. It seems as if it's peak was 10 years ago, and the quality keeps going down.  The suite itself was pleasant, but seemed a bit dated and didn't have something as basic as a fridge. I mean come on, even cheap motels out in the boonies have small fridges, so surely Bellagio can invest in one; instead, you can rent one for $35 a night.  I reckon I'll pass on that.  You should pass on Bellagio too.  There's much nicer, newer hotels on the strip that are more pleasing to stay at.  For one, the Palazzo is a much better experience. 
 Bellagio is slowly fading into mediocrity.  

Looks as if Bellagio is the next soon-to-be Rio\/Mirage\/MGM.

Very great breakfast buffet we did come just in time to sample the breakfast right before the dinner switch and they had some of the best eggs benedict i have ever had in my life hahaha. Really great prime rib and they had a great selection of seafood. The fish was well seasoned and very moist and flavorful

If you want to live the Las Vegas intense, make sure to go here. Right down the strip, great pool, big rooms, good to play poker. 
I thought it would be a bit over the top and old, but nope, it is in good state. 
When is Las Vegas understanding it by giving free wifi througout the hotel (also in the rooms).

This place is fancy. Every time I come here, I feel like I can not afford anything. 

However, this place is just incredible to walk through. Beautiful shops, beautiful casino, and beautiful rooms. Definitely high class which gives to its flare. 

Also, I know this will be redundant but its fountain show is simply incredible. Such an incredible place to watch an incredible show. 

Come here to sight see but unless you have crazy money - try staying at Ballys (right across).

Protip: You can take the tram here from Bellagio to Monte Carlo with a stop at Aria.

Although our view of the fountains were spectacular, I found the room to be dingy, old, and small, compared to the Wynn or Encore.  Also, since we were taking the red eye back to Boston, I paid for an extra half day until 6pm on a Friday.  At 5:45, my daughter and sister tried to get into the hotel room, and it was locked - our keys turned off!!  The security guard could not reach a manager, and would not let us in to get our luggage, even after I showed them my receipt and my ID.  I was furious.  I called the front desk several times before I got the "on call" manager.  She apologized, and refunded my fee for the half day.  Meanwhile, she said we had a limo ride to the airport, all taken care of "just go to the bell man out front; they have your name".  Needless to say, when I went there, they had no idea what I was talking about, so I again tried to reach a manager in vain.  It is apparent that one hand has no clue what the other is doing in this large hotel; God forbid, if there was an emergency in a room - they wouldn't let you into your own room!!  We ended up taking a cab to the airport.  The manager did call me again after I reached the airport to apologize for a second time about the lack of communication.  You can always walk by the fountains; I do not recommend staying here if you are used to first class service and excellent, modern accommodations.

Amazing hotel!!! My fiance and I came to celebrate out b-days. The staff was friendly and very helpful. The room was beautiful. We didn't have a view of the fountains but we had a great view of the beautiful pools. Our room was cleaned twice, which is a little annoying if you're sleeping in but it's great to know everything is clean. If it matters to anyone, the halls are pretty quiet so after long nights of partying you can catch up on your zzz.
All in all, the Bellagio is worth the money.

I didn't stay here, but the Bellagio is worth visiting. They have a beautiful inside garden and it is just amazing to look at. The inside is so nice too. Outside is great as well and it overlooks the Paris like part of Vegas. I really like the gelato place in here. I will definitely come back here!

I have been a regular guest at the Bellagio twice a year for the past several years.  I have always looked forward to the environment and amenities that it has, but over time I see things slipping and I now need to reconsider if I will try another resort.

The buffet quality and selection has decreased.

I have always been granted at least 30 min late check out, but this time I was told the hotel was sold out and extending  was not possible UNLESS I wanted to pay for extra hours.

One of the things that has drawn me to the Bellagio was that I felt that the hotel did anything it could to make my stay comfortable.  Now I see it more interested in drawing crowds an making money.

One of the most beautiful casino and event locations in all of Las Vegas.  Staffed by friendly, competent and intelligent people who make sure that you are having a good time.  Elegant and heavenly.  A must see!

This was definitely our favorite casino on the strip.  The place was amazing inside and almost all of the dealers were friendly and helpful.  They also never carded me, which was a nice change from pretty much every other casino we went to.  I haven't stayed here yet due to being poor from student loans, but if I ever have enough cash to stay somewhere nice in Vegas, it will be here.  

Maybe I'm also biased because I won a decent amount of money here.  I definitely had the best luck at this casino.

I had a dream.

I had a dream that someday, I'd give up my life here in SoCal.  I had a dream that I'd travel to the far reaches of Nevada and pursue my dreams of becoming a professional poker player.  I'd make big bucks from winning championship after championship.

Always, this dream ended with me taking up permanent residence at the Bellagio.  Always.  Did I mention the word: permanent?  Yes, I think I must've mentioned it.

Aside from being flat-out gorgeous, the service is top notch.  Yes, in Vegas, you'll feel like a VIP almost anywhere.  But what hotel actually caters to a green, naive 21-year-old as if she were the most famous socialite in the world?  Only Bellagio.

The rooms are simply elegant, with every pleasure and convenience you can dream up.  You will truly feel like a princess, I kid you not.

The rooms are fantastic, the service is fantastic, the actual hotel itself is fantastic - is there more?  Of course!  The food!  Bellagio has some of the best food I've had in the Vegas area, and again, the service is impeccable.  Their servers can even make chow mein and saimin seem like elegant delicacies, the way they carry on serving you. Shoot, i could probably order a street taco and it'd come with a gold-plated mini-spoon and monogrammed napkins.  Who knows.

Is there more?  Yes, of course!

True Vegas lovers do not go to Vegas for the shows, the hotels, the restaurants, or the nightlife - True Vegas Lovers go to Vegas to gamble.

Duh.

All I have to say is... the dealers are all incredibly friendly and classy, some are also incredibly funny, and best of all, I feel like it's my lucky casino (so I always save it for last on my casino crawls).  Winner, winner, chicken dinner, bitches!

Oh, and it helps that, as Bellagio caters to a slightly higher-end clientele, the people who are playing cards with you are either (a) familiar with the rules of the game, or (b) well-mannered and fun to play with.  I hate playing with people with uncivilized tourists with bad attitudes. Blech!

Anyways... Someday, my dream will come true.  Someday, y'all can write me fan mail and address it to Bellagio.  Thanks.

Yes the hotel is nice and clean but this one star review is for how greedy they are.  You have to use a ice bucket to keep your drinks cold.  Yes they do have a fridge but it's completely full with there extremely overpriced drinks all on sensors.   You move it you get charged.  And the sign says it's for my convenience.   How is going down the long hall to get ice convenient to me?  Paying a couple hundred dollars a night you should be able to use part of the fridge.   Next time we are staying on Fremont Street.  Drinks and food is 1\/4 the cost.

The Bellagio is five stars all the way IF you intend to spend a substantial portion of your time in the resort and casino, AND IF you don't mind spending money or you are a moderately large gambler (you will get comps).  But only IF.  For a place to sleep, you have better or less expensive choices.  See what kind of deal you can get at Aria.

The rooms are only four star by any standard.  Recent upgrades have addressed the TV and bathroom issues, but the building still is 15 years old.  You can get more opulent and modern rooms at Aria, for example.

The common areas are five stars, led by the incomparable fountain display and the conservatory.  These are among top five attractions in Las Vegas.  Also note the Chihuly glass flower canopy in the lobby.  

The buffet is the #1 buffet in Las Vegas, and the holiday dinner buffets are particularly fine.  Breakfast is a great value too (but not weekend brunch).  The rest of the dining establishments are good but not good enough for their cost.  A possible exception is Picasso, which, at $150-$200 a person, might still be considered worthwhile.

Service is generally very good to excellent, although at busy times there is sometimes a wait to check in.  This seems to be true everywhere in Las Vegas.  When well trained employees are hassled, they tend to act hassled, although at least at Bellagio the smiles usually remain, if somewhat frozen.

Here are a few tips:
1.  Make sure you get a room in the main tower.  A good fountain view (from at least the 20th floor) may be your preference the first time you stay here, but it will be noisy.  You will hear the fountain shows every 15-30 minutes until midnight.  A pool view is quieter.
2.  If you gamble, be sure to get a Player's Card and use it.  After a relatively modest amount of gambling in any year, you will get upgraded from the lowest (Sapphire) status and important percs become available -- such as line passes to the buffet and coffee shop.
3.  Jean Phillipe's is a good place for breakfast and lunch, and the bakery desserts are worth the price.  Make sure you ask them to grill the Paninis.  Some of the packaged products are expensive even for the Bellagio.
4.  Eat at the buffet or coffee shop (Picasso for a real splurge).
5.  See "O".  Make you reservations way ahead of time.  It is that good.  I have seen virtually every show in Las Vegas, and "O" is #1.  [Here's an odd note -- of the many Cirque de Soleil shows in Las Vegas, the shorter the name, the better the show.  "O" is the best, followed closely by "Ka", etc.  Forget about "Zumanity".]

i LOVED my stay at the bellagio. I loved it even more that my company paid for it. 

My flight landed at like 8am something and check in wasn't until like way later in the afternoon.... but i arrived and asked the girl working at the front desk if there was anything she could do.

i lucked out! she said i was the first person all morning to be nice to her and she gave me a BEAUTIFUL room. one of my co-workers was also staying at the bellagio and her room was no where near as nice as mine...like totally outdated and not as spacious. she was in the spa towers.  and yes, i definitely rubbed it in her face that my room was 40x better. 

My amazing room had a view of the pool, was super super clean, had all the amenities i could ever ask for, free and FAST wifi, was decorated super cute... it even had my favorite option: curtains controlled by a bedside button. don't you just love that!?! i totally need that in my house. 

i also had some business cards sent to the bellagio business center bc they weren't going to arrive to my office back home in time and they made that go very smoothly for me. 

they had the best pillows too. i called the morning of check out and was like 'do you sell your pillows and if not how much would you bill me if i stole one?' thankfully, they sell them and they are $30 for the king size. concierge will pick one up for you, too.

i was actually kinda sad to leave. i loved getting ready there in the mornings bc the bathroom counters were super spacious so i could lay out all my stuff and the shower had almost instant hot water...i never got a chance to use the tub but one day i will. one day...

To start, we were given a room that was filthy beyond imagination. Food crumbs on the carpet, chair, and in the bed, sparkles on the bed sheets, covers, and the carpets, and sticky liquid like substance all over the marble entryway and in the lavatory. We found the sticky stuff first, and asked for housekeeping to come in and clean the sticky mess. Unfortunately, even after 2.5 hours, nobody showed up. As it was already 1 AM, we decided to clean it ourselves. Then, we found the food crumbs and the sparkles all over the bed sheets and covers. When we asked for a room change, we were given a room that already had an occupant. We opened the door with out key, only to find the safety lock had been put in place. Thinking it was a mistake, we slammed the door shut and somehow managed to open the door, to the absolute horror of the man who had been peacefully asleep. The shock and terror in his voice is something that would most likely linger for a while. By this time, we demanded to see the manager, but were sent a desk attendant instead. When we went to our third room, we found a used cable tie on one of the beds and food crumbs, yet again, on the carpets and sofas. At this point, we refused to leave the room until we spoke with the manager. Our fourth and final room also had tape on the lavatory sink and taps and food crumbs on the floor, yet again. However, seeing that it was already 4 AM, we decided to stay.
This isn't the first time we stayed at the Bellagio. We try to stay at the Bellagio whenever we visit Las Vegas for work. Though this is the first time we've experienced anything this egregious and frustrating, we do not intend on staying here ever again. We'd recommend the Wynn or the Mandarin Oriental.

*************** All that glitters is not gold ************* 

You pass by the fountain watching its spender, wander through the casino, the "O" theater, the retail shops, it all just feels so great. So the lodging experience has to be even better right? 

Nope, keep walking. When do you realize this? It all starts with the check in experience. High brow hotel? High brow service? Nope, get in one of the random lines and pray you will get checked in. No one to direct you to an attendant, no one to organize the guests, just kinda figure out if you are in the "right line". In my opinion, not a good start, but I was still looking forward to relaxing in the room. 

From there, while the room was nicely appointed, once you look past the glitter, it is just a basic room. Mine came with a slow running sink and well used towels. Not my idea of a 5 star hotel. 

Clearly the big plus is the location, but that has a bit of a downside too. I found getting in and out of the hotel parking area was problematic because of the foot traffic on the Blvd. Big glitter, big hotel and I would stop at big disappointment, but clearly a disappointment.

The Bellagio is a gorgeous hotel from the moment my family car pulled up to their entrance. The valet staff was very accommodating and pleasant throughout our whole stay. Their lobby is quite a feast for the eyes, my only complaint was that it's always ridiculously crowded: tourists and hotel guests alike. It was a bit hard to feel welcome pushing past bodies after bodies to get to the elevator. The suite we stayed at is absolutely breathtaking. We had a living room, three bedrooms, and four bathrooms; it was quite spacious. The furnitures are impeccable and the decor have a warm feeling. The pools surprisingly were not crowded and there were a lot of chaise available for lounging and sunbathing. In conclusion everything was great and Bellagio had made my first Las Vegas stay memorable and fun. In the future I'd love to stay here again but with a smaller room for a different feel.

If you like a grandiose setting this is easily 5 stars. However if you want service minus 5 stars. 
Getting around this monstrosity is a chore no maps or directions. Some examples: 
My my wife forgot to leave at tip for the maid guess what linen not changed, wastepaper basket not emptied ,bathtub and surfaces not cleaned. 
Non allergic pillows not in room as requested. After several requests they finally said they would bring the pillows. we went to dinner when we cam back still not pillows. Housekeeping stated could not change unless we were in the room again the tip. 
In the restaurant my wife was called a Jap. 
A number of other irritants made me feel that this hotel for those who like long lines, lots of people and palace like setting.

Our stay at The Bellagio has been nothing short of wonderful. The employee at check in (wish I would've gotten his name) was so personal and friendly. We received an upgraded fountain view room, and the view took our breath away! The fountains are one of the best shows in Vegas without a doubt. The breakfast at the Pool Cafe was superb, and portions were huge! So much so that we actually were able to split an entree on the second day and have plenty of food for the both of us. The pools were fantastic, and the cocktail waitresses at the pool were very friendly and accommodating. We were able to take in a couple of shows, have amazing food, and gamble a little. I loved the new fall display in the lobby... Beautiful arrangement of flowers! Great getaway for a couple of days! I appreciate this higher end hotel and we will definitely be back. 

The only downsides to this hotel are basically what I hate about Vegas in general... But they come with the territory. The smoke in the lobby in the casino area is atrocious! My allergies are horrible, so I just avoided the area as much as possible. The fresh air at the pool sort of made up for this. In addition, the extreme prices of basic things such as $10 for a bottle of Figi water, $90 that we spent on breakfast the first day, $15 for a small cocktail at the pool, and $5 for a vending machine soda were a little rediculous. This hotel will quickly thin your wallet. However, this is the case with most Vegas hotels. You take the bad with the great, stay for a couple of days, and hopefully spend most of the day at the pool :)

Booked the hotel thru American Express Platinum card FHR(Fine hotel and resort) program.  

The benefits under this program are as follows:
Noon check in and upgrade room when available
Daily breakfast for 2
$100 property credit to be used during stay
Guaranteed 4pm late check out

At check-in I asked for fountain view room upgrade
Bellagio check in attendant Christy replied "Did you book for the room? You have to book for the room".  What she should have said was "Let me see what I can do"  

Then she said "I am offering you 4pm late check out", 
At this point I get very annoyed and think that Excuse me?! I paid for my late check out with my platinum card fees"

She did assign me to a fountain view room at Spa Tower Room 16-606.  Note 16-606 is over looking parking garage and fountain view is partial almost non existent. Did I mention the moldy smell associated with the room? It smell so bad.
I called front desk and asked for room change as this was a total insult to me, mind you this is a long walk all the way down the hall from elevator.   I then got re-assign to 26-624 but this room the switch plates had turned yellow and the tub had rusts on them.  Both of these room to me do not worth $250 per night.  

The best part comes when I found out my dining reservation at Le Cirque wouldn't be honored under that $100 property credit.  The benefit that has the most value for my buck is property credit and that wasn't going to be granted.  

At this point I asked for management intervention.  The manager Robin is nice enough to resolve the issue but who wants to constantly have any heated conversation on their vacation.

Guess what I checked out at 9am and chose not to have breakfast because I was so dissatisfied with their room and services.   Then the valet didn't even help with my luggage took the tips and walked away.  5 star\/diamond hotel really?!

Conclusion:
1.  Don't book for resort room.  Bellagio will assign you to spa tower, these rooms Bellagio comp their frequent gambler free nights.  These rooms should never be sold at the same price as the main tower.  Unless you like Vintage rooms that you have to switch every lamp on and every single light.

2.  Even if you book deluxe room there is no guarantee that you will not be assign to spa tower.

3.  I thought I would be special under American Express Platinum FHR program but I was so wrong.  Maybe I expected Bellagio to perform the same as Wynn.  

4.  Prior to my stay at Bellagio I stayed at Wynn under the same program, I was treated like queen and had the best time ever.  There are so much competition on the strip and they fail so miserably to keep me as a customer.  

I totally agree with other Yelpers who said come visit the fountain, the garden and or eat at the fine dining restaurants but DO NOT stay in their rooms.

We have stayed for 3 nights in Bellagio. It was something. I mean wonderful.Check in was quick and easy. Even it was so crowded, we were noticed by the front desk clerks. Room was gorgeous and clean.
 Even though our room was facing busy street and mountains, we had a really good time. Housekeeping rocks. Mariela and Adanu took care of our room. They are perfect. Just please, do not move minibar drinks, You are going to be charged. Go to any bar. There are enough super good bars and cafes in Bellagio. We were having breakfast  in Bellagio cafe. Food was delicious. Personnel very nice and kind. They serve very good coffee. Oh, boy...If you want some pastries, go to Palio. Yummy yummy...
Overall..it was an excellent stay. Thank you, Bellagio!..We will come back and let everybody know!............;)

Horrible experience!!!  The show was good, but the parking disaster ruined the whole night. First it took an hour to get parked due to them checking if local or not to get a parking ticket, then after the show it took OVER an hour to get out of parking garage level 3 (don't park on that level because they don't have anyone directing traffic there but do on 2 & 1 making you wait for them to get in!  Finally they stopped charging people (2 tkt booths for all the cars coming & going=dumb) & let people go or we still would be there! Literally didn't move for 40 min.  Everyone was irate & honking their horns. The parking attendants or Security were so rude when we told them there wasn't anyone directing traffic on level 3 & said "we love you, have a nice day" so sarcastically.  Never going back!  Not worth the time or hassle & I didn't even care if we had to pay.

I travel to Las Vegas a lot. I stay in their suites at the Bellagio. Their suites are very spacious. Very Large Bathrooms and living areas. Comfortable beds. The Bellagio is a very touristy place so it tends to be very crowded. Staying in a suite the Bellagio provided me with a Line pass for restaurants which allowed me to go to the front of the line. I also had access tot he VIP rom which included complimentary drinks as well as appetzizors. They have elevator attendants checking room keys to keep out the non guests from the living areas. Staff is very helpful and attentive. I also have a review for the Restaurant Sensi inside the Bellagio be sure to check it out.

the best place for rich men to take you on holiday. i mean, if you must stay in the states and can't get to new york. the best place really would be paris, don't you think? how come nobody's ever taken me to paris?! man, fuck the belagio. furthermore, fuck everyone i've ever dated. this review turned really bad really fast. excuse me while i go cry in the bathroom before my boss gets in.

I remember staying here for a weekend and was expecting it to be too mature of a place for us, young, girls to enjoy Vegas.
However, this is one of the few times I was pleasantly mistaken. 
Staying at Bellagio was a great experience. The service from the front desk to the bell hop to the room service. Everything exceeded my expectations.
The room was quite roomy for 2 double beds and even a living area. Customer service went beyond protocol- customer service with a smile would be an understatement.
Bellagio ranks among the top places to stay, IMO, and I would recommend this spot to anyone planning a trip to sin city.

My husband & I recently stayed at the Bellagio hotel we hadn't ever stayed there before & were expecting it to be top notch since it isn't exactly cheap to stay there. I'm giving them a 3 for a number or reasons I realize not everyone's experience won't be the same. 

Pros:
1. The woman at the concierge desk was so extremely nice she blew me away she made sure Greg & I were well taken care of at the restaurant FIX & she told us all of her favorite things to eat. Also the woman who checked us into the hotel was very sweet & I could tell wanted to impress us. 

2.  FIX the restaurant was absolutely delicious! I highly recommend going there for dinner & getting the tacos & the fried Mac & cheese so so good. They were prompt with service & the waitress even placed our napkins in our laps which I found odd but still it is a very high class place. 

3. The sweet woman in the shop across from the elevators. She was so sweet & exhausted but she helped us & even chatted it up with us for a little while. 

4. Gorgeous downstairs & for the most part everyone that worked there was nice & said good morning or hello when you crossed their path. 

Cons:
1. We got there early so I didn't expect a room to be ready right away & was told that they'd text us when our room was ready. We arrived at 7am & still didn't get a text by 12:30pm which sucked cause we still had to get ready for the event we had planned at 2pm we also had a drive ahead of us & didn't know what the traffic would be like. So we called to check to see if the room was done or if another one like the one booked was available yet. Well the room wasn't ready it was suppose to have a garden\/pool view we asked if another one exactly like it was ready otherwise we'd still wait. They switched us to another one which I assume was suppose to be like it I could be wrong but they told us to go up to that room after almost getting to the elevators they called to say go to the front desk for new keys to activate. We got to the desk & the new lady was pretty rude we told her what happened she got all pissy & said "who are you? Let me see your ID." My husband gave it to her and she then looked up the room she said "it isn't even listed on here so I'll have to give you something else like it." She gave us the new card keys & we headed up to the room. It was pretty lame we got a king size bed but there was nothing special about the room or the view we got a view of the freeway definitely a downgrade from the garden\/pool view. The tub & pillows are nice though.

2. After a long day at the Vegas speedway we wanted to take a nap & refresh our batteries for the night out, we were on our way up to our room when we were stopped at the elevator entrance by someone that worked there he yelled "um excuse me you two! Room keys?" I wouldn't have minded him saying this but since we were the only ones he stopped to see the room keys it was rude & I didn't appreciate the look or tone of voice he gave us. I'm not sure if he was having a crappy day or didn't want to be there. 

At the end of the trip although I liked the food at fix & some of the people that worked there I wasn't the impressed with the hotel rooms or the view. I don't think id stay here again unless it was extremely discounted.

Buffet was cool!!! 2hr limt, used every minute. Best time to go is right when the breakfast is ending transitioning to Lunch$$ save lil!! Hard to walk out with your back straight!! Lol felt like rolling out on my Belly, went to room and damn near laid it down Zzzzz for the rest of the day.

Love the Bellagio. Always have. Love the ambiance, shops, restaurants & clubs. Can't get enough of the conservatory. We had never been during the winter to the conservatory & finally made it this NYE & love, love, loved it. Never lets me down. Also managed to catch the fountains & it was Elvis. Just great!

VALENTINES experience ruined by this  hotel!!! 
  My husband was asked for feedback by hotel, yet has not been offered reconsiliation. This was a surprise from my husband. Great time on the grounds (bit overcrowded tho), the restaurants, the view that my husband paid the upsell fee for was wonderful. 
 However, The room had not been cleaned. This was not the obvious not cleaned room either. This was the get in bed and go to sleep to discover a smell of analgesic rubbing cream emanating from the sheets. We discovered this around 3am. No problem - have housekeeping take care of it. 
    We had had a long night. So no prob- fresh sheets. Until we went back to bed, fell asleep.. smell still there. The medicated ointment had permeated in to the mattress.
 The efficiency and professionalism of staff severely lacking. 
 The attitude and tone of the guest services staff was confrontational, unsympathetic and unapologetic. Literally had to request from their employees a verbal apology. This was not only a tremendous inconvenience to us and a great disappointment but also raised concerns for the exposure to the biologics present in the room. We were mouth wideopen flabbergasted!!
  The only staff member of the hotel that recognized the grave implications of the state of the bedding was the actual room attendant. The supervisor of housekeeping offered 2 pieces of chocolate. Refused to perform a sniff test of the mattress, however, did proceed to cough mouth uncovered in our enclosed space. Anxiety levels were through the roof as we waited door opened for Maintenance to replace the mattress. Who had their own set of issues as they delivered the wrong mattress to us.
   The Supervisor of Housekeeping offered up a spot clean of the room after a convo between her and the attendant. We were so beyond exhausted and felt for the attendant, we declined. (She had to run back and forth to remove, find and replace sheets and cases.) This however prompted our own  investigation. Finally it all made sense. 
   Even though the room was a cool, modern feel, it didn't wow. WHY? The room had not been cleaned. Upon closer inspection, the cabinets, mirrors, chairs and floors had visibly dried stains, dust and lint about. The biggest and most notable? The bathroom shower- long black hairs in and about the drain and entrance to the shower. I nearly threw up, I
 began gagging. This was beyond too much for us.
  At around 5am the fiasco drew to a close with more dealings with the guest services. Facing 4-5 hours of sleep after being so severely stressed by the experience, we requested a late checkout. The level of inconvenience Guest Services expressed to us was insane by this point. We were enraged. 
    Who would think that a hotel that intrigues everyone with so much romance would show so little concern for the effect it has on it patrons through their representatives? I have a medical condition that causes great fatigue. This experience drained everything out of me. It took me a week to recover physically. 
    This experience has stuck with me, hence the reason I have reported back my findings so late. We are recent locals to the area. The number of choices we have to stay on the Strip include staying home then heading out for the enjoyment. What a horrible experience Bellagio afforded us. I would advise everyone to think twice. Do the due diligence when u enter the room. Don't do the upsell until you can be guaranteed the status on the room. Hey better yet the Paris across the street may score lower but they are cheaper, with great views and better staff - from our experience. Or spend the money and stay at the Cosmo. People! I hadn't even begun to talk with you about the long check in  lines. OMG

I went back and forth between giving this place four or five stars, but I settled on five because although not as awesome as the Cosmo, it's still pretty awesome.

Bellagio is the gold standard in Vegas through reputation. From the beautiful water fountain outside to the breathtaking view of the property from the strip, it captures you whether you stay here or not.

During my three day stay, I had what was a just about perfect hotel experience. The rooms are unique, spacious and mine offered a great view of the strip. Housekeeping was always done within an hour of me leaving the room and the room itself was comfy from the bed to the awesome bathroom.

The hotel also offers a club, many restaurants (including the famous buffet) a huge casino area and shopping. You could essentially not leave the hotel your entire trip if you really wanted to, which is the sign of a great place. 

A truly amazing hotel with a comparable experience to go along with it. The Gold Standard!

I'm doing the local tourist review today. I haven't stayed at the hotel, so DON'T READ if that's what you're looking for.

Going to Vegas? Yeah, you're gunna want to watch water dancing to music, 1 Star.

That garden thingy? Oh yeah, it's the picturesque place.. if you could have the place to yourself. 2 Stars.

The big chocolate fountain? I long for the day that I can dip my hands and drink from that magical fountain. 3 Stars.

I'm not one for Vegas.  It's bunch of glitz and glamour and lights, lacking any kind of culture. The city is there to take your money.  With that said, if you're gonna go, might as well go in style and the Bellagio is the place to be.  

A few years ago, my friend got married in Vegas and had his reception at the Bellagio.  The ambiance was great, and the food was very tasty.

I love this place. The style, the fountain, the people. It's just a beautiful positive place to visit for any reason. I haven't eaten here, but I did see "O" in the theater. Hope to be able to stay here next time I visit Vegas.
By far my favorite place to stay in Las Vegas!!!
Garden is awesome. Convention rooms are accessible, comfortable and near plenty of restrooms. Food and beverages supplied were more than acceptable.

I used to love this place. Rooms are comfortable, casino is spacious, and service used to be great. Service definitely went south after the MGM acquisition. Ended up switching over to Wynn. I still have a little fondness for Bellagio because it's facilities overall are just great. Nice pool as well and great restaurants. If only the service was better these days...

Bellagio was built to last, and at eighteen years old, this hotel is still the top hotel in Las Vegas. The attention to detail, tall ceilings, beautiful decor,  and location on the strip make for a winning combination. Recently I stayed in a deluxe fountain view room and it was so worth it. We planned ahead and got an amazing rate. 
On that visit I enjoyed a spa treatment. The spa areas were well maintained and peaceful. I like that the areas were relaxing and pleasantly lit, not dark as some trendy spas are.
The Bellagio has some unique areas such as the Conservatory, and it is always beautiful, but during certain times of the year it really becomes amazing. The most recent theme was Chinese New Year, Year of the Monkey. Just incredible the amount of flowers and plants that go into the projects.
I think that the service at the Bellagio is still very, very good. Every person, from the bellhops, valet, housekeepers, dealers, and servers we encountered were friendly, smiling, and enhanced our visit by their attitudes.

Lovely hotel, as you'd expect, but the service is shocking.

We were here initially, then in LA for a few days and back here again for two nights.  We had booked a room for four people but on the first check in they said the room wasn't suitable for four.  They didn't propose to do anything about it, even though they could see we had booked for four people.  In the end we managed to get them to put two foldaway beds in and we managed OK.

When we came back just now for the second visit they tried to charge us extra for the two foldaway beds.  When we said 'No' they went away and then came back and said it would be OK - No apology for trying to charge us extra.

Also, trying to pull up to load\/unload the car is a trauma.  Both times they waved me through to an area and then told me I couldn't park there.  After driving round the loop again they told me to pull up in the valet area where we then got abused by the valets.

As I said, very nice hotel, food is good and the baggage people were very friendly but I couldn't recommend staying here.

Quick update two years later - we checked in at 16:30, with a check in time of 15:00, after six hours of travelling and they said they should be able to find us a room in about 90m.  We said this wasn't acceptable and to be fair they upgraded us several levels to a penthouse suite!!  Room was very large but basically this is a very old fashioned hotel that has had its day.  The wifi was patchy to say the least in our suite, showers leaked and it all felt very dated.

There are some much better newer hotels in a similar location - Cosmopolitan, Aria etc - and I suspect we will be going for one of them next time after persevering for too long with the Bellagio.

This is a very nice hotel. It is large without being TOO large a la Caesar's Palace or Venetian (although I love the Venetian). We stayed in the spa tower. Minus one star because the room, although beautiful and comfortable, was no larger than your standard generic hotel room (except the bathroom was large and beautiful). We did have an amazing view of the fountains and the strip. The pool area is gorgeous and relaxing....people are pretty quiet and laid back but I second the review about the most annoying soft rock music ever. Ugh. There were very few children at the pool and that was fantastic by itself. Free water coolers and cups were nice. The breakfast buffet, at $14.95, is the best value on the strip. It includes all your beverages and is huge and full of fresh food. You won't need to eat again until the evening. Minus a star for long concierge lines, sometimes I just wanted to ask a quick question but the line was always long. The place is pretty spotless. Easy and plentiful parking. I'd like to stay again. I didn't mind the lack of a "party scene" at the pool one bit. I came to relax, and relax I did.

Was in this over priced shit hole on Saturday Nov 5th went to bar in casino with my girlfriend and cousin ordered 3 bud lights and 3 fireball shots bartender tells me 72$! What the fuck? I tell him we don't want it so be shakes his head and said your cheap! Not cheap at all that just seems like price gouging to me. Fuck this place will never step foot in this place again. The worst customer service ever.

My favorite resort to visit in Las Vegas. The penthouses are my go-to as they offer an above average sq footage and provide a relatively good value given the level of service and amenities. A handful of spectacular restaurants on property as well.

Now, I'm not a 1 star reviewer kind of girl, but Bellagio and I have a little bit of an issue.

See, the bellagio kicked me out.

On my BIRTHDAY!

Yes, there is a story, a really good one at that, but it will not be posted on yelp at this current time.

Now Bellagio, did I REALLY deserve that treatment?
  (yes, I probably did... but I'm still allowed to hold grudges, right?)
Now comp me a room and I'll give you a good rating. Deal?

Had a nice stay at the Bellagio. Clean suites, fresh 
towels and clean bedding. Calm vacation with the family, we enjoyed the amenities. The best part is the lobby area , the decor is beautiful. Perfect for memorable pictures :)

Bellagio is my top hotel in Las Vegas.  Why?  Well, I love that it's located in the Center of the Strip, the interior is nice and welcoming, the Fountain Show, the Conservatory, the Buffet, and the rooms are clean and inviting.

And the price is not too bad since you can usually snag a weekday special in the mid $100.  Other 5 star places like the Wynn cost so much more.

I recommend the Lake-View rooms since you'll be able to see the Fountains.  Otherwise, the view is typical of what you get from Vegas.

I also do love Caesar's Palace for their history of being in Vegas, but Bellagio is still the one for me.

If you have not stayed here yet, you should. This place lives up to all the hype. Everything is flashy and picturesque. The spa tower is just as good as the main building. The food is pretty good. I wen to the chinese restaurant. Of course, almost everything is way overpriced. 
The pool area is nice because it is large. There is also a dedicated area to sun bathing. Not really full ever. 

Tip: hold out for a non-smoking room if you can.

Staying at the Spa Tower at Bellagio is okay, but first choice should be the main building. It's not the Spa Tower has any major flaws, it's just out of the way, with more distant views of The Fountains & The Strip.. (across an expansive view of an upper deck parking lot). 
And the rooms do appear a bit smaller.. the twin bedded room has enough space for a desk & one chair... (no other seating... 2nd person has to sit on a bed)... really not desirable for a hi-end hotel. 
If it's a comp it's one thing... but out of pocket, rooms in the fountain tower are the better choice.

We checked into this hotel for a long weekend on 15th June. The next morning, our locked hotel rooms were broken into, resulting in all valuables being stolen, including my US passport and my UK visa.

It took security over an hour to get to us, and when they did arrive they were rude and did not care. Security told us they had called the police, which they had not. We spoke to the hotel manager who basically informed me I had no reason to be upset about my passport being stolen, that 'this is Las Vegas, people lose their passport all the time'.  Cut to: it took me 16 days to return home. The Bellagio did not reach out or help at all to accommodate me during this time. In fact, their 'internal investigation' team discovered that although someone did try to get into our room the very same morning we were robbed, they determined they were 'unsuccessful' and therefore no one actually broke in our room, and that was have lied about what happened.  

Yes, Bellagio. I spent thousands of dollars trying to get back home to the UK just to try to get a $200 drink voucher for 6 girls and 6 bad tickets to cirque du solei. It's not even about compensation- the way we were treated after this happened was appalling. We had to ask to change rooms- as clearly someone somehow got access to ours. We went to our new room, which had horrible gurgling sounds coming from the sink all night, and contained used bath robes that stunk of BO.

Not a good hotel, not worth the money, definitely not 5 stars. PLEASE do not stay at this hotel.
Love it- beautifully decorated. The food choices here are amazing along with the crepes and gelato. The O Show is also here- do not miss it:)

4 night stay in a lakeview room.  Have been waiting for years to be able to stay here.  Maybe that was the problem.  The anticipation was too great.  Positives: it is by far the classiest and most gorgeous hotel on the entire Strip; the view (from the 19th floor) of the water show, The Strip and of the Eiffel Tower across the street was breathtaking; Cafe Bellagio has good basic food at a fair price with attentive service.  Negatives: thought for sure that I had booked one of their "remodeled rooms" but it just didn't seem that way (I was expecting plush, new and really luxurious); room (especially the bathroom) and hallways could have been cleaner; need more room amenities such as bath gel for the huge tub and in-room coffee; could have done without a frig full of overpriced drinks and snacks on the counter (just an empty frig please); $25 resort fee plus $3 tax on the $25 resort fee when you don't use any of the benefits is crazy (how about pay as you use and skip the blanket fee); and while there were no problems at check-in (except for the initial "let me make a phone call to see if what you booked is available\/1 king vs 2 queens - WHAT?!) and checkout, please relieve some of the tension by having a more organized way of having folks wait in line. Given everything, would stay here again though.

What I loved the most about my stay at Bellagio was the Grand Buffet. Simply was in awe. I have tried many other buffets in Vegas but at Bellagio, it was the best. Other than the food, I do think Bellagio is overrated. The Chocolate fountain is fun to look at but all the rest of the stuff here I could easily give a miss.

The hotel is beautiful like most hotels in the Vegas strip.  When we arrived the check-in line was short.  They found our reservation BUT they wanted to give us a room with 2 beds.  They told us they don't guarantee a King bed.  Also, my husband had upgraded the room and had requested flower for my birthday.  They didn't have it!  That was disappointing.  Because of that they gave us a room with a view of the fountain - I guess that was nice!
The room was nice but was surprised it didn't have a coffee maker like most places.  
The first day we arrived they had a beautiful garden next to the check-in section.  It had flowers and a waterfall.  Everyone was taking pictures, it was beautiful.  On Sunday they close down that section to remodel.  They had construction machines and workers all over the area.  In order to get to a restaurant located in that section we had to go around all the construction workers.  That was disappointing!
The pool was nice! We were able to find 2 chairs really fast.  The water was cold but it was perfect since the weather was hot.
The hotel is in a great location.  Close to the mall and many restaurants.
I think next time we go to Vegas we will try a different hotel.

I never get tired of watching the fountain show in front of Bellagio whenever I visit Vegas. 

This hotel is very nice! Staff is always friendly and the restaurants are awesome. Definitely check out the Buffet if you are here! You will not be disappointed!

4:10 PM - room 1 - high-pitched whirring noise in ceiling, thought I could call to get it fixed
4:30 PM - after 20 minutes of phone hold, sent to another room where my key would work and security would be there in five minutes to let us in. 
5:00 Pm - after 10 minutes in the hallway waiting for security because the cards didn't actually work, and 20 minutes on hold with the front desk asking for security, we learn that room 2 was smoked in, so no go for us non-smokers. When the front desk was informed that someone had smoked in the room, they reacted with disbelief
5:20 PM - front desk guy says he'll waive $80 in fees, and give us what he says is a slightly nicer room. When I said this was pretty poor compensation for making guests sit in a hallway for most of an hour, front desk guy literally said that was too bad and I should just stay where I was. 
5:30 PM - into room 3. It had a visibly stained bedspread. While the nice housecleaning lady fixed it over 20 minutes, come on. 

This place isn't five stars. It's not even a Hampton Inn if consistency and courtesy count for anything.  I wouldn't stay here again and I would recommend anyone else think hard about staying somewhere else. 

Look, it may be a busy day for the hotel. But, there's no excuse for thirty minute hold times to speak to the front desk and there's no excuse for discourtesy. I've never been so frustrated with a hotel.

The casino was the worst ever. The people working there were no help at all, everybody gives u the runaround especially the supervisor Zana C .It takes them more then 2 hours to put some info in there data base in order to get a member card witch they offer u in the first place. Just go to WYNN casino it's a lot better, the people are more friendly and it takes them less then 5 min to do what the Bellagio is doing in 2 hours. wish they had half a star
As always Bellagio delivers in terms of comfort, cleanliness and great service.  This is for Hotel accommodations, casino and restaurants.  All first class!

This review is quite dated, I stayed there back in 2005 or so, I'm scheduled to stay again this Thanksgiving 2011 and I'll update after that.

Though from family stays, I know it's a nice hotel, swanky, for the older crowd I feel. The rooms are alright but as a kid I was really unimpressed. Maybe I'd appreciate it more now.

The housekeepers don't go through the sheets before they take them, they just roll it all off, so don't leave clothes, toys or worse, baby-blankets on the bed, or say goodbye. I learned this the hard way, as a kid I left my blankey there and that was the last I've seen of him. Despite calling housekeeping and being re-directed all over the damn hotel, I got nothing for my grief, and instead left a very devastated child.

And now that I'm 21 I still have a biased grudge against them...

There is no place on earth like Vegas and the Bellagio fits in with this other-worldly experience.  The pool area, shopping, spa, restaurants, fountains, and the "O" show are amazing!  If you don't like Vegas, no problem, you don't even have to leave the Bellagio.  I do think that this makes the Bellagio unique.     

As most of the large Vegas casinos, the scale is just hard to express.  While it isn't an authentic Italian hotel, there is real venetian glass, marble, flowers, etc.  The adjectives grandiose, ostentatious, huge, all come to mind, but I think the best way to describe the Bellagio is "up scale Vegas".          

The cons are the smoking and the crowds, which you will experience at any of the large casinos.

I booked my room for a 3 night stay through southwest.com. My room ended up being right across from the ice machine room, even though most of the floor seemed empty. The room itself was somewhat basic and kind of lackluster. They left "Honor Bar" snacks on the dresser that were easy to accidentally knock over. I really didn't see much of difference between the Bellagio's rooms and others on the Strip for substantially less money.
Also, need to mention that the bouncer at The Lily Bar on the casino floor was an unprofessional jerk for pulling a bar stool out from under me while having a drink at their bar. 

You can get better service and value at other casinos on the strip. I won't be staying at the Bellagio again.

Great casino, and then they started charging for parking. This is terrible. Add on the "resort fee" and MGM Resorts no longer make sense. Cosmopolitan, Caesars, Wynn - no fee for parking.  That's where we will go from now on.

Great stay, amazing customer service !!!  Clean rooms, Im allergic to the dust so I definitely can tell that rooms cleaned well . 
Valet $25 every 24hrs 
Our bags arrived 5 min right after we called in ! Bellagio has great buffet and  beautiful art   Decor that everybody have to see witch is located on the first floor when you pass the lobby ...and of course beautiful Fountains of Bellagio! Michael Mina  restaurant~  definitely a great place to have romantic and delicious dinner and after all O Show !)

I don't know, you know?

For a hotel that says that they are luxurious, the only luxury I saw was the ultra deep bath tubs (WIIIIN btw!!) - the beds were pretty much what you get in hotels, the pillows the same. The sheets weren't high thread count at all, my bed at home has higher thread count.

Room service happened daily unless you specified otherwise - some days we had chocolates on our pillows, other days we didn't. I guess it was up to the feelings of the room service people.

Just be aware though, if you are going to spend extra for a fountain view room that you'll be listening and being kept awake by the thunderous noise they make all the way till midnight. It's a we bit like having a cannon go of in your room, to be honest. And why you have to pay extra for that noise I really don't know.

The TV!! Oh good gods, the TV. It was atrocious. My best friend was sick so we decided to spend one night in bed watching crappy shows and eating room service. We turned on the TV to find that whatever crap channel was trying to show, kept pixelating and freezing. We advised the front desk of this and was told that there was nothing to be done. 

And what the hell is it with the channels available? More than half were in another language and the few that were english were useless. Free to air TV has better offerings but unfortunately we couldn't get that either.

All in all though? If you want to spend this much on a hotel room, find somewhere that is actually luxurious and not just upmarket in the bathrooms.

And the walk to get to your room. If you're in heels you might want to think of slipping them off during your trek to get through the casino to find the elevators to rooms. Also don't forget to have your keycard ready for the man standing at the bottom of the elevators or you might not be allowed up.

very nice decor

good tables, and not too smoky.

their drink ladies are prompt, and the drinks are good; has a lot of choices

We stayed here for the weekend.  It is really gorgeous and the rooms are clean with a great view.
