My company had 5,000 guest attend an annual dealers meeting,  and it's insulting not to cover the Valet parking for guests.  Even self parking is 10 dollars,  so all this would have been fine due to these poor casinos all hurting for money. What really is upsetting,  is that I arrived at 11 pm
And went to park my car at the self parking to avoid the 18 dollars valet parking charge , and when I checked out they charged me for 2 days although I picked up the car at 5pm the next day so the total hours were below 1 day 24 hours , it was 19 hours only.  The desk gal and the Manager told me to go talk with the valet people. ..are you serious,  I have to catch a flight people and we just spent millions of dollars that equalled lots of revenues and gross to your outrageous everything you serve and provide to rip off people.  I just asked to remove 18 dollars from my huge 1,800. 2 days stay bill ,otherwise you will get a bad review.  Even if I was in the wrong ,which I was not , they should please and satisfy a client. 
Apparently they could care less about how I feel so this 0 stars is what you  deserve,  All MGM properties and Casinos are  charging fees now a days,  so would negotiate that when you do your reservations and there are no more coffee making machines in the rooms.  As a matter of fact just stay at Ceasars Casino Hotels,  they actually care about customers and classy treatment all the way. Or like some of my friends comments stay downtown it's great .

Our favorite hotel in Las Vegas. The room service food has become like a five star restaurant and the service is amazing. We always get great offers and wouldn't want to go anywhere else.
Loved watching the fountains from the room at night, was great having a private show. My favorite room is to pay the upgrade and do the Bellagio Suite, has a steam sauna and a jacuzzi tub. Can't get any better then this.

3 star for 5 star hotel. My husband and i stayed on a 4th of July weekend so it was busy. We expected that though so it did not bother us. 

Pros:
1) The hotel is magnificent. We booked a fountain view room so the night view specially is spectacular. The fountain is turned on every 15 mins starting at 3 pm.
2) The room did not disappoint either. It was huge! The king size bed is so gorgeous. There's separate seating area. The drapes are controlled electronically so that's kinda awesome. 
3) The bathroom is huge as well. Separate shower n tub. 
4) Centrally located. This is both pro & con. You can go to tons of places on foot.   
5) Mobile checkin\/checkout. I was particularly pleased with this service. I checked us in the night before we travelled to Vegas. Checkin time is 3 pm usually but I got an email saying our room was ready at around 1:30 pm. We then picked up our room keys at the mobile check-in counter. The process took less than 2 mins. 
6) Complimentary breakfast buffet for 2.
7) Luxury shopping. Valentino, Louis Vuitton, Bottega and many more luxury brands are within the hotel premises. Very convenient. You dnt have to go out to the heat.

Cons:
1) For a 5-star hotel, It was lacking the basics such as toothbrush, slippers, tongs for ice. We stayed at a lot of other 5 star hotel before n we even get sleeping masks sometimes, razor, emergency kit, q tips, etc. 
2) Towel is stained with brown. Ewww. Made me wonder if they were changed at all. 
3) The room key never worked for getting out of parking. We had to call for assistance every time which is embarrassing because we're holding the line. 
4) So-so security. Anyone can use the guest elevators. There's an employee standing near elevators randomly asking for room cards but I see a lot doesn't get checked. Ive been to places where u can't use the elevator without card. It makes me feel unsafe that a non hotel guest could just come knock at my room. 
5) Because it was centrally located getting in and out of parking is horrible at certain hours. 
6) The door to our room keeps getting stuck. I think they need to upgrade.

Our room was large, clean and it had  a very nice view. The bed was very comfortable. All necessities  were provided.  There was not a tint of cigarette smoke in a room. It is very important to me because i can't stand the smell of  cigarettes.  Check in and check out was very easy and fast. 
After taking a walk on the Strip I can totally understand why you have a security check in front of the guest elevators. We stayed in this hotel for a few days and  did not have any problems with any of the security personnel but two women who worked on Thanksgiving morning. I think they  should be reminded that this is a HOTEL ( and rather expensive one) , not a TSA or some state prison check point.  There is no reason to be over zealously aggressive in asking people like my husband to show their keys. I understand that they probably were trained to profile certain people based on their appearance, but there is no reason to make it so obvious.

This hotel is soooo awesome in January 2013. We walked around to some of the other hotels but we really loved the Bellagio. The staff is awesome over here. So friendly and nice, except for one lady from the hotel staff.  She was rude and took a terrible photo of me and my wife.   Awesome restaurants inside. The common areas, we thought were the best in Bellagio. The room was pretty good too. It could have been a little fancier. The room was what I would expect at a 4 star hotel. The bathroom though was super nice and 5 star worthy. The fitness center is also great for a hotel. I would recommend this hotel just for the common areas and of course the beautiful fountains.
Beautiful casino!  Had a great time but the slot machines are a little tight.  Video poker was great and the rooms are excellent!!!

I've been at the Bellagio in 2009, 2011, 12, 14, this year we decided to change and go to the Wynn, away from the fun zone.
But we decided to have a breakfast at the buffet, $172 for 4, the worst service i never had in vegas, the service at the MGM buffet to take this as an example is just unbeliveble better.
I'm very disappointed about this place, because no one is really care about the quality on that restaurant.
We highly recommend to try the other less expensive with a better food and service .

As soon as we walked into our deluxe fountain view room, I went into the bathroom and there was a long curly black hair in the bathroom sink. Very noticeable by the way. For the price we paid I was expecting to be blown away but it was very average. The view was great though. There is a refrigerator in the room, its just loaded with stuff you cannot move or you'll be charged for it. Good thing I brought an ice chest in advance. There is an A\/C unit but it barely works. We stayed on the final hot weekend of the year and not having a strong A\/C unit was a bummer. 
There was a nice swimming pool and hot tub. The arcade area was small. The cafe Gelato was very good. 
The positives was the view, got to see fountain show a dozen times, Cafe Gelato, great place to eat, the lobby and inside lobby decor was really pretty. 
The "deluxe" fountain view room itself was Meh....

I had never stayed in the Bellagio until a recent trip to attend a conference. Quite frankly I was not impressed. The garage is tiny for a hotel of this size with only 3 levels of parking. It took 30 minutes of searching to find a parking spot.  2 minutes later I saw my first pile of puke next to someone's car. Vegas attracts all the idiots which is why I hate it so much. Checking in was worse than the usual Vegas nightmare.  It took 40 minutes to get to the front of the line. The room was nice but who spends any time in their room in Vegas?  To sum it up I wouldn't spend any more $ to stay in the Bellagio. There are better alternatives.

I friggin' LOVE the Bellagio!!!  I've been to Vegas numerous times, but have never stayed at the Bellagio (as much as I always wanted to).  This time, we took the plunge.  It was our 20th Wedding Anniversary and we wanted it to be awesome.  

We booked a non smoking Deluxe Fountain View room two months in advance. We checked several times, up until the week before our trip, to confirm that our room was booked.  When we arrived, we quickly realized that check in is a bit of a pain.  There must've been at least 200 people standing in line to check in.  It's a big hotel, but wow!  And, as always, we must've picked the slowest moving line ever!  It took us well over 45 minutes just to get to the point of talking to the gal at the check in counter.  

Although we booked our room ahead of time, there was a problem with our room; they apparently only had a smoking room.  I'm not sure what the point of a reservation is, if they can't hold the room you're wanting.  And it's not like we were checking in way late; we arrived right around 3 pm.  After more time watching the gal sit on the phone, she came back and said they've found a non smoking room up on the 27th (or something similar) floor.  My husband said that would be fine as long as it was a fountain view room.  Back on the phone she goes.  After another 15 minutes just for that phone call, she says that room just had one bed (we needed two) so they found another fountain view non smoking room. Hallelujah!  But for our trouble, they did give us a $75 credit to use at select restaurants within the hotel, on top of the $80 credit we already had at "The Buffet" as a booking perk.  So, check in was a bit of a pain, especially with one very tired six year old on our hands.

The room was amazing.  The view was amazing.  You can tune the TV to a specific channel to listen to the music playing along with the fountain shows.  You cannot hear the music playing from outside, which is nice, however the really big water acts sound a bit like loud thunder during the night; not necessarily a bad thing.  

The staff were all very nice, if only a bit clueless on a few things.  Because it was our anniversary, they did bring us a nice box of fancy chocolates and a hand written "congratulations" card.  The grounds feature seven pools, with a couple reserved for special folks.  There's an outdoor pool cafe located right near the entrance to the pools.  The location is awesome, being very near the middle of the Strip.  There's a small Tram that'll take you to the Monte Carlo, Vdara and Crystals.  They've got free Wifi. The staff are pretty adamant about getting your attention; if you use the Do No Distrub sign on the door, and you truly do not want to be disturbed, you'd best unplug your phone... because they'll be calling "just to let you know we noticed the sign on your door."  

Having stayed at several other hotels on the Strip, and having visited most of the rest of them, I will say that the Bellagio is indeed one of the very nicest and I'm glad I got to stay there.  Will we stay there again?  Maybe!  While we do enjoy trying out a new hotel each time we visit, I did love our stay, even given a few minor annoyances. It was exactly the way I wanted to spend our 20th Anniversary!

My husband took me to Vegas for my birthday and booked a fountain view room as a surprise since I've always wanted to stay at the Bellagio. 

We checked in during the evening (around 6pm) and when we arrived at our room, the door was open and there was a pair of dirty women's underwear sitting on top of the bathroom door as if the cleaning staff had put it up there and forgotten about it. We called downstairs and someone came up and got rid of them. The next morning, upon the sun shining in through the windows, fingerprints were covering the mirrored armoire doors, the drawer to the nightstand and the plate of the door handle on the room door. The carpet hadn't been vacuumed and the shower (especially the shower head) was caked in limescale. We went down to the front desk and told them what we found, even showed the person pictures so they knew we weren't just complaining to complain. She apologized and assured us she'd let the cleaning staff know to take care of it. I had packed everything we had into our suitcases, except my husband's prescription glasses, which were left sitting on the nightstand between the bed and the wall (the one without fingerprints). We were gone ALL DAY, returning around midnight. We arrived to find that whoever cleaned our room also decided to steal my husband's prescription eyeglasses, worth almost $400. We called security and were told to wait until morning since the staff works through the night and they turn things in around 8-9am. We waited until 10-11 and called. No one turned in any glasses. Shocker. We decided to make a report.

A lady with security came to the room and took a report, and we were told it would take 5-7 days for an investigation to be completed. I called today, 2+ weeks later and was told by another lady in security that it could take "months and months" for investigations to complete and that the status of our report would depend on how many reports were in front of us. Really? You have SO many security reports that it will take "months and months" to get the results and some kind of reimbursement??? That is such garbage. So now we have to fork out another $400 for new glasses that my husband needs for practically everything (night driving, reading, working, etc.) because your cleaning staff has butterfingers as revenge for not cleaning a room properly and someone calling them out on it? Thanks for nothing, Bellagio!

By far one of the best hotels in Las Vegas. It's funny, to be honest I thought the Bellagio was a made up hotel from Oceans Eleven. When entering you just know this is a 5 star hotel. The Bellagio is simply a classic. The rooms give you a very special feel and the costumer service is top notch!

Would I recommend it to my friends? If they can afford it! Or get comps!

Who love the Bellagio on our trip here of all the casino hopping we've done the Bellagio was our favorite did gambling good drinking service was a little slow but once we got a good cocktail waitress rolling it was on had a great time

Love their food and other things...except I can't visit this place too often, not for my class...I have no class...My bf said I need a upgrade done...hahaha, my friend was paying that...Thanks my dear gf friend!
We spent 4 days here and had a wonderful time.the staff were friendly wand we didn't want for anything.Will defiantly return,just marvelous.

I always park here when I have to walk on the strip and also check on the floral arrangements. I usually get parking on lower floors. Hotel is clean for the crown and the fountain is great. I have never stayed here as its beyond affordable for me.

Stayed here many times but truly nothing special, wife has never been so took her for her b day. Nice rooms and grounds but there is better for less money. Pool and hot tub close at 4:00????? WTH? Staff is very friendly and attentive.
It's the nicest hotel casino I have ever been in. Cafe Bellagio is delicious with great prices. The rooms are beautiful

Melinda was the best waiter while playing she came back so quick and was always waiting until we were done with our drink while gambling. Made the experience more fun.  And definitely more enjoyable. Watch for her

I had no problems here 5star service all around. My room was so cool full view of the strip and the beautiful fountain show. The access to the las Vegas strip is very simple just walk straight down from valet parking also you will find so many stores to shop at the hotel is clean inside and out.

This is probably my favorite hotel, and I also do very well here at the slots.  The down side is its owned by MGM and I am more loyal to the Caesar's Entertainment group.  

I have stayed here a few times, usually as a wedding guest.  The Bellagio does a top notch job on weddings, and their prime rib is probably one of the best on the Strip.  I think it was probably the best wedding reception I've been to in all time.

As a guest, the rooms are spacious, and classy.  Their check in process is pretty fast, which says a lot considering the volume of guests they have.

The down side is EVERYONE wants to visit this casino, so there's wall to wall people miling around, gawking at the lobby, the holiday decorations and of course, the water show (which runs every 1\/2 hour until 8:00 pm, then every 15 minutes).

Overall a great hotel\/ casino.

This is an absolutely gorgeous hotel. Every single detail is just wonderful. There's a lovely flower garden in the center of the lobby that changes every season. It is gorgeous for photos. I do with that they had an indoor pool or jacuzzi. I was a guest here during New Years and wasn't able to take a dip in the pool bc of the weather ... but then again, very few Vegas hotels have indoor pools. 
The service is impeccable; you will be treated like royalty. 
Eat at their restaurants and buffets; you won't be disappointed.

Gorgeous hotel, great service (well, the daily room service was great.) If you stay here, there is no need to leave as they have everything: multiple restaurants and lots of shopping (if you're into that.) I LOVED the lobby, this is the main reason I wanted to stay here. Room had a great bed, beautiful decor and a HUGE awesome bathroom and shower.Weird comment, I know, but the humidity of the room was REALLY low and the water was REALLY hard so our stay here, albeit awesome, resulted in some dry itchy and unpleasant skin. Definitely stay here if looking for something more upscale and romantic. If looking for fun? I'd recommend the Hard Rock Hotel. Hotel was definitely fancy!

It's a really beautiful hotel and we had a good time staying in one of the bigger suites but the only thing I wasn't very happy with was the traffic - people everywhere!  Poker tables were cool as were the restaurants and room service.

Clean and good looking hotel.
I paid $205 for a very small room, and the best part was a sneakers bar for $9!!
No fridge!!??? But i could rent 1 for extra $35....parking extra $15 which is a mile away from the room- inconvenient!!!
Everything in the room is on sensors and clickers which will be charged to your card automatically!!!
I got charged extra $134 for a minibar, after calling them they told me they will refund the money...
At the end- we got 3 nights at hilton grand vacations- amazing!!!!
Walk through this Bellagio- its beautiful, but i wouldnt stay there and dont recommend anybody, except if you have $1000 a night for a very very tiny room.

Overall a great 4 days at the Bellagio. Centrally located to most of the hotels in the Strip and easy walk to Caesars, Venetian as well as Paris hotel. Check in was easy. Since I booked my trip on the AMEX platinum card I was able to get breakfast for 2 ($60) and $100 credit for a spa. We also got a 12 noon check in and a 4 pm late check out through AMEX platinum. We also got an upgrade to a fountain view room with AMEX. The only issue we had was the loud noise from the clubs across the street. They were playing loud music till 3:30 AM. Initially I thought the music was coming from the Bellagio however whenI called the front desk they said it was coming from the club at Paris Hotel. Anyways we got used to the noise and enjoyed the rest of the trip.

I enjoyed my 2 night stay in Bellagio. I appreciated was that the room service put a small clean towel ON my bed, because they noticed that I use a towel on my pillow to keep it dry from my wet hair after taking a shower. This attention to detail shows that they really care about their customers. The view was amazing, pillows were really comfy, and towels were fresh. The only complaint I have is the shower handle was loose and fell on my toe and it hurt really bad, but I still think they deserve 5 stars.

If you're in Vegas, stopping at the Bellagio has to be mandatory.  I go once a season to see the free gardens & free fountains.  The fountain has a new show every 15-20 minutes, so you won't have to wait long. 

Also, I just learned that the Bellagio also houses the World's Largest Chocolate fountain!

The Bellagio is the best hotel on the Vegas strip, hands down. If you haven't been, you should go. The water show is one of the most beautiful things I've ever seen (Catch it on a night without wind. Wind puts a damper on the show and can sometimes cancel it.) The botanical gardens and the glass flower ceiling at the entryway are amazing too. 

We had a small mishap during one of our stays. The Bellagio staff completely made it up for it, though. We experienced great customer service, and Heidi Cribbs in Guest Relations was fantastic. Her service, professionalism, and friendly demeanor were all A++++.
Fountain view is a must.... It's worth every single penny. My favorite place too stay. The O Show I will give 10 stars out of 5.
when i was there, this place spelled elegance for me. seems lots of shopping opportunities here.

Dirty, Smelly, Smokey.  This hotel was a favorite of ours, but we have not been there since the Wynn opened.  We tried last weekend, and had to check out after one day to move to the Wynn.  We stayed one night because they would not let us out of a one night charge.  I could have checked out immediately.  The hallways to the rooms smelled musty and like an old apartment building.  There were 4 sets of dishes, glasses, cups and condiments left by guests in the hallway, which remained in the hallway for over 24 hour before being cleaned up.  The main restroom in the lobby always reeked of human waste.  The overall condition of the hotel was old and tired looking, its glory days are long gone, like an old madame who still thinks she's hot and young, but just a bit sad, wrinkled, fat, smelly, in a tattered and repaired frock, who's hanging on to a better time.  The main common areas are very darkly decorated and overly crowded with a unpleasant element, very much like the MGM.  We attempted to sit in the lounge in the casino at an empty sofa, but were told it was not available and was directed to an uncomfortably small table and chairs, we left.  We made a big mistake wasting one night there, hopefully you won't.  Good Luck!!!
Another great stay. Thank you. Rooms were immaculate. Room service was delicious. Jean Phillip desserts are amazing. Always love the chocolate fountain

If you enjoy cigarette smoke this may be the place for you. We visited multiple casinos for dining and entertainment this time to Vegas and this hotel was the smokiest, our throats were scratchy. Unfortunately for us, we were staying at Bellagio so we had to deal with it for days. Even our non-smoking floor and room had traces of smoke. 
The five star rating must be for a suite somewhere in the hotel because it does not apply to the room we stayed in.  The hotel is showing wear. Carpet in the hall was ripped, make-up mirror in the bathroom was falling out of the wall and I don't remember a worse hotel hair dyer.  The TV signal cut out about every 2-5 minutes so you had to change channel to "reboot" a 30 minute show about 5 times.  There are no USB ports for charging devices in the room.  
I'm sorry to say there are better options on the strip especially for the $$$.

I just returned from a 4 day stay at the Bellagio and, as always, the property was immaculately beautiful, and the service was top-notch.  All in all, the service and opulent setting are what set the Bellagio apart from many other Vegas spots. Moreover, the  Bellagio has everything you could ask for on site: 5 star restaurants, an expansive casino, a luxurious spa and fitness center, stunning pools, fabulous shops, the Cirque show O, fun clubs and bars, and the best gelato in Vegas.  I love that you can enjoy so much of the Vegas scene without even leaving the building! On top of all that, the huge guest rooms are so inviting and pretty! The beds are perfectly comfortable and the bathrooms are massive.

A few of my favorite things about the Bellagio:

-The Cypress VIP Pool: While all the pools are nice, it's well worth the money to rent a cabana or chair at the Cypess Pool.  The amenities and service at Cypress are incredible, and the staff goes out of their way to make sure that you have a perfect day. I LOVE the constant delivery of amenities from fresh fruit to chilled towels while I relax in the sun.

-The spa and gym: They offer great fitness classes on site, the workout room is huge, and the spa offers an escape from the Vegas scene to a world of blissful serenity.  The service is incredible here as well, and the staff makes you feel like you are the most important person there.

-The security: The Bellagio is just about as safe as you can get in Vegas, and I love that security is everywhere. They won't let people in the hallways near the guest room elevators, or down the stairs to the pool level area, unless they are a registered guest and have a hotel room key.  

-The food options: Whatever you like to eat, they have it at the Bellagio and they make it the right way! A dear friend of mine who is on a gluten-free diet joined me on my last trip here, and the staff really bent over backwards to accommodate her dietary needs.  Even she had a ton of options to choose from! While I have never had a meal I didn't enjoy at the Bellagio, my favorite restaurants there include: Prime (incredible filet and seafood), Circo (Italian), and Todd English's Olives (more Italian).  If you have a sweet tooth, Jean-Phillipe offers treats that are to die for, especially the snickers chocolate mousse, and Cafe Gelato serves up incredible gelato in every flavor under the sun.

I highly recommend everyone do Vegas Bellagio style at least once.  If you do, the odds are you will be back for more!

Big nice room, BIG bathroom for a standard hotel room....had a huge seperate tub and then a seperate walk in shower....woo! Wear comfy shoes because the place is HUGE....walked my stupid feet off in high heel wedges...came home with blisters...but I was cute, right??

Casino is pretty clean considering, it'sa casino and everyone smokes....but it wasn't terribly smoky. Lots of slots, my favorite being the Sex in the City machine! Won $500 on $20.....but then like everyone else does, my stupid ass put it back in the machine throughout the next 2 days and lost is all.

Several nice restaurants and shops.....the conservatory garden is beautiful! Stop by the largest chocolate fountain.

The biggest attraction at the Bellagio is the fountains...gorgeous choreographed sprays to music...and its free to all. The 2nd attraction is in their theatre...the Cirque Du Soleil show "O". I have never seen anything so stunning...amazing music, acrobats, all in WATER!! I've seen a few other Cirque shows, but this one was the best by far.....and 7 rows from the front I had an amazing view of it all....yep, beeee jealous!!

I can't tell you anymore about my experience because you know what they say about Vegas..........

From the valet greeting when driving up, to the back-to-reality of checking out, Bellagio is a lovely, wonderful, elegant, first class experience. Been there for work, for play, for conferences, for the poker room, for the buffet. WHENEVER I'm in VEGA$ I always spend time, and money, at Bellagio. PS No matter where I'm staying in the 89109 I always hit Bellagio Buffet - always, no exception - period.

Rooms are too small, too old, the place needs a remodel by an LA flipper.  Service and staff think they are better than guests . . Complete waste of money 

This place is a Toyota priced like a Ferrari !
Bellagioといえば無料の噴水ショーですね。ずーっとやっているので飽きるまで見ちゃいます。また、周囲はStripの中心的な場所になるので、他のホテルも見ていて楽しいです。

If your looking for a WOW factor from Bellagio ? Well keep looking. This is just an over priced hotel with fancy name and over priced amenities. 

Room: There is nothing special about the room. Standard room with nothing special. If you overpaid for the room with the view then you'll at least get the fountain view. If not, you'll get the view of the... The freeway. 

Hotel: The hotel must have a horrible ventilation since the entire hotel is filled with cigarette fumes. You can't escape the smell you'll walk away smelling like the nasty smokers.  

Pool:  Pool was small and over crowded. We couldn't even find a spot to lay down and had to wait an hour or so. Horrible experience. 

Service: It was mediocre at best. If you call the front desk, expect to get transferred and put on hold for 10 minutes or more. Service you would get is just OK and nothing special. 

Bellagio Buffet: MOST DISAPPOINTING BUFFET EVER !!!!  Over priced and seriously nothing special to even write about it. Don't waste your money here. If you have kids, they'll have the adult rate, even at age 4. 

Overall, we ended up checking out early to switch hotel. We couldn't stand it here anymore after 2 nights. 

I hope this helps.

Overall I had a nice stay. The hotel was a bit over the top for me. Trying to hard to be grand and majestic. The room was clean with a comfortable bed. Soaking tub and separate shower. Closet space was limited. Pretty good restaurant options though not much for the more casual side.  The fountain show was fun. The hotel is giant so be prepared to walk a while to get anywhere. It was nice but would prefer some of the other options around.

A post-checkin problem when they locked my room, and forced my party back to the front desk to resolve it was no fun.  However, it was resolved - after an hour.  The property was clean, service was kind & efficient.  Comfortable & generous accommodations.  They know hospitality here, and for the most part, it was a great stay.  I'd gladly return.

my friends and I had THEE WORST stay ever there last weekend. We were traveling to Vegas for a friends bachelorette weekend. We wanted a NICE hotel so we picked the Bellagio, the best of the best right? WRONG!! I would NEVER recommend this hotel to anyone. The customer service was awful. You would think a bachelorette party of 8 females staying in a pricey suite could be accommodated... But instead the hotel messed up our reservations, didn't have our room ready on time, gave us DIRTY sheets, and then said there was nothing you could do to make it better. We paid over $2k for two nights and we got a room no better than my local Marriott. When we tried talking to the manager she was rude and not helpful at all. We didn't even want to be upgraded.... We just wanted the room we were told we had booked over 2 months ago. In the end our option was full refund if we could find someone else to stay (umm it was a Manny Paquio fight weekend- where the hell else would we go?!). In the end, she gave us $25 in restaurant credit and a free roll away bed...thanks? DO NOT EVER STAY AT THE BELLAGIO.
Not what it once was.  Vegas used to be a classy place now it's just tacky. Next time we will stay at the Wynn.

I stayed here years ago and it was amazing but on my last visit I only walked through.

Bellagio is so beautiful. The fountain makes me feel like a kid again and the whole vibe of the place screams class.

If I can ever splash out again on something like this I most definitely will.

*Interesting fact: Our tour guide told us Vegas' most expensive wedding was at Bellagio. Something like $30 MILLION, a couple from India who flew an elephant in. Wow!!!

Their book keeping sucks. They treat you like rents cops. And way over priced. Not to mention the ongoing noise and construction keeping us up. 

No thanks.

Loved our stay! Granted we only stayed one night, but because of this the receptionist gave us an amazing deal, which included a suite with a whirlpool spa. It was my 1st time in Vegas and loved it; only cons are the people in line are super rude and tried to fight us because they insisted we cut in front of them and we slept with the door open ALL night because it seems it's closed but it's not...shove all your weight against it to close it! Also we were told they'd call us (and email us) to wake us and we never got either. Otherwise the room was clean, neat, and comfy and service was good. Will definitely go back.

This is by far my favorite place on the strip. The energy at the Bellagio is radiant and I always feel happy and relaxed whenever I'm spending time here. The casino is huge and there are a nice variety of games. It's also very clean and well kept. 
  My favorite thing is the interior design with this hotel. There's a indoor botanical garden that is absolutely magnificent and they change it every season. There's also floral blown glass on the lobby ceiling. It's breathtaking. Outside they have a huge water design with fountains and lights. Every night they do a water show where there's music, fountains shooting up and lights to go along with the show. LOVE this place. It's gorgeous. :)

Confession....have yet to stay here.  Have yet to be able to afford it.  

But considering they are the reason for my Vegas trips, I felt an obligation to Yelp them.  

And, why are they getting a 5 star review?  Because the Fountains of Bellagio is amazing.  I think I can stand there and watch it a million times and not get bored.  And don't get my 5 year old started either.  About once a week he says he wants to go to Las Vegas...to see the water show.

Also, their Botanical Garden is nothing to sneeze at either.  

Lastly, they are home to The Buffet....which gets a review of its own.

Beautiful hotel, friendly staff, great holiday decor etc.  No wonder this is the favorite of a lot of Vegas addicts I know.  Far too pricey for my measly dime, but with convention rates, it's perfect!
My only complaint - please please please clean your service hallways.  I can smell it way down the hall on the way to and from my room and it makes my stomach turn every time.  More frequent bussing of the hallways may help too - I walked past the same leftover breakfast cart outside a neighboring room several times until after lunch.

** 02\/08\/08 Update **
If you're coming for business be very careful about paying for a room block in advance.  The nightmare that is billing has washed any good taste I had for the Bellagio right out of my mouth, dropping a four star review to one.  How is it possible that I can call the hotel weekly (sometimes a few times a week), to try to get a list of all the charges made to my credit card for over two months and still not have it?  Especially when the woman I just spoke to said, "we get this all the time."?!  
I've talked to so many people and been transferred and brushed off so many times; it wasn't until I threatened to dispute the charges with my credit card company AND had my company AP department contact them several times as well, that someone was actually able to help me.  How is that even possible?  Why would they be so against sending me a list of charges?
For two months of stress and anguish, I am totally pissed off at you Bellagio.  There are plenty of other hotels on the strip that would gladly take my 200+ room nights, and thanks to you, they'll get to in the future.

Recently stayed here and in the 2br penthouse suite. The suite was awesome. 5 bathrooms, great view and very comfortable bed. Oh yeah did I forget to mention that the showers had steam function and the tubs whirlpool was amazing. My buddy and I went and deliberately meant it to be a bit luxury and it was. From the limo pickup at the airport to the private check-in and incredible room to the luxury spa treatments we got. 

The bed and pillows were incredible as well.  I only wish I knew what brands and types they were. I slept so amazing. The website for Bellagioathome.com gives a type but it isn't for the penthouse suite. 

Bellagio hotel was a overall nice experience. For as old as it is, it has a great feeling about it. It was also Christmas time in the hotel and the decorations were great. I had a great time and hope to visit again. If u want a nice experience with a great spot on the strip you have to try bellagio and all it has to offer. If you have some extra cash u need to check out the PE those suites.

A mixed perspective about my recent experience here: The accommodations presented are modern and luxurious. We had a good experience with most of the staff. When we entered our room, there was a pile of garbage in the corner below our thermostat. When we called to have it removed, housekeeping was gracious and quick to accommodate.  The elevator attendants were friendly and helpful, The room service was pricey but always extremely quick to deliver.  There are excellent dining options, like Olive, where we had a great overall dining experience. The chairman's lounge offers complementary beverages and snacks, which we only used twice during our three day visit. The second time I went to grab a few waters and an orange juice, The clerk behind the desk approached me and scolded me for taking too many beverages. Apparently she thought I loaded my bag up which was filled with a toy and sweater for my daughter! I was truly appalled that management would train their staff to limit customers to complementary items.  It was more embarrassing for her than it was for me, when she realized that I only had a few things!   Overall, I think this is a good hotel but trying to short change customers on water bottles leaves me with a cheap taste in my mouth.

The place looks fantastic but...
You have to call them every day of your stay with the same request if you need a medical accommodation. 

Also, no coffee is provided in guest rooms.

Also, if you ask employees for directions... Expect to be told a way to go, which is not necessarily the fastest, but will take you through the casino.
Was here June 3-5 2011 and what can I say.  It was fantastic.  The hotel, the pool, the buffet, etc.  Everything was A+!!
Just got back from a wonderful stay at Bellagio. Got upgraded to an awesome suite!! Great time and will be back again.

I just loved this hotel. Everything about it was amazing. The room, the view, the food, the checkin was fabulous. People super nice. The garden area was adorable great thing to see and the entrance with the ceiling above was just awesome.

On my first ever visit to Vegas our first night was at the Bellagio.  

What a wonderful first night in Vegas.  An exceptional hotel from all aspects.  The hotel amenities, the rooms, the fountains, and the conservatory.  A truly wonderful hotel on the strip.  The room was gorgeous, two queen size beds, a ginormous world class bathroom with a bathtub, separate standing shower, double vanity with sinks, flat screen TV, black out curtains worked by remote control, and not to mention the overpriced mini fridge and snack area for those who don't care about price.

We didn't end up dining here so I can't speak to that.  We did a little slot gambling that was enjoyable, lots of slot options which is always nice.

I think next time we go to Vegas I think we're splurging on the Bellagio for the entire trip because honestly one you go Bellagio no other hotel can compare.  

Bellagio - I think you have ruined me from all other Vegas hotels.  Thanks a lot!
